Text

BOOK I. [THE MOTHER]242-the mother ’S RECOMPENSE I. [Kate Clephane]87-kate was wakened , as usual , by the slant of Riviera sun across [her]87-kate bed . It was the thing [she]87-kate liked best about [[her]87-kate shabby cramped room]243-her shabby cramped room in [the third - rate Hôtel de Minorque et de l’Univers]244-the third - rate hôtel de minorque et de l’univers : that the morning sun came in at [her]87-kate window , and yet that it did n’t come too early . No more sunrises for [Kate Clephane]87-kate . [They]245-they were associated with too many lost joys -- coming [home]246-home from balls where [one]247-one had danced [one]247-one ’s self to tatters , or from suppers where [one]247-one had lingered , counting [one]247-one ’s winnings ( it was wonderful , in the old days , how often [she]87-kate had won , or [friends]251-friends had won for [her]87-kate , staking a _ louis _ just for fun , and cramming [her]87-kate hands with thousand franc bills ) ; associated , too , with the scramble up hill through the whitening gray of [the garden]252-the garden , flicked by scented shrubs , caught on perfidious prickles , up to [the shuttered villa]253-the shuttered villa askew on [its]253-the shuttered villa heat - soaked rock -- and then , at the door , in the laurustinus - shade that smelt of honey , that unexpected kiss ( well honestly , yes , unexpected , since it had long been settled that one was to remain “ just [friends ”]1441-friends ”[88-chris] ) ; and the pulling away from an insistent arm , and the one more pressure on [hers]87-kate of lips young enough to be fresh after a night of drinking and play and more drinking . And [she]87-kate had never let [Chris]88-chris come in with [her]87-kate at that hour , no , not once , though at the time there was only [[Julie]89-julie the cook in [the house]255-the house]254-julie the cook in the house , and goodness knew .... Oh , but [she]87-kate had always had [her]87-kate pride -- [people]256-people ought to remember _ that _ when [they]256-people said such things about [her]87-kate .... That was what the sunrise reminded [Kate Clephane]87-kate of -- as [she]87-kate supposed it did most women of forty - two or so ( or was it really forty - four last week ? ) For nearly twenty years now [she]87-kate had lived chiefly with [women of [her]87-kate own kind]257-women of her own kind , and [she]87-kate no longer very sincerely believed there were any others , that is to say among [women properly so called]258-women properly so called . [Her]87-kate female world was made up of three categories : frumps , [hypocrites]259-hypocrites and the “ good sort”--like[87-kate] [herself]87-kate . After all , the last was the one [she]87-kate preferred to be in . Not that [she]87-kate could not picture another life -- if [only one]260-only one had met [the right man at the right hour]261-the right man at the right hour . [She]87-kate remembered [her]87-kate one week -- that tiny little week of seven days , just six years ago -- when [she]87-kate and [Chris]88-chris had gone together to [a lost place in [Normandy]1-normandy]262-a lost place in normandy where there was n’t [a railway within ten miles]263-a railway within ten miles , and [you]264-you had to drive in [[the farmer]265-the farmer ’s cart]266-the farmer ’s cart to [the farm - house smothered in apple - blossoms]267-the farm - house smothered in apple - blossoms ; and [Chris]88-chris and [she]87-kate had gone off every morning for the whole day , while [he]88-chris sketched by [willowy river - banks]268-willowy river - banks , and under the flank of [mossy village churches]269-mossy village churches ; and every day for seven days [she]87-kate had watched [the farm - yard]270-the farm - yard life waking at dawn under [their]271-their windows , while [she]87-kate dashed [herself]87-kate with cold water and did [her]87-kate hair and touched up [her]87-kate face before [he]88-chris was awake , because the early light is so pitiless after thirty . [She]87-kate remembered it all , and how sure [she]87-kate had been then that [she]87-kate was meant to live on [a farm]272-a farm and keep chickens ; just as sure as [he]88-chris was that [he]88-chris was meant to be [a painter]273-a painter , and would already have made a name if [[his]88-chris parents]274-his parents had n’t called [him]88-chris back to [Baltimore]2-baltimore and shoved [him]88-chris into [[a broker]275-a broker ’s office]276-a broker ’s office after [Harvard]3-harvard -- to have [him]88-chris off [their]274-his parents minds , as [he]88-chris said . Yes , [she]87-kate could still picture that kind of life : every fibre in [her]87-kate kept its glow . But [she]87-kate did n’t believe in it ; [she]87-kate knew now that “ things did n’t happen like that ”[87-kate] for long , that reality and durability were attributes of [the humdrum]277-the humdrum , the prosaic and the dreary . And it was to escape from reality and durability that [one]247-one plunged into cards , gossip , flirtation , and all the artificial excitements which society so lavishly provides for [people who want to forget]279-people who want to forget . [She]87-kate and [Chris]88-chris had never repeated that week . [He]88-chris had never suggested doing so , and had let [her]87-kate hints fall unheeded , or turned them off with a laugh , whenever [she]87-kate tried , with shy tentative allusions , to coax [him]88-chris back to the idea ; for [she]87-kate had found out early that [one]247-one could never ask [him]88-chris anything point - blank -- it just put [his]88-chris back up , as [he]88-chris said [himself]88-chris . [One]247-one had to manœuvre and wait ; but when did n’t [a woman]282-a woman have to manœuvre and wait ? Ever since [she]87-kate had left [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband , eighteen years ago , what else had [she]87-kate ever done ? Sometimes , nowadays , waking alone and unrefreshed in [[her]87-kate dreary hotel room]284-her dreary hotel room , [she]87-kate shivered at the memory of all the scheming , planning , ignoring , enduring , accepting , which had led [her]87-kate in the end to -- this . Ah , well-- “ [Aline]90-aline ! ”[87-kate] After all , there was the sun in [her]87-kate window , there was the triangular glimpse of blue wind - bitten sea between the roofs , and a new day beginning , and hot chocolate coming , and a new hat to try on at [the milliner ’s]285-the milliner ’s , and-- “ _ [Aline]90-aline ! _ ”[87-kate] [She]87-kate had come to [this cheap hotel]286-this cheap hotel just in order to keep [[her]87-kate maid]287-her maid . [One]247-one could n’t afford everything , especially since the war , and [she]87-kate preferred veal for dinner every night to having to do [her]87-kate own mending and dress [her]87-kate hair : the unmanageable abundant hair which had so uncannily survived [her]87-kate youth , and sometimes , in [her]87-kate happier moods , made [her]87-kate feel that perhaps , after all , in the eyes of [[her]87-kate friends]289-her friends , other of its attributes survived also . And besides , it looked better for [a lone woman who , after having been thirty - nine for a number of years , had suddenly become forty - four]290-a lone woman who , after having been thirty - nine for a number of years , had suddenly become forty - four , to have [a respectable - looking servant in the background]291-a respectable - looking servant in the background ; to be able , for instance , when [one]247-one arrived in new places , to say to [supercilious hotel - clerks]293-supercilious hotel - clerks : “ [[My]247-one maid]1442-my maid is following with the luggage . ”[247-one] “ _ [Aline]90-aline ! _ ”[90-aline] [Aline]90-aline , ugly , neat and enigmatic , appeared with the breakfast - tray . A delicious scent preceded [her]90-aline . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane raised [herself]187-mrs. clephane on a pink elbow , shook [her]187-mrs. clephane hair over [her]187-mrs. clephane shoulders , and exclaimed : “ Violets ? ”[187-mrs. clephane] [Aline]90-aline permitted [herself]90-aline [her]90-aline dry smile . “ From [a gentleman]1443-a gentleman . ”[90-aline] Colour flooded [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress ’s face . Had n’t [she]90-aline known that something good was going to happen to [her]90-aline that morning -- hadn’t [she]90-aline felt it in every touch of the sunshine , as its golden finger - tips pressed [her]90-aline lids open and wound their way through [her]90-aline hair ? [She]90-aline supposed [she]90-aline was superstitious . [She]90-aline laughed expectantly . “ [A gentleman]1443-a gentleman ? ”[90-aline] “ [The little lame boy with the newspapers]1445-the little lame boy with the newspapers that [Madame]92-madame was kind to , ”[295-the maid] [the maid]295-the maid continued , arranging the tray with [her]295-the maid spare Taylorized gestures . “ Oh , [poor child]1446-poor child ! ”[295-the maid] [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s voice had a quaver which [she]187-mrs. clephane tried to deflect to [the lame boy]296-the lame boy , though [she]187-mrs. clephane knew how impossible it was to deceive [Aline]90-aline . Of course [Aline]90-aline knew everything -- well , yes , that was the other side of the medal . [She]90-aline often said to [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress : “ [Madame]92-madame is too much alone -- [Madame]92-madame ought to make some new friends-- ”[90-aline] and what did that mean , except that [Aline]90-aline knew [she]90-aline had lost the old ones ? But it was characteristic of [Kate]87-kate that , after a moment , the quaver in [her]90-aline voice did instinctively tilt in the direction of [the lame boy who sold newspapers]298-the lame boy who sold newspapers ; and when the tears reached [her]90-aline eyes it was over [his]296-the lame boy wistful image , and not [her]90-aline own , that they flowed . [She]90-aline had a way of getting desperately fond of [people]256-people [she]90-aline had been kind to , and exaggeratedly touched by the least sign of [their]256-people appreciation . It was [her]90-aline weakness -- or [her]90-aline strength : [she]90-aline wondered which ? “ Poor , [poor little chap]1447-poor little chap . But [his]1447-poor little chap mother’ll beat [him]1447-poor little chap if [she]90-aline finds out . [Aline]90-aline , [you]90-aline must hunt [him]1447-poor little chap up this very day and pay back what the flowers must have cost [him]1447-poor little chap . ”[90-aline] [She]90-aline lifted the violets and pressed them to [her]90-aline face . As [she]90-aline did so [she]90-aline caught sight of a telegram beneath them . A telegram -- for [her]90-aline ? It did n’t often happen nowadays . But after all there was no reason why it should n’t happen once again -- at least once . There was no reason why , this very day , this day on which the sunshine had waked [her]90-aline with such a promise , there should n’t be a message at last , the message for which [she]90-aline had waited for two years , three years ; yes , exactly three years and one month -- just a word from [him]300-him to say : “ _ Take [me]90-aline back . _ ”[90-aline] [She]90-aline snatched up the telegram , and then turned [her]90-aline head toward the wall , seeking , while [she]90-aline read , to hide [her]90-aline face from [Aline]90-aline . [The maid , on whom such hints were never lost]301-the maid , on whom such hints were never lost , immediately transferred [her]301-the maid , on whom such hints were never lost attention to the dressing - table , skilfully deploying [the glittering troops]302-the glittering troops on that last battlefield where the daily struggle still renewed itself . [Aline]90-aline ’s eyes averted , [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress tore open the blue fold and read : “ [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane dead-- ”[294-her mistress] A shiver ran over [her]90-aline . _ [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane dead ? _ Not if [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane knew it ! Never more alive than today , with the sun crisping [her]187-mrs. clephane hair , the violet scent enveloping [her]187-mrs. clephane , and that jolly north - west gale rioting out there on [the Mediterranean]4-the mediterranean . What was the meaning of this grim joke ? The first shock over , [she]90-aline read on more calmly and understood . It was the other [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane who was dead : [the one who used to be [[her]90-aline mother - in - law]305-her mother - in - law]304-the one who used to be her mother - in - law . [Her]90-aline first thought was : “ Well , serve [her]187-mrs. clephane right”--since[90-aline] , if it was so desirable to be alive on such a morning it must be correspondingly undesirable to be dead , and [she]90-aline could draw the agreeable conclusion that [the other Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had at last been come up with -- oh , but thoroughly . [She]90-aline lingered awhile on this pleasing fancy , and then began to reach out to wider inferences . “ But if -- but if -- but [little Anne--]93-little anne-- ”[90-aline] At the murmur of the name [her]90-aline eyes filled again . For years now [she]90-aline had barricaded [her]90-aline heart against [[her]90-aline daughter]306-her daughter ’s presence ; and here it was , suddenly in possession again , crowding out everything else , yes , effacing even [Chris]88-chris as though [he]88-chris were the thinnest of ghosts , and the cable in [her]90-aline hand a cock - crow . “ But perhaps now [they]308-they ’ll let [me]242-the mother see [her]306-her daughter , ”[242-the mother] [the mother]242-the mother thought . [She]242-the mother did n’t even know who “ [they]308-they ”[242-the mother] were , now that [[their]308-they formidable chieftain]309-their formidable chieftain , [[her]242-the mother mother - in - law]305-her mother - in - law , was dead . [Lawyers]311-lawyers , [judges]312-judges , [trustees]313-trustees , [guardians]314-guardians , [she]242-the mother supposed -- [all the natural enemies of woman]315-all the natural enemies of woman . [She]242-the mother wrinkled [her]242-the mother brows , trying to remember who , at the death of [[the child]316-the child ’s father]317-the child ’s father , had been appointed [[the child]316-the child ’s other guardian]319-the child ’s other guardian -- old [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s overpowering assumption of [the office]320-the office having so completely effaced [[her]187-mrs. clephane associate]321-her associate that it took a few minutes to fish [him]321-her associate up out of the far - off past . “ Why , poor old [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , of course ! ”[242-the mother] [She]242-the mother smiled retrospectively . “ [I]242-the mother do n’t believe [he]94-fred landers ’d prevent [my]242-the mother seeing [the child]316-the child if [he]94-fred landers were left to [himself]94-fred landers . Besides , is n’t [she]316-the child nearly grown up ? Why , [I]242-the mother do believe [she]316-the child must be . ”[242-the mother] The telegram fell from [her]242-the mother hands , both of which [she]242-the mother now impressed into a complicated finger - reckoning of how old [little Anne]95-anne must be , if [Chris]88-chris were thirty - three , as [he]88-chris certainly was -- no , thirty - one , [he]88-chris could n’t be more than thirty - one , because _ [she]322-she _ , [Kate]87-kate , was only forty - two ... yes , forty - two ... and [she]242-the mother ’d always acknowledged to [herself]242-the mother that there were nine years between [them]323-them ; no , eleven years , if [she]242-the mother were really forty - two ; yes , but was [she]242-the mother ? Or , goodness , was [she]242-the mother actually forty - five ? Well , then , if [she]242-the mother was forty - five -- just supposing it for a minute -- and had married [John Clephane]96-john clephane at twenty - one , as [she]242-the mother knew [she]242-the mother had , and [little Anne]95-anne had been born the second summer afterward , then [little Anne]95-anne must be nearly twenty ... why , quite twenty , was n’t it ? But then , how old would _ that _ make [Chris]88-chris ? Oh , well , [he]88-chris _ must _ be older than [he]88-chris looked ... [she]242-the mother ’d always thought [he]88-chris was . That boyish way of [his]88-chris , [she]242-the mother had sometimes fancied , was put on to make [her]242-the mother imagine there was a greater difference of age between [them]323-them than there really was -- a device [he]88-chris was perfectly capable of making use of for ulterior purposes . And of course [she]242-the mother ’d never been that dreadful kind of woman [they]323-them called [a “ baby - snatcher ”]1449-a “ baby - snatcher ”[295-the maid] .... But if [Chris]88-chris were thirty - one , and [she]242-the mother forty - five , then how old _ was _ [Anne]95-anne ? With impatient fingers [she]242-the mother began all over again . [The maid]295-the maid ’s voice , seeming to come from a long way off , respectfully reminded [her]242-the mother that the chocolate would be getting cold . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane roused [herself]187-mrs. clephane , looked about [the room]325-the room , and exclaimed : “ [My]187-mrs. clephane looking - glass , please . ”[187-mrs. clephane] [She]187-mrs. clephane wanted to settle that question of ages . As [Aline]90-aline approached with the glass there was a knock at the door . [The maid]295-the maid went to it , and came back with [her]295-the maid small inward smile . “ Another telegram . ”[295-the maid] Another ? This time [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane sat bolt upright . What could it be , now , but a word from [him]88-chris , a message at last ? Oh , but [she]242-the mother was ashamed of [herself]242-the mother for thinking of such a thing at such a moment . [Solitude]97-solitude had demoralized [her]242-the mother , [she]242-the mother supposed . And then [[her]242-the mother child]327-her child was so far away , so invisible , so unknown -- and [Chris]88-chris of a sudden had become so near and real again , though it was three whole years and one month since [he]88-chris had left [her]242-the mother . And at [her]242-the mother age -- [She]242-the mother opened the second message , trembling . Since Armistice Day [her]242-the mother heart had not beat so hard . “ [New York]5-new york . [Dearest mother]1450-dearest mother , ”[242-the mother] it ran , “ [I]242-the mother want [you]1450-dearest mother to come [home]246-home at once . [I]242-the mother want [you]1450-dearest mother to come and live with [me]242-the mother . [[Your]1450-dearest mother daughter]1452-your daughter [Anne]95-anne . ”[242-the mother] “ [You]242-the mother asked for the looking - glass , [Madame]1453-madame , ”[90-aline] [Aline]90-aline patiently reminded [her]242-the mother . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane took the proffered glass , stared into it with eyes at first unseeing , and then gradually made out the reflection of [her]187-mrs. clephane radiant irrepressible hair , a new smile on [her]187-mrs. clephane lips , the first streak of gray on [her]187-mrs. clephane temples , and the first tears -- oh , [she]242-the mother could n’t remember for how long -- running down over [her]187-mrs. clephane transfigured face . “ [Aline--]98-aline-- ”[295-the maid] [The maid]295-the maid was watching [her]242-the mother with narrowed eyes . “ The [Rachel]99-rachel powder , please-- ”[295-the maid] Suddenly [she]242-the mother dropped the glass and the powder - puff , buried [her]242-the mother face in [her]242-the mother hands , and sobbed . II . [She]242-the mother went out an hour later , [her]242-the mother thoughts waltzing and eddying like the sunlit dust which the wind kept whirling round the corners in spasmodic gusts . Everything in [her]242-the mother mind was hot and cold , and beating and blowing about , like the weather on that dancing draughty day ; the very pavement of [the familiar streets]329-the familiar streets , and the angles of [the buildings]330-the buildings , seemed to be spinning with the rest , as if the heaviest substances had suddenly grown imponderable . “ It must , ”[242-the mother] [she]242-the mother thought , “ be a little like the way the gravestones will behave on the Day of Judgment . ”[242-the mother] To make sure of where [she]242-the mother was [she]242-the mother had to turn down [one of [the white streets]332-the white streets leading to [the sea]333-the sea]331-one of the white streets leading to the sea , and fix [her]242-the mother eyes on that wedge of blue between [the houses]334-the houses , as if it were the only ballast to [her]242-the mother brain , the only substantial thing left . “ [I]242-the mother ’m glad it ’s one of the days when [the sea]333-the sea is firm , ”[242-the mother] [she]242-the mother thought . [The glittering expanse]335-the glittering expanse , flattened by the gale and solidified by the light , rose up to meet [her]242-the mother as [she]242-the mother walked toward [it]335-the glittering expanse , the pavement lifting [her]242-the mother and flying under [her]242-the mother like wings till it dropped [her]242-the mother down in the glare of [the Promenade]336-the promenade , where the top - knots of the struggling palms swam on the wind like chained and long - finned sea - things against that sapphire wall climbing half - way up the sky . [She]242-the mother sat down on a bench , clinging sideways as if lashed to [a boat]337-a boat ’s deck , and continued to steady [her]242-the mother eyes on [the Mediterranean]4-the mediterranean . To collect [her]242-the mother thoughts [she]242-the mother tried to imagine that nothing had happened , that neither of the two cables had come , and that [she]242-the mother was preparing to lead [her]242-the mother usual life , as mapped out in the miniature engagement - book in [her]242-the mother hand - bag . [She]242-the mother had [her]242-the mother “ set ”[242-the mother] now in [the big Riviera town where [she]242-the mother had taken refuge in 1916 , after the final break with [Chris]88-chris , and where , after two years of war - work]338-the big riviera town where she had taken refuge in 1916 , after the final break with chris , and where , after two years of war - work and a “ Reconnaissance Française ”[242-the mother] medal , [she]242-the mother could carry [her]242-the mother head fairly high , and even condescend a little to [certain newcomers]339-certain newcomers . [She]242-the mother drew forth the engagement - book , smiling at [her]242-the mother childish game of “ pretending . ”[242-the mother] At eleven , a hat to try on ; eleven - thirty , a dress ; from then to two o’clock , nothing ; at two , a slow solemn drive with [poor old [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity ( in [the last - surviving private victoria in [the town]342-the town]341-the last - surviving private victoria in the town]340-poor old mrs. minity ( in the last - surviving private victoria in the town ) ; tea and bridge at [[Countess Lanska]101-countess lanska ’s]343-countess lanska ’s from four to six ; a look in at [the Rectory of [the American church]345-the american church]344-the rectory of the american church , where there was a Ladies ’ Guild meeting about [the Devastated Regions ’ Fancy Fair]346-the devastated regions ’ fancy fair ; lastly a little dinner at [the Casino]347-the casino , with [the Horace Betterlys]102-the horace betterlys and [a few other pals]348-a few other pals . Yes -- a rather - better - than - the - average day . And now -- Why , now [she]242-the mother could kick over the whole apple - cart if [she]242-the mother chose ; chuck it all ( except the new dress and hat ! ): the tedious drive with [the prosy patronizing old woman]349-the prosy patronizing old woman ; [the bridge]350-the bridge , which was costing [her]242-the mother more than it ought , with that third - rate cosmopolitan set of [Laura Lanska]103-laura lanska ’s ; the long discussion at [the Rectory]6-the rectory as to whether it would “ do ”[352-you] to ask [Mrs. Schlachtberger]104-mrs. schlachtberger to take a stall at the Fair in spite of [her]104-mrs. schlachtberger unfortunate name ; and the little dinner with [the Horace Betterlys]102-the horace betterlys and [[their]102-the horace betterlys dull noisy friends]351-their dull noisy friends , who wanted to “ see life ”[352-you] and did n’t know that [you]352-you ca n’t see it unless [you]352-you ’ve first had the brains to imagine it .... Yes , [she]242-the mother could drop it all now , and never never see one of [them]102-the horace betterlys again .... “ [[My]352-you daughter]1455-my daughter ... [[my]352-you daughter]1455-my daughter [Anne]95-anne .... Oh , [you]352-you do n’t know [[my]352-you little girl]1457-my little girl ? [She]1457-my little girl _ has _ changed , has n’t [she]1457-my little girl ? Growing up is a way [the children]1458-the children have .... Yes , it is ageing for [a poor mother]1459-a poor mother to trot about [such a young giantess]1460-such a young giantess .... Oh , [I]352-you ’m going gray already , [you]352-you know -- here , on the temples . _ [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ? _ It is [you]352-you , really ? [Dear old Fred]94-fred landers ! No , of course [I]352-you ’ve never forgotten [you]352-you .... Known [me]352-you anywhere ? [You]352-you would ? Oh , nonsense ! Look at [my]352-you gray hair . But _ [men]1461-men _ do n’t change -- [lucky men]1462-lucky men ! Why , [I]352-you remember even that Egyptian seal - ring of yours .... [[My]352-you daughter]1455-my daughter ... [[my]352-you daughter]1455-my daughter [Anne]95-anne ... let [me]352-you introduce [you]352-you to [this big girl of [mine]352-you]1465-this big girl of mine ... [my]352-you little Anne .... ”[352-you] It was curious : for the first time [she]353-she realized that , in thinking back over the years since [she]353-she had been parted from [Anne]95-anne , [she]353-she seldom , nowadays , went farther than the episode with [Chris]88-chris . Yet it was long before -- it was eighteen years ago -- that [she]353-she had “ lost ”[353-she] [Anne]95-anne : “ lost ”[353-she] was the euphemism [she]353-she had invented ( as [people]256-people called [the Furies The Amiable Ones]355-the furies the amiable ones ) , because [a mother]356-a mother could n’t confess , even to [her]356-a mother most secret self , that [she]356-a mother had willingly deserted [[her]356-a mother child]327-her child . Yet that was what [she]353-she had done ; and now [her]353-she thoughts , shrinking and shivering , were being forced back upon the fact . [She]353-she had left [Anne]95-anne when [Anne]95-anne was [a baby of three]358-a baby of three ; left [her]95-anne with a dreadful pang , a rending of the inmost fibres , and yet a sense of unutterable relief , because to do so was to escape from the oppression of [her]353-she married life , the thick atmosphere of self - approval and unperceivingness which emanated from [John Clephane]96-john clephane like coal - gas from a leaking furnace . So [she]353-she had put it at the time -- so , in [her]353-she closest soul - scrutiny , [she]353-she had to put it still . “ [I]353-she could n’t breathe-- ”[353-she] that was all [she]353-she had to say in [her]353-she own defence . [She]353-she had said it first -- more ’s the pity -- to [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies ; with the result that two months later [she]353-she was on [[his]105-hylton davies yacht]359-his yacht , headed for [the West Indies]360-the west indies .... And even then [she]353-she could n’t breathe any better ; not after the first week or two . The asphyxiation was of a different kind , that was all . It was a year later that [she]353-she wrote to [[her]353-she husband]283-her husband . There was no answer : [she]353-she wrote again . “ At any rate , let [me]353-she see [Anne]95-anne .... [I]353-she ca n’t live without [Anne]95-anne .... [I]353-she ’ll go and live with [her]95-anne anywhere [you]283-her husband decide .... ”[353-she] Again no answer .... [She]353-she wrote to [[her]353-she mother - in - law]305-her mother - in - law , and [[Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s lawyer]363-mrs. clephane ’s lawyer sent the letter back unopened . [She]353-she wrote , in [her]353-she madness , to [[the child]316-the child ’s nurse]365-the child ’s nurse , and got a reply from [the same legal firm]366-the same legal firm , requesting [her]353-she to cease to annoy [[[her]353-she husband]283-her husband ’s family]368-her husband ’s family . [She]353-she ceased . Of all this [she]353-she recalled now only the parting from [Anne]95-anne , and the subsequent vain efforts to recover [her]95-anne . Of [the agent of [her]353-she release]369-the agent of her release , of [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies , [she]353-she remembered , in the deep sense of remembering , nothing . [He]105-hylton davies had become to [her]353-she , with [his]105-hylton davies flourish and [his]105-hylton davies yachting - clothes , and [the big shining yacht]370-the big shining yacht , and the cocoa - palms and general setting of cool drinks and tropical luxury , as unreal as somebody in a novel , [the highly coloured hero ( or [villain ) on the “ jacket ”]1467-villain ) on the “ jacket ”]1466-the highly coloured hero ( or villain ) on the “ jacket ”[372-a lady on a “ jacket ” .... dim] . From [her]353-she inmost life [he]105-hylton davies had vanished into a sort of remote pictorial perspective , where [a woman of [her]353-she name]371-a woman of her name figured with [him]105-hylton davies , in muslin dresses and white sunshades , [herself]353-she as unreal as [a lady on a “ jacket ”[372-a lady on a “ jacket ” .... dim] .... Dim]372-a lady on a “ jacket ” .... dim also had grown the years that followed : lonely humdrum years at [St. Jean - de - Luz]7-st. jean - de - luz , at [Bordighera]8-bordighera , at [Dinard]9-dinard . [She]353-she would settle in [a cheap place where there were [a circulating library]374-a circulating library]373-a cheap place where there were a circulating library , a mild climate , [a few quiet bridge - playing couples whom [one]247-one got to know through [the doctor]377-the doctor or [the clergyman]378-the clergyman]375-a few quiet bridge - playing couples whom one got to know through the doctor or the clergyman ; then would grow tired and drift away again . Once [she]353-she went back to [America]10-america , at the time of [[her]353-she mother]379-her mother ’s death .... It was in midsummer , and [Anne]95-anne ( now ten years old ) was in [Canada]11-canada with [[her]95-anne father]380-her father and [grandmother]381-grandmother . [Kate Clephane]87-kate , not [herself]87-kate [a New Yorker]382-a new yorker , and with [only two or three elderly and disapproving relatives left in [the small southern city of]384-the small southern city of [her]87-kate origin]383-only two or three elderly and disapproving relatives left in the small southern city of her origin , stood alone before [the elaborately organized defences of [a vast New York clan]386-a vast new york clan]385-the elaborately organized defences of a vast new york clan , and knew [herself]87-kate helpless . But in [her]87-kate madness [she]87-kate dreamed of a dash to [Canada]11-canada , an abduction -- schemes requiring money , [friends]251-friends , support , all the power and ruse [she]87-kate was so lacking in . [She]87-kate gave that up in favour of a midnight visit ( inspired by _ [Anna Karénine _]106-anna karénine _ ) to [[the child]316-the child ’s nursery]389-the child ’s nursery ; but on the way to [Quebec]12-quebec [she]87-kate heard that [the family]390-the family had left in [a private car]391-a private car for [the Rocky Mountains]13-the rocky mountains . [She]87-kate turned about and took [the first steamer]392-the first steamer to [France]14-france . All this , too , had become dim to [her]87-kate since [she]87-kate had known [Chris]88-chris . For the first time , when [she]87-kate met [him]88-chris , [her]87-kate soul ’s lungs seemed full of air . [Life]107-life still dated for [her]87-kate from that day -- in spite of the way [he]88-chris had hurt [her]87-kate , of [his]88-chris having inflicted on [her]87-kate the bitterest pain [she]87-kate had ever suffered , [he]88-chris had yet given [her]87-kate more than [he]88-chris could take away . At thirty - nine [her]87-kate real self had been born ; without [him]88-chris [she]87-kate would never have had a self .... And yet , at what a cost [she]87-kate had bought it ! All the secluded penitential years that had gone before wiped out at a stroke -- stained , defiled by follies [she]87-kate could not bear to think of , among people from whom [her]87-kate soul recoiled . [Poor Chris]108-poor chris ! It was not that [he]88-chris was what is called “ vicious”--but[88-chris] [he]88-chris was never happy without what [he]88-chris regarded as excitement ; [he]88-chris was always telling [her]87-kate that [an artist]393-an artist had to have excitement . [She]87-kate could not reconcile [his]88-chris idea of what this stimulus consisted in with [his]88-chris other tastes and ideas -- with that flashing play of intelligence which had caught [her]87-kate up into an air [she]87-kate had never breathed before . To be capable of that thought - play , of those flights , and yet to need gambling , [casinos]394-casinos , [rowdy crowds]395-rowdy crowds , and all the pursuits devised to kill time for the uninventive and lethargic ! [He]88-chris said [he]88-chris saw things in that kind of life that [she]87-kate could n’t see -- but since [he]88-chris also saw this unseeable ( and [she]87-kate knew [he]88-chris did ) in nature , in poetry and painting , in [their]396-their shared sunsets and moonrises , in [their]396-their first long dreaming days , far from jazz - bands and baccarat tables , why was n’t that enough , and how could the other rubbishy things excite the same kind of emotions in [him]88-chris ? It had been the torment of [her]87-kate torments , the inmost pang of [her]87-kate misery , that [she]87-kate had never understood ; and that when [she]87-kate thought of [him]88-chris now it was through that blur of noise and glare and popping corks and screaming bands that [she]87-kate had to grope back to the first fleeting Chris who had loved [her]87-kate and waked [her]87-kate . * * * * * At eleven o’clock [she]87-kate found [herself]87-kate , [she]87-kate did n’t know how , at [the milliner ’s]285-the milliner ’s . [Other women]398-other women , envious or undecided , were already flattening [their]398-other women noses against the panes . “ That bird of [Paradise]15-paradise ... what they cost nowadays ! ”[398-other women] But [she]87-kate went in , cool and confident , and asked gaily to try on [her]87-kate new hat . [She]87-kate must have been smiling , for [the saleswoman]399-the saleswoman received [her]87-kate with a smile . “ What a complexion , [ma’am]1468-ma’am ! [One]247-one sees [you]87-kate ’re not afraid of the wind . ”[399-the saleswoman] But when the hat was produced , though it was the copy of one [she]87-kate had already tried on , it struck [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane as absurdly youthful , even ridiculous . Had [she]87-kate really been dressing all this time like [a girl in [her]400-a girl in her teens teens]400-a girl in her teens ? “ [You]187-mrs. clephane forget that [I]87-kate ’ve [a grown - up daughter]1470-a grown - up daughter , [Madame Berthe]92-madame . ”[87-kate] _ “ Allons , [Madame plaisante]92-madame ! ”[87-kate] _ [She]87-kate drew [herself]87-kate up with dignity . “ [A daughter of twenty - one]1471-a daughter of twenty - one ; [I]87-kate ’m joining [her]1471-a daughter of twenty - one in [New York]5-new york next week . What would [she]1471-a daughter of twenty - one think of [me]87-kate if [I]87-kate arrived in a hat more youthful than [hers]1471-a daughter of twenty - one ? Show [me]87-kate something darker , please : yes , [the one with the autumn leaves]1472-the one with the autumn leaves . See , [I]87-kate ’m growing gray on the temples -- don’t try to make [me]87-kate look like [a flapper]1473-a flapper . What ’s the price of that blue fox over there ? [I]87-kate like a gray fur with gray hair . ”[87-kate] In the end [she]87-kate stalked out , offended by [the milliner]401-the milliner ’s refusal to take [her]87-kate gray hair seriously , and reflecting , with a retrospective shiver , that [her]87-kate way of dressing and [her]87-kate demeanour must have thoroughly fixed in all [these people]402-these people ’s minds the idea that [she]87-kate was [one of the silly vain fools who imagine [they]402-these people look like [[their]402-these people own daughters]404-their own daughters]403-one of the silly vain fools who imagine they look like their own daughters . At [the dress - maker]405-the dress - maker ’s , the scene repeated itself . The dashing little frock prepared for [her]87-kate -- an orange silk handkerchief peeping from the breast - pocket on which an anchor was embroidered -- made [her]87-kate actually blush ; and reflecting that money would n’t “ matter ”[87-kate] now ( the thought of the money had really not come to [her]87-kate before ) [she]87-kate persuaded [the dress - maker]405-the dress - maker to take the inappropriate garment back , and ordered , instead , something sober but elaborate , and ever so much more expensive . It seemed a part of the general unreal rapture that even the money - worry should have vanished . Where should [she]87-kate lunch ? [She]87-kate inclined to [a quiet restaurant in [a back street]408-a back street]407-a quiet restaurant in a back street ; then the old habit of following [the throng]409-the throng , the need of rubbing shoulders with [a crowd of unknown people]410-a crowd of unknown people , swept [her]87-kate automatically toward [the Casino]347-the casino , and sat [her]87-kate down , in a blare of brass instruments and hard sunshine , at the only table left . After all , as [she]87-kate had often heard [Chris]88-chris say , [one]247-one could feel more alone in a crowd .... But gradually it came over [her]87-kate that to feel alone was not in the least what [she]87-kate wanted . [She]87-kate had never , for years at any rate , been able to bear it for long ; [the crowd]413-the crowd , formerly a solace and an escape , had become a habit , and being face to face with [her]87-kate own thoughts was like facing [a stranger]414-a stranger . Oppressed and embarrassed , [she]87-kate tried to “ make conversation ”[413-the crowd] with [herself]87-kate ; but the soundless words died unuttered , and [she]87-kate sought distraction in staring about [her]87-kate at the unknown faces . [Their]413-the crowd number became oppressive : it made [her]87-kate feel small and insignificant to think that , of all this vulgar feasting throng , [not one]415-not one knew the amazing thing which had befallen [her]87-kate , knew that [she]87-kate was awaited by [an only daughter in [a big house in [New York]5-new york]417-a big house in new york]416-an only daughter in a big house in new york , [a house [she]87-kate would re - enter in a few days]418-a house she would re - enter in a few days -- yes , actually in a few days -- with the ease of [a long - absent mistress]419-a long - absent mistress , [a mistress returning from an immense journey]420-a mistress returning from an immense journey , but to whom it seems perfectly natural and familiar to be once again smiling on [old friends]421-old friends from the head of [her]87-kate table . The longing to be with [people to whom [she]87-kate could tell [her]87-kate news]422-people to whom she could tell her news made [her]87-kate decide , after all , to live out [her]87-kate day as [she]87-kate had originally planned it . Before leaving [the hotel]423-the hotel [she]87-kate had announced [her]87-kate departure to [the astonished Aline]90-aline ( it was agreeable , for once , to astonish [Aline]90-aline ) and despatched [her]87-kate to [the post - office]424-the post - office with a cable for [New York]5-new york and a telegram for [a Paris steamship company]425-a paris steamship company . In the cable [she]87-kate had said simply : “ Coming darling . ”[87-kate] They were the words with which [she]87-kate used to answer little [Anne]95-anne ’s calls from [the nursery]426-the nursery : that impatient reiterated “ Mummy -- Mummy -- [I]87-kate want [my]87-kate _ Mummy _ ! ”[87-kate] which had kept on echoing in [her]87-kate ears through so many sleepless nights . The phrase had flashed into [her]87-kate head the moment [she]87-kate sat down to write the cable , and [she]87-kate had kept murmuring to [herself]87-kate ever since : “ Mummy -- Mummy -- [I]87-kate want [my]87-kate _ Mummy _ ! ”[87-kate] [She]87-kate would have liked to quote the words to [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity , whose door [she]87-kate was now approaching ; but how could [she]87-kate explain to [the old lady , who was deaf and self - absorbed]427-the old lady , who was deaf and self - absorbed , and thought it a privilege for [any one]428-any one to go driving with [her]87-kate , why [little Anne]95-anne ’s cry had echoed so long in the void ? No ; [she]87-kate could not speak of that to [any one]428-any one : [she]87-kate must stick to [her]87-kate old “ take - it - for - granted ”[87-kate] attitude , the attitude which had carried [her]87-kate successfully over so many slippery places . [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity was very much pre - occupied about [her]100-mrs. minity foot - warmer . [She]87-kate spent the first quarter of an hour in telling [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane that [[the Rector]430-the rector ’s wife , whom [she]87-kate had taken out the day before]431-the rector ’s wife , whom she had taken out the day before , had possessed [herself]431-the rector ’s wife , whom she had taken out the day before of the object without so much as a “ may [I]87-kate , ”[87-kate] and kept [her]431-the rector ’s wife , whom she had taken out the day before big feet on it till [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity had had to stop [the carriage]432-the carriage and ask [the coachman]433-the coachman in a loud voice how it was that _ The Foot - warmer _ had not been put in as usual . [Whereupon]109-whereupon , if [you]434-you please , [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman had simply said : “ Oh , [I]110-mrs. merriman have it , thanks , dear [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity -- such a comfort , on these windy days ! ”[110-mrs. merriman] “ Though why [a woman who keeps]1474-a woman who keeps [no carriage]1475-no carriage , and has to tramp [the streets]1476-the streets at all hours , should have cold feet [I]100-mrs. minity ca n’t imagine -- nor , in fact , wholly believe [her]1474-a woman who keeps when [she]1474-a woman who keeps says so , ”[100-mrs. minity] said [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity , in the tone of one to whom a defective circulation is the recognized prerogative of [carriage - owners]435-carriage - owners . “ [I]100-mrs. minity notice , [[my]100-mrs. minity dear]1477-my dear , that _ [you]1477-my dear _ never complain of being cold , ”[100-mrs. minity] [she]100-mrs. minity added approvingly , relegating [Kate]87-kate , as [an enforced pedestrian]436-an enforced pedestrian , to [[Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman ’s class]437-mrs. merriman ’s class , but acknowledging in [her]87-kate a superior sense of propriety . “ [I]100-mrs. minity ’m always glad , ”[100-mrs. minity] [she]100-mrs. minity added , “ to take [you]1477-my dear out on windy days , for battling with the _ mistral _ on foot must be so very exhausting , and in [the carriage]432-the carriage , of course , it is so easy to reach a sheltered place . ”[100-mrs. minity] [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity was still persuaded that to sit in [[her]100-mrs. minity hired victoria]438-her hired victoria , behind [its]438-her hired victoria somnolent old pair , was one of the most rapid modes of progression devised by modern science . [She]100-mrs. minity talked as if [[her]100-mrs. minity carriage]439-her carriage were [an aeroplane]440-an aeroplane , and was as particular in avoiding [narrow streets]441-narrow streets , and waiting at the corner when [she]100-mrs. minity called for [[friends]251-friends who lived in [them]444-them]443-friends who lived in them , as if [she]100-mrs. minity had to choose [a safe alighting - ground]445-a safe alighting - ground . [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity had come to [the Riviera]16-the riviera thirty years before , after an attack of bronchitis , and finding the climate milder and the life easier than in [Brooklyn]17-brooklyn , had not gone back . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane never knew what roots [she]100-mrs. minity had broken in the upheaval , for everything immediately surrounding [her]100-mrs. minity assumed such colossal proportions that remoter facts , even concerning [herself]100-mrs. minity , soon faded to the vanishing - point . Only now and then , when [a niece from [Bridgeport]18-bridgeport]446-a niece from bridgeport sent [her]100-mrs. minity a bottle of brandy - peaches , or [a nephew from [Brooklyn]17-brooklyn]447-a nephew from brooklyn wrote to say that [her]100-mrs. minity income had been reduced by the foreclosure of a mortgage , did [the family]390-the family emerge from its transatlantic mists , and [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity become , for a moment , gratified or irate at the intrusion . But such emotions , at their acutest , were but faint shadows of those aroused by the absence of [her]100-mrs. minity foot - warmer , or the Salvation Army ’s having called twice in the same month for [her]100-mrs. minity subscription , or one of the horses having a stiff shoulder , and being replaced , for a long hazardous week , by another , known to [the same stable]449-the same stable for twenty years , and whom [the _ patron _]450-the _ patron _ [himself]450-the _ patron _ undertook to drive , so that [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity should not miss [her]100-mrs. minity airing . [She]100-mrs. minity _ had _ thought of staying in till [her]100-mrs. minity _ own _ horse recovered ; but [the doctor]377-the doctor had absolutely forbidden it , so [she]100-mrs. minity had taken [her]100-mrs. minity courage in both hands , and gone out with the substitute , who was not even of the same colour as the horse [she]100-mrs. minity was used to . “ But [I]100-mrs. minity took valerian every night , ”[100-mrs. minity] [she]100-mrs. minity added , “ and doubled [my]100-mrs. minity digitalis . ”[100-mrs. minity] [Kate Clephane]87-kate , as [she]87-kate listened ( for the hundredth time ) , remembered that [she]87-kate had once thought [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity [a rather impressive old lady]452-a rather impressive old lady , somewhat arrogant and very prosy , but with a distinct “ atmosphere , ”[87-kate] and a charming half - obsolete vocabulary , suggesting “ [Signers ”[87-kate] and Colonial generals]1479-signers ” and colonial generals , which was a refreshing change from the over - refinement of [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman and [the Betterlys]102-the horace betterlys ’ monotonous slang . Now , compared to certain long - vanished figures of [the Clephane]87-kate background -- compared even to the hated figure of [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane -- [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity shrank to the semblance of [a vulgar fussy old woman]453-a vulgar fussy old woman . “ [Old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane never bragged , whatever [she]100-mrs. minity did , ”[100-mrs. minity] [Kate]87-kate thought : “ how ridiculous all that fuss about driving behind a strange horse would have seemed to [her]100-mrs. minity . After all , good breeding , even in the odious , implies a certain courage .... ”[100-mrs. minity] [[Her]87-kate mother - in - law]305-her mother - in - law , as [she]87-kate mused , assumed the commanding yet not unamiable shape of [a Roman matron of heroic mould , a kind of “ It - hurts - not - O - my - Pætus , ”[87-kate] falling first upon the sword]455-a roman matron of heroic mould , a kind of “ it - hurts - not - o - my - pætus , ” falling first upon the sword . The bridge - players in [Countess Lanska]101-countess lanska ’s pastille - scented and smoke - blurred drawing - room seemed to have undergone the same change as [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity . [The very room]456-the very room , as [Kate]87-kate entered , on fire from the wind , seemed stuffier , untidier and , yes -- vulgarer -- than [she]87-kate had remembered . The empty glasses with drowned lemon - peel , the perpetually unemptied ash - trays , the sketches by [the Countess]101-countess lanska ’s latest protégé -- [splashy flower markets]457-splashy flower markets , [rococo churches]458-rococo churches , white balustrades , umbrella - pines and cobalt seas -- the musical instruments tossed about on threadbare cashmere shawls covering still more threadbare sofas , even the heart - rending gaze of the outspread white bear with the torn - off ear which , ever since [Kate]87-kate had known [him]459-him , had clung to [his]459-him flattened head by the same greasy thread : all this disorder was now , for the first time , reflected in the faces about the card - tables . [Not one of [them]461-they]460-not one of them , [men]1461-men or [women]463-women , if asked where [they]461-they had come from , where [they]461-they were going , or why [they]461-they had done such and such things , or refrained from doing such other , would have answered truthfully ; not , as [Kate]87-kate knew , from any particular , or at any rate permanent , need of concealment , but because [they]461-they lived in a chronic state of mental inaccuracy , excitement and inertia , which made it vaguely exhilarating to lie and definitely fatiguing to be truthful . [She]87-kate had not meant to stay long , for [her]87-kate first glance at [their]461-they new faces told [her]87-kate that to [them]461-they also [she]87-kate would not be able to speak of what had happened . But , to subdue [her]87-kate own agitation and divert [their]461-they heavy eyes , the easiest thing was to take [her]87-kate usual hand at bridge ; and once [she]87-kate had dropped into [her]87-kate place , the familiar murmur of “ No trumps ... yes ... diamonds .... Who dealt ? ... No bid .... No ... yes ... no ... ”[87-kate] , held [her]87-kate to [her]87-kate seat , soothed by the mesmeric touch of habit . * * * * * At the Rectory [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman exclaimed : “ Oh , _ there _ [she]187-mrs. clephane is ! ”[110-mrs. merriman] in a tone implying that [she]110-mrs. merriman had had to stand between [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane and [the assembled committee]464-the assembled committee . [Kate]87-kate remembered that [she]87-kate was [secretary]465-secretary , and expected to read the minutes . “ Have [I]110-mrs. merriman kept [you]468-you all waiting ? So sorry , ”[110-mrs. merriman] [she]110-mrs. merriman beamed , in a voice that sang hallelujahs . [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman pushed the book toward [her]87-kate with a protecting smile ; and [[Mrs. Parley]111-mrs. plush Plush of [the Villa Mimosa]467-the villa mimosa]466-mrs. parley plush of the villa mimosa ( [she]111-mrs. plush always told [you]468-you it had been quite [her]111-mrs. plush own idea , calling it that ) visibly wondered that [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman should be so tolerant . [They]469-they were all there : [the American Consul ’s wife]470-the american consul ’s wife , mild , plump and irreproachable ; [the lovely Mrs. Prentiss of [San Francisco]19-san francisco , who “ took things ”[111-mrs. plush] and had been involved in a drug scandal]112-the lovely mrs. prentiss of san francisco , who “ took things ” and had been involved in a drug scandal ; [the Comtesse de Sainte Maxime , who had been [a Loach of [Philadelphia]20-philadelphia]472-a loach of philadelphia , and had figured briefly on the operatic stage]471-the comtesse de sainte maxime , who had been a loach of philadelphia , and had figured briefly on the operatic stage ; [[the Consul]473-the consul ’s sister , who dressed like [a flapper]1473-a flapper , and had been engaged during the war to a series of [American officers , all of whom seemed to have given [her]110-mrs. merriman celluloid bangles]476-american officers , all of whom seemed to have given her celluloid bangles]474-the consul ’s sister , who dressed like a flapper , and had been engaged during the war to a series of american officers , all of whom seemed to have given her celluloid bangles ; and [a pale [Mrs. Marsh]113-mrs. marsh , who used to be seen about with [a tall tired man]478-a tall tired man [called “ the Colonel ”[478-a tall tired man] , whose family - name was not [Marsh]114-called “ the colonel ” , whose family - name was not marsh , but for whom she wore mourning when he died , but for whom [she]113-mrs. marsh wore mourning when [he]478-a tall tired man died]114-called “ the colonel ” , whose family - name was not marsh , but for whom she wore mourning when he died , explaining -- somewhat belatedly -- that [he]478-a tall tired man was [a cousin]479-a cousin]477-a pale mrs. marsh , who used to be seen about with a tall tired man called “ the colonel ” , whose family - name was not marsh , but for whom she wore mourning when he died , explaining -- somewhat belatedly -- that he was a cousin . Lastly , there was [Mrs. Fred Langly]115-mrs. fred langly of [Albany]21-albany , whose husband was “ wanted ”[115-mrs. fred langly] at [home]246-home for misappropriation of funds , and [who , emerging from the long seclusion consequent on this unfortunate episode]481-who , emerging from the long seclusion consequent on this unfortunate episode , had now blossomed into [a “ prominent war - worker ”]1480-a “ prominent war - worker ”[115-mrs. fred langly] , while [Mr. Langly]482-mr. langly devoted [himself]482-mr. langly to the composition of patriotic poems , which [he]482-mr. langly read ( flanked by [the civil and military authorities]483-the civil and military authorities ) at all the allied Inaugurations and Commemorations ; so that by the close of the war [he]482-mr. langly had become [[its]484-its recognized bard]485-its recognized bard , and [his]482-mr. langly “ [Lafayette]116-lafayette , can [we]489-their forget ? ”[430-the rector] was quoted with tears by [the very widows and [orphans]487-orphans [he]482-mr. langly had defrauded]486-the very widows and orphans he had defrauded . Facing [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman sat [the Rector]430-the rector , in clerical pepper - and - salt clothes and a secular pepper - and - salt moustache , talking cheerful slang in a pulpit voice . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane looked about [her]187-mrs. clephane with new eyes . Save for [[their]489-their hostess]490-their hostess , [[the Consul]473-the consul ’s wife]492-the consul ’s wife and [Mrs. Langly]115-mrs. fred langly , “ things ”[493-all the women] had been said of [all the women]493-all the women ; even concerning [Mrs. Parley Plush]111-mrs. plush , [the older inhabitants]494-the older inhabitants ( though [they]494-the older inhabitants all went to [her]111-mrs. plush teas at [the Villa Mimosa]467-the villa mimosa ) smiled and hinted . And [they]489-their all knew [each other]496-each other ’s stories , or at least the current versions , and affected to disapprove of [each other]496-each other and yet be tolerant ; thus following the example of [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman , who simply would n’t _ listen _ to any of those horrors , and of [Mr. Merriman]117-mr. merriman , whose principle it was to “ believe the best ”[117-mr. merriman] till the worst stared [him]117-mr. merriman in the face , and then to say : “ [I]117-mr. merriman understand it all happened a long while ago . ”[117-mr. merriman] To all of [them]489-their [the Rectory]6-the rectory was a social nucleus . One after another [they]489-their had found [their]489-their way [there]498-there , subscribed to [parochial charities]499-parochial charities , sent [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman fruit and flowers , and suppressed [their]489-their yawns at [Mothers]118-mothers ’ Meetings and [Sewing Circles]22-sewing circles . It was part of the long long toll [they]489-their had to pay to [the outraged goddess of Respectability]500-the outraged goddess of respectability . And at [the Rectory]501-the rectory [they]489-their had made [each other]496-each other ’s acquaintance , and thus gradually widened [their]489-their circle , and saved more hours from solitude , [[their]489-their most dreaded enemy]503-their most dreaded enemy . [Kate Clephane]87-kate knew it all by heart : for eighteen years [she]87-kate had trodden that round . [The Rector]430-the rector knew too ; if ever [a still youngish and still prettyish woman , in quiet but perfect clothes with a scent of violets]505-a still youngish and still prettyish woman , in quiet but perfect clothes with a scent of violets , asked to see [him]430-the rector after service , [he]430-the rector knew [she]87-kate was [one more recruit]506-one more recruit . [Even the oldest , stoutest , grimmest of [his]430-the rector flock]511-even the oldest , stoutest , grimmest of his flock had had [her]87-kate day ; [Mr. Merriman]117-mr. merriman remembered what [[his]117-mr. merriman predecessor]512-his predecessor had hinted of [old Mrs. Orbitt]119-old mrs. orbitt ’s past , and how [he]117-mr. merriman had smiled at the idea , seeing [Mrs. Orbitt]119-old mrs. orbitt , that first Sunday , planted in [her]119-old mrs. orbitt front pew like [a very Deborah]513-a very deborah . [Some of the prettiest -- or who had been , at least -- exchanged [parishes]515-parishes , as it were]514-some of the prettiest -- or who had been , at least -- exchanged parishes , as it were ; like that sweet [Lady de Tracey]120-lady de tracey , who joined the American fold , while [Miss Julia Jettridge]89-julie , from [New York]5-new york , attended the Anglican services . [They]516-they both said it was because [they]516-they preferred “ [the nearest church ”]1481-the nearest church ”[516-they] ; but [the Rector]430-the rector knew better than that . Then the war came ; the war which , in [those bland southern places]518-those bland southern places and to those uprooted [drifting women]519-drifting women , was chiefly a healing and amalgamating influence . It was awful , of course , to admit even to [[one]247-one ’s self]521-one ’s self that it could be that ; but , in the light of [her]522-her own deliverance , [Kate Clephane]87-kate knew that [she]87-kate and all [the others]523-the others had so viewed it . [They]516-they had shuddered and wept , toiled hard , and made [their]516-they sacrifices ; of clothes and bridge , of butter and sweets and carriage - hire -- but all the while [they]516-they were creeping slowly back into [the once impregnable stronghold of Social Position]524-the once impregnable stronghold of social position , getting to know [people who used to cut [them]516-they , being invited to [the Préfecture]526-the préfecture and [the Consulate]527-the consulate]525-people who used to cut them , being invited to the préfecture and the consulate , and lots of houses of which [they]516-they used to say with feigned indifference : “ Go to _ [those _ dreary people]1482-those _ dreary people ? Not for [the world]1483-the world ! ”[516-they] because [they]516-they knew [they]516-they had no chance of getting [there]498-there . Yes : the war had brought [them]516-they peace , strange and horrible as it was to think it . [Kate]87-kate ’s eyes filled as [she]87-kate looked about the table at those haggard powdered masks which had once glittered with youth and insolence and pleasure . All [they]516-they wanted now was what [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate wanted only a few short hours ago : to be bowed to when [they]516-they caught [certain people]529-certain people ’s eyes ; to be invited to [one more dull house]530-one more dull house ; to be put on [[the Rector]430-the rector ’s Executive Committees]532-the rector ’s executive committees , and pour tea at [the Consuless]533-the consuless ’s “ afternoons ”[534-a man ’s voice fluted ; and a noble silver - thatched head with a beak - like nose and soft double chin] . “ May [I]534-a man ’s voice fluted ; and a noble silver - thatched head with a beak - like nose and soft double chin ? ”[534-a man ’s voice fluted ; and a noble silver - thatched head with a beak - like nose and soft double chin] [a man ’s voice fluted ; and a noble silver - thatched head with a beak - like nose and soft double chin]534-a man ’s voice fluted ; and a noble silver - thatched head with a beak - like nose and soft double chin was thrust into the doorway . “ Oh , [Mr. Paly]121-mr. paly ! ”[110-mrs. merriman] cried [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman ; and murmured to [the nearest ladies]535-the nearest ladies : “ For the music-- [I]110-mrs. merriman thought [he]430-the rector ’d better come today . ”[110-mrs. merriman] [Every one]536-every one greeted [Mr. Paly]121-mr. paly with enthusiasm . It was odd : during [her]548-his wife drive with [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity , at [Madame Lanska ’s]130-madame , and again at [the Rectory]501-the rectory , [Kate Clephane]87-kate had meant to proclaim [her]548-his wife great news -- and [she]548-his wife had not yet breathed a word of it . And now , in the glare and clatter of [the Casino]347-the casino , with [the Sids]131-the sids and [Harrys]132-harrys exchanging winks , and [the Mrs. Sids]131-the sids and [Harrys]132-harrys craning fat necks to see [the last new cocotte]555-the last new cocotte , or [the young Prince about whom there were such awful stories]556-the young prince about whom there were such awful stories -- here , of all places , to unbare [her]548-his wife secret , name [[her]548-his wife daughter]306-her daughter : how could [she]548-his wife ever have thought it possible ? Only toward the end of the long deafening dinner , when [Marcia]127-marcia and [Mrs. Sid]128-sid began to make plans for a week at [Monte Carlo]25-monte carlo , and [she]548-his wife found [herself]548-his wife being impressed into the party ( as [she]548-his wife had , so often and so willingly , before ) did [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane suddenly find [herself]187-mrs. clephane assuming the defensive . “ [You]548-his wife ca n’t ? [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane swept the table with a cool eye . “ Business -- family business , ”[187-mrs. clephane] [she]187-mrs. clephane said . “ _ Criky ! _ ”[129-horace] burst from [Horace]129-horace . III . As [Kate Clephane]87-kate stood on [deck]561-deck , straining [her]87-kate eyes at the Babylonian [New York]5-new york which seemed to sway and totter toward [her]87-kate menacingly , [she]87-kate felt a light hand on [her]87-kate arm . “ [Anne]95-anne ! ”[87-kate] [She]87-kate barely suppressed the questioning lift of [her]87-kate voice ; for the length of a heart - beat [she]87-kate had not been absolutely certain . Then ... yes , there was [her]87-kate whole youth , [her]87-kate whole married past , in that small pale oval -- [her]87-kate own hair , but duskier , stronger ; something of [her]87-kate smile too , [she]87-kate fancied ; and [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s straight rather heavy nose , beneath [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s awful brows . “ But the eyes -- [you]95-anne chose [your]95-anne own eyes , [[my]87-kate darling]1505-my darling ! ”[87-kate] [She]87-kate had [the girl]562-the girl at arms’-length , [her]562-the girl own head thrown back a little : [Anne]95-anne was slightly the taller , and [her]95-anne pale face hung over [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s like a young moon seen through mist . “ So wise of [you]95-anne ! Such an improvement on anything [we]1506-we had in stock .... ”[95-anne] How absurd ! When [she]87-kate thought of the things [she]87-kate had meant to say ! What would [[her]87-kate child]327-her child think [her]87-kate ? Incurably frivolous , of course . Well , if [she]87-kate stopped to consider _ that _ [she]87-kate was lost .... [[Her]87-kate house]588-her house , since [she]87-kate had been [its mistress]589-its mistress ; but never [hers]87-kate in the sense of [her]87-kate having helped to make it . [John Clephane]96-john clephane lived by proverbs . One was that [fools]590-fools built houses for [wise men]591-wise men to live in ; so [he]96-john clephane had bought [[a fool]592-a fool ’s house]593-a fool ’s house , furniture and all , and moved into [it]593-a fool ’s house on [his]96-john clephane marriage . But if [it]593-a fool ’s house had been built by [a fool]592-a fool , [Kate]87-kate sometimes used to wonder , how was it that [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband found [it]593-a fool ’s house to be planned and furnished so exactly as [he]283-her husband would have chosen ? [He]283-her husband never tired of boasting of the fact , seemingly unconscious of the unflattering inference to be drawn ; perhaps , if pressed , [he]283-her husband would have said there was no contradiction , since [the house]255-the house had cost [the fool]597-the fool a great deal to build , and [him]283-her husband , [the wise man]598-the wise man , very little to buy . It had been , [he]283-her husband was never tired of repeating , a bargain , the biggest kind of a bargain ; and that , somehow , seemed a reason ( again [Kate]87-kate did n’t see why ) for leaving everything in [it]255-the house unchanged , even to the heraldic stained glass on the stairs and the Jacobean mantel in [a drawing - room that ran to [Aubusson ....]29-aubusson ....]599-a drawing - room that ran to aubusson .... And first of all-- ”[87-kate] [She]87-kate paused to gather up [her]87-kate courage . “ What does [Anne]95-anne know ? ”[87-kate] [she]87-kate flung at [him]94-fred landers . [[Her]87-kate visitor]676-her visitor had seated [himself]94-fred landers in the armchair facing [her]87-kate . The late afternoon light fell on [his]94-fred landers thick ruddy face , in which the small eyes , between white lids , looked startlingly blue . At [her]87-kate question the blood rose from [his]94-fred landers cheeks to [his]94-fred landers forehead , and invaded the thin pepper - and - salt hair carefully brushed over [his]94-fred landers solidly moulded head . “ Don’t -- don’t try to find out , [I]94-fred landers beg of [you]87-kate ; [I]94-fred landers have n’t , ”[94-fred landers] [he]94-fred landers stammered . [She]87-kate felt [his]94-fred landers blush reflected on [her]87-kate own pale cheek , and the tears rose to [her]87-kate eyes . How was [he]94-fred landers to help [her]87-kate if [he]94-fred landers took that tone ? [He]94-fred landers did not give [her]87-kate time to answer , but went on , in a voice laboriously cheerful : “ Look forward , not back : that ’s the thing to do . Living with [young people]1543-young people , is n’t it the natural attitude ? And [Anne]95-anne is not the kind to dig and brood : thank goodness , [she]95-anne ’s health itself , body and soul . [She]95-anne asks no questions ; never has . Why should [I]94-fred landers have put it into [her]95-anne head that there were any to ask ? [[Her]95-anne grandmother]1544-her grandmother did n’t . [A girl]1548-a girl , ”[94-fred landers] [he]94-fred landers went on in an embarrassed tone , “ ca n’t grow up nowadays without seeing a good many cases of the kind about [her]95-anne ; [Lord]1549-lord forgive [me]94-fred landers , [they]1550-they ’re getting to be the rule rather than the exception . Well , [Anne]95-anne ’s going to have one now . And so it was with everything . In the end [Anne]95-anne invariably gets what [she]95-anne wants . Tentatively , fearfully , [she]87-kate was building up out of [[her]87-kate visitor]676-her visitor ’s tones , [his]96-john clephane words , [his]96-john clephane reticences , the incredible fact that , for [him]96-john clephane and all [[her]87-kate husband ’s family]368-her husband ’s family -- [that huge imperious clan]1561-that huge imperious clan -- [her]87-kate life , after [she]87-kate had left [them]368-her husband ’s family , had been divided into two sharply differentiated parts : the brief lapse with [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies , the long expiation alone . Of that third episode , which for [her]87-kate was the central fact of [her]87-kate experience , apparently not a hint had reached [them]368-her husband ’s family . [She]87-kate was [the woman who had once “[707-his mother] stooped to folly ”]1562-the woman who had once “ stooped to folly ” , and then , regaining [her]87-kate natural uprightness , had retained it inflexibly through all the succeeding years . As the truth penetrated [her]87-kate mind [she]87-kate was more frightened than relieved . Was [she]87-kate not returning on false pretences to these kindly forgiving relations ? Was it not possible , indeed almost certain , that [a man like [Frederick Landers]147-frederick landers]1563-a man like frederick landers , had [he]147-frederick landers known about [Chris]88-chris , would have used all [his]147-frederick landers influence to dissuade [Anne]95-anne from sending for [her]95-anne , instead of exerting it in the opposite sense , as [he]147-frederick landers avowedly had ? And , that being so , was [she]87-kate not taking [them]368-her husband ’s family all unawares , actually abusing [their]368-her husband ’s family good faith , in passing [herself]87-kate off as [the penitential figure whom the passage of blameless years had gradually changed from the offending into the offended]1564-the penitential figure whom the passage of blameless years had gradually changed from the offending into the offended ? Yet was it , after all , possible that the affair with [Chris]88-chris , and the life [she]87-kate had led with [him]88-chris , could so completely have escaped [their]368-her husband ’s family notice ? Rumour has a million eyes , and though [she]87-kate had preserved appearances in certain , almost superstitious , ways , [she]87-kate had braved them recklessly in others , especially toward the end , when the fear of losing [Chris]88-chris had swept away all [her]87-kate precautions . Then suddenly the explanation dawned on [her]87-kate . [She]87-kate had met [Chris]88-chris for the first time less than a year before the outbreak of the war , and the last of [their]368-her husband ’s family months together , [the most reckless and fervid]1565-the most reckless and fervid , had been overshadowed , blotted out of [everybody]1566-everybody ’s sight , in that universal eclipse . [She]87-kate had never before thought of it in that way : for [her]87-kate the war had begun only when [Chris]88-chris left [her]87-kate . During its first months [she]87-kate and [he]88-chris had been in [Spain]34-spain and [Italy]35-italy , shut off by [the safe Alps]1567-the safe alps or the neutral indifference ; and the devouring need to keep [Chris]88-chris amused , and [herself]87-kate amusing , had made [her]87-kate fall into the easy life of [the Italian watering - places]1568-the italian watering - places , and the careless animation of [Rome]36-rome , without any real sense of being in [an altered world]1569-an altered world . Around [them]368-her husband ’s family [they]368-her husband ’s family found only the like - minded ; [the cheerful , who refused to be “[1571-artists ” or “ thinkers ” to ignore the barbarian commotion] worried ”]1570-the cheerful , who refused to be “ worried ” , or the argumentative and paradoxical , like [Chris]88-chris [himself]88-chris , who thought it [their]368-her husband ’s family duty as “[1571-artists ” or “ thinkers ” to ignore the barbarian commotion] [artists ” or “[1571-artists ” or “ thinkers ” to ignore the barbarian commotion] thinkers ” to ignore the barbarian commotion]1571-artists ” or “ thinkers ” to ignore the barbarian commotion . It was only in 1915 , when [Chris]88-chris ’s own attitude was mysteriously altered , and [she]87-kate found [him]88-chris muttering that after all [a fellow]1572-a fellow could n’t stand aside when all [[his]88-chris friends]1573-his friends and [the chaps of [his]88-chris own age]1574-the chaps of his own age were getting killed -- only then did the artificial defences fall , and the reality stream in on [her]87-kate . Was [his]88-chris change of mind genuine ? [He]88-chris often said that [his]88-chris opinions had n’t altered , but that there were times when opinions did n’t count ... when [a fellow]1572-a fellow just had to _ act _ . It was [her]87-kate own secret thought ( had been , perhaps , for longer than [she]87-kate knew ) ; but with [Chris]88-chris -- could [one]247-one ever tell ? Whatever [he]88-chris was doing , [he]88-chris was sure , after a given time , to want to be doing something else , and to find plausible reasons for it : even the war might be serving merely as a pretext for [his]88-chris unrest . Unless ... unless [he]88-chris used it as an excuse for leaving [her]87-kate ? Unless being with _ [her]87-kate _ was what it offered an escape from ? If only [she]87-kate could have judged [him]88-chris more clearly , known [him]88-chris better ! But between [herself]87-kate and any clear understanding of [him]88-chris there had hung , from the first , the obscuring mist of [her]87-kate passion , muffling [his]88-chris face , touch , speech ( so that now , at times , [she]87-kate could not even rebuild [his]88-chris features or recall [his]88-chris voice ) , obscuring every fold and cranny of [his]88-chris character , every trick of phrase , every doubling and dodging of [his]88-chris restless mind and capricious fancy . Sometimes , in looking back , [she]87-kate thought there was only one sign [she]87-kate had ever read clearly in [him]88-chris , and that was the first sign of [his]88-chris growing tired of [her]87-kate . Disguise that as [she]87-kate would , avert [her]87-kate eyes from it , argue it away , there the menace always was again , faint but persistent , like the tiny intermittent pang which first announces a mortal malady . And of all this [none of [the people watching [her]87-kate from across [the sea]333-the sea]1578-the people watching her from across the sea]1577-none of the people watching her from across the sea had had a suspicion . The war had swallowed [her]87-kate up , [her]87-kate and all [her]87-kate little concerns , as it had engulfed [so many million others]1580-so many million others . It seemed written that , till the end , [she]87-kate should have to be thankful for the war . [Her]87-kate eyes travelled back to [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , whose sturdy bulk , planted opposite [her]87-kate , seemed to have grown so far off and immaterial . Did [he]88-chris really guess nothing of [that rainbow world [she]87-kate had sent [her]87-kate memory back to]1581-that rainbow world she had sent her memory back to ? [You]94-fred landers ’ll promise [me]0-i that , [mother]1508-mother , wo n’t [you]1508-mother ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate let [her]87-kate hand droop against the strong young shoulder . It was -- yes , without doubt -- an echo of [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s way of saying : “[717-we] [We]717-we ’ll consider that _ settled _ , [I]0-i think . ” [Kate]87-kate shivered a little ; but it was only a passing chill . The use [the girl]562-the girl made of [her]562-the girl authority was so different -- as if [the old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane in [her]562-the girl spoke from a milder sphere -- and it was so sweet to be compelled , to have things decided for one , to be told what [one]247-one wanted and what was best for one . For years [Kate Clephane]87-kate had had to order [herself]87-kate about : to tell [herself]87-kate to rest and not to worry , to eat when [she]87-kate was n’t hungry , to sleep when [she]87-kate felt staring wide - awake . [She]87-kate would have preferred , on the whole , that evening , to slip into a tea - gown and go down to a quiet dinner , alone with [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter and perhaps [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ; [she]87-kate shrank from the hurricane that would start up in [her]87-kate head as soon as [she]87-kate was alone ; yet [she]87-kate liked better still to be “[717-we] mothered ” in that fond blundering way [the young]1592-the young have of mothering [[their]1592-the young elders]1593-their elders . And besides , [Anne]95-anne perhaps felt -- not unwisely -- that again , for the moment , [she]95-anne and [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother had nothing more to say to [each other]496-each other ; that to close on that soft note was better , just then , than farther effort . At any rate , [Anne]95-anne evidently did not expect to have [her]95-anne decision questioned . It was that hint of finality in [her]95-anne solicitude that made [Kate]87-kate , as [she]87-kate sank into the lavender - scented pillows , feel -- perhaps evoked by the familiar scent of cared - for linen -- the closing - in on [her]87-kate of all the old bounds . The next morning banished the sensation . [She]87-kate felt only , now , the novelty , the strangeness . Did n’t [you]1521-dear know ? It was really dreadful for [Aunt Enid]145-enid drover -- especially with [her]145-enid drover ideas .
