Oh , but [I]0-i ’m boring [you]1521-dear with all this family gossip . ” [The girl]562-the girl paused , suddenly embarrassed ; then , glancing out of the window : “[0-i] It ’s a lovely morning , and not too cold . What do [you]1521-dear say to [my]0-i running [you]1521-dear up to [Bronx Park]38-bronx park and back before lunch , just to give [you]1521-dear a glimpse of what [Nollie]154-nollie calls [[our]725-our _ [New _ York]72-york]726-our _ new _ york ? Or would [you]1521-dear rather take another day to rest ? ” * * * * * The rush through the vivid air ; the spectacle of [the new sumptuous city]1603-the new sumptuous city ; of [the long reaches above [the Hudson]40-the hudson with [their]1604-the long reaches above the hudson with their showy architecture and towering “ institutions ” showy architecture and towering “[1521-dear] Institutions ”]1604-the long reaches above the hudson with their showy architecture and towering “ institutions ” ; of [the smooth Boulevards flowing out to [cared - for prosperous suburbs]1606-cared - for prosperous suburbs]1605-the smooth boulevards flowing out to cared - for prosperous suburbs ; the vista of [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue , as [they]1604-the long reaches above the hudson with their showy architecture and towering “ institutions ” returned , stretching southward , interminably , between [monumental façades]1607-monumental façades and resplendent [shop - fronts]1608-shop - fronts -- all this and the tone of [Anne]95-anne ’s talk , [her]95-anne unconscious allusions , revelations of [herself]95-anne and [her]95-anne surroundings , acted like champagne on [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s brain , making [the world]1483-the world reel about [her]95-anne in a headlong dance that challenged [her]95-anne to join it . The way [they]1604-the long reaches above the hudson with their showy architecture and towering “ institutions ” all took [their]1604-the long reaches above the hudson with their showy architecture and towering “ institutions ” mourning , for instance ! [She]95-anne , [Anne]95-anne , being [[[her]95-anne grandmother]1544-her grandmother ’s heiress]1611-her grandmother ’s heiress ( [she]95-anne explained ) would of course not wear colours till Easter , or go to [the Opera]1612-the opera ( except to matinées ) for at least another month . Did n’t [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother think [she]95-anne was right ? “[154-nollie] [Nollie]154-nollie thinks it awfully archaic of [me]0-i to mix up music and mourning ; what have [they]727-they got to do with each other , as [she]154-nollie says ? But [I]0-i know [Aunt Enid]145-enid drover would n’t like it ... and [she]145-enid drover ’s been so kind to [me]0-i . Do n’t [you]728-you agree that [I]0-i ’d better not ? ” “[728-you] But of course , [dear]1521-dear ; and [I]0-i think [[your]1521-dear aunt]730-your aunt ’s right . ” Inwardly , [Kate]87-kate was recalling the inexorable laws which had governed family affliction in [the New York]1614-the new york to which [she]87-kate had come as [a bride]587-a bride : three crape - walled years for [a parent]1616-a parent , two for [sister]1617-sister or [brother]1618-brother , at least twelve solid months of black for [grandparent]1619-grandparent or [aunt]1620-aunt , and half a year ( to the full ) for [cousins]1621-cousins , even if [you]1622-you counted [them]1621-cousins by dozens , as [the Clephanes]158-the clephanes did . As for the weeds of widowhood , [they]1621-cousins were supposed to be measured only by the extent of [the survivor]1623-the survivor ’s affliction , and _ that _ was expected to last as long , and proclaim itself as unmistakably in crape and seclusion , as [the most intolerant censor in [the family]390-the family]1624-the most intolerant censor in the family decreed -- unless [you]1622-you were prepared to flout [the whole clan]1626-the whole clan , and could bear to be severely reminded that [your]1622-you veil was a quarter of a yard shorter than [cousin Julia]89-julie ’s , though [her]89-julie bereavement antedated [yours]1622-you by six months . Much as [Kate Clephane]87-kate had suffered under the old dispensation , [she]87-kate felt a slight recoil from the indifference that had succeeded it . [She]87-kate [herself]87-kate , just before sailing , had replaced the coloured finery hastily bought on [the Riviera]1627-the riviera by a few dresses of unnoticeable black , which , without suggesting the hypocrisy of [her]87-kate wearing mourning for [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , yet kept [her]87-kate appearance in harmony with [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s ; and [Anne]95-anne ’s question made [her]87-kate glad that [she]87-kate had done so . The new tolerance , [she]87-kate soon began to see , applied to everything ; or , if it did n’t , [she]87-kate had not yet discovered the new prohibitions , and during all that first glittering day seemed to move through a millennium where the lamb of pleasure lay down with the lion of propriety .... After all , [this [New York]5-new york into which [she]87-kate was being reinducted]1629-this new york into which she was being reinducted had never , in any of its stages , been [hers]87-kate ; and the fact , which had facilitated [her]87-kate flight from [it]5-new york , leaving fewer broken ties and uprooted habits , would now , [she]87-kate saw , in an equal measure simplify [her]87-kate return . [Her]87-kate absence , during all those years , had counted , for [the Clephanes]158-the clephanes , only in terms of [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband ’s humiliation ; there had been [no family]1631-no family of [her]87-kate own to lament [her]87-kate fall , take up [her]87-kate defence , quarrel with [the clan]1632-the clan over the rights and wrongs of the case , force [people]256-people to take sides , and leave a ramification of vague rancours to which [her]87-kate return would give new life . [The old aunts and [indifferent cousins at [Meridia]41-meridia]1635-indifferent cousins at meridia -- [[her]87-kate remote inland town]1636-her remote inland town]1634-the old aunts and indifferent cousins at meridia -- her remote inland town -- had bowed [their]1634-the old aunts and indifferent cousins at meridia -- her remote inland town heads before the scandal , thanking fortune that [the people [they]1634-the old aunts and indifferent cousins at meridia -- her remote inland town visited]1637-the people they visited would probably never hear of it . And now [she]87-kate came back free of everything and every one , and rather like [a politician resuming office than [a prodigal returning to [his]1639-a prodigal returning to his own own]1639-a prodigal returning to his own]1638-a politician resuming office than a prodigal returning to his own . The sense of it was so rejuvenating that [she]87-kate was almost sure [she]87-kate was looking [her]87-kate best ( and with less help than usual from [Aline]90-aline ) when [she]87-kate went down to dinner to meet [the clan]1632-the clan . [Enid Drover]145-enid drover ’s appearance gave a momentary check to [her]145-enid drover illusion : [Enid]145-enid drover , after eighteen years , seemed alarmingly the same -- pursed - up lips , pure vocabulary and all . [She]145-enid drover had even kept , to an astonishing degree , the physical air of [[her]145-enid drover always middle - aged youth]1641-her always middle - aged youth , the smooth complexion , symmetrically - waved hair and empty eyes that made [her]145-enid drover plump small - nosed face like a statue ’s . Yet the mere fact of [[her]145-enid drover daughter]306-her daughter [Lilla]153-lilla profoundly altered [her]87-kate -- the fact that [she]87-kate could sit beaming maternally across the table at that impudent stripped version of [herself]87-kate , with dyed hair , dyed lashes , drugged eyes and unintelligible dialect . And [[her]145-enid drover husband]283-her husband , [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover -- [the typical old New Yorker]1644-the typical old new yorker -- that [he]159-hendrik drover too should accept [this outlawed daughter]1645-this outlawed daughter , laugh at [her]145-enid drover slang , and greet [her]145-enid drover belated entrance with the remark : “[0-i] Top - notch get - up tonight , [Lil]160-lil ! ” “[160-lil] Oh , [Lilla]153-lilla ’s going on , ” laughed [Mrs. Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton , slipping [her]145-enid drover thin brown arm through [[her]145-enid drover cousin]1646-her cousin ’s heavy white one . [Lilla]153-lilla laughed indolently . “[153-lilla] Ai n’t _ [you]731-you _ ? ” “[731-you] No -- [I]0-i mean to stay and bore [Aunt Kate]161-aunt kate till the small hours , if [she]161-aunt kate ’ll let [me]0-i . ” _ [Aunt Kate]161-aunt kate ! _ How sweet it sounded , in that endearing young voice ! No wonder [Anne]95-anne had spoken as [she]95-anne did of [Nollie]154-nollie . Whatever [Mrs. Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton ’s past had been , it had left on [her]145-enid drover no traces like those which had smirched and deadened [Lilla]153-lilla . [Kate]87-kate smiled back at [Nollie]154-nollie and loved [her]154-nollie . [She]87-kate was prepared to love [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton too , if only for having brought this live thing into [the family]390-the family . Personally , [Joe]155-joe tresselton did n’t at first offer many points of contact : [he]731-you was so hopelessly like [[his]731-you cousin]1648-his cousin [Alan Drover]152-alan , and like [all the young American officers [Kate]87-kate had seen on leave on [the Riviera]16-the riviera]1649-all the young american officers kate had seen on leave on the riviera , and [all the young men who showed off collars or fountain - pens or golf - clubs]1650-all the young men who showed off collars or fountain - pens or golf - clubs in the backs of American magazines . [She]87-kate wondered if [Anne]95-anne would marry [an American Face]1653-an american face , and hoped , before that , to learn to differentiate [them]1651-the few people she had seen ; meanwhile , [she]87-kate would begin by practising on [Joe]155-joe tresselton , who , seating [himself]155-joe tresselton beside [her]87-kate with the collective smile , seemed about to remark : “[161-aunt kate] See [that Arrow]162-that arrow ? ” Instead [he]1654-he said : “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne ’s great , is n’t [she]95-anne , [Aunt Kate]161-aunt kate ? ” and thereby acquired an immediate individuality for [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother . Dinner was announced , and at the dining - room door [Kate]87-kate wavered , startled by the discovery that [it]1656-it was still exactly [the same room]1657-the same room -- black and gold , with imitation tapestries and a staring white bust niched in a red marble over - mantel -- and feeling once more uncertain as to what was expected of [her]87-kate . But already [Anne]95-anne was guiding [her]87-kate to [her]95-anne old seat at the head of the table , and waiting for [her]87-kate to assign [their]1651-the few people she had seen places to [the others]523-the others . [The girl]562-the girl did it without a word ; just a glance and the least touch . If this were indeed a mannerless age , how miraculously [Anne]95-anne ’s manners had been preserved ! And now the dinner was progressing , [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s champagne bubbling in [their]1651-the few people she had seen glasses ( it seemed oddest of all to be drinking [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband ’s Veuve Clicquot ) , [Lilla]153-lilla steadily smoking , both elbows on the table , and [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie leading an exchange of chaff between [the younger cousins]1661-the younger cousins , with the object , as [Kate Clephane]87-kate guessed , of giving [her]87-kate , [the newcomer]1662-the newcomer , time to take breath and get [her]87-kate bearings . It was wonderful , sitting there , to recall the old “[95-anne] family dinners ” , when [Enid]145-enid drover ’s small censorious smile ( [Enid]145-enid drover , then in [her]145-enid drover twenties ! ) seemed as inaccessible to pity as the forbidding line of old [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s lips ; when [even [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton ’s mother]1663-even joe tresselton ’s mother ( that lazy fat [Alethea Tresselton]163-alethea tresselton ) had taken [her]1663-even joe tresselton ’s mother cue from [the others]523-the others , and echoed [their]1651-the few people she had seen severities with a mouth made for kissing and forgiving ; and [John Clephane]96-john clephane , at the foot of the table , proud of [[his]96-john clephane house]649-his house , proud of [his]96-john clephane wine , proud of [[his]96-john clephane cook]1666-his cook , still half - proud of [[his]96-john clephane wife]548-his wife , was visibly saying to [himself]96-john clephane , as [he]96-john clephane looked about on [[his]96-john clephane healthy handsome relatives]1668-his healthy handsome relatives : “[95-anne] After all , blood is thicker than water . ” The contrast was the more curious because nothing , after all , could really alter [people]256-people like [the Drovers]702-the drovers . [Enid]145-enid drover was still gently censorious , though with [her]145-enid drover range of criticism so deflected by the huge exception to be made for [[her]145-enid drover daughter]306-her daughter that [her]145-enid drover fault - finding had an odd remoteness : and [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover , [Kate]87-kate guessed , would be as easily shocked as of old by allusions to the “[95-anne] kind of thing [they]732-they did in [Europe]42-europe ” , though what [they]732-they did at [home]246-home was so vividly present to [him]159-hendrik drover in [[Lilla]153-lilla ’s person]1673-lilla ’s person , and in the fact of [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton ’s having married a [Fourteenth Street Shriner]43-fourteenth street shriner , and [a divorced one at that]1674-a divorced one at that . It was all too bewildering for [a poor exile]1675-a poor exile to come to terms with -- [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane could only smile and listen , and be thankful that [her]187-mrs. clephane own case was so evidently included in the new range of [their]732-they indulgence . But [the young people]1676-the young people -- what did [they]1676-the young people think ? That would be the interesting thing to know . [They]1676-the young people had all , [she]87-kate gathered , far more interests and ideas than had scantily furnished [her]87-kate own youth , but all so broken up , scattered , and perpetually interrupted by the strenuous labour of [their]1676-the young people endless forms of sport , that [they]1676-the young people reminded [her]87-kate of a band of [young entomologists]1677-young entomologists , equipped with the newest thing in nets , but in far too great a hurry ever to catch anything . Yet perhaps it seemed so only to the slower motions of middle - age . [Kate]87-kate ’s glance wandered from [Lilla Gates]153-lilla , the most obvious and least interesting of [the group]1678-the group , to [Nollie Shriner]156-nollie shriner ( one of [the “[732-they] awful ” Fourteenth Street Shriners]1679-the “ awful ” fourteenth street shriners ) ; [Nollie Shriner]156-nollie shriner first , then [Nollie Haverford]164-nollie haverford , [wife of [a strait - laced [Albany Haverford]165-albany haverford]1681-a strait - laced albany haverford , and now [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie , though [she]154-nollie still looked , with [her]154-nollie brown squirrel - face and slim little body , like [a girl in [the schoolroom]1683-the schoolroom]1682-a girl in the schoolroom]1680-wife of a strait - laced albany haverford , and now nollie tresselton , though she still looked , with her brown squirrel - face and slim little body , like a girl in the schoolroom . Yes , even [Nollie]154-nollie seemed to be in a great hurry ; [one]247-one felt [her]154-nollie perpetually ordering and sorting and marshalling things in [her]154-nollie mind , and the fact , [Kate]87-kate presently perceived , now and then gave an odd worn look of fixity to [her]154-nollie uncannily youthful face . [Kate]87-kate wondered when there was ever time to enjoy anything , with that perpetual alarm - clock in one ’s breast . [Her]87-kate glance travelled on to [[her]87-kate own daughter]1685-her own daughter . [Anne]95-anne seemed eager too , but not at such a pace , or about such a multiplicity of unrelated things . Perhaps , though , it was only the fact of being taller , statelier -- old - fashioned words still fitted [Anne]95-anne -- which gave [her]95-anne that air of boyish aloofness . But no ; it was the mystery of [her]95-anne eyes -- those eyes which , as [Kate]87-kate had told [her]95-anne , [she]95-anne had chosen for [herself]95-anne from some forgotten ancestral treasury into which none of the others had dipped . Between olive and brown , but flecked with golden lights , a little too deep - set , the lower lid flowing up smooth and flat from the cheek , and the black lashes as evenly set as the microscopic plumes in a Peruvian feather - ornament ; and above them , too prominent , even threatening , yet melting at times to curves of maiden wonder , the obstinate brows of [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane . What did those eyes portend ? [Kate Clephane]87-kate glanced away , frightened at the riddle , and absorbed [herself]87-kate in the preoccupying fact that the only way to tell [the Drovers]702-the drovers from [the Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons was to remember that [the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ noses were even smaller than [the Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons ’ ( but _ would _ that help , if [one]247-one met one of [either tribe]1689-either tribe alone ? ) . [She]87-kate was roused by hearing [Enid Drover]145-enid drover question plaintively , as [the ladies]1690-the ladies regained [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room : “[95-anne] But after all , why _ should n’t _ [Anne]95-anne go too ? ” [The women]1692-the women formed an interrogative group around [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , who found [herself]187-mrs. clephane suddenly being scrutinized as if for a verdict . [She]187-mrs. clephane cast a puzzled glance at [Anne]95-anne , and [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter slipped an arm through [hers]187-mrs. clephane but addressed [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover . “[95-anne] Go to [[Madge Glenver]167-madge glenver ’s cabaret - party]733-madge glenver ’s cabaret - party with [Lilla]153-lilla ? There was a stricken pause . [Kate]87-kate filled it by saying with a laugh : “[737-you] [You]737-you ’ll think [I]0-i might as well have , when [I]0-i tell [you]737-you [I]0-i ’ve never in [my]0-i life been to a cabaret - party . ” [Lilla]153-lilla ’s stare deepened ; [she]153-lilla seemed hardly able to take the statement in . “[0-i] What _ did _ [you]737-you do with [your]737-you evenings , then ? ” [she]153-lilla questioned , after an apparently hopeless search for alternatives . [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover had grown pink and pursed - up ; even [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie ’s quick smile seemed congealed . That [they]741-our should have found [each other]496-each other again , [she]87-kate and [Anne]95-anne ! [The butler]1698-the butler threw open the drawing - room door with solemnity . “[1443-a gentleman] [A gentleman]1443-a gentleman has called in [[his]1443-a gentleman motor]743-his motor for [Mrs. Gates]168-mrs. gates ; [he]1443-a gentleman sends word that [he]1443-a gentleman ’s in a hurry , [madam]744-madam , please . ” “[744-madam] Oh , ” said [Lilla]153-lilla , leaping upon [her]153-lilla fan and vanity bag . [She]153-lilla was out of [the room]325-the room before [the butler]1698-the butler had rounded off [his]1443-a gentleman sentence . [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover , [her]166-mrs. drover complacency restored , sank down on a plump [Clephane]87-kate sofa that corresponded in richness and ponderosity with [[her]166-mrs. drover own person]1701-her own person . “[744-madam] [Lilla]153-lilla ’s such [a baby]745-a baby ! ” [she]166-mrs. drover sighed ; then , with a freer breath , addressed [herself]166-mrs. drover to sympathetic enquiries as to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s voyage . It was evident that , as far as [the family]390-the family were concerned , [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother had been born again , seven days earlier , on [the gang - plank of [the liner]1705-the liner that had brought [her]1655-anne ’s mother [home]246-home]1704-the gang - plank of the liner that had brought her home . On these terms [they]390-the family were all delighted to have [her]1655-anne ’s mother back ; and [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover declared [herself]166-mrs. drover particularly thankful that the voyage had been so smooth . [V. Smoothness]169-v. smoothness , [Kate Clephane]87-kate could see , was going to mark the first stage of [her]166-mrs. drover re - embarkation on the waters of life . The truth came to [her]166-mrs. drover , after that first evening , with the surprised discovery that [the family]390-the family had refrained from touching on [her]166-mrs. drover past not so much from prudery , or discretion even , as because such retrogressions were jolting uncomfortable affairs , and the line of least resistance flowed forward , not back . [She]166-mrs. drover had been right in guessing that [her]166-mrs. drover questions as to what [people]256-people thought of [her]166-mrs. drover past were embarrassing to [Landers]94-fred landers , but wrong in the interpretation of [his]94-fred landers embarrassment . Like every one else about [her]166-mrs. drover , [he]94-fred landers was caught up in the irresistible flow of existence , which somehow reminded [her]166-mrs. drover less of [a mighty river tending seaward]1709-a mighty river tending seaward than of a moving stairway revolving on itself . “[744-madam] Only [they]746-they all think it ’s [a river]747-a river .... ” [she]166-mrs. drover mused . But such thoughts barely lit on [her]166-mrs. drover tired mind and were gone . In the first days , after [she]166-mrs. drover had grasped ( without seeking its explanation ) the fact that [she]166-mrs. drover need no longer be on [her]166-mrs. drover guard , that henceforth there would be nothing to conjure away , or explain , or disguise , [her]166-mrs. drover chief feeling was one of illimitable relief . The rapture with which [she]166-mrs. drover let [herself]166-mrs. drover sink into the sensation showed [her]166-mrs. drover for the first time how tired [she]166-mrs. drover was , and for how long [she]166-mrs. drover had been tired . It was almost as if this sense of relaxation were totally new to [her]166-mrs. drover , so far back did [her]166-mrs. drover memory have to travel to recover a time when [she]166-mrs. drover had not waked to apprehension , and fallen asleep rehearsing fresh precautions for the morrow . In the first years of [her]166-mrs. drover marriage there had been the continual vain effort to adapt [herself]166-mrs. drover to [[her]166-mrs. drover husband]283-her husband ’s point of view , to [[her]166-mrs. drover mother - in - law]305-her mother - in - law ’s standards , to all the unintelligible ritual with which [they]1712-they barricaded [themselves]1712-they against the alarming business of living . After that had come the bitterness of [her]166-mrs. drover first disenchantment , and the insatiable longing to be back on the nursery floor with [Anne]95-anne ; then , through all the ensuing years , the many austere and lonely years , and the few consumed with [her]166-mrs. drover last passion , the ever - recurring need of one form of vigilance or another , the effort to keep hold of something that might at any moment slip from [her]166-mrs. drover , whether it were [her]166-mrs. drover painfully - regained “[744-madam] respectability ” or [the lover for whom [she]166-mrs. drover had forgone it]1713-the lover for whom she had forgone it . Yes ; as [she]166-mrs. drover looked back , [she]166-mrs. drover saw [herself]166-mrs. drover always with taut muscles and the grimace of ease ; always pretending that [she]166-mrs. drover felt [herself]166-mrs. drover free , and secretly knowing that the prison of [her]166-mrs. drover marriage had been liberty compared with what [she]166-mrs. drover had exchanged it for . That was as far as [her]166-mrs. drover thoughts travelled in the first days . [She]166-mrs. drover abandoned [herself]166-mrs. drover with [the others]523-the others to the flood of material ease , the torrent of facilities on which [they]1712-they were all embarked . [She]166-mrs. drover had been scornful of luxury when it had symbolized the lack of everything else ; now that it was an adjunct of [her]166-mrs. drover recovered peace [she]166-mrs. drover began to enjoy it with the rest , and to feel that the daily perfection of [her]166-mrs. drover breakfast - tray , the punctual renewal of the flowers in [[her]166-mrs. drover sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room , the inexhaustible hot water in [her]166-mrs. drover bath , the swift gliding of [Anne]95-anne ’s motor , and the attentions of [[her]166-mrs. drover household of [servants]1717-servants]1716-her household of servants , were essential elements of this new life . At last [she]166-mrs. drover was at rest . Even the nature of [her]166-mrs. drover sleep was changed . Waking one morning -- not with a jerk , but slowly , voluntarily , as it were -- out of a soundless , dreamless night , a miraculous draught of sleep , [she]166-mrs. drover understood that for years even [her]166-mrs. drover rest had been unrestful . [She]166-mrs. drover recalled the uncertainty and apprehension always woven through [her]166-mrs. drover dreams , the sudden nocturnal wakings to a blinding , inextinguishable sense of [her]166-mrs. drover fate , [her]166-mrs. drover future , [her]166-mrs. drover past ; and the shallow turbid half - consciousness of [her]166-mrs. drover morning sleep , which would leave [her]166-mrs. drover , when [she]166-mrs. drover finally woke from it , emptied of all power of action , all hope and joy . Then every sound that broke the night - hush had been irritating , had pierced [her]166-mrs. drover rest like an insect ’s nagging hum ; now the noises that accompanied [her]166-mrs. drover falling asleep and awakening seemed to issue harmoniously out of the silence , and the late and early roar of Fifth Avenue to rock [her]166-mrs. drover like the great reiterations of [the sea]333-the sea . “[744-madam] This is peace ... this _ must _ be peace , ” [she]166-mrs. drover repeated to [herself]166-mrs. drover , like [a botanist arrested by an unknown flower]1719-a botanist arrested by an unknown flower , and at once guessing it to be the rare exquisite thing [he]1719-a botanist arrested by an unknown flower has spent half [his]1719-a botanist arrested by an unknown flower life in seeking . Of course [she]166-mrs. drover would not have felt any of these things if [Anne]95-anne had not been [the Anne [she]95-anne was]1720-the anne she was . It was from [Anne]95-anne ’s presence , [her]95-anne smile , [her]95-anne voice , the mystery of [her]95-anne eyes even , that the healing flowed . If [Kate Clephane]87-kate had an apprehension left , it was [her]87-kate awe -- almost -- of that completeness of [Anne]95-anne ’s . Was it possible , humanly possible , that [one]247-one could cast away [one]247-one ’s best treasure , and come back after nearly twenty years to find it there , not only as rare as [one]247-one had remembered it , but ripened , enriched , as only beautiful things are enriched and ripened by time ? It was as if one had set out some delicate plant under one ’s window , so that it might be an object of constant vigilance , and then gone away , leaving it unwatched , unpruned , unwatered -- how could [one]247-one hope to find more than a dead stick in the dust when [one]247-one returned ? But [Anne]95-anne was real ; [she]95-anne was not [a mirage or a mockery]1726-a mirage or a mockery ; as the days passed , and [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s life and [hers]379-her mother became adjusted to each other , [Kate]87-kate felt as if [they]1728-they were two parts of some delicate instrument which fitted together as perfectly as if they had never been disjoined -- as if [Anne]95-anne were that other half of [her]95-anne life , the half [she]95-anne had dreamed of and never lived . To see [Anne]95-anne living it would be almost the same as if it were [her]95-anne own ; would be better , almost ; since [she]95-anne would be there , with [her]95-anne experience , and tenderness , to hold out a guiding hand , to help shape the perfection [she]95-anne had sought and missed . These thoughts came back to [her]87-kate with particular force on the evening of [Anne]95-anne ’s reappearance at [the Opera]1612-the opera . During the weeks since [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s death the Clephane box had stood severely empty ; even when [the Opera House]1730-the opera house was hired for some charity entertainment , [Anne]95-anne sent a cheque but refused to give the box . It was awfully “[744-madam] archaic ” , as [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie said ; but somehow it suited [Anne]95-anne , was as much in [her]95-anne “[744-madam] style ” as the close braids folded about [her]95-anne temples . “[744-madam] After all , it ’s not so easy to be statuesque , and [I]0-i like [Anne]95-anne ’s memorial manner , ” [Nollie]154-nollie concluded . Tonight the period of formal mourning for [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane was over , and [Anne]95-anne was to go to [the Opera]1612-the opera with [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother . [She]95-anne had asked [the Joe Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons and [[her]95-anne guardian]572-her guardian to join [them]1734-them first at a little dinner , and [Kate Clephane]87-kate had gone up to dress rather earlier than usual . It was [her]87-kate first public appearance , also , and -- as on each occasion of [her]87-kate new life when [she]87-kate came on some unexpected survival of [her]87-kate youth , a face , a voice , a point of view , [a room in which the furniture had not been changed]1735-a room in which the furniture had not been changed -- [she]87-kate was astonished , and curiously agitated , at setting out from [the very same house]1736-the very same house for the very same Opera box . The only difference would be in the mode of progression ; [she]87-kate remembered the Parisian landau and sixteen - hand chestnuts with glittering plated harness that had waited at the door in [her]87-kate early married days . Then [she]87-kate had a vision of [[her]87-kate own toilet]1737-her own toilet , of the elaborate business it used to be : [[Aline]90-aline ’s predecessor]1738-aline ’s predecessor , with cunning fingers , dividing and coiling the generous ripples of [her]90-aline hair , and building nests of curls about the temples and in the nape ; then the dash up in [her]95-anne dressing - gown to [[Anne]95-anne ’s nursery]1739-anne ’s nursery for a last kiss , and the hurrying back to get into [her]95-anne splendid brocade , to fasten the diamond coronet , the ruby “[95-anne] sunburst ” , the triple pearls . [John Clephane]96-john clephane was fond of jewels , and particularly proud of [[his]96-john clephane wife]548-his wife ’s , first because [he]96-john clephane had chosen them , and secondly because [he]96-john clephane had given them to [her]548-his wife . [She]548-his wife sometimes thought [he]96-john clephane really admired [her]548-his wife only when [she]548-his wife had them all on , and [she]548-his wife often reflected ironically on [Esther]170-esther ’s wifely guile in donning [her]548-his wife regal finery before [she]548-his wife ventured to importune Ahasuerus . It certainly increased [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s importance in [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband ’s eyes to know that , when [she]87-kate entered [[her]87-kate box]1742-her box , no pearls could hold their own against [hers]87-kate except [Mrs. Beaufort]139-mrs. beaufort ’s and [old Mrs. Goldmere]171-old mrs. goldmere ’s . It was years since [Kate Clephane]87-kate had thought of those jewels . [She]87-kate smiled at the memory , and at the contrast between the unobtrusive dress [Aline]90-aline had just prepared for [her]87-kate , and all those earlier splendours . The jewels , [she]87-kate supposed , were [Anne]95-anne ’s now ; since [modern young girls dressed as richly as [[their]1743-modern young girls dressed as richly as their elders elders]1593-their elders]1743-modern young girls dressed as richly as their elders , [Anne]95-anne had no doubt had them reset for [her]95-anne own use . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane closed [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes with a smile of pleasure , picturing [Anne]95-anne ( as [she]187-mrs. clephane had not yet seen [her]95-anne ) with bare arms and shoulders , and the orient of the pearls merging in that of [her]95-anne young skin . It was lucky that [Anne]95-anne was tall enough to look [her]95-anne best in jewels . Thence [the mother]242-the mother ’s fancy wandered to the effect [Anne]95-anne must produce on other imaginations ; on those , particularly , of [young men]1746-young men . Was [she]95-anne already , as [they]1746-young men used to say , “[95-anne] interested ” ? Among [the young men [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane]1747-the young men mrs. clephane had seen , either calling at [the house]255-the house , or in the course of informal dinners at [the Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons ’ , [the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ , and [other cousins]1750-other cousins or [“[95-anne] in - laws]1751-“ in - laws ” , [she]187-mrs. clephane had remarked none who seemed to fix [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s attention . But there had been , as yet , few opportunities : the mitigated mourning for [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane did at least seclude [them]1746-young men from general society , and when [a girl as aloof as Anne]1753-a girl as aloof as anne was attracted , the law of contrasts might draw [her]95-anne to some one unfamiliar and undulled by propinquity . “[748-an older man] Or [an older man]748-an older man , perhaps ? ” [Kate]87-kate considered . [She]87-kate thought of [Anne]95-anne ’s half - daughterly , half - feminine ways with [[her]87-kate former guardian]1754-her former guardian , and then shrugged away the possibility that [[her]87-kate old stolid Fred]1755-her old stolid fred could exercise a sentimental charm . Yet [the young men of [Anne]95-anne ’s generation]1756-the young men of anne ’s generation , those [[her]87-kate mother]379-her mother had hitherto met , seemed curiously undifferentiated and immature , as if [they]1756-the young men of anne ’s generation had been kept too long in [some pure and enlightened school]1758-some pure and enlightened school , eternally preparing for a life into which [[their]1756-the young men of anne ’s generation parents]1759-their parents and [professors]1760-professors could never decide to let [them]1756-the young men of anne ’s generation plunge .... It struck [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane that [Chris]88-chris , when [she]187-mrs. clephane first met [him]88-chris , must have been about the age of [these beautiful inarticulate athletes]1761-these beautiful inarticulate athletes ... and [Heaven]172-heaven knew how many lives [he]88-chris had already run through ! As [he]88-chris said [himself]88-chris , [he]88-chris felt every morning when [he]88-chris woke as if [he]88-chris had come into a new fortune , and had somehow got to “[748-an older man] blow it all in ” before night . [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat up and brushed [her]87-kate hand over [her]87-kate eyes . It was the first time [Chris]88-chris had been present to [her]87-kate , in that insistent immediate way , since [her]87-kate return to [New York]5-new york . [She]87-kate had thought of [him]88-chris , of course -- how could [she]87-kate cast even a glance over [her]87-kate own past without seeing [him]88-chris there , woven into its very texture ? But [he]88-chris seemed to have receded to the plane of that past : from [his]88-chris torturing actual presence [her]87-kate new life had delivered [her]87-kate .... [She]87-kate pressed both hands against [her]87-kate eyes , as if to crush and disperse the image stealthily forming ; then [she]87-kate rose and went into [[her]87-kate bedroom]1762-her bedroom , where , a moment before , [she]87-kate had heard [Aline]90-aline laying out [her]90-aline dress . [The maid]295-the maid had finished and gone ; [the bedroom]1764-the bedroom was empty . The change of scene , the mere passage from [one room]1765-one room to another , the sight of the evening dress and opera - cloak on the bed , and of [Beatrice Cenci]140-beatrice cenci looking down on [them]1766-them through [her]87-kate perpetual sniffle , sufficed to recall [Kate]87-kate to the present . [She]87-kate turned to the dressing - table , and noticed a box which had been placed before [her]87-kate mirror . It was of ebony and citron - wood , embossed with agates and cornelians , and heavily clasped with chiselled silver ; and from the summit of the lid a silver Cupid bent [his]88-chris shaft at [her]87-kate . [Kate]87-kate broke into a faint laugh . How well [she]87-kate remembered that box ! [She]87-kate did not have to lift the lid to see [its]1767-its padded trays and tufted sky - blue satin lining ! It was old [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s jewel - box , and on [Kate]87-kate ’s marriage [the dowager]1768-the dowager had solemnly handed it over to [[her]1768-the dowager daughter - in - law]1769-her daughter - in - law with all that it contained . “[748-an older man] [I]0-i wonder where [Anne]95-anne found it ? ” [Kate]87-kate conjectured , amused by the sight of one more odd survival in [that museum of the past which [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s house]1770-that museum of the past which john clephane ’s house had become . A little key hung on one of the handles , and [she]87-kate put it in the lock , and saw all [her]87-kate jewels lying before [her]87-kate . On a slip of paper [Anne]95-anne had written : “[95-anne] [Darling]1516-darling , these belong to [you]1516-darling . Please wear some of them tonight .... ” * * * * * As [she]87-kate entered the opera box [Kate Clephane]87-kate felt as if the great central chandelier were raying all its shafts upon [her]87-kate , as if [she]87-kate were somehow caught up into and bound on the wheel of its devouring blaze . But only for a moment -- after that it seemed perfectly natural to be sitting there with [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter and [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie , backed by the usual cluster of white waistcoats . After all , in this new existence it was [Anne]95-anne who mattered , not [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother ; instantly , after the first plunge , [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane felt [herself]187-mrs. clephane merged in the blessed anonymity of motherhood . [She]187-mrs. clephane had never before understood how exposed and defenceless [her]87-kate poor unsupported personality had been through all the lonely years . [Her]187-mrs. clephane eyes rested on [Anne]95-anne with a new tenderness ; the glance crossed [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie ’s , and [the two]573-the two triumphed in [their]573-the two shared admiration . “[154-nollie] Oh , there ’s [no one]750-no one like [Anne]95-anne , ” [their]573-the two four eyes told [each other]496-each other . [Anne]95-anne looked round and intercepted the exchange . [Her]95-anne eyes smiled too , and turned with a childish pleasure to the pearls hanging down over [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s black dress . “[750-no one] Is n’t [she]95-anne beautiful , [Nollie]154-nollie ? ” [Young Mrs. Tresselton]173-young mrs. tresselton laughed . “[154-nollie] [You]751-you two were made for [each other]496-each other , ” [she]173-young mrs. tresselton said . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane closed [her]187-mrs. clephane lids for an instant ; [she]187-mrs. clephane wanted to drop a curtain between [herself]187-mrs. clephane and the stir and brightness , and to keep in [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes the look of [Anne]95-anne ’s as they fell on the pearls . The episode of the jewels had moved [the mother]242-the mother strangely . It had brought [Anne]95-anne closer than a hundred confidences or endearments . As [Kate]87-kate sat there in the dark , [she]87-kate saw , detached against the blackness of [her]87-kate closed lids , [a child]1777-a child stumbling with unsteady steps across [a windy beach]1778-a windy beach , [a funny flushed child with sand in [her]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother hair and in the creases of [her]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother fat legs , who clutched to [her]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother breast something [she]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother was bringing to [[her]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother mother]379-her mother]1779-a funny flushed child with sand in her hair and in the creases of her fat legs , who clutched to her breast something she was bringing to her mother . “[751-you] It ’s for mummy , ” [she]87-kate said solemnly , opening [her]87-kate pink palms on a dead star - fish . [Kate]87-kate saw again [the child]316-the child ’s rapturous look , and felt the throb of catching [her]316-the child up , star - fish and all , and devouring with kisses the rosy body and tousled head . In [themselves]1782-them the jewels were nothing . If [Anne]95-anne had handed [her]95-anne a bit of coal -- or another dead star - fish -- with that look and that intention , the gift would have seemed as priceless . Probably it would have been impossible to convey to [Anne]95-anne how indifferent [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother had grown to the Clephane jewels . In [her]95-anne other life -- that confused [intermediate]1784-intermediate life which now seemed so much more remote than the day when [the little girl]1785-the little girl had given [her]95-anne the star - fish -- jewels , [she]95-anne supposed , might have pleased [her]95-anne , as pretty clothes had , or flowers , or anything that flattered the eye . Yet [she]95-anne could never remember having regretted [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s jewels ; and now they would have filled [her]95-anne with disgust , with abhorrence almost , had [they]1782-them not , in the interval , become [Anne]95-anne ’s .... It was [the girl]562-the girl who gave [them]1782-them [their]1782-them beauty , made [them]1782-them exquisite to [the mother]242-the mother ’s sight and touch , as though they had been a part of [[her]562-the girl daughter]306-her daughter ’s loveliness , the expression of something [she]562-the girl could not speak . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane suddenly exclaimed to [herself]187-mrs. clephane : “[0-i] [I]0-i am rewarded ! ” It was a queer , almost blasphemous , fancy -- but it came to [her]187-mrs. clephane so . [She]187-mrs. clephane was rewarded for having given up [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ; if [she]187-mrs. clephane had not , could [she]187-mrs. clephane ever have known such a moment as this ? [She]187-mrs. clephane had been too careless and impetuous in [her]187-mrs. clephane own youth to be worthy to form and guide [this rare creature]1790-this rare creature ; and while [she]187-mrs. clephane seemed to be rushing blindly to [her]187-mrs. clephane destruction , [Providence]174-providence had saved the best part of [her]187-mrs. clephane in saving [Anne]95-anne . [All these scrupulous self - controlled people]1791-all these scrupulous self - controlled people -- [Enid]145-enid drover and [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover , [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , even [the arch enemy]1792-the arch enemy , [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane -- had taken up the task [she]187-mrs. clephane had flung aside , and carried it out as [she]187-mrs. clephane could never have done . And [she]187-mrs. clephane had somehow run the mad course allotted to [her]187-mrs. clephane , and come out of it sane and sound , to find [them]1791-all these scrupulous self - controlled people all waiting there to give [her]187-mrs. clephane back [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter . It was incredible , but there it was . [She]187-mrs. clephane bowed [her]187-mrs. clephane head in self - abasement . The box door was opening and shutting softly , on the stage voices and instruments soared and fell . [She]187-mrs. clephane did not know how long [she]187-mrs. clephane sat there in a kind of brooding rapture . But presently [she]187-mrs. clephane was roused by hearing a different voice at [her]187-mrs. clephane elbow . [She]187-mrs. clephane half opened [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes , and saw [a newcomer sitting by [Anne]95-anne]1794-a newcomer sitting by anne . It was [one of [the young men who came to [the house]255-the house]1796-the young men who came to the house]1795-one of the young men who came to the house ; [his]753-he fresh blunt face was as inexpressive as a football ; [he]753-he might have been made by [a manufacturer of sporting - goods]1798-a manufacturer of sporting - goods . “[0-i] --in the box over there ; but [he]753-he ’s gone now ; bolted . Said [he]753-he was too shy to come over and speak to [you]754-you . Said [he]753-he ’s never had the microbe before . Anyhow , [he]753-he ’s bolted off [home]246-home . Says [he]753-he do n’t know when [he]753-he ’ll come back to [New York]5-new york . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate , watching [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter through narrowed lids , perceived a subtle change in [her]95-anne face . [Anne]95-anne did not blush -- that close - textured skin of [hers]95-anne seldom revealed the motions of [her]95-anne blood . [Her]95-anne delicate profile remained shut , immovable ; [she]95-anne merely lowered [her]95-anne lids as if to keep in a vision . It was [Kate]87-kate ’s own gesture , and [the mother]242-the mother recognized it with a start . [She]87-kate had been right , then ; there was [some one]1801-some one -- [some one whom [Anne]95-anne had to close [her]95-anne eyes to see]1802-some one whom anne had to close her eyes to see ! But who was [he]1801-some one ? Why had [he]1801-some one been too shy to come to the box ? Where did [he]1801-some one come from , and whither had [he]1801-some one fled ? [Kate]87-kate glanced at [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie , wondering if [she]87-kate had overheard ; but [Nollie]154-nollie , in the far corner of the box , leaned forward , deep in the music . [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton had vanished , [Landers]94-fred landers slumbered in the rear . With a little tremor of satisfaction , [Kate]87-kate saw that [she]87-kate had [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s secret to [herself]87-kate : if there was [no one]750-no one to enlighten [her]87-kate about it at least there was [no one]750-no one to share it with [her]87-kate , and [she]87-kate was glad . For the first time [she]87-kate felt a little nearer to [Anne]95-anne than all the others . “[753-he] It ’s odd , ” [she]87-kate thought , “[753-he] [I]0-i always knew it would be some one from a distance . ” But there are no real distances nowadays , and [she]87-kate reflected with an inward smile that [the fugitive]1806-the fugitive would doubtless soon reappear , and [her]87-kate curiosity be satisfied . That evening , when [Anne]95-anne followed [her]95-anne into [[her]95-anne bedroom]1762-her bedroom , [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane opened the wardrobe in which [she]0-i had placed the jewel - box . “[753-he] Here , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear ; [you]1477-my dear shall choose one thing for [me]0-i to wear . But [I]0-i want [you]1477-my dear to take back all the rest . ” [The girl]562-the girl ’s face clouded . “[0-i] [You]0-i wo n’t keep them , then ? But they ’re all [yours]758-yours ! ” “[758-yours] Even if they were , [I]0-i should n’t want [them]759-them any longer . But [they]759-them ’re not , they ’re only a trust-- ” [she]0-i paused , half smiling--“a[1477-my dear] trust till [your]1477-my dear wedding . ” [She]0-i had tried to say the word lightly , but it echoed on through the silence like a peal of silver bells . “[0-i] Oh , [my]0-i wedding ! But [I]0-i shall never marry , ” said [Anne]95-anne , laughing joyously , and catching [[her]0-i mother]379-her mother in [her]0-i arms . It was the first time [she]0-i had made so impulsive a movement ; [Kate Clephane]87-kate , trembling a little , held [her]562-the girl close . It brought [the girl]562-the girl nearer , made [her]562-the girl less aloof , to hear that familiar old denial . “[0-i] Some day before long , ” [the mother]242-the mother thought , “[0-i] [she]0-i ’ll tell [me]0-i who [he]760-he is . ” [VI]175-vi . [Kate Clephane]87-kate lay awake all night thinking of [the man who had been too shy to come into the box]1812-the man who had been too shy to come into the box . [Her]87-kate sense of security , of permanence , was gone . [She]87-kate understood now that it had been based on the idea that [her]87-kate life would henceforth go on just as it had for the two months since [her]87-kate return ; that [she]87-kate and [Anne]95-anne would always remain side by side . The idea was absurd , of course ; if [she]87-kate followed it up , [her]87-kate mind recoiled from it . To keep [Anne]95-anne for the rest of [her]95-anne life unchanged , and undesirous of change -- the aspiration was inconceivable . [She]87-kate wanted for [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter the common human round , no more , but certainly no less . Only [she]87-kate did not want [her]306-her daughter to marry yet -- not till [[they]1814-they two]1815-they two had grown to know [each other]496-each other better , till [Kate]87-kate had had time to establish [herself]87-kate in [her]87-kate new life . So [she]87-kate put it to [herself]87-kate ; but [she]87-kate knew that what [she]87-kate felt was just an abject fear of change , more change -- of being uprooted again , cast once more upon [her]87-kate own resources . No ! [She]87-kate could not picture [herself]87-kate living alone in [a little house in [New York]5-new york]1817-a little house in new york , dependent on [Drovers]1818-drovers and [Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons , and on [the good Fred Landers]94-fred landers , for [her]87-kate moral sustenance . To be with [Anne]95-anne , to play the part of [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother -- the one part , [she]87-kate now saw , that fate had meant [her]87-kate for -- that was what [she]87-kate wanted with all [her]87-kate starved and world - worn soul . To be the background , the atmosphere , of [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s life ; to depend on [Anne]95-anne , to feel that [Anne]95-anne depended on [her]95-anne ; it was the one perfect companionship [she]87-kate had ever known , the only close tie unmarred by dissimulation and distrust . The mere restfulness of it had made [her]87-kate contracted soul expand as if it were sinking into a deep warm bath . Now the sense of restfulness was gone . From the moment when [she]87-kate had seen [Anne]95-anne ’s lids drop on that secret vision , [the mother]242-the mother had known that [her]87-kate days of quietude were over . [Anne]95-anne ’s choice might be perfect ; [she]87-kate , [Kate Clephane]87-kate , might live out the rest of [her]87-kate days in peace between [Anne]95-anne and [[Anne]95-anne ’s husband]1822-anne ’s husband . But the mere possibility of [a husband]1823-a husband made everything incalculable again . The morning brought better counsel . There was [Anne]95-anne [herself]95-anne , in [her]95-anne riding - habit , aglow from an early canter , and bringing in [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s breakfast , without a trace of mystery in [her]95-anne clear eyes . There was the day ’s pleasant routine , easy and insidious , the planning and adjusting of engagements , notes to be answered , invitations to be sent out ; the habitual took [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane into its soothing hold . “[0-i] After all , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane reflected , “[0-i] [young men]1746-young men do n’t run away nowadays from falling in love . ” Probably the whole thing had been some cryptic chaff of [the youth with the football face]1825-the youth with the football face ; [Nollie]154-nollie , indirectly , might enlighten [her]187-mrs. clephane . Indirectly ; for it was clear to [Kate]87-kate that whatever [she]187-mrs. clephane learned about [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter must be learned through observing [her]306-her daughter , and not through questioning [others]1827-others . [The mother]242-the mother could not picture [herself]187-mrs. clephane as having any rights over [the girl]562-the girl , as being , under that roof , anything more than [a privileged guest]1830-a privileged guest . [Anne]95-anne ’s very insistence on treating [her]95-anne as [the mistress of [the house]255-the house]1831-the mistress of the house only emphasized [her]95-anne sense of not being so by right : it was the verbal courtesy of [the Spaniard who puts all [his]1833-the spaniard who puts all his possessions at the disposal of a casual visitor possessions at the disposal of [a casual visitor]1834-a casual visitor]1833-the spaniard who puts all his possessions at the disposal of a casual visitor . Not that there was anything in [Anne]95-anne ’s manner to suggest this ; but that to [Kate]87-kate it seemed inherent in the situation . It was absurd to assume that [her]95-anne mere return to [[John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s house]1835-john clephane ’s house could invest [her]95-anne , in [any one else]1836-any one else ’s eyes , and much less in [her]95-anne own , with the authority [she]95-anne had lost in leaving [it]1835-john clephane ’s house ; [she]95-anne would never have dreamed of behaving as if [she]95-anne thought so . [Her]95-anne task , [she]95-anne knew , was gradually , patiently , to win back , of all [she]95-anne had forfeited , the one thing [she]95-anne really valued : [[her]95-anne daughter]306-her daughter ’s love and confidence . The love , in a measure , was [hers]95-anne already ; could the confidence fail to follow ? Meanwhile , at any rate , [she]95-anne could be no more than the fondest of [lookers - on]1838-lookers - on , [the discreetest of [listeners]1840-listeners]1839-the discreetest of listeners ; and for the moment [she]95-anne neither saw nor heard anything to explain that secret tremor of [Anne]95-anne ’s eyelids . At [the Joe Tresseltons ’]1841-the joe tresseltons ’ , a few nights later , [she]95-anne had hoped for a glimpse , a hint . [Nollie]154-nollie had invited [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter ( with affectionate insistence on [the mother]242-the mother ’s presence ) to a little evening party at which [some one who was not Russian]1845-some one who was not russian was to sing -- for [Nollie]154-nollie was original in everything . [The Joe Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons had managed to lend a freshly picturesque air to [a dull old Tresselton house near [Washington Square]45-washington square]1846-a dull old tresselton house near washington square , of which [the stable]1847-the stable had become [a studio]684-a studio , and [other apartments]1849-other apartments suffered like transformations , without too much loss of character . It was typical of [Nollie]154-nollie that [she]154-nollie could give an appearance of stability to [her]154-nollie modern furnishings , just as [her]154-nollie modern manner kept its repose . It was evident that , though at [Nollie]154-nollie ’s [she]154-nollie was not in [her]154-nollie element , [she]154-nollie would not for [the world]1483-the world have been left out . [Kate Clephane]87-kate , while the music immobilized [the groups scattered about the great shadowy room]1853-the groups scattered about the great shadowy room , found [herself]87-kate scanning [them]1853-the groups scattered about the great shadowy room with a fresh intensity of attention . [She]87-kate no longer thought of [herself]87-kate as an object of curiosity to [any of [these careless self - engrossed young people]1855-these careless self - engrossed young people]1854-any of these careless self - engrossed young people ; [she]87-kate had learned that [a woman of [her]1856-a woman of her age age]1856-a woman of her age , however conspicuous [her]1856-a woman of her age past , and whatever [her]1856-a woman of her age present claims to notice , is fated to pass unremarked in a society where [youth so undisputedly rules]1857-youth so undisputedly rules . The discovery had come with a slight shock ; then [she]87-kate blessed the anonymity which made observation so much easier . Only -- what was there to observe ? Again the sameness of [the American Face]1858-the american face encompassed [her]87-kate with its innocent uniformity . How many of [them]1858-the american face it seemed to take to make up a single individuality ! Most of [them]1858-the american face were like the miles and miles between [two railway stations]1859-two railway stations . [She]87-kate saw again , with gathering wonder , that one may be young and handsome and healthy and eager , and yet unable , out of such rich elements , to evolve a personality . [Her]87-kate thoughts wandered back to the shabby faces peopling [her]87-kate former life . [She]87-kate knew every seam of [their]1858-the american face shabbiness , but now for the first time [she]87-kate seemed to see that [they]1858-the american face had been worn down by emotions and passions , however selfish , however sordid , and not merely by ice - water and dyspepsia . “[1746-young men] Since [the Americans]176-the americans have ceased to have dyspepsia , ” [she]87-kate reflected , “[176-the americans] [they]176-the americans have lost the only thing that gave [them]176-the americans any expression . ” [Landers]94-fred landers came up as the thought flashed through [her]87-kate mind , and apparently caught its reflection in [her]87-kate smile . “[762-you] [You]762-you look at [me]0-i as if [you]762-you ’d never seen [me]0-i before ; is it because [my]0-i tie ’s crooked ? ” [he]94-fred landers asked , sitting down beside [her]87-kate . “[762-you] No ; [your]762-you tie is absolutely straight . So is everything else about [you]762-you . That ’s the reason [I]0-i was looking at [you]762-you in that way . [I]0-i ca n’t get used to it ! ” [He]94-fred landers reddened a little , as if unaccustomed to such insistent scrutiny . “[0-i] Used to what ? ” “[0-i] The universal straightness . [You]762-you ’re all so young and -- and so regular ! [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i were in [a gallery of marble masterpieces]763-a gallery of marble masterpieces . ” “[0-i] As that can hardly apply to [our]764-our features , [I]0-i suppose it ’s intended to describe [our]764-our morals , ” [he]94-fred landers said with a faint grimace . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know -- [I]0-i wish [I]0-i did ! [She]242-the mother remembered that , in old days , [John Clephane]96-john clephane had always jokingly declared -- in a tone proclaiming the matter to be one mentionable only as a joke -- that [Fred Landers]94-fred landers was in love with [her]242-the mother ; and [she]242-the mother said to [herself]242-the mother that the lesson [[her]242-the mother old friend]1862-her old friend referred to was perhaps the one [she]242-the mother had unwittingly given [him]94-fred landers when [she]242-the mother went away with [another man]692-another man .
