[Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had not been allowed to see [the studio]618-the studio ; [Anne]95-anne and [Nollie]154-nollie and [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton , for a breathless week , had locked [themselves]1895-themselves in with nails and hammers and pots of paint , sealing [their]1895-themselves ears against all questioning . Then one afternoon the doors were opened , and [Kate]87-kate , coming out of the winter twilight , found [herself]87-kate in [a great half - lit room]1896-a great half - lit room with a single wide window overlooking the reaches of the Sound all jewelled and netted with lights , [the fairy span of [the Brooklyn Bridge]46-the brooklyn bridge]1897-the fairy span of the brooklyn bridge , and [the dark roof - forest of [the intervening city]1899-the intervening city]1898-the dark roof - forest of the intervening city . It all seemed strangely significant and mysterious in that disguising dusk -- full of shadows , distances , invitations . [Kate]87-kate leaned in the window , surprised at this brush of the wings of poetry . In [the room]325-the room , [Anne]95-anne had had the good taste to let the sense of space prolong itself . [It]325-the room looked more like [a great library waiting for [its]325-the room books than [a modern studio]1902-a modern studio]1901-a great library waiting for its books than a modern studio ; as though [the girl]562-the girl had measured the distance between that mighty nocturne and [her]562-the girl own timid attempts , and wanted the implements of [her]562-the girl art to pass unnoticed . [They]1895-themselves were sitting -- [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , [the Joe Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons and [one or two others]1904-one or two others -- about the tea - cups set out at one end of a long oak table , when the door opened and [Lilla Gates]153-lilla appeared , tawny and staring , in white furs and big pendulous earrings . [She]153-lilla brought with [her]153-lilla a mingled smell of cigarettes and Houbigant , and as [she]153-lilla stood there , circling [the room]325-the room with [her]153-lilla sulky contemptuous gaze , [Kate]87-kate felt a movement of annoyance . “[178-dr. johnson] Why must one forever go on being sorry for [Lilla]153-lilla ? ” [she]87-kate wondered , wincing a little as [Anne]95-anne ’s lips touched [[her]95-anne cousin]1646-her cousin ’s mauve cheek . “[153-lilla] It was nice of [you]153-lilla to come , [Lilla]153-lilla . ” “[153-lilla] Well -- [I]0-i chucked something bang - up for [you]153-lilla , ” said [Lilla]153-lilla coolly . It was evidently [her]0-i pride to be perpetually invited , perpetually swamped in a multiplicity of boring engagements . [She]153-lilla looked about [her]153-lilla again , and then dropped into an armchair . “[0-i] [Mercy]179-mercy -- [you]153-lilla _ have _ cleared the decks ! ” [she]153-lilla remarked . “[179-mercy] Ai n’t there going to be any more furniture than this ? ” “[179-mercy] Oh , the furniture ’s all outside -- and the pictures too , ” [Anne]95-anne said , pointing to the great window . “[179-mercy] What -- [Brooklyn Bridge]46-the brooklyn bridge ? Lord!--Oh , but [I]0-i see : [you]153-lilla ’ve kept [the place]790-the place clear for dancing . [Good girl]791-good girl , [Anne]95-anne ! Can [I]0-i bring in some of [[my]0-i little boys]792-my little boys sometimes ? Is that a pianola ? ” [she]0-i added , with a pounce toward the grand piano in a shadowy corner . “[0-i] [I]0-i like [this kindergarten]793-this kindergarten , ” [she]0-i pronounced . [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie laughed . “[0-i] If [you]153-lilla come , [Anne]95-anne wo n’t let [you]153-lilla dance . [You]153-lilla ’ll all have to sit for [her]95-anne -- for hours and hours . ” “[153-lilla] Well , [we]794-we ’ll sit between the dances then . Ai n’t [I]0-i going to have a latch - key , [Anne]95-anne ? ” [She]95-anne stood leaning against the piano , sipping the cock - tail [some one]1801-some one had handed [her]95-anne , [her]95-anne head thrown back , and the light from a shaded lamp striking up at [her]95-anne columnar throat and the green glitter of [her]95-anne earrings , which suggested to [Kate Clephane]87-kate the poisonous antennæ of some giant insect . [Anne]95-anne stood close to [her]87-kate , slender , erect , [her]95-anne small head clasped in close braids , [her]95-anne hands hanging at [her]95-anne sides , dead - white against the straight dark folds of [her]95-anne dress . There was something distinctly unpleasant to [Kate Clephane]87-kate in the proximity of [the two]573-the two , and [she]87-kate rose and moved toward the piano . As [she]87-kate sat down before it , letting [her]87-kate hands drift into the opening bars of a half - remembered melody , [she]87-kate saw [Lilla]153-lilla , in [her]153-lilla vague lounging way , draw nearer to [Anne]95-anne , who held out a hand for the empty cock - tail glass . The gesture brought [them]573-the two so close that [Lilla]153-lilla , slightly drooping [her]153-lilla head , could let fall , hardly above [her]153-lilla breath , but audibly to [Kate]87-kate : “[795-he] [He]795-he ’s back again . [He]795-he bothered the life out of [me]0-i to bring [him]795-he here today . ” Again [Kate]87-kate saw that quick drop of [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s lids ; this time it was accompanied by a just - perceptible tremor of the hand that received the glass . “[795-he] Nonsense , [Lilla]153-lilla ! ” “[153-lilla] Well , what on earth am [I]0-i to do about it ? [I]0-i ca n’t get [the police]1492-the police to run [him]795-he in , can [I]0-i ? ” [Anne]95-anne laughed -- the faintest half - pleased laugh of impatience and dismissal . “[797-you] [You]797-you may have to , ” [she]87-kate said . [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie , in the interval , had glided up and slipped an arm through [Lilla]153-lilla ’s . “[797-you] Come along , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear . There ’s to be no dancing here today . ” [Her]154-nollie little brown face had the worn sharp look it often took on when [she]154-nollie was mothering [Lilla]153-lilla . But [Lilla]153-lilla ’s feet were firmly planted . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t budge till [I]0-i get another cock - tail . ” [One of [the young men]1911-the young men]1910-one of the young men hastened to supply [her]153-lilla , and [Anne]95-anne turned to [[her]95-anne other guests]1912-her other guests . A few minutes later [the Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons and [Lilla]153-lilla went away , and one by one [the remaining visitors]1913-the remaining visitors followed , leaving [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter alone in the recovered serenity of [the empty room]1916-the empty room . But there was no serenity in [Kate]87-kate . That half - whispered exchange between [Lilla Gates]153-lilla and [Anne]95-anne had stirred all [her]95-anne old apprehensions and awakened new ones . The idea that [[her]95-anne daughter]306-her daughter was [one of [[Lilla]153-lilla ’s confidants]1919-lilla ’s confidants]1918-one of lilla ’s confidants was inexpressibly disturbing . Yet the more [she]0-i considered , the less [she]0-i knew how to convey [her]0-i anxiety to [[her]0-i daughter]306-her daughter . “[0-i] If [I]0-i only knew how intimate they really are -- what [she]799-she really thinks of [Lilla]153-lilla ! ” For the first time [she]0-i understood on what unknown foundations [her]0-i fellowship with [Anne]95-anne was built . Were they solid ? Would [they]1921-they hold ? Was [Anne]95-anne ’s feeling for [her]0-i more than a sudden girlish enthusiasm for [an agreeable older woman]1922-an agreeable older woman , the kind of sympathy based on things [one]247-one can enumerate , and may change [one]247-one ’s mind about , rather than the blind warmth of habit ? [She]0-i stood musing while [Anne]95-anne moved about [the studio]618-the studio , putting away the music , straightening a picture here and there . “[799-she] And this is where [you]0-i ’re going to work-- ” [Anne]95-anne nodded joyously . “[153-lilla] [Lilla]153-lilla apparently expects [you]0-i to turn [it]800-it into [a dance - hall]801-a dance - hall for [her]153-lilla benefit . ” “[180-poor lilla] [Poor Lilla]180-poor lilla ! [She]153-lilla ca n’t see [a new room]802-a new room without wanting to fox - trot in [it]802-a new room . Life , for [her]153-lilla , wherever [she]153-lilla is , consists in going somewhere else in order to do exactly the same thing . ” [Kate]87-kate was relieved : there was no mistaking the half - disdainful pity of the tone . “[180-poor lilla] Well -- don’t give [her]153-lilla that latch - key ! ” [she]87-kate laughed , gathering up [her]87-kate furs . [Anne]95-anne echoed the laugh . “[180-poor lilla] There are to be only two latch - keys -- yours and [mine]0-i , ” [she]87-kate said ; and [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter went gaily down [the steep stairs]1928-the steep stairs . * * * * * The days , after that , moved on with the undefinable reassurance of habit . [Kate Clephane]87-kate was beginning to feel [herself]87-kate part of an old - established routine . [She]87-kate had tried to organize [her]87-kate life in such a way that it should fit into [Anne]95-anne ’s without awkward overlapping . [Anne]95-anne , nowadays , after [her]95-anne early canter , went daily to [the studio]618-the studio and painted till lunch ; sometimes , as the days lengthened , [she]95-anne went back for another two hours ’ work in the afternoon . When the going was too bad for [her]95-anne morning ride [she]95-anne usually walked to [the studio]618-the studio , and [Kate]87-kate sometimes walked with [her]95-anne , or went through [the Park]1931-the park to meet [her]95-anne on [her]95-anne return . When [she]95-anne painted in the afternoon , [Kate]87-kate would occasionally drop in for tea , and [they]1932-they would return [home]246-home together on foot in the dusk . But [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane was scrupulously careful not to intrude on [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s working - hours ; [she]187-mrs. clephane held back , not with any tiresome display of discretion , but with the air of caring for [her]187-mrs. clephane own independence too much not to respect [Anne]95-anne ’s . Sometimes , now that [she]187-mrs. clephane had settled down into this new way of life , [she]187-mrs. clephane was secretly aware of feeling a little lonely ; there were hours when the sense of being only [a visitor in [the house where [her]187-mrs. clephane life ought to have been lived]1936-the house where her life ought to have been lived gave [her]187-mrs. clephane the same drifting uprooted feeling which had been the curse of [her]187-mrs. clephane other existence]1935-a visitor in the house where her life ought to have been lived gave her the same drifting uprooted feeling which had been the curse of her other existence . It was not [Anne]95-anne ’s fault ; nor that , in this new life , every moment was not interesting and even purposeful , since each might give [her]187-mrs. clephane the chance of serving [Anne]95-anne , pleasing [Anne]95-anne , in some way or another getting closer to [Anne]95-anne . But this very feeling took a morbid intensity from the fact of having no common memories , no shared associations , to feed on . [Kate]87-kate was frightened , sometimes , by its likeness to that other isolated and devouring emotion which [her]87-kate love for [Chris]88-chris had been . Everything might have been different , [she]87-kate thought , if [she]87-kate had had more to do , or [more friends of [her]87-kate own]1937-more friends of her own to occupy [her]87-kate . But [[Anne]95-anne ’s establishment]1938-anne ’s establishment , which had been [[her]187-mrs. clephane grandmother]1544-her grandmother ’s , still travelled smoothly enough on its own momentum , and though [the girl]562-the girl insisted that [[her]187-mrs. clephane mother]379-her mother was now [the head of [the house]255-the house]1942-the head of the house , the headship involved little more than ordering dinner , and talking over linen and carpets and curtains with [[old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s house - keeper]1944-old mrs. clephane ’s house - keeper . Then , as to [friends]251-friends -- was it because [she]187-mrs. clephane was too much engrossed in [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter to make any ? Or because [her]187-mrs. clephane life had been too incommunicably different from that of [[her]187-mrs. clephane bustling middle - aged contemporaries]1947-her bustling middle - aged contemporaries , absorbed by local and domestic questions [she]187-mrs. clephane had no part in ? Or had [she]187-mrs. clephane been too suddenly changed from [a self - centred woman , insatiable for personal excitements]1948-a self - centred woman , insatiable for personal excitements , into that new being , [a mother]356-a mother , [her]187-mrs. clephane centre of gravity in a life not [hers]187-mrs. clephane ? [She]187-mrs. clephane did not know ; [she]187-mrs. clephane felt only that [she]187-mrs. clephane no longer had time for anything but motherhood , and must be content to bridge over , as best [she]187-mrs. clephane could , the unoccupied intervals . And , after all , the intervals were not many . [[Her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter never appeared without instantly filling up every crevice of the present , and overflowing into the past and the future , so that , even in [the mother]242-the mother ’s rare lapses into despondency , life without [Anne]95-anne , like life before [Anne]95-anne , had become unthinkable . [She]187-mrs. clephane was revolving this for the thousandth time as [she]187-mrs. clephane turned into [the Park]1931-the park one afternoon to meet [Anne]95-anne on [the latter]1953-the latter ’s way homeward . The days were already much longer ; the difference in the light , and that premature languor of the air which comes , in [America]10-america , before [the sleeping earth]1954-the sleeping earth seems to expect it , made [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane feel that the year had turned , that a new season was opening in [her]187-mrs. clephane new life . [She]187-mrs. clephane walked on with the vague sense of confidence in the future which the first touch of spring gives . The worst of the way was past -- how easily , how smoothly to the feet ! Where misunderstanding and failure had been so probable , [she]187-mrs. clephane was increasingly sure of having understood and succeeded . And already [she]187-mrs. clephane and [Anne]95-anne were making delightful plans for the spring .... Ahead of [her]187-mrs. clephane , in [a transverse alley]1955-a transverse alley , [she]187-mrs. clephane was disagreeably surprised by the sight of [Lilla Gates]153-lilla . There was no mistaking that tall lounging figure , though it was moving slowly away from [her]187-mrs. clephane . [Lilla]153-lilla at that hour in [the Park]48-the park ? It seemed curious and improbable . Yet [Lilla]153-lilla it was ; and [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s conclusion was drawn immediately . “[0-i] Who is [she]803-she waiting for ? ” Whoever it was had not come ; the perspective beyond [Lilla]153-lilla was empty . After a moment [she]153-lilla hastened [her]153-lilla step , and vanished behind a clump of evergreens at the crossing of [the paths]1956-the paths . [Kate]87-kate did not linger to watch for [her]153-lilla reappearance . The incident was too trifling to fix the attention ; after all , what had [one]247-one ever expected of [Lilla]153-lilla but that [she]153-lilla might be found loitering in unlikely places , in quest of [objectionable people]1958-objectionable people ? There was nothing new in that -- nor did [Kate]87-kate even regret not having a glimpse of [the objectionable person]1959-the objectionable person . In [her]187-mrs. clephane growing reassurance about [Anne]95-anne , [Lilla]153-lilla ’s affairs had lost whatever slight interest [they]1960-they once offered . [She]187-mrs. clephane walked on -- but [her]187-mrs. clephane mood was altered . The sight of [Lilla]153-lilla lingering in [that deserted path]1961-that deserted path had called up old associations . [She]187-mrs. clephane remembered meetings of the same kind -- but was it [[her]187-mrs. clephane own young figure [she]187-mrs. clephane saw fading down those far - off perspectives]1962-her own young figure she saw fading down those far - off perspectives ? Well -- if it were , let it go ! [She]187-mrs. clephane owned no kinship with [that unhappy ghost]1963-that unhappy ghost . Serene , middle - aged , respected and respectable , [she]187-mrs. clephane walked on again out of that vanishing past into the warm tangible present . And at any moment now [she]187-mrs. clephane might meet [Anne]95-anne . [She]187-mrs. clephane had turned down a wide walk leading to one of [the [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue entrances of [the Park]1931-the park]1964-the fifth avenue entrances of the park . [One]247-one could see a long way ahead ; there were [people]256-people coming and going . [Two women]1968-two women passed , with [some noisy children]1969-some noisy children racing before [them]1968-two women , [a milliner ’s boy]1970-a milliner ’s boy , whistling , [his]1970-a milliner ’s boy boxes slung over [his]1970-a milliner ’s boy shoulder , a paralytic pushing [himself]1970-a milliner ’s boy along in a wheeled chair ; then , coming toward [her]187-mrs. clephane from the direction of [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue , [a man who half - stopped]1971-a man who half - stopped , recognized [her]187-mrs. clephane , and raised [his]1971-a man who half - stopped hat . BOOK II . VIII . “[88-chris] [Chris]88-chris ! ” [she]187-mrs. clephane said . [She]187-mrs. clephane felt [herself]187-mrs. clephane trembling all over ; then , abruptly , mysteriously , and in the very act of uttering [his]88-chris name , [she]187-mrs. clephane ceased to tremble , and it came flooding in on [her]187-mrs. clephane with a shock of wonder that the worst was already over -- that at last [she]187-mrs. clephane was going to be free . “[88-chris] Well , well , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane heard [him]88-chris saying , in that round full voice which always became fuller and more melodious when it had any inner uncertainty to mask ; and “[88-chris] If only , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane thought , “[88-chris] it does n’t all come back when [he]88-chris laughs ! ” [He]88-chris laughed . “[88-chris] [I]0-i ’m so glad ... _ glad _ , ” [he]88-chris reiterated , as if explaining ; and with the laugh in [her]187-mrs. clephane ears [she]187-mrs. clephane still felt [herself]187-mrs. clephane as lucidly , as incredibly remote from [him]88-chris . “[0-i] Glad ? ” [she]187-mrs. clephane echoed , a little less sure of [her]187-mrs. clephane speech than of [her]187-mrs. clephane thoughts , and remembering how sometimes the smile in [his]88-chris eyes used to break up [her]187-mrs. clephane words into little meaningless splinters that [she]187-mrs. clephane could never put together again till [he]88-chris was gone . “[0-i] Of [your]88-chris good luck , [I]0-i mean .... [I]0-i ’ve heard , of course . ” And now [she]187-mrs. clephane had [him]88-chris , for the first time , actually reddening and stammering as [she]187-mrs. clephane [herself]187-mrs. clephane used to do , and catching at the splinters of [his]88-chris own words ! Ah , the trick was done -- [she]187-mrs. clephane could even see , as [they]1972-they continued to face [each other]496-each other in the searching spring light , that [he]88-chris had reddened , thickened , hardened -- as if [the old Chris]1974-the old chris had been walled into this new one , and were not even looking at [her]187-mrs. clephane out of the windows of [[his]88-chris prison]1975-his prison . “[0-i] [My]0-i good luck ? ” [she]187-mrs. clephane echoed again , while the truth still danced in [her]187-mrs. clephane ears : the truth that [she]187-mrs. clephane was free , free , free -- away from [him]88-chris at last , far enough off to see [him]88-chris and judge [him]88-chris ! It must have been [his]88-chris bad taste -- the bad taste that could lead [him]88-chris into such an opening as that -- which , from the very first , [she]187-mrs. clephane had felt in [him]88-chris , and tried not to feel , even when [she]187-mrs. clephane was worshipping [him]88-chris most blindly . But , after all , if [she]187-mrs. clephane felt so free , why be so cruel ? Ah , because the terror was still there -- it had only shifted its ground . What frightened [her]187-mrs. clephane now was not the thought of [their]1976-their past but of [their]1976-their future . And [she]187-mrs. clephane must not let [him]88-chris see that it frightened [her]187-mrs. clephane . What had [his]88-chris last words been ? Ah , yes-- . [She]187-mrs. clephane answered : “[0-i] Of course [I]0-i ’m very happy to be at [home]246-home again . ” [He]88-chris lowered [his]88-chris voice to murmur : “[0-i] And [I]0-i ’m happy _ for _ [you]0-i . ” Yes ; [she]187-mrs. clephane remembered now ; it was always in emotional moments that [his]88-chris tact failed [him]88-chris , [his]88-chris subtlety vanished , and [he]88-chris seemed to be reciting speeches learned by heart out of some sentimental novel -- the very kind [he]88-chris was so clever at ridiculing . [They]1977-them continued to stand facing [each other]496-each other , [their]1977-them inspiration spent , as if waiting for the accident that had swept [them]1977-them together to whirl [them]1977-them apart again . Suddenly [she]187-mrs. clephane risked ( since it was better to know ): “[0-i] So [you]0-i ’re living now in [New York]5-new york ? ” [He]88-chris shook [his]88-chris head with an air of melancholy . “[0-i] No such luck . [I]0-i ’m back in [Baltimore]2-baltimore again . Come full circle . For a time , after the war , [I]0-i was on a newspaper [there]498-there ; interviewing [film - stars]806-film - stars and [base - ball fans]807-base - ball fans and [female prohibitionists]808-female prohibitionists . Then [I]0-i tried to run [a Country Club]809-a country club -- awful job ! All book - keeping , and rows between [members]810-members . Now [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew has taken pity on [me]0-i ; [I]0-i ’m what [I]0-i suppose [you]811-you ’d call [[his]181-horace maclew private secretary]812-his private secretary . No eight - hour day : [he]181-horace maclew keeps [me]0-i pretty close . It ’s only once in a blue moon [I]0-i can get away . ” [She]0-i felt [her]0-i tightened heart dilating . [Baltimore]2-baltimore was n’t very far away ; but it was far enough as long as [he]181-horace maclew had anything to keep [him]181-horace maclew [there]498-there . [She]0-i knew about [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew , [an elderly wealthy bibliophile]1980-an elderly wealthy bibliophile and philanthropist , with countless municipal and social interests in [[his]181-horace maclew own town]1981-his own town , and [[a big country]1982-a big country - place just outside [it]2-baltimore]1983-a big country - place just outside it . No ; [[Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s private secretary]1984-mr. maclew ’s private secretary was not likely to have many holidays . But how long would [Chris]88-chris resign [himself]88-chris to such drudgery ? [She]0-i wanted to be kind and say : “[181-horace maclew] And [your]0-i painting ? [Your]0-i writing ? ” but [she]0-i did n’t dare . Besides , [he]88-chris had probably left both phases far behind [him]88-chris , and there was no need , really , for [her]0-i to concern [herself]0-i with [his]88-chris new hobbies , whatever they might be . Of course [she]0-i knew that [he]88-chris and [she]0-i would have to stand there staring at [one another]1985-one another till [she]0-i made a gesture of dismissal ; but on what note was [she]0-i to make it ? The natural thing ( since [she]0-i felt so safe and easy with [him]88-chris ) would have been to say : “[0-i] The next time [you]0-i ’re in [town]813-town [you]0-i must be sure to look [me]0-i up-- ” . But , with [him]88-chris , how could one be certain of not having such a suggestion taken literally ? Now that [he]88-chris had seen [she]0-i was not afraid of [him]88-chris [he]88-chris would probably not be afraid of _ [her]0-i _ ; if [he]88-chris wanted a good dinner , or an evening at [the Opera]1612-the opera , [he]88-chris ’d be as likely as not to call [her]0-i up and ask for it . And suddenly , as [they]1987-they hung there , [she]0-i caught , over [his]88-chris shoulder , a glimpse of another figure just turning into [the Park]1931-the park from the same direction ; [Anne]95-anne , with [her]95-anne quick step , [her]95-anne intent inward air , as [she]95-anne always moved and looked when [she]95-anne had just left [her]95-anne easel . In another moment [Anne]95-anne would be upon [them]1987-they . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane held out [her]187-mrs. clephane hand : for a fraction of a second it lay in [his]88-chris . “[0-i] Well , goodbye ; [I]0-i ’m glad to know [you]0-i ’ve got a job that must be so interesting . ” “[0-i] Oh -- interesting ! ” [He]88-chris dismissed it with a gesture . “[0-i] But [I]0-i ’m glad to see [you]0-i , ” [he]88-chris added ; “[0-i] just to _ see _ [you]0-i , ” with a clever shifting of the emphasis . [He]88-chris paused a moment , and then risked a smile . “[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t look a day older , [you]0-i know . ” [She]0-i threw [her]0-i head back with an answering smile . “[0-i] Why should [I]0-i , when [I]0-i feel years younger ? ” Thank heaven , [an approaching group of people]1989-an approaching group of people must have obstructed [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s view ! [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane hurried on , wanting to put as much distance as [she]187-mrs. clephane could between [herself]187-mrs. clephane and [Chris]88-chris ’s retreating figure before [she]187-mrs. clephane came up with [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter . When [she]187-mrs. clephane did , [she]187-mrs. clephane plunged straight into [the girl]562-the girl ’s eyes , and saw that they were still turned on [her]187-mrs. clephane inward vision . “[0-i] [Dearest]716-dearest , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane cried gaily , “[0-i] [I]0-i can see by [your]716-dearest look that [you]716-dearest ’ve been doing a good day ’s work . ” [Anne]95-anne ’s soul rose slowly to the surface , shining out between deep lashes . “[0-i] How do [you]716-dearest know , [I]0-i wonder ? [I]0-i suppose [you]716-dearest must have been a great deal with [somebody who painted]815-somebody who painted . For a long time afterward [one]247-one carries the thing about with one wherever [one]247-one goes . ” [She]187-mrs. clephane slipped [her]187-mrs. clephane arm in [Kate]87-kate ’s , and turned unresistingly as [the latter]1953-the latter guided [her]95-anne back toward [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue . “[247-one] It ’s dusty in [the Park]1931-the park , and [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i wanted a quick walk [home]246-home . [I]0-i like [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue when the lights are just coming out , ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane explained . * * * * * All night long [she]187-mrs. clephane lay awake in [the great bed of [the Clephane spare - room]1995-the clephane spare - room]1994-the great bed of the clephane spare - room , and stared at [Chris]88-chris . While [they]1996-they still faced [each other]496-each other -- and after [her]187-mrs. clephane first confused impression of [his]88-chris having thickened and reddened -- [she]187-mrs. clephane had seen [him]88-chris only through the blur of [her]187-mrs. clephane fears and tremors . Even after [they]1996-they had parted , and [she]187-mrs. clephane was walking [home]246-home with [Anne]95-anne , the shock of the encounter still tingling in [her]187-mrs. clephane , [he]88-chris remained far off , almost imponderable , less close and importunate than [her]187-mrs. clephane memories of [him]88-chris . It was as if [his]88-chris actual presence had exorcised [his]88-chris ghost . But now-- [He]88-chris had not vanished ; [he]88-chris had only been waiting . Waiting till [she]187-mrs. clephane was alone in [[her]187-mrs. clephane room]1999-her room in [the sleeping house]2000-the sleeping house , in [the unheeding city]2001-the unheeding city . How alone , [she]187-mrs. clephane had never more acutely felt . Who on [earth]2002-earth was there to intervene between [them]1996-they , when there was not [a soul to whom [she]187-mrs. clephane could even breathe that [she]187-mrs. clephane had met [him]88-chris]2003-a soul to whom she could even breathe that she had met him ? [She]187-mrs. clephane lay in the darkness with terrified staring eyes , and there [he]88-chris stood , [his]88-chris smile deriding [her]187-mrs. clephane -- [a strange composite figure]2004-a strange composite figure , made equally of the old [Chris]88-chris and the new .... It was of no use to shut [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes ; [he]88-chris was between lid and ball . It was of no use to murmur disjointed phrases to [herself]187-mrs. clephane , conjure [him]88-chris away with the language of [her]187-mrs. clephane new life , with allusions and incantations unknown to [him]88-chris ; [he]88-chris just stood there and waited . Well , then -- [she]187-mrs. clephane would face it out now , would deal with [him]88-chris ! But how ? What was [he]88-chris to [her]187-mrs. clephane , and what did [he]88-chris want of [her]187-mrs. clephane ? Yes : it all came to the question of what [he]88-chris wanted ; it always had . When had there ever been a question of what _ [she]187-mrs. clephane _ wanted ? [He]88-chris took what [he]88-chris chose from life , gathered and let drop and went on : it was [the artist]2005-the artist ’s way , [he]88-chris told [her]187-mrs. clephane . But what could [he]88-chris possibly want of [her]187-mrs. clephane now , and why did [she]187-mrs. clephane imagine that [he]88-chris wanted anything , when by [his]88-chris own showing [he]88-chris was so busy and so provided for ? [She]187-mrs. clephane pulled [herself]187-mrs. clephane together , suddenly ashamed of [her]187-mrs. clephane own thoughts . In pity for [herself]187-mrs. clephane [she]187-mrs. clephane would have liked to draw the old tattered glamour over [him]88-chris ; but there must always have been rents and cracks in it , and now it could n’t by any tugging be made to cover [him]88-chris . No ; [she]187-mrs. clephane did n’t love [him]88-chris any longer ; [she]187-mrs. clephane was sure of that . Like [a traveller who has just skirted an abyss]2006-a traveller who has just skirted an abyss , [she]187-mrs. clephane could lean over without dizziness and measure the depth into which [she]187-mrs. clephane had not fallen . But if that were so , why was [she]187-mrs. clephane so afraid of [him]88-chris ? If it were a mere question of [her]187-mrs. clephane own social safety , a mean dread of having [her]187-mrs. clephane past suspected , why , [she]187-mrs. clephane was more ashamed of that than of having loved [him]88-chris . [She]187-mrs. clephane would almost rather have endured the misery of still loving [him]88-chris than of seeing what [he]88-chris and [she]187-mrs. clephane looked like , now that the tide had ebbed from [them]2007-their . [She]187-mrs. clephane had been [a coward]2008-a coward ; [she]187-mrs. clephane had been stiff and frightened and conventional , when , from the vantage - ground of [her]187-mrs. clephane new security , [she]187-mrs. clephane could so easily have been friendly and generous ; [she]187-mrs. clephane felt like rushing out into [the streets]1476-the streets to find [him]88-chris , to speak to [him]88-chris as [she]187-mrs. clephane ought to have spoken , to tell [him]88-chris that [she]187-mrs. clephane was not in the least afraid of [him]88-chris . And yet [she]187-mrs. clephane _ was _ ! [She]187-mrs. clephane supposed it was the old incalculable element in [him]88-chris , that profound fundamental difference in [their]2007-their natures which used to make [their]2007-their closest nearness seem more like a spell than a reality . [She]187-mrs. clephane understood now that if [she]187-mrs. clephane had always been afraid of [him]88-chris it was just because [she]187-mrs. clephane could never tell what [she]187-mrs. clephane was afraid of .... If only there had been [some one to whom [she]187-mrs. clephane could confess [herself]187-mrs. clephane]2010-some one to whom she could confess herself , [some one who would laugh away [her]187-mrs. clephane terrors]2011-some one who would laugh away her terrors ! [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ? But [she]187-mrs. clephane would frighten [him]88-chris more than [he]88-chris reassured [her]187-mrs. clephane . And [the others]523-the others -- [the kindly approving family]2013-the kindly approving family ? What would [they]523-the others do but avert [their]523-the others eyes and beg [her]187-mrs. clephane to be reasonable and remember [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ? Well -- and [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter , then ? And [Anne]95-anne ? Was there any one on [earth]2002-earth but [Anne]95-anne who would understand [her]187-mrs. clephane ? The oppression of the night and the silence , and the rumour of [her]187-mrs. clephane own fears , were becoming intolerable . [She]187-mrs. clephane could not endure them any longer . [She]187-mrs. clephane jumped up , flung on [her]187-mrs. clephane dressing - gown , and stole out of [[her]187-mrs. clephane room]1999-her room . [The corridor]2018-the corridor was empty and obscure ; only a faint light from [the lower hall]2019-the lower hall cast its reflection upward on the ceiling of the stairs . From below came the pompous tick of the hall clock , as loud as a knocking in the silence . [She]187-mrs. clephane stole to [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s door , and kneeling down laid [her]187-mrs. clephane ear against the crack . Presently , through the hush , [she]187-mrs. clephane caught the soft rhythmic breath of youthful sleep , and pictured [Anne]95-anne , slim and motionless , [her]95-anne dark hair in orderly braids along the pillow . The vision startled [the mother]242-the mother back to sanity . [She]187-mrs. clephane got up stiffly and stood looking about [her]187-mrs. clephane with dazed eyes . Suddenly the light on the stairs , the nocturnal ticking , swept another vision through [her]187-mrs. clephane throbbing brain . In just such a silence , before the first cold sounds of the winter daylight , [she]187-mrs. clephane had crept down [those very stairs]2022-those very stairs , unchained the front door , slipped back one after another of [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s patent bolts , and let [herself]187-mrs. clephane out of [[his]96-john clephane house]649-his house for the last time . Ah , what business had [she]187-mrs. clephane in [it]649-his house now , [her]187-mrs. clephane hand on [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s door ? [She]187-mrs. clephane dragged [herself]187-mrs. clephane back to [[her]187-mrs. clephane own room]2025-her own room , switched on the light , and sat hunched up in the great bed , mechanically turning over the pages of a fashion - paper [she]187-mrs. clephane had picked up on [her]187-mrs. clephane sitting - room table . Skirts were certainly going to be narrower that spring .... [IX]183-ix . “[153-lilla] [Lilla]153-lilla -- but of course [he]820-he comes for [Lilla]153-lilla ! ” [she]187-mrs. clephane exclaimed . [She]187-mrs. clephane raised [herself]187-mrs. clephane on [her]187-mrs. clephane elbow , saw the bed - lamp still burning , and the fashion - paper on the floor beside the bed . The night was not over ; there was no grayness yet between the curtains . [She]187-mrs. clephane must have dropped into a short uneasy sleep , from which [Lilla]153-lilla ’s loitering expectant figure , floating away from [her]187-mrs. clephane down [an alley of [the Park]1931-the park]2026-an alley of the park , had detached itself with such emphasis that the shock awoke [her]187-mrs. clephane . [Lilla]153-lilla and [Chris]88-chris ... but of course [they]2028-they had gone to [the Park]1931-the park to meet [each other]496-each other ! Why should [he]820-he have happened to turn in at that particular gate , at that particular hour , unless to find [some one who , a few yards off , careless and unconcerned , was so obviously lingering there to be found]2031-some one who , a few yards off , careless and unconcerned , was so obviously lingering there to be found ? The discovery gave [Kate Clephane]87-kate a sensation of actual physical nausea . [She]187-mrs. clephane sat up in bed , pushed [her]187-mrs. clephane hair back from [her]187-mrs. clephane damp forehead , and repeated the two names slowly , as if trying from those conjoined syllables to disentangle the clue to the mystery . For mystery there was ; [she]187-mrs. clephane was sure of it now ! [People like [Lilla Gates]153-lilla and [Chris]88-chris]2032-people like lilla gates and chris did not wander aimlessly through [Central Park]50-central park at the secret hour when the winter dusk begins to blur its paths . Every moment of such purposeless lives was portioned out , packed with futilities . [Kate]87-kate had seen enough of that in [her]87-kate enforced association with [the idlers of [a dozen watering - places]2034-a dozen watering - places]2033-the idlers of a dozen watering - places , [her]87-kate dreary participation in [their]2033-the idlers of a dozen watering - places idling . And how the clue , now [she]187-mrs. clephane held it , explained everything ! Explained , first of all , why [Chris]88-chris , the ready , [the resourceful]2035-the resourceful , had been so tongue - tied and halting when [they]2036-their met . Why had [she]187-mrs. clephane not been struck by that before ? [She]187-mrs. clephane saw now that , if [she]187-mrs. clephane was afraid of [him]88-chris , [he]88-chris was a thousand times more afraid of [her]187-mrs. clephane ! And how could [she]187-mrs. clephane have imagined that , to [a man like [Chris]88-chris]2037-a man like chris , the mere fact of running across [a discarded mistress]2038-a discarded mistress would be disconcerting , or even wholly unpleasant ? Who better than [he]88-chris should know how to deal with such emergencies ? [His]88-chris past must be strewn with precedents . As [her]187-mrs. clephane memory travelled back over [their]2036-their life together [she]187-mrs. clephane recalled [their]2036-their having met , one day at [Hadrian ’s Villa]51-hadrian ’s villa , [a little woman]2039-a little woman , [a Mrs. Guy So - and - so --]2040-a mrs. guy so - and - so -- [she]187-mrs. clephane had even forgotten the name ! [She]187-mrs. clephane and [Chris]88-chris had been wandering , close - linked -- for the tourist season was over , and besides , [they]2036-their cared so little who saw [them]2036-their -- through the rich garlanded ruins , all perfume and enchantment ; and there , in [their]2036-their path , had stood [a solitary figure]2041-a solitary figure , the figure of [a young woman]2042-a young woman , pretty , well - dressed , with a hungry melancholy face . A little way behind [her]187-mrs. clephane , [a heavy elderly gentleman in blue goggles and an overcoat]2043-a heavy elderly gentleman in blue goggles and an overcoat was having archæological explanations shouted into [his]2043-a heavy elderly gentleman in blue goggles and an overcoat deaf ear and curved hand by [a guide with a rasping German accent]2044-a guide with a rasping german accent -- and [Chris]88-chris , exclaiming : “[820-he] By [Jove]184-jove , there are [the So - and - sos]821-the so - and - sos ! ” had advanced with outstretched hand , introduced [the two women]2045-the two women , and poured out upon [the melancholy newcomer]2046-the melancholy newcomer a flood of laughing allusive talk , half chaff , half sentiment , and all as easily , as unconcernedly as if [her]187-mrs. clephane great eyes had not , all the while , been pleading , pleading with [him]823-he to remember . And then , afterward , when [Kate]87-kate had said to [him]823-he : “[821-the so - and - sos] But was n’t that [the woman [you]823-he told [me]0-i about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with [you]823-he]822-the woman you told me about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with you ? ” [he]823-he had merely answered : “[822-the woman you told me about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with you] Oh , not particularly with _ [me]0-i _ , as far as [I]0-i remember-- ” and [she]87-kate had hugged [his]823-he arm closer , and thought how funny [he]823-he was , and luxuriously pitied [the other woman]2047-the other woman . Yes ; that was the real [Chris]88-chris ; always on the spot , easy - going and gay . The stammering evasive apparition in [the Park]1931-the park had no resemblance to [that Chris]88-chris ; [Kate]87-kate knew instinctively that it was not the fact of meeting [her]87-kate that had so disturbed [him]823-he , but the fact that , for some reason , the meeting might interfere with [his]823-he plans . But what plans ? Why , [his]823-he plans with [Lilla]153-lilla -- which would necessarily bring [him]823-he in contact with [the clan]1632-the clan , since [they]1632-the clan so resolutely backed [Lilla]153-lilla up , and thus expose [him]823-he to -- to what ? To [Kate]87-kate ’s betraying [him]823-he ? For a moment [she]87-kate half - laughed at the idea . For what could [she]87-kate do to injure [him]823-he , after all ? And , whatever [his]823-he plans were , how could [he]823-he ever imagine [her]87-kate interfering with [them]1632-the clan , when to do so would be to betray [her]87-kate own secret ? [She]87-kate lay there in the dreary dawn and tried to work [her]87-kate way through the labyrinth . And then , all at once , it came to [her]87-kate : what if [he]823-he wanted to marry [Lilla]153-lilla ? And what more probable than that [he]823-he did ? It was evident that living with [[his]823-he people]2050-his people and administering [Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s philanthropies was not a life that [he]823-he would have called “[822-the woman you told me about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with you] fit for a dog ” . [He]823-he liked money , [she]87-kate knew , for all [his]823-he careless way ; [he]823-he wanted to have it , but [he]823-he hated to earn it . And if [he]823-he married [Lilla]153-lilla there would be plenty of money . [The Drovers]702-the drovers would see to that -- [Kate]87-kate could imagine nothing more likely to unloose [their]702-the drovers purse - strings than the possibility of “[822-the woman you told me about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with you] settling ” [Lilla]153-lilla , and getting rid of the perpetual menace that [her]153-lilla roving fancies hung over [[her]153-lilla mother]379-her mother ’s neatly - waved head . [Chris]88-chris , of course , was far too clever not to have seen that , and worked out the consequences in [his]88-chris own mind . If [Lilla]153-lilla had been plain and dowdy [he]88-chris would n’t even have considered it -- [Kate]87-kate did [him]88-chris that justice . If [he]88-chris liked money [he]88-chris liked it in a large lordly way , and only as one among several things which it was convenient but not essential to have . [He]88-chris would never do a base thing for money ; but , after all , there was nothing base in marrying [Lilla]153-lilla if [he]88-chris liked [her]153-lilla looks and was amused by [her]153-lilla talk , as [he]88-chris probably was . There was one side of [Chris]88-chris , the side [Kate Clephane]87-kate had least explored , and was least capable of understanding , which might very well find its complement in [Lilla]153-lilla .... [Kate]87-kate ’s aching eyes continued to strain into the future . If that were really [his]88-chris plan , of course [he]88-chris would be afraid of [her]153-lilla ! For [he]88-chris knew [her]153-lilla too , knew [her]153-lilla ever so much better than [she]153-lilla did [him]88-chris , and would be sure to guess that , much as [she]153-lilla would want to cover up [their]2053-their past , [she]153-lilla would not hesitate a moment between revealing it and doing what [she]153-lilla called [her]153-lilla duty . [Her]153-lilla duty -- how [he]88-chris used to laugh at the phrase ! [He]88-chris told [her]153-lilla [she]153-lilla had run away from [her]153-lilla real duties only for the pleasure of inventing new ones , and that to [her]153-lilla they were none the less duties because [she]153-lilla imagined them to be defiances . It was one of the paradoxes that most amused [him]88-chris : the picture of [her]153-lilla flying from [her]153-lilla conscience and always meeting it again in [her]153-lilla path , barely disguised by the audacities [she]153-lilla had dressed it up in . Yes ; evidently [he]88-chris had asked [himself]88-chris , on the instant , what [she]153-lilla would do about [Lilla]153-lilla ; and the mere fact made [her]153-lilla feel , with a fierce desperation , that [she]153-lilla must do something . Not that [she]153-lilla cared a straw about [Lilla]153-lilla , or felt the least “[822-the woman you told me about once , who was so desperately unhappy , and wanted to run away with you] call ” to save [her]153-lilla -- but to have [Chris]88-chris in [the family]390-the family , in [the group]1678-the group , to have to smile at [him]88-chris across the Clephane dinner - table , [the Drover]2056-the drover dinner - table , all the family dinner - tables , to have to keep up , for all the rest of [her]153-lilla life , the double pretence of never having liked [him]88-chris too much , and of now liking [him]88-chris enough to gratify the pride and allay the suspicions of [the family]390-the family -- no , [she]153-lilla could not imagine [herself]153-lilla doing it ! [She]153-lilla was right to be afraid of [him]88-chris ; [he]88-chris was right to be afraid of [her]153-lilla . * * * * * The return to daylight made [her]153-lilla nocturnal logic seem absurd ; but several days passed before [her]153-lilla agitation subsided . It was only when [she]153-lilla found life continuing undisturbed about [her]153-lilla , [Anne]95-anne painting for long rapturous hours , [Lilla]153-lilla following [her]153-lilla same bored round of pleasure , [the others]523-the others placidly engaged in [their]523-the others usual pursuits , and [no one]750-no one mentioning [Chris]88-chris ’s name , or apparently aware of [his]88-chris existence , that the shadow of [her]153-lilla midnight imaginings was lifted . Once or twice , as the sense of security returned , [she]153-lilla thought of letting [Chris]88-chris ’s name fall , ever so casually , in [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ’s hearing . [She]153-lilla never got as far as that ; but one day [she]153-lilla contrived , in speaking of some famous collection of books just coming into the market , to mention [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew . Well , it was a lesson to hold [her]87-kate tongue , to let things follow [their]2064-their course without fearing or interfering . Happily [Anne]95-anne , more and more absorbed in [her]95-anne painting , seemed to have no idea of a visit to [Washington]53-washington ; [she]95-anne had never mentioned such a plan , beyond once casually saying : “[95-anne] Oh , the [Washington]53-washington magnolias ... some spring [I]0-i must go [there]498-there and paint them . ” Some spring ... well , that was pleasantly indefinite . For [Chris]88-chris was not likely to remain long with [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew . Where had [Chris]88-chris ever remained long ? [Kate Clephane]87-kate did not know , now , whether to tremble at that impermanence or be glad of it . [She]87-kate did not know what to think about anything , now that the thought of [Chris]88-chris had suddenly re - introduced itself into the smooth - running wheels of [her]87-kate existence . Then , as the days passed , [her]87-kate reassurance returned again , and it was with a stupefied start that one afternoon , crossing [the Park]1931-the park on [her]87-kate way to [the studio]618-the studio , [she]87-kate once more caught sight of [Lilla Gates]153-lilla . This time [the person for whom [she]87-kate had presumably been waiting]2067-the person for whom she had presumably been waiting was with [her]87-kate , and [the two]573-the two stood in close communion . [The man]2069-the man ’s back was turned , but [his]2069-the man figure , [his]2069-the man attitude , were so familiar to [Kate]87-kate that [she]87-kate stopped short , trembling lest [she]87-kate should see [his]2069-the man face . [She]87-kate did not see it . [He]2069-the man and [Mrs. Gates]168-mrs. gates were in the act of leave - taking . [Their]573-the two hands met , [they]573-the two lingered for a last word , and then separated , each hastening away in a direction other than [[Kate]87-kate ’s]2070-kate ’s . [She]87-kate continued to stand motionless after [they]573-the two had vanished , uncertain yet certain . It was [Chris]88-chris -- but of course it was [Chris]88-chris ! [He]88-chris came often to [New York]5-new york , then , in spite of what [he]88-chris had said about the difficulty of getting away . If [he]88-chris had said that , it was probably just because [he]88-chris wanted to keep [his]88-chris comings and goings from [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s knowledge . And that again would tally with what [she]87-kate suspected as to [his]88-chris motives . [She]87-kate turned sick , and stood with compressed lips and lowered head , as if to close [her]87-kate senses against what was coming . At length [she]87-kate roused [herself]87-kate and walked on . [Lilla]153-lilla .... [Lilla]153-lilla .... [Chris]88-chris and [Lilla]153-lilla ! [She]87-kate kept on [her]87-kate way northward , following [the less frequented by - ways of [the Park]1931-the park]2071-the less frequented by - ways of the park . It was early yet , and [she]87-kate wanted to walk off [her]87-kate agitation before joining [Anne]95-anne at [the studio]618-the studio . [Lilla]153-lilla .... [Lilla]153-lilla .... [Chris]88-chris and [Lilla]153-lilla ! Something must be done about it , something must be said -- it was impossible that this affair , whatever it was , should go on unchecked . But had [she]87-kate , [Kate Clephane]87-kate , any power to prevent it ? Probably not -- [her]87-kate intervention might serve only to precipitate events . Well , at least [she]87-kate must know what was coming -- must find out what [the others]523-the others knew .... [Her]87-kate excitement increased instead of subsiding : as [she]87-kate walked on [she]87-kate felt the tears running down [her]87-kate face . Life had seemed , at last , so simple , so merciful , so soothing ; and here were all the old mysteries and duplicities pressing on [her]87-kate again . [She]87-kate stopped , out of breath , and finding [herself]87-kate at [the extreme northern end of [the Park]1931-the park]2075-the extreme northern end of the park , with the first street - lights beginning to gem the bare trees . The need to be with [Anne]95-anne suddenly seized [her]87-kate . Perhaps , by dropping a careless word or two , [she]87-kate might learn something from [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter -- learn at least if the baleful [Lilla]153-lilla were using [the girl]562-the girl as [a confidant]2079-a confidant , as that brief scene in [the studio]618-the studio had once suggested . On that point , at any rate , it was [the mother]242-the mother ’s right , [her]87-kate duty even , to be informed . [She]87-kate had made no appointment to meet [Anne]95-anne that afternoon ; and [she]87-kate hastened [her]87-kate pace , fearing to find that [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter had already left [the studio]618-the studio .... A light through the transom reassured [her]87-kate . [She]87-kate put [her]87-kate key in the lock , threw off [her]87-kate cloak in the little entrance - hall , and pushed open the door beyond . [The studio]618-the studio was unlit except by [the city]630-the city ’s constellated lamps , hung like a golden vintage from an invisible trellising of towers and poles , and by the rosy gleam of the hearth . [Anne]95-anne ’s easel had been pushed aside , and [Anne]95-anne and [another person]2086-another person were sitting near each other in low chairs , duskily outlined against the fire . As [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane crossed the threshold [a man]2087-a man ’s voice was saying gaily : “[0-i] What [I]0-i want is a rhyme for _ astrolabe _ . [I]0-i must have it ! And apparently there is none ; at least none except _ babe _ . And so there wo n’t be any poem . That ’s always [my]0-i luck . [I]0-i find something ... or [somebody]846-somebody ... who ’s just what [I]0-i want , and then .... ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate stood still , enveloped by the voice . It was the first time [she]87-kate had heard those laughing confiding inflexions addressed to any ear but [hers]87-kate . Southern sunshine scorched [her]87-kate ; the air seemed full of flowers . [She]87-kate hung there for a moment , netted in tightening memories ; then [she]87-kate loosed [her]87-kate hold on the door - handle and advanced a few steps into [the room]325-the room . [Her]87-kate heels clicked on the bare floor , and [the two by the fire]2089-the two by the fire rose and turned to [her]87-kate . [She]87-kate fancied [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s glance conveyed a faint surprise -- was it even a faint annoyance at [her]87-kate intrusion ? “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother , this is [Major Fenno]186-major fenno . At that moment [she]95-anne reminded [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother of [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ; somehow , there was an odd solace in the likeness . “[857-he] If [he]857-he comes for [anybody]1494-anybody it ’s for [Lilla]153-lilla , ” [the mother]242-the mother thought , as [her]242-the mother eyes rested on [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter ’s stern young profile ; and again [she]242-the mother felt the necessity of clearing up the mystery . And all [he]857-he cared about was [his]857-he writing . X. After all , [she]95-anne was not going to be able to question [Anne]95-anne about [Lilla]153-lilla . As [she]95-anne faced the situation the next day -- as [she]95-anne faced the new Chris in [[her]95-anne path]2109-her path -- [Kate Clephane]87-kate saw the impossibility of using [him]857-he as a key to [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s confidence . There was one thing much closer to [her]95-anne now than any conceivable act of [Chris]88-chris ’s could ever be ; and that was [her]95-anne own relation to [Anne]95-anne . [She]95-anne simply could not talk to [Anne]95-anne about [Chris]88-chris -- not yet . It was not that [she]95-anne regarded that episode in [her]95-anne life as a thing to be in itself ashamed of . [She]95-anne was not going , even now , to deny or disown it ; [she]95-anne wanted only to deny and disown [Chris]88-chris . Quite conceivably , [she]95-anne might have said to [[her]95-anne daughter]306-her daughter : “[153-lilla] Yes , [I]0-i loved once -- and [the man [I]0-i loved]860-the man i loved was not [[your]861-you father]862-your father . ” But to say it about [Chris]88-chris ! To see the slow look of wonder in those inscrutable depths of [Anne]95-anne ’s eyes : a look that said , not “[0-i] [I]0-i blame [you]861-you ” , or even “[0-i] [I]0-i disapprove [you]861-you ” , but , so much more scathingly , just : “[861-you] [You]861-you , [mother]1508-mother -- and _ [Chris]88-chris _ ? ” Yes ; that was it . It was necessary for [her]95-anne pride and dignity , for [her]95-anne moral safety almost , that what [people like [Enid Drover]145-enid drover]2112-people like enid drover would have called [her]95-anne “[861-you] past ” should remain unidentified , unembodied -- or at least not embodied in [Chris Fenno]88-chris . Yet to know -- to know ! There were , of course , other sources of enlightenment ; if there were anything in [her]95-anne theory of a love - affair between [Lilla]153-lilla and [Chris]88-chris , [the family]390-the family were probably not unaware of it . [Kate]87-kate had the sense that [they]390-the family never had [their]390-the family eyes off [Lilla]153-lilla for long . But it was all very well to plan to talk to [them]390-the family -- the question remained , how to begin ? Before trying to find out about [Lilla]153-lilla [she]87-kate would first have to find out about [them]390-the family . What did [she]87-kate know of [any one of [them]390-the family]2114-any one of them ? Nothing more , [she]87-kate now understood , than [their]390-the family glazed and impenetrable surfaces . [She]87-kate was still [a guest among [them]390-the family]2115-a guest among them ; [she]87-kate was a guest even in [[[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s house]2117-her daughter ’s house . It was the character [she]87-kate had [herself]87-kate chosen ; in [her]87-kate dread of seeming to assert rights [she]87-kate had forfeited , to thrust [herself]87-kate into [a place [she]87-kate had deserted]2118-a place she had deserted , [she]87-kate had perhaps erred in the other sense , held back too much , been too readily content with the easy part of [the week - end visitor]2119-the week - end visitor . Well -- it had all grown out of the other choice [she]87-kate had made when , years ago , [she]87-kate had said : “[864-thy] [[Thy]864-thy gods]865-thy gods shall _ not _ be [[my]0-i gods]866-my gods . ” And now [she]87-kate but dimly guessed who [[their]865-thy gods gods]2120-their gods were . [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie , of course , could have put the clue in [her]87-kate hand ; but to speak to [Nollie]154-nollie was too nearly like speaking to [Anne]95-anne . Only the long nights of dreamless sleep were gone ; and [her]87-kate heart stood still each time [she]87-kate slipped the key into the studio door . * * * * * “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother , [Uncle Fred]94-fred landers wants to take [us]867-them to [Baltimore]2-baltimore next week to see [the Maclew library]868-the maclew library ; [you]185-mother and [Lilla]153-lilla and [me]0-i . ” [Anne]95-anne threw it over [her]95-anne shoulder as [she]95-anne stood before [her]95-anne easel , frowning and narrowing [her]95-anne lips at the difficulty of a branch of red pyrus japonica in a brass pot , haloed with the light of the sunlit window . Had [she]87-kate , [Kate]87-kate , ever imagined that [Chris]88-chris ’s love - affairs would cease when [she]87-kate passed from [his]88-chris life ? [The family]390-the family thought it a pity that [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane should miss such a chance , for [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew was chary of exhibiting [his]181-horace maclew books . But there was something absent - minded and perfunctory in the tone of these regrets ; [Kate]87-kate could see that [the family]390-the family interest was passionately centred in [Lilla]153-lilla . And [she]87-kate felt , more and more , that in the circumstances [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate was better out of the way . For , at the last moment , [the party]2132-the party had been invited to stay at [[Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew ’s]2133-horace maclew ’s ; and to have assisted , in an almost official capacity , at the betrothal of [Chris]88-chris and [Lilla]153-lilla , with all the solemnity and champagne likely to ensue in such a setting , was more than [her]87-kate newly healed nerves could have endured . It was easier to sit at [home]246-home and wait , and try to prepare [herself]87-kate for this new and unbelievable situation . [Chris]88-chris and [Lilla--]191-lilla-- ! It was on the third day that [Aline]90-aline , bringing in the breakfast - tray with a bunch of violets ( [Anne]95-anne ’s daily attention since [she]95-anne had been gone ) , produced also a telegram ; as on that far - off morning , four months ago , when [the girl]562-the girl ’s first message had come to [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother with the same flowers . [Kate]87-kate held the envelope for a moment before opening it , as [she]87-kate had done on that other occasion -- but not because [she]87-kate wanted to prolong [her]87-kate illusion . This time there was no illusion in the thin envelope between [her]87-kate fingers ; [she]87-kate could feel through it the hard knife - edge of reality . If [she]87-kate delayed [she]87-kate did so from cowardice . [Chris]88-chris and [Lilla--]191-lilla-- [She]87-kate tore open the envelope and read : “[95-anne] Engaged to [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew madly happy [Lilla]153-lilla . ” The telegram fluttered to the floor , and [Kate Clephane]87-kate leaned back on [her]87-kate pillows , feeling a little light - headed . “[153-lilla] Is [Madame]130-madame not well ? ” [Aline]90-aline sharply questioned . “[130-madame] Oh , yes ; perfectly well . Perfectly well ! ” [Kate]87-kate repeated joyously . But [she]87-kate continued to lean back , staring vacantly ahead of [her]87-kate , till [Aline]90-aline admonished [her]87-kate , as [she]90-aline had done when the other message came , that the chocolate would be getting cold . A respite -- a respite . Oh , yes , it was at least a respite ! [XI]192-xi . There was something so established and reassuring in the mere look of [[Enid Drover]145-enid drover ’s drawing - room]2137-enid drover ’s drawing - room that [Kate Clephane]87-kate , waiting there that afternoon for [[her]87-kate sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law to come in , felt a distinct renewal of confidence . [The house]255-the house was old [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s wedding gift to [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter , and everything in [it]255-the house had obviously been selected by [some one whose first thought concerning any work of art]2141-some one whose first thought concerning any work of art was to ask if it would chip or fade . Nothing in [the solid and costly drawing - room]2142-the solid and costly drawing - room had chipped or faded ; [it]255-the house had retained something of [Enid]145-enid drover ’s invulnerable youthfulness , and , like [herself]87-kate , had looked as primly old - fashioned in its first bloom as in [its]255-the house well - kept maturity . It was odd that so stable a setting should have produced that hurricane of [a Lilla]153-lilla ; and [Kate]87-kate smiled at the thought of the satisfaction with which the very armchairs , in their cushioned permanence , would welcome [her]87-kate back to domesticity . But [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover , when [she]166-mrs. drover appeared , took it on a higher plane . Had [Lilla]153-lilla ever been unstable , or in any way failed to excel ? If so , [[her]306-her daughter mother]379-her mother , and [[her]306-her daughter mother]379-her mother ’s background , showed no signs of remembering . The armchairs stood there stolidly , as if asking what [you]2145-you meant by such ideas . [Enid]145-enid drover was a little troubled -- [she]145-enid drover confessed -- by the fact that [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew was [a widower]2146-a widower , and so much older than [[her]145-enid drover child]327-her child . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m not sure if such a difference of age is not always a risk .... But then [Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew is [a man of such strong character]880-a man of such strong character , and has behaved so generously .... There will be such opportunities for doing good .... ” Opportunities for doing good ! It was on the tip of [Kate]87-kate ’s tongue to say : “[182-mr. maclew] Ah , that must have been [Lilla]153-lilla ’s reason for accepting [him]182-mr. maclew ! ” ; but [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover was serenely continuing : “[153-lilla] [He]182-mr. maclew has given [her]153-lilla all the pearls already . [She]153-lilla ’s bringing them back tomorrow to be restrung . ” And [Kate]87-kate understood that , for the present , the opportunities for doing good lay rather with [the bridegroom]2148-the bridegroom than [the bride]2149-the bride . “[153-lilla] Of course , ” [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover went on , “[153-lilla] it will be a great sacrifice for [[her]153-lilla father]380-her father and [me]0-i to let [her]153-lilla go ; though luckily [Baltimore]2-baltimore is not far off . And it will be a serious kind of life ; a life full of responsibilities . [Hendrik]159-hendrik drover is afraid that , just at first , [Lilla]153-lilla may miss the excitements of [New York]5-new york ; but [I]0-i think [I]0-i know [[my]0-i child]882-my child better . When [Lilla]153-lilla is _ really happy _ [no one]750-no one cares less than [she]153-lilla does for excitement . ” The phrase gave [Kate]87-kate ’s nerves a sudden twist . It was just what [Chris]88-chris used to say when [she]87-kate urged [him]88-chris to settle down to [his]88-chris painting -- at least on the days when [he]88-chris did n’t say that excitement was necessary to [the artist]2005-the artist .... [She]87-kate looked at [[her]87-kate sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law ’s impenetrable pinkness , and thought : “[100-mrs. minity] It might be [Mrs. Minity speaking]100-mrs. minity . ” [Fred Landers]94-fred landers had telephoned that [he]94-fred landers had got back and was coming to dine ; [she]87-kate fancied [he]94-fred landers had it on [his]94-fred landers mind not to let [her]87-kate feel [her]87-kate solitude while [Anne]95-anne was away ; and [she]87-kate said to [herself]87-kate that from [him]94-fred landers at least [she]87-kate would get a glimpse of the truth . [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , as became [a friend of [the family]390-the family]2152-a friend of the family , was also beaming ; but [he]94-fred landers called [Lilla]153-lilla ’s engagement a “[100-mrs. minity] solution ” and not a “[100-mrs. minity] sacrifice ” ; and this made it easier for [Kate]87-kate at last to put [her]87-kate question : “[100-mrs. minity] How did it happen ? ” [He]94-fred landers leaned back , pulling placidly at [his]94-fred landers after - dinner cigar , [his]94-fred landers old - fashioned square - toed pumps comfortably stretched to the fire ; and for an instant [Kate]87-kate thought : “[100-mrs. minity] It might be pleasant to have [him]884-him in that armchair every evening . ” It was the first time such a possibility had occurred to [her]87-kate . “[100-mrs. minity] How did [she]885-she pull it off , [you]886-you mean ? ” [He]94-fred landers screwed up [his]94-fred landers friendly blue eyes in a confidential grin . “[885-she] Well , [I]0-i ’m naturally not initiated ; but [I]0-i suppose in one of the good old ways , [Lilla]153-lilla probably knows most of the tricks -- and [I]0-i rather think [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie ’s been aiding and abetting [her]153-lilla . [She]87-kate had to prove to some one that [Chris]88-chris was [[Lilla]153-lilla ’s lover]2155-lilla ’s lover in order to believe it [herself]87-kate , and [she]87-kate had to believe it [herself]87-kate in order to dispel the dreadful supposition raised by [Landers]94-fred landers ’s words . [She]87-kate found [herself]87-kate , now , able to smile away [his]94-fred landers suggestion quite easily , to understand that [he]94-fred landers had meant it only as a random joke . [People in [America]10-america]2156-people in america were always making jokes of that kind , juvenile jokes about flirtations and engagements ; they were the staple topic of the comic papers . But the shock of finding [herself]87-kate for a second over that abyss sent [her]87-kate stumbling back half - dazed to the safe footing of reality . If [she]87-kate were going to let [her]87-kate imagination run away at any chance word , what peace would there ever be for [her]87-kate ? The next day [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie reappeared , smiling and fresh , like [a sick - nurse whose patient has “[153-lilla] turned the corner ”]2157-a sick - nurse whose patient has “ turned the corner ” . With [Lilla]153-lilla off [her]154-nollie hands [her]154-nollie keen boyish face had lost its expression of premature vigilance , and [she]154-nollie looked positively rejuvenated . [She]154-nollie was more outspoken than [Landers]94-fred landers . “[153-lilla] At last [we]898-we can talk about it -- thank goodness ! ” And [she]154-nollie began . [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew and [Lilla]153-lilla had met the previous autumn , duck - shooting in [South Carolina]59-south carolina . [Lilla]153-lilla was a wonderful shot when [she]153-lilla was n’t ... well , when [she]153-lilla was in training ... and [Maclew]181-horace maclew , like [most heavy solemn men of [his]181-horace maclew type]2158-most heavy solemn men of his type , who theoretically admire [helpless feminine women]2159-helpless feminine women , had been bowled over by the sight of [this bold huntress , who damned up and down the birds]2160-this bold huntress , who damned up and down the birds [she]2160-this bold huntress , who damned up and down the birds missed , smoked and drank with [the men]2161-the men , and in the evening lay back silent , with lids half - dropped over smouldering sullen eyes , and did n’t bore [one with sporting chatter or sentimental airs]2162-one with sporting chatter or sentimental airs . It had been a revelation , the traditional thunderbolt ; only , once back in [Baltimore]2-baltimore , [Maclew]181-horace maclew had been caught in the usual network of habits and associations ; or perhaps other influences had intervened . The risk was removed , the dreadful risk ; [she]87-kate was safe again -- as safe as [she]87-kate would ever be -- unless some suicidal madness drove [her]87-kate to self - betrayal .
