[Anne]95-anne ’s sojourn in [Washington]53-washington prolonged itself for a fortnight . [Her]95-anne letters to [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother , though punctual , were inexpressive ; but that was not [her]95-anne fault , [Kate]87-kate knew . [She]95-anne had inherited from [[her]95-anne father]380-her father a certain heaviness of pen , an inability to convey on paper shades of meaning or of feeling , and having said : “[914-you] Is n’t it splendid about [Lilla]153-lilla ? ” had evidently exhausted the subject , or rather [her]95-anne power of developing it . At length [she]95-anne returned , bringing with [her]95-anne some studies of magnolias that were freer and more vigorous than any of [her]95-anne previous work . [She]95-anne greeted [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother with [her]95-anne usual tenderness , and to [Kate]87-kate [her]95-anne coming was like a lifting of clouds and opening of windows ; [the mother]242-the mother had never supposed that anything in [her]242-the mother life could ever again strike such deep roots as this passion for [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter . _ Perfect love casteth out fear ! _ “[914-you] Does it ? _ How does [any one]428-any one know ? _ ” [she]95-anne had often incredulously asked [herself]95-anne . But now , for the first time , love and security dwelt together in [her]95-anne in a kind of millennial quiet . [She]95-anne grudged having to dine out on the evening of [Anne]95-anne ’s return ; but [Mrs. Porter Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey was celebrating [Lilla]153-lilla ’s betrothal by a big dinner , with music afterward , and [Anne]95-anne , arriving by [a late train]2181-a late train , had barely time to dress before the motor was announced . There was no way of avoiding the festivity ; its social significance was immeasurable . [Mrs. Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey was one of [the hostesses who had dropped [Lilla]153-lilla from [their]2182-the hostesses who had dropped lilla from their lists after the divorce lists after the divorce]2182-the hostesses who had dropped lilla from their lists after the divorce , and [Mrs. Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey ’s yea or nay was almost the last survival of the old social code in [New York]5-new york . Those [she]95-anne invited , at any rate , said that [hers]2183-hers was [the only house where there was a “[914-you] tradition ” left]2184-the only house where there was a “ tradition ” left ; and though [Lilla]153-lilla , at this , used to growl : “[914-you] Yes , the tradition of how to bore [people]256-people , ” [her]95-anne reinstatement visibly elated [her]153-lilla as much as it did [[her]153-lilla family]2185-her family . To [Enid Drover]145-enid drover -- resplendent in all [her]145-enid drover jewels -- the event had already reversed the parts in [[her]145-enid drover daughter]306-her daughter ’s matrimonial drama , and relegated all the obloquy to the outraged Gates . “[914-you] Of course this evening shows what [Jessie Lanfrey]197-jessie lanfrey really thinks of [Phil Gates]198-phil gates , ” [Enid]145-enid drover whispered to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane as [the sisters - in - law]2187-the sisters - in - law took off [their]2187-the sisters - in - law cloaks in [the marble hall]2188-the marble hall ; and [Kate]87-kate inwardly emended , with a faint smile : “[917-she] Or what [she]917-she really thinks of [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew . ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had entered [the vast Lanfrey drawing - room]2189-the vast lanfrey drawing - room with a shrinking not produced by the presence of most of [[her]187-mrs. clephane own former censors]2190-her own former censors and [judges]312-judges -- now transformed into [staunch champions]2192-staunch champions or [carelessly benevolent acquaintances]2193-carelessly benevolent acquaintances -- but by the dread of seeing , behind [Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s momentous bulk , [a slighter figure and more vivid face]2194-a slighter figure and more vivid face . But the moment of suspense was not long ; [Chris]88-chris was not there ; nor was [his]88-chris name announced after [her]187-mrs. clephane arrival . [The guests]2195-the guests were all assembled ; the dining - room doors were thrown open , and [Mrs. Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey , taking [Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s arm , majestically closed the procession from walnut - and - gold to gold - and - marble -- for [the Lanfrey house]2196-the lanfrey house was “[917-she] tradition ” made visible , and even the _ menu _ was exactly what [a previous transmitter of the faith]2197-a previous transmitter of the faith had thought a _ menu _ ought to be when [Mrs. Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey gave [her]196-mrs. lanfrey first dinner . For a moment [Kate Clephane]87-kate felt [herself]87-kate in the faint bewildered world , between waking and sleeping . There [they]2198-they all were , the faces that had walled in [her]187-mrs. clephane youth ; [she]187-mrs. clephane was not sure , at first , if [they]2198-they belonged to [the same persons]2199-the same persons , or had been handed on , as part of the tradition , to [a new generation]2200-a new generation . It even occurred to [her]187-mrs. clephane that , by the mere act of entering [[Mrs. Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey ’s drawing - room]2201-mrs. lanfrey ’s drawing - room , [the latter ’s guests]2202-the latter ’s guests acquired a facial conformity that belonged to [the Lanfrey]196-mrs. lanfrey plan as much as [the fat prima - donna]2203-the fat prima - donna islanded in a sea of [Aubusson]29-aubusson .... who warbled an air from _ La Tosca _ exactly as [a previous fat prima - donna]2204-a previous fat prima - donna had warbled it on the same spot years before . It seemed as if even [Lilla]153-lilla , seated on a gilt sofa beside [[her]153-lilla betrothed]2205-her betrothed , had smoothed [her]153-lilla rebellious countenance to an official smirk . Only [Anne]95-anne and [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie resisted the enveloping conformity ; [Kate]87-kate wondered if [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate were not stealthily beginning to resemble [Enid Drover]145-enid drover . “[914-you] This is what [I]0-i ran away from , ” [she]0-i thought ; and found more reasons than ever for [her]0-i flight . “[0-i] And after all , [I]0-i have [Anne]95-anne back , ” [she]0-i murmured blissfully ... for that still justified the rest . Ah , how fate , in creating [Anne]95-anne , had baffled its own designs against [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother ! * * * * * On the way [home]246-home [the girl]562-the girl was unusually silent . [She]562-the girl leaned back against the cushions and let [her]562-the girl lids drop . Was it because [she]562-the girl was tired after [her]562-the girl long day , or only because [she]562-the girl was holding in [her]562-the girl vision ? [Kate]87-kate could not tell . In the passing flashes of the arc - lights the head at [her]562-the girl side , bound about with dark braids , looked as firm and young as a Greek marble ; [Anne]95-anne was still at the age when neither weariness nor anxiety mars the surface . [Kate Clephane]87-kate always respected [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s silences , and never felt [herself]87-kate excluded from [them]2210-them ; but [she]87-kate was glad when , as [they]2211-they neared [their]2211-they door , [Anne]95-anne ’s hand stole out to [her]87-kate . How many old breaches the touch healed ! It was almost as if [the girl]562-the girl had guessed how often [Kate]87-kate had driven up to that door inertly huddled in [her]87-kate corner , with [[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband ’s profile like a wall between [her]87-kate and the world beyond the windows . “[1521-dear] [Dear]1521-dear ! [You]1521-dear seem to have been gone for months , ” [the mother]242-the mother said as [they]2211-they reached [[her]242-the mother sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room . “[1521-dear] Yes . So much has happened . ” [Anne]95-anne spoke from far off , as if [she]95-anne were groping through a dream . “[1521-dear] But there ’ll be time for all that tomorrow . [You]1521-dear ’re dead tired now -- [you’re]1521-dear falling with sleep . ” [The girl]562-the girl opened [her]562-the girl eyes wide , in the way [she]562-the girl had when [she]562-the girl came out of one of [her]562-the girl fits of abstraction . “[1521-dear] [I]0-i ’m not tired ; [I]0-i ’m not sleepy . ” [She]0-i seemed to waver . “[1521-dear] Ca n’t [I]0-i come in and sit with [you]1521-dear a little while ? ” “[0-i] Of course , [dear]1521-dear . ” [Kate]87-kate slipped an arm through [hers]242-the mother , and [they]2217-they entered [the shadowy welcoming room]2218-the shadowy welcoming room , lit by one veiled lamp and the faint red of the hearth . “[0-i] After all , this is the best hour of the twenty - four for a talk , ” [the mother]242-the mother said , throwing [herself]242-the mother back luxuriously on [[her]242-the mother lounge]2220-her lounge . It was delicious , after [her]242-the mother fortnight of solitude , to think of talking things over with [Anne]95-anne . “[0-i] And now tell [me]0-i about everything , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i want to . ” [Anne]95-anne stood leaning against the chimney - piece , [her]95-anne head on [her]95-anne lifted arm . “[0-i] There ’s so much to say , is n’t there ? Always , [I]0-i mean -- now that [you]1521-dear and [I]0-i are together . [You]1521-dear do n’t know the difference it makes , coming [home]246-home to [you]1521-dear , instead-- ” [She]95-anne broke off , and crossing the hearth knelt down by [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother . [Their]2222-their hands met , and [the girl]562-the girl leant [her]562-the girl forehead against [Kate]87-kate ’s shoulder . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve been lonely too ! ” The confession sprang to [Kate]87-kate ’s lips . Oh , if at last [she]87-kate might say it ! But [she]87-kate dared not . The bond between [her]87-kate and [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter was still too fragile ; and how would such an avowal sound on [her]87-kate lips ? It was better to let [Anne]95-anne guess-- [Anne]95-anne did guess . “[0-i] [You]1521-dear _ have _ been happy [here]735-here , have n’t [you]1521-dear ? ” “[199-happy] [Happy]199-happy ? [Little Anne]95-anne ! ” “[95-anne] And what [a beautiful mother]922-a beautiful mother [you]1521-dear are ! [Nollie]154-nollie was saying tonight that [you]1521-dear ’re younger looking every day . And [nobody]923-nobody wears [their]923-nobody clothes as [you]1521-dear do . [I]0-i knew from that old photograph that [you]1521-dear were lovely ; but [I]0-i could n’t guess that [you]1521-dear had n’t grown any older since it was taken . ” [Kate]87-kate lay still , letting the warmth of the words and the embrace flow through [her]87-kate . What praise had ever seemed as sweet ? All the past faded in the sunset radiance of the present . “[1521-dear] [Little Anne]95-anne , ” [she]87-kate sighed again . The three syllables summed it all up . [Anne]95-anne was silent for a moment ; then [she]0-i continued , [her]0-i cheek still pressed against [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother : “[95-anne] [I]0-i want [you]1521-dear to stay [here]735-here always , [you]1521-dear know ; [I]0-i want [the house]255-the house to belong to [you]1521-dear . ” “[0-i] [The house--]926-the house-- ? ” [Kate]87-kate sat up with a start . [The girl]562-the girl ’s shoulder slipped from [hers]87-kate and [they]2227-they remained looking at [each other]496-each other , the space between [them]2227-they abruptly widened . “[0-i] [This house]927-this house -- belong to [me]0-i ? Why , what in [the world--]928-the world-- ” It was the first time such a question had arisen . On [her]87-kate arrival in [America]10-america , when [Landers]94-fred landers , at [Anne]95-anne ’s request , had tentatively broached the matter of financial arrangements , [Kate]87-kate had cut [him]94-fred landers short with the declaration that [she]87-kate would gladly accept [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s hospitality , but preferred not to receive any money beyond the small allowance [she]87-kate had always had from [the Clephane estate]2230-the clephane estate . [Kate]87-kate put out an encircling arm . “[0-i] What in [the world]1483-the world should [I]0-i do with [this house]927-this house , [dear]1521-dear ? Besides -- need [we]932-we look so far ahead ? ” For a moment [Anne]95-anne remained somewhat passively in [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s embrace ; then [she]95-anne freed [herself]95-anne and went back to lean against the mantel . “[0-i] That ’s just it , [dear]1521-dear ; [I]0-i think [we]932-we must , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] With such years and years before [you]1521-dear -- and all that lovely hair ! ” [Her]95-anne eyes still lingered smilingly on [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother . [Kate]87-kate sat upright again , and brushed back the lovely hair from [her]87-kate bewildered temples . What did [Anne]95-anne mean ? What was it [she]95-anne was trying to say ? [The mother]242-the mother began to tremble with an undefined apprehension ; then the truth flashed over [her]242-the mother . “[716-dearest] [Dearest]716-dearest -- [you]1521-dear mean [you]1521-dear may be married ? ” [The girl]562-the girl nodded , with the quick drop of the lids that called up such memories to [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother . “[1521-dear] [I]0-i could n’t write it ; [I]0-i ’m so bad at writing . [Baltimore]2-baltimore -- [the conductor]2238-the conductor called it out as [the train]2239-the train ground its way into [the station]2240-the station . All lesser differences seemed to have been swallowed up in that .... [She]87-kate pushed [her]87-kate way between the seats , in the wake of [the other travellers who were getting out]2248-the other travellers who were getting out -- [she]87-kate wondered why!--at [Baltimore]2-baltimore . [No one]750-no one noticed [her]87-kate ; [she]87-kate had no luggage ; in a moment or two [she]87-kate was out of [the station]2240-the station . [She]87-kate stood there , staring in a dazed way at the meaningless traffic of [the streets]1476-the streets . Where were all [these people]402-these people going , what could [they]402-these people possibly want , or hope for , or strive for , in [a world such as [she]87-kate now knew it to be]2253-a world such as she now knew it to be ? There was a spring mildness in the air , and presently , walking on through [the hurrying crowd]2254-the hurrying crowd , [she]87-kate found [herself]87-kate in [a quiet park - like square , with budding trees , and bulbs pushing up in the mounded flower - beds]2255-a quiet park - like square , with budding trees , and bulbs pushing up in the mounded flower - beds . [She]87-kate sat down on a bench . Strength had been given [her]87-kate to get through that first hour with [Anne]95-anne ... [she]87-kate did n’t know how , but somehow , all at once , the shabby years of dissimulation , of manœuvring , of concealing , had leapt to [her]87-kate defence like [a mercenary army roused in a righteous cause]2256-a mercenary army roused in a righteous cause . [She]87-kate had to deceive [Anne]95-anne , to lull [Anne]95-anne ’s suspicions , though [she]87-kate were to die in the attempt . And [she]87-kate had not died-- That was the worst of it . [She]87-kate had never been more quiveringly , comprehensively alive than as [she]87-kate sat there , in [that alien place]2257-that alien place , staring out alone into an alien future . [She]87-kate felt strong and light enough to jump up and walk for miles and miles -- if only [she]87-kate had known where to go ! [They]2258-they said grief was ageing -- well , this agony seemed to have plunged [her]87-kate into a very Fountain of Youth . [No one]750-no one could possibly know where [she]87-kate was . [She]87-kate had told [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter that [one of [the aunts at [Meridia]41-meridia]2262-the aunts at meridia]2261-one of the aunts at meridia was very ill ; dying , [she]87-kate believed [she]87-kate had said . To reach [Meridia]41-meridia one passed through [Baltimore]2-baltimore -- it had all been simple enough . Luckily [she]0-i had once or twice talked of [the aunts]2263-the aunts to [Anne]95-anne ; had said vaguely : “[186-major fenno] There was never much intimacy , but some day [I]0-i ought to go and see them”--so that now it seemed quite natural , and [Anne]95-anne , like all [[her]95-anne generation]2264-her generation , was too used to sudden comings and goings , and violent changes of plan , to do more than ring up the motor to take [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother to [the first train]2266-the first train , and recommend carrying a warm wrap . The hush , the solitude , the sense of being alone and unknown in [a strange place to which [no one]750-no one knew [she]95-anne had gone]2267-a strange place to which no one knew she had gone , gradually steadied [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s mind , and fragments torn from the last hours began to drift through it , one by one . Curiously enough , it was [Anne]95-anne ’s awkward little speech about giving [her]95-anne [the house that came first]2269-the house that came first -- perhaps because it might so easily be the key to the rest . [Kate Clephane]87-kate had never thought of money since [she]87-kate had been under [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s roof , save on the one occasion when [she]87-kate had refused to have [her]87-kate allowance increased . [Her]87-kate disregard of the matter came not so much from conventional scruples as from a natural gay improvidence . If [one were poor]2271-one were poor , and lived from hand to mouth , [one]247-one had to think about money -- worse luck ! But once relieved from the need of doing so , [she]87-kate had dismissed the whole matter from [her]87-kate thoughts . [Safely]2273-safely sheltered , becomingly arrayed , [she]87-kate cared no more than [a child]1777-a child for the abstract power of possession . And the possession of money , in particular , had always been so associated in [her]87-kate mind with moral and mental dependence that after [her]87-kate break with [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies poverty had seemed one of the chief attributes of freedom . It was [Anne]95-anne ’s suggestion of giving [her]95-anne [the house]255-the house which had flung a sudden revealing glare on the situation . [Anne]95-anne was rich , then -- very rich ! Such [a house]2276-a house -- one of the few surviving from the time when [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue had been [[New York]5-new york ’s fashionable quarter]2277-new york ’s fashionable quarter -- must have grown greatly in value with the invasion of business . What could it be worth ? [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane could n’t conjecture ... could only feel that , to offer it in that way ( and with it , of course , the means of living in it ) , [Anne]95-anne , who had none of [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s improvidence , must be securely and immensely wealthy . And if [she]95-anne were-- [The mother]242-the mother stood up and stared about [her]95-anne . What [she]87-kate was now on the verge of thinking was worse , almost , than all the dreadful things [she]87-kate had thought before . If it were the money [he]105-hylton davies wanted , [she]87-kate might conceivably buy [him]105-hylton davies off -- that was what [she]87-kate was thinking ! And a nausea crept over [her]87-kate as [she]87-kate thought it ; for [he]105-hylton davies had never seemed to care any more for money than [she]87-kate did . [His]105-hylton davies gay scorn of it , not only expressed but acted upon , had been one of [his]105-hylton davies chief charms to [her]87-kate , after all [her]87-kate years in the Clephane atmosphere of thrifty wealth , and the showy opulence of the months with [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies . [Chris Fenno]88-chris , quite simply and naturally , had laughed with [her]87-kate at the cares of [the anxious rich]2280-the anxious rich , and rejoiced that those , at least , would never weigh on either of [them]2280-the anxious rich . But that was long ago ; long at least in a life as full of chances and changes as [his]105-hylton davies . Compared with [the reckless boy [she]87-kate had known]2281-the reckless boy she had known [he]105-hylton davies struck [her]87-kate now as having something of the weight and prudence of middle - age . Might not [his]105-hylton davies respect for money have increased with the increasing need of it ? [Her]87-kate mind flagged . [No one]750-no one was more appreciative of the amenities of living when [they]750-no one came [his]105-hylton davies way without [his]105-hylton davies having to take thought ; and [she]87-kate had pictured [him]105-hylton davies quartered in [a pleasant corner of [[Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew ’s house]2287-horace maclew ’s house]2286-a pleasant corner of horace maclew ’s house , and participating in all the luxuries of [his]105-hylton davies larder and [cellar]2288-cellar . A new emotion shot through [her]87-kate , half sharper anguish , half relief . What a solution -- [Kate Clephane]87-kate leapt on it -- to be able to return to [Anne]95-anne with that announcement ! It seemed to clear the way in a flash -- but as a hurricane does , by ploughing its path through the ruins it makes . [She]87-kate supposed [she]87-kate would never , as long as [she]87-kate lived , be able to think evil of [Chris]88-chris without its hurting [her]87-kate . [He]202-mr. chris had always hated any dependence on [other people]691-other people ’s plans and moods ; [she]87-kate remembered how irritably [he]202-mr. chris had spoken of [his]202-mr. chris servitude as [[Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s secretary]2319-mr. maclew ’s secretary , light as the yoke must be . [He]202-mr. chris looked at [her]87-kate as if [he]202-mr. chris hardly saw [her]87-kate . “[941-you] Yes ; [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i did , ” [he]202-mr. chris answered at length in a slow dragging voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i was going to write ; to ask when [I]0-i could see [you]0-i . ” As [he]202-mr. chris stood there [he]202-mr. chris seemed like [some one snatched out of a trance]2330-some one snatched out of a trance . [Their]2331-their parts were reversed for the first time , and [she]87-kate said to [herself]87-kate : “[0-i] [I]0-i must act quickly , before [he]942-he can collect [himself]942-he . ” Aloud [she]87-kate asked : “[942-he] What have [you]0-i got to say ? ” “[0-i] To say-- ” [he]202-mr. chris began ; and then , suddenly , with a quick change of voice , and moving toward [her]87-kate with outstretched hands : “[0-i] For [God]195-god ’s sake do n’t take that tone . It ’s bad enough .... ” [She]87-kate knew every modulation ; [he]202-mr. chris had pleaded with [her]87-kate so often before ! [His]202-mr. chris trying it now only hardened [her]87-kate mind and cleared [her]87-kate faculties ; and with that flash of vision came the sense that [she]87-kate was actually seeing [him]202-mr. chris for the first time . There [he]202-mr. chris stood , stripped of [her]87-kate dreams , while [she]87-kate registered in a clear objective way all the strength and weakness , the flaws and graces of [[his]202-mr. chris person]2332-his person , marked the premature thinning of [his]202-mr. chris smooth brown hair , the incipient crows’-feet about the lids , their too tender droop over eyes not tender enough , and that slight slackness of the mouth that had once seemed a half - persuasive pout , and was now only a sign of secret uncertainties and indulgences . [She]87-kate saw it all , and under the rich glaze of a greater prosperity , a harder maturity , a prompter self - assurance and resourcefulness , [she]87-kate reached to the central failure . That was what [she]87-kate became aware of -- and aware too that the awful fact of actually seeing [another human being]2333-another human being might happen to [one for the first time only after years of intimacy]2334-one for the first time only after years of intimacy . [She]87-kate averted [her]87-kate eyes as from a sight not meant for [her]87-kate . “[195-god] It ’s bad enough , ” [she]87-kate heard [him]202-mr. chris repeat . If there were any degrees left in such misery [she]87-kate supposed that the worst of it was over . [XIV]204-xiv . As [Kate Clephane]87-kate drove up late that night to [the house in [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue]2364-the house in fifth avenue [she]87-kate seemed to be reliving all [her]87-kate former anguished returns there , real or imaginary , from the days when [she]87-kate had said to [herself]87-kate : “[0-i] Shall [I]0-i never escape ? ” to those others when , from far off , [she]87-kate had dreamed of the hated threshold , and yearned for it , and thought : “[0-i] Shall [I]0-i never get back ? ” [She]87-kate had said [she]87-kate might be late in returning , and had begged that [no one]750-no one should stay up for [her]87-kate . [Her]87-kate wish , as usual , had been respected , and [she]87-kate let [herself]87-kate into [the hushed house]2366-the hushed house , put out the lights , and stole up past the door where [Anne]95-anne lay sleeping [her]95-anne last young sleep . Ah , that thought of [Anne]95-anne ’s awakening ! The thought of seeing [Anne]95-anne ’s face once again in all its radiant unawareness , and then assisting helpless at the darkening of its light ! How would the blow fall ? Suddenly and directly , or gradually , circuitously ? Would [the girl]562-the girl learn [her]562-the girl fate on the instant , or be obliged to piece it together , bit by bit , through all the slow agonies of conjecture ? What pretext would [Chris]88-chris give for the break ? [He]88-chris was skilled enough in evasions and subterfuges -- but what if [he]88-chris had decided to practise them on [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother , and not on [Anne]95-anne ? What if the word [he]88-chris had given were already forfeited ? What assurance had any promise of [his]88-chris ever conveyed ? [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat in [[her]87-kate midnight room]2369-her midnight room alone with these questions . [She]87-kate had forgotten to go to bed , [she]87-kate had forgotten to undress . [She]87-kate sat there , in [her]87-kate travelling dress and hat , as [she]87-kate had stepped from [the train]2239-the train : it was as if [this house which [people]256-people called [her]87-kate own]2371-this house which people called her own were itself no more than [the waiting - room of [a railway station]2374-a railway station where [she]87-kate was listening for the coming of [another train]2375-another train that was to carry [her]87-kate]2373-the waiting - room of a railway station where she was listening for the coming of another train that was to carry her -- whither ? Ah , but [she]87-kate had forgotten -- forgotten that [she]87-kate had [him]976-his in [her]87-kate power ! [She]87-kate had said to [him]976-his : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve got the means to beat [you]976-his in the end , ” and [he]976-his had bowed [his]976-his head to the warning and given [his]976-his word . Why , the mere threat that [she]87-kate would tell [[his]976-his mother]707-his mother had thrown [him]976-his on [her]87-kate mercy -- what would it be if [she]87-kate were to threaten to tell [Anne]95-anne ? [She]87-kate knew [him]976-his ... under all [his]976-his emancipated airs , [his]976-his professed contempt for traditions and conformities , lurked an uneasy fear of being thought less than [his]976-his own romantic image of [himself]976-his .... No ; even if [his]976-his designs on [Anne]95-anne were wholly interested , it would kill [him]976-his to have [her]87-kate know . There was no danger there . The bitterness of death was passed ; yes -- but the bitterness of what came after ? What of the time to come , when [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter were left facing each other like two ghosts in a gray world of disenchantment ? Well , [the girl]562-the girl was young -- time would help -- [they]2380-they would travel .... Ah , no ; [her]562-the girl tortured nerves cried out that there could not be , in [any woman]2381-any woman ’s life , another such hour as the one [she]562-the girl had just lived through ! Toward dawn [she]562-the girl roused [herself]562-the girl , undressed , and crawled into bed ; and there [she]562-the girl lay in the darkness , sharpening [her]562-the girl aching wits for the continuation of the struggle . * * * * * “[0-i] A telegram-- ” [Aline]90-aline always said it with the same slightly ironic intonation , as if it were still matter of wonder and amusement to [her]90-aline that [any one]428-any one should be in such haste to communicate with [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , in sables and pearls , with [a great house at [her]187-mrs. clephane orders]2384-a great house at her orders , was evidently [a more considerable person]2385-a more considerable person than [the stray tenant of [the little third - floor room at [the Hôtel de Minorque]2388-the hôtel de minorque]2387-the little third - floor room at the hôtel de minorque]2386-the stray tenant of the little third - floor room at the hôtel de minorque , and [no one]750-no one was more competent to measure the distance between [them]2390-them than [Aline]90-aline . But still -- a telegram ! [Kate]87-kate opened the envelope with bloodless fingers . “[0-i] [I]0-i am going . ” That was all -- there was not even a signature . [He]2391-he had kept [his]2391-he word ; and [he]2391-he wanted [her]87-kate to know it . [She]87-kate felt the loosening of the cords about [her]87-kate heart ; a deep breath of relief welled up in [her]87-kate . [He]2391-he had kept [his]2391-he word . There was a tap on the door , and [Anne]95-anne , radiant , confident , came in . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ve had a telegram ? Not about [Aunt Janey--]977-aunt janey-- ” [Aunt Janey]205-aunt janey ? For a second [Kate]87-kate could not remember , could not associate the question with anything related to the last hours . Then [she]87-kate collected [herself]87-kate , just in time to restrain a self - betraying clutch at the telegram . With a superhuman effort at composure [she]87-kate kept [her]87-kate hands from moving , and left the message lying , face up , on the coverlet between [herself]87-kate and [Anne]95-anne . Yet what if [Anne]95-anne were to read the _ Baltimore _ above the unsigned words ? “[977-aunt janey--] No ; it ’s not about [Aunt Janey]205-aunt janey . ” [She]87-kate made a farther effort at recollection . “[205-aunt janey] The fact is , [the aunts]2263-the aunts had a panic ... an absurd panic .... [Aunt Janey]205-aunt janey ’s failed a good deal , of course ; it ’s the beginning of the end . But there ’s no danger of anything sudden -- not the least .... [I]0-i ’m glad [I]0-i went , though ; it comforted [them]2263-the aunts to see [me]0-i .... And it was really rather wrong of [me]0-i not to have been before . ” Ah , now , at last [she]87-kate remembered , and how thankfully , that [she]87-kate had , after all , been to [Meridia]41-meridia ; had , automatically , after leaving [Chris]88-chris , continued [her]87-kate journey , surprised and flattered [the aunts]2263-the aunts by [her]87-kate unannounced appearance , and spent an hour with [them]2263-the aunts before taking [the train]2239-the train back to [New York]5-new york . [She]87-kate had had the wit , at the time , to see how useful such an alibi might be , and then , in the disorder of [her]87-kate dreadful vigil , had forgotten about it till [Anne]95-anne ’s question recalled [her]87-kate to [herself]87-kate . The complete gap in [her]87-kate memory frightened [her]87-kate , and made [her]87-kate feel more than ever unfitted to deal with what might still be coming -- what must be coming . [Anne]95-anne still shed about [her]87-kate the reflected radiance of [her]95-anne bliss . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m so glad it ’s all right -- so glad [you]0-i went . And of course , [dear]1521-dear , [you]0-i did n’t tell [them]980-them anything , did [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Tell [them]980-them anything-- ? ” “[0-i] About [me]0-i . ” The lids dropped , the lashes clasped [her]87-kate vision . How could [[her]87-kate mother]379-her mother have forgotten?--that flutter of the lids seemed to say . “[0-i] [Darling]206-darling ! But of course not . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate brought the words out with dry lips . [Her]87-kate hand stole out to [Anne]95-anne ’s , then drew back , affecting to pick up the telegram . [She]0-i could not put [her]0-i hand in [[her]0-i daughter]306-her daughter ’s just yet . [The girl]562-the girl sat down beside [her]95-anne on the bed . “[206-darling] [I]0-i want it to be [our]981-their secret , remember -- just [yours]0-i and [mine]0-i -- till [he]982-he comes next week . [He]982-he ca n’t get away before . ” Ah , thank God for that ! [The mother]242-the mother remembered now that [Anne]95-anne had told [her]242-the mother this during [their]981-their first talk -- the talk of which , at the time , no details had remained in [her]242-the mother shattered mind . Now , as [she]242-the mother listened , those details came back , bit by bit , phantasmagorically mingled . [No one]750-no one was to be told of the engagement ; no , not even [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie ; not till [Chris]88-chris came to [New York]5-new york . And that was not to be for another week . [He]982-he could not get away sooner , and [Anne]95-anne had decreed that [he]982-he must see [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother before [their]981-their betrothal was made public . “[982-he] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ’m absurdly out - of - date -- but [I]0-i want it to be like that , ” [the girl]562-the girl had said ; and [Kate Clephane]87-kate understood that it was out of regard for [her]562-the girl , with the desire to “[0-i] situate ” [her]562-the girl again , and once for all , as [the head of [the house]255-the house]1942-the head of the house , that [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter had insisted on this almost obsolete formality , had stipulated that [[her]87-kate suitor]2404-her suitor should ask [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s consent in the solemn old - fashioned way . [The girl]562-the girl bent nearer , [her]562-the girl radiance veiled in tenderness . “[0-i] If [you]0-i knew , [mother]1508-mother , how [I]0-i want [you]0-i to like [him--]984-he ” ah , [the familiar cruel words!--“You]2406-the familiar cruel words!--“you[984-he] did , did n’t [you]0-i , in old times , when [you]0-i used to know [him]984-he so well ? Though [he]984-he says [he]984-he was just [a silly conceited boy]985-a silly conceited boy then , and wonders that [anybody]1494-anybody could endure [his]984-he floods of nonsense .... ” Ah , [God]195-god , how long would it go on ? [Kate Clephane]87-kate again reached out [her]87-kate hand , and this time clasped [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s with a silent nod of assent . Speech was impossible . [She]87-kate moistened [her]87-kate parched lips , but no sound came from them ; and suddenly [she]87-kate felt everything slipping away from [her]87-kate in a great gulf of oblivion . “[1508-mother] [Mother]1508-mother ! [You]1508-mother ’re ill -- [you’re]1508-mother over - tired .... ” [She]87-kate was just aware , through the twilight of [her]87-kate faintness , that [Anne]95-anne ’s arm was under [her]87-kate , that [Anne]95-anne was ringing the bell and moistening [her]95-anne forehead . BOOK III . XV . Fantastic shapes of heavy leaf - shadows on blinding whiteness . Torrents of blue and lilac and crimson foaming over the branches of unknown trees . Azure distances , snow - peaks , silver reefs , and an unbroken glare of dead - white sunshine merging into a moonlight hardly whiter . Was there never any night , real , black , obliterating , in all these dazzling latitudes in which [two desperate women]2408-two desperate women had sought refuge ? [They]2408-two desperate women had “[1508-mother] travelled . ” It had been very interesting ; and [Anne]95-anne was better . Certainly [she]95-anne was much better . [They]2408-two desperate women were on [their]2408-two desperate women way [home]246-home now , moving at a leisurely pace -- what was there to return for?--from one scene of gorgeous unreality to another . And all the while [Anne]95-anne had never spoken -- never really spoken ! [She]95-anne had simply , a day or two after [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s furtive trip to [Baltimore]2-baltimore , told [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother that [her]95-anne engagement was broken : “[1508-mother] by mutual agreement ” were the stiff old - fashioned words [she]95-anne used . As [no one else]718-no one else , even among [[their]2408-two desperate women nearest]2412-their nearest , had been let into the secret of that fleeting bond , there was [no one to whom explanations were due]2413-no one to whom explanations were due ; and [the girl]562-the girl , [her]562-the girl curt confidence to [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother once made , had withdrawn instantly into the rigid reserve [she]562-the girl had maintained ever since . Just so , in former days , [Kate Clephane]87-kate had seen [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane meet calamity . After [[her]87-kate favourite daughter]2416-her favourite daughter ’s death [the old woman]2417-the old woman had never spoken [her]87-kate name . And thus with [Anne]95-anne ; [her]87-kate soul seemed to freeze about its secret . Even the physical resemblance to [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane reappeared , and with it a certain asperity of speech , a sharp intolerance of trifles , breaking every now and again upon long intervals of smiling apathy . During [their]2408-two desperate women travels [the girl]562-the girl was more than ever attentive to [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother ; but [her]562-the girl solicitude seemed the result of a lesson in manners inculcated long ago ( with the rest of [her]562-the girl creed ) by [old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane . It was impossible for a creature so young and eager to pass unseeingly through the scenes of [their]2408-two desperate women journey ; but it was clear that each momentary enthusiasm only deepened the inner pang . And from all participation in that hidden conflict between youth and suffering [the mother]242-the mother continued to feel [herself]242-the mother shut out . Nevertheless , [she]242-the mother began to imagine that time was working its usual miracle . [Anne]95-anne ’s face was certainly less drawn -- [Anne]95-anne ’s manner perhaps a shade less guarded . Lately [she]242-the mother had begun to sketch again ... [she]242-the mother had suggested one day [their]2408-two desperate women crossing from [Rio]64-rio to [Marseilles]65-marseilles , continuing [their]2408-two desperate women wanderings in [the Mediterranean]4-the mediterranean ... had spoken of [Egypt]66-egypt and [Crete]67-crete for the winter .... [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane acquiesced , bought guide - books , read up furtively , and tried to temper zeal with patience . It would not do to seem too eager ; [she]187-mrs. clephane held [her]187-mrs. clephane breath , waiting on [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s moods , and praying for the appearance of the “[2422-some one else ” whose coming mothers] [some one else ” whose coming mothers]2422-some one else ” whose coming mothers invoke in such contingencies . That very afternoon , sitting on [the hotel balcony]2423-the hotel balcony above a sea of flowers , [she]242-the mother had suffered [herself]242-the mother to wonder if [Anne]95-anne , who was off on a long riding excursion with [a party of [young people]1543-young people]2424-a party of young people , might not return with a different look , the clear happy look of [the last year ’s Anne]2426-the last year ’s anne . [The young English planter to whose _ hacienda]2427-the young english planter to whose _ hacienda _ [they]2408-two desperate women had gone had certainly interested [her]242-the mother more than [any one [they]2408-two desperate women had hitherto met]2428-any one they had hitherto met . [The mother]242-the mother , late that evening , was still alone on [the balcony]2430-the balcony when , from behind [her]242-the mother , [Anne]95-anne ’s shadow fell across the moonlight . [The girl]562-the girl dropped into a seat . No , [she]562-the girl was n’t tired -- wasn’t hungry -- [they]2408-two desperate women had supped , on the way back , at [a glorious place high up over [Rio]64-rio]2432-a glorious place high up over rio . Yes , the day had been wonderful ; the beauty incredible ; and the moonlit descent through [the forest]2433-the forest .... [Anne]95-anne lapsed into silence , [her]95-anne profile turned from [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother . Perhaps -- who could tell ? [Her]95-anne silence seemed heavy with promise . Suddenly [she]0-i put out a hand to [Kate]87-kate . “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother , [I]0-i want to make over all [my]0-i money to [you]185-mother . It would have been [yours]185-mother if things had been different . It _ is _ [yours]185-mother , really ; and [I]0-i do n’t want it -- [I]0-i hate it ! ” [Her]0-i hand was trembling . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane trembled too . “[0-i] But , [Anne]95-anne -- how absurd ! What can it matter ? What difference can it make ? ” “[0-i] All the difference . ” [The girl]562-the girl lowered [her]562-the girl voice . “[0-i] [It]988-it ’s because [I]0-i was too rich that [he]989-he would n’t marry [me]0-i . ” [It]207-it broke from [her]0-i in a sob . “[989-he] [I]0-i ca n’t bear it -- [I]0-i ca n’t bear it ! ” [She]0-i stretched [her]0-i hand to the silver splendours beneath [them]2436-them . “[0-i] All this beauty and glory in [the world]1483-the world -- and nothing in [me]0-i but cold and darkness ! ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat speechless . [She]87-kate remembered just such flashes of wild revolt in [her]87-kate own youth , when [sea]2437-sea and earth and sky seemed joined in a vast conspiracy of beauty , and within [her]87-kate too all was darkness . For months [she]87-kate had been praying for this hour of recovered communion with [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ; yet now that it had come , now that the barriers were down , [she]87-kate felt powerless to face what was beyond . If it had been [any other man]2439-any other man ! Paralysed by the fact that it was just that one , [she]87-kate continued to sit silent , [her]87-kate hand on [Anne]95-anne ’s sunken head . “[0-i] Why should [you]991-you think it ’s the money ? ” [she]87-kate whispered at last , to gain time . “[991-you] [I]0-i know it -- [I]0-i know it ! [He]992-he told [Nollie]154-nollie once that nothing would induce [him]992-he to marry [a girl with a fortune]993-a girl with a fortune . [He]992-he thought it an impossible position for [a poor man]994-a poor man . ” “[992-he] Did [he]992-he tell _ [you]991-you _ so ? ” “[992-he] Not in so many words . But it was easy to guess . When [he]992-he wrote to [...]995-... to give [me]0-i back [my]0-i freedom , [he]992-he said [he]992-he ’d been mad to think [we]996-we might marry ... that it was impossible ... there would always be an obstacle between [us]996-we .... ” [The girl]562-the girl lifted [her]562-the girl head , [her]562-the girl agonized eyes on [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother ’s . “[992-he] What obstacle could there be but [my]0-i money ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate had turned as cold as marble . At the word “[992-he] obstacle ” [she]87-kate stood up , almost pushing [the girl]562-the girl from [her]87-kate . In that searching moonlight , what might not [Anne]95-anne read in [her]87-kate eyes ? “[992-he] Come [indoors]997-indoors , [dear]1521-dear , ” [she]87-kate said . [Anne]95-anne followed [her]87-kate mechanically . In [the high - ceilinged shadowy room]2443-the high - ceilinged shadowy room [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane sat down in a wooden rocking - chair and [the girl]562-the girl stood before [her]187-mrs. clephane , tall and ghostly in [her]562-the girl white linen riding - habit , the dark hair damp on [her]562-the girl forehead . “[992-he] Come and sit by [me]0-i , [Anne]95-anne . ” “[95-anne] No . [I]0-i want [you]95-anne to answer [me]0-i first -- to promise . ” “[95-anne] But , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear , what [you]95-anne suggest is madness . How can [I]0-i promise such a thing ? And why should it make any difference ? Why should [any man]1000-any man be humiliated by the fact of marrying [a girl with money]1001-a girl with money ? ” “[95-anne] Ah , but [Chris]88-chris is different ! [You]95-anne do n’t know [him]88-chris . ” [The mother]242-the mother locked [her]242-the mother hands about the chair - arms . [She]242-the mother sat looking down at the bare brick floor of [the room]325-the room , and at [Anne]95-anne ’s two feet , slim and imperious , planted just before [her]242-the mother in an attitude of challenge , of resistance . [She]242-the mother did not dare to raise [her]242-the mother eyes higher . “[95-anne] _ [I]0-i do n’t know [him]88-chris ! _ ” [she]242-the mother repeated to [herself]242-the mother . “[0-i] [Mother]185-mother , answer [me]0-i -- [you’ve]185-mother got to answer [me]0-i ! ” [The girl]562-the girl ’s low - pitched voice had grown shrill ; [her]562-the girl swaying tall white presence seemed to disengage some fiery fluid . [Kate Clephane]87-kate suddenly recalled the baby [Anne]95-anne ’s lightning - flashes of rage , and understood what reserves of violence still underlay [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s calm exterior . “[185-mother] How can [I]0-i answer ? [I]0-i know what [you]185-mother ’re suffering -- but [I]0-i ca n’t pretend to think that what [you]185-mother propose would make any difference . ” “[0-i] [You]185-mother do n’t think it was the money ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate drew a deep breath , and clasped the chair - arms tighter . “[185-mother] No . ” “[185-mother] What _ was _ it , then ? ” [Anne]95-anne had once more sunk on [her]95-anne knees beside [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t bear not to know . And yet [I]0-i know-- ” “[185-mother] [You]185-mother know ? ” “[185-mother] [He]1004-he _ did _ love [me]0-i , [mother]1508-mother . ” “[1004-he] Yes , [dear]1521-dear . ” “[1004-he] And there was n’t [any one else]1836-any one else ; [I]0-i know that too . ” “[0-i] Yes . ” “[0-i] [No one else that [he]1004-he cared about]1008-no one else that he cared about ... or who had any claim .... [I]0-i asked [him]1004-he that before [I]0-i promised to marry [him]1004-he . ” “[0-i] Then , [dear]1521-dear , there ’s nothing more to say -- or to do . [You]1521-dear can only conclude that [he]1004-he gave [you]1521-dear back [your]1521-dear freedom because [he]1004-he wanted [his]1004-he . ” “[1004-he] But it was all so quick ! How can [anybody]1494-anybody love one day , and not the next ? ” [Kate]87-kate winced . “[1004-he] It does happen so -- sometimes . ” “[1004-he] [I]0-i do n’t believe it -- not of [him]1004-he and [me]0-i ! And there _ was _ the money ; [I]0-i know that . [Mother]185-mother , let [me]0-i try ; let [me]0-i tell [him]1004-he that [you]185-mother ’ve agreed to take it all back ; that [I]0-i shall have only the allowance [you]185-mother choose to make [me]0-i . ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane again sat silent , with lowered head . [She]187-mrs. clephane had not foreseen this torture . “[185-mother] Do n’t [you]185-mother think , [dear]1521-dear , as [you]185-mother ’ve written three times and had no answer , that [you]185-mother ’d better wait ? Better try to forget ? ” [The girl]562-the girl shook [herself]562-the girl free and stood up with a tragic laugh . “[185-mother] [You]185-mother do n’t know [me]0-i either , [mother]1508-mother ! ” That word was crueller than the other ; [the mother]242-the mother shrank from it as if [she]242-the mother had received a blow . “[185-mother] [I]0-i do know that , in such cases , there ’s never any remedy but one . If [your]185-mother courage fails [you]185-mother , there ’s [your]185-mother pride . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i pride ? What ’s pride , if [one]247-one cares ? [I]0-i ’d do anything to get [him]1014-him back . [I]0-i only want [you]185-mother to do what [I]0-i ask ! ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate rose to [her]87-kate feet also . [Her]87-kate own pride seemed suddenly to start up from its long lethargy , and [she]87-kate looked almost defiantly at [[her]87-kate defiant daughter]2453-her defiant daughter . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t do what [you]185-mother ask . ” “[0-i] [You]185-mother wo n’t ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t . ” “[0-i] [You]185-mother want [me]0-i to go on suffering , then ? [You]185-mother want to kill [me]0-i ? ” [The girl]562-the girl was close to [her]87-kate , in a white glare of passion . “[185-mother] Ah , it ’s true -- why should [you]185-mother care what happens to [me]0-i ? After all , [we]1015-we ’re only strangers to [each other]496-each other . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s first thought was : “[0-i] [I]0-i must n’t let [her]1017-her see how it hurts-- ” not because of the fear of increasing [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s suffering , but to prevent [her]87-kate finding out how [she]87-kate could inflict more pain . [Anne]95-anne , at that moment , looked as if the discovery would have been exquisite to [her]95-anne . [The mother]242-the mother dared not speak ; [she]242-the mother feared [her]242-the mother whole agony would break from [her]242-the mother with [her]242-the mother first word . [The two]573-the two stood facing [each other]496-each other for a moment ; then [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane put [her]187-mrs. clephane hand out blindly . But [the girl]562-the girl turned from it with a fierce “[0-i] Do n’t ! ” that seemed to thrust [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother still farther from [her]562-the girl , and swept out of [the room]325-the room without a look . [XVI . Anne]95-anne had decreed that [they]573-the two should return [home]246-home ; and [they]573-the two returned . The day after the scene at [Rio]64-rio [the girl]562-the girl had faltered out an apology , and [the mother]242-the mother had received it with a silent kiss . After that [neither]2465-neither had alluded to the subject of [their]573-the two midnight talk . [Anne]95-anne was as solicitous as ever for [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s comfort and enjoyment , but [the daughter]2467-the daughter had vanished in [the travelling companion]2468-the travelling companion . Sometimes , during those last weary weeks of travel , [Kate Clephane]87-kate wondered if any closer relation would ever be possible between [them]573-the two . But it was not often that [she]87-kate dared to look ahead . [She]87-kate felt like [a traveller crawling along a narrow ledge above a precipice]2469-a traveller crawling along a narrow ledge above a precipice ; a glance forward or down might plunge [her]87-kate into the depths . As [they]573-the two drew near [New York]5-new york [she]87-kate recalled [her]87-kate other return [there]498-there , less than a year before , and the reckless confidence with which [she]87-kate had entered on [her]87-kate new life . [She]87-kate recalled [her]87-kate first meeting with [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter , [her]87-kate sense of an instant understanding on the part of each , and the way [her]87-kate own past had fallen from [her]87-kate at [the girl]562-the girl ’s embrace . Now [Anne]95-anne seemed remoter than ever , and it was [the mother]242-the mother ’s past which had divided [them]573-the two . [She]87-kate shuddered at the fatuity with which [she]87-kate had listened to [Enid Drover]145-enid drover and [Fred Landers]94-fred landers when [they]573-the two assured [her]87-kate that [she]87-kate had won [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s heart . “[0-i] [She]1018-she ’s taken a tremendous fancy to [you--]1019-you-- ” Was it possible that that absurd phrase had ever satisfied [her]87-kate ? But [daughters]2475-daughters , [she]87-kate said to [herself]87-kate , do n’t take a fancy to [[their]2475-daughters mothers]2476-their mothers ! [Mothers]2477-mothers and [daughters]2475-daughters are part of [each other]496-each other ’s consciousness , in different degrees and in a different way , but still with the mutual sense of something which has always been there . [A real mother]2480-a real mother is just a habit of thought to [[her]2480-a real mother children]2481-her children . Well -- [this mother]2482-this mother must put up with what [she]2482-this mother had , and make the most of it . Yes ; for [Anne]95-anne ’s sake [she]2482-this mother must try to make the most of it , to grope [her]2482-this mother own way and [the girl]562-the girl ’s through this ghastly labyrinth without imperilling whatever affection [Anne]95-anne still felt for [her]2482-this mother . So [a conscientious chaperon]2484-a conscientious chaperon might have reasoned -- and what more had [Kate Clephane]87-kate the right to call [herself]87-kate ? [They]2485-they reached [New York]5-new york early in October . [None of [the family]390-the family]2486-none of the family were in [town]813-town ; even [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , uninformed of the exact date of [their]2485-they return , was off shooting with [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew in [South Carolina]59-south carolina . [Anne]95-anne had wanted [their]2485-they arrival to pass unperceived ; [she]95-anne told [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother that [they]2485-they would remain in [town]813-town for a day or two , and then decide where to spend the rest of the autumn . On the steamer [they]2485-they languidly discussed alternatives ; but , from [the girl]562-the girl ’s inability to decide , [the mother]242-the mother guessed that [she]242-the mother was waiting for something -- probably a letter . “[1020-she] [She]1020-she ’s written to [him]1021-him after all ; [she]1020-she expects to find the answer when [we]1022-we arrive . ” [They]2485-they reached [the house]255-the house and went [upstairs]2312-upstairs to [[their]2485-they respective apartments]2495-their respective apartments . Everything in [[Anne]95-anne ’s establishment]1938-anne ’s establishment was as discreetly ordered as in [a club]2497-a club ; [each lady]2498-each lady found [her]2498-each lady correspondence in [[her]2498-each lady sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room , and [Kate Clephane]87-kate , while [she]87-kate glanced indifferently over [her]87-kate own letters , sat with an anguished heart wondering what message awaited [Anne]95-anne . [They]2485-they met at dinner , and [she]87-kate fancied [the girl]562-the girl looked paler and more distant than usual . After dinner [the two]573-the two went to [[Kate]87-kate ’s sitting - room]2502-kate ’s sitting - room . [Aline]90-aline had already laid out some of the presents [they]2485-they had brought [home]246-home : a Mexican turquoise ornament for [Lilla]153-lilla , an exotic head - band of kingfishers ’ feathers for [Nollie]154-nollie , an old Spanish chronicle for [Fred Landers]94-fred landers . [Mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter turned [them]2506-them over with affected interest ; then talk languished , and [Anne]95-anne rose and said goodnight . On the threshold [she]95-anne paused . “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother , [I]0-i was odious to [you]185-mother that night at [Rio]64-rio . ” [Kate]87-kate started up with an impulsive gesture . “[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i darling]1505-my darling , what does that matter ? It was all forgotten long ago . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have n’t forgotten it . [I]0-i ’m more and more ashamed of what [I]0-i said . But [I]0-i was dreadfully unhappy .... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know , [dear]1521-dear , [I]0-i know . ” [The girl]562-the girl still stood by the door , clutching the knob in an unconscious hand . “[0-i] [I]0-i wanted to tell [you]185-mother that now [I]0-i ’m cured -- quite cured . ” [Her]0-i smile was heart - breaking . “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t follow [your]185-mother advice ; [I]0-i wrote to [him]1025-him . [I]0-i told [him]1025-him -- [I]0-i pretended -- that [you]185-mother were going to accept [my]0-i plan of giving [you]185-mother back the money , and that [I]0-i should have only a moderate allowance , so that [he]1025-him need n’t feel any inequality ... any sense of obligation .... ” [Kate]87-kate listened with lowered head . “[185-mother] Perhaps [you]185-mother were right to write to [him]1025-him . ” “[185-mother] Yes , [I]0-i was right , ” [Anne]95-anne answered with a faint touch of self - derision . “[0-i] For now [I]0-i know . It was not the money ; [he]1025-him has told [me]0-i so . [I]0-i ’ve had a letter . ” “[0-i] Ah-- ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m dismissed , ” said [the girl]562-the girl with an abrupt laugh . “[0-i] What do [you]185-mother mean , [dear]1521-dear , when [you]185-mother say [I]0-i was right ? ” “[185-mother] [I]0-i mean that there was [another woman]1027-another woman . ” [Anne]95-anne came close to [her]562-the girl , with the same white vehement face as [she]95-anne had shown during [their]2509-their nocturnal talk at [Rio]64-rio . But of course , with [a man]2087-a man ... [a man like that ....]1031-a man like that .... ” ( Should [she]87-kate go on , or should [she]87-kate stop ? ) [Anne]95-anne was upon [her]562-the girl with a cry . “[1508-mother] _ [Mother]1508-mother , what kind of [a man]2087-a man ? _ ” Fool that [she]95-anne was , not to have foreseen the consequences of such a slip ! [Anne]95-anne repeated [her]95-anne question with insistence . “[2087-a man] [You]185-mother knew [him]2087-a man before [I]0-i did , ” [she]95-anne added . “[185-mother] Yes ; but it ’s so long ago . ” “[2087-a man] But what makes [you]185-mother suspect [him]2087-a man now ? ” “[185-mother] Suspect ? [She]0-i could not yet grasp the significance of the words [[her]0-i daughter]306-her daughter was pouring out , and repeated dully : “[185-mother] [You]185-mother went to [Baltimore]2-baltimore ? ” How secret [Anne]95-anne must be , [she]0-i thought , not only to have concealed [her]95-anne visit at the time , but even to have refrained from any allusion to it during [their]2514-their stormy talk at [Rio]64-rio ! [Anne]95-anne ’s voice sank to a whisper . “[185-mother] [Mother]1508-mother -- [you]1508-mother did that ? It was really [you]1508-mother -- it was [your]1508-mother doing ? [The mother]242-the mother , bowed there , [her]242-the mother shrunken body drawn in on itself , felt a faint expanding of the heart . “[1508-mother] No , [dear]1521-dear ; no ; not hate , ” [she]242-the mother stammered . “[1508-mother] But it _ was _ [you]1508-mother ? ” [She]242-the mother suddenly understood that , all the while , [Anne]95-anne had not really believed it . XVII . Two days later [Fred Landers]94-fred landers returned . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had sent a note begging [him]94-fred landers to call [her]187-mrs. clephane up as soon as [he]94-fred landers arrived . When [his]94-fred landers call came [she]187-mrs. clephane asked if [she]187-mrs. clephane might dine with [him]94-fred landers that night , and [he]94-fred landers replied that [she]187-mrs. clephane ought to have come without asking . [Anne]95-anne , [he]94-fred landers supposed , would honour [him]94-fred landers too ? No , [she]187-mrs. clephane answered ; [Anne]95-anne , the day before , had gone down to [[the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ on [Long Island]54-long island]2530-the drovers ’ on long island . [She]95-anne would probably be away for a few days . And would [Fred]94-fred landers please ask [no one else]718-no one else to dine ? [He]94-fred landers assured [her]187-mrs. clephane that such an idea would never have occurred to [him]94-fred landers . [He]94-fred landers received [her]187-mrs. clephane in [the comfortable shabby drawing - room which [he]94-fred landers had never changed since [[his]94-fred landers mother]707-his mother and [an old - maid sister]2534-an old - maid sister had vanished from [it]2532-the comfortable shabby drawing - room which he had never changed since his mother and an old - maid sister had vanished from it years before years before]2532-the comfortable shabby drawing - room which he had never changed since his mother and an old - maid sister had vanished from it years before . [He]94-fred landers indulged [his]94-fred landers own tastes in [the library]2535-the library [upstairs]2312-upstairs , leaving [this chintzy room]2537-this chintzy room , with [its]2537-this chintzy room many armchairs , the Steinway piano and the family Chippendale , much as [Kate]87-kate had known it when [old Mrs. Landers]211-old mrs. landers had given [her]87-kate a bridal dinner . The memory of that dinner , and of [Mrs. Landers]211-old mrs. landers , large , silvery , demonstrative , flashed through [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s mind . [She]187-mrs. clephane saw [herself]187-mrs. clephane in an elaborately looped gown , proudly followed by [[her]187-mrs. clephane husband]283-her husband , and enclosed in [[her]187-mrs. clephane hostess]2539-her hostess ’s rustling embrace , while [[her]187-mrs. clephane present host]2540-her present host , crimson with emotion and admiration , hung shyly behind [[his]94-fred landers mother]707-his mother ; and the memory gave [her]187-mrs. clephane a pang of self - pity . In the middle of [the room]325-the room [she]187-mrs. clephane paused and looked about [her]187-mrs. clephane . “[1508-mother] It feels like [home]246-home , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane said , without knowing what [she]187-mrs. clephane was saying . A flush almost as agitated as the one [she]187-mrs. clephane remembered mounted to [Landers]211-old mrs. landers ’s forehead . [She]187-mrs. clephane saw [his]94-fred landers confusion and pleasure , and was remotely touched by them . “[1066-you] [You]1066-you see , [I]0-i ’m homeless , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane explained with a faint smile . “[0-i] Homeless ? ” “[1508-mother] Oh , [I]0-i ca n’t remember when [I]0-i was ever anything else . [I]0-i ’ve been [a wanderer]1067-a wanderer for so many years . ” “[1067-a wanderer] But not any more , ” [he]94-fred landers smiled . The double mahogany doors were thrown open . [Landers]211-old mrs. landers , with [his]94-fred landers stiff little bow , offered [her]187-mrs. clephane an arm , and [they]2543-they passed into [a dusky flock - papered dining - room which seemed to borrow most of [its]2544-a dusky flock - papered dining - room which seemed to borrow most of its lighting from the sturdy silver and monumental cut - glass of the dinner - table lighting from the sturdy silver and monumental cut - glass of the dinner - table]2544-a dusky flock - papered dining - room which seemed to borrow most of its lighting from the sturdy silver and monumental cut - glass of the dinner - table . A bunch of violets , compact and massive , lay by [her]187-mrs. clephane plate . Everything about [Fred Landers]94-fred landers was old - fashioned , solid and authentic . [She]187-mrs. clephane sank into [her]187-mrs. clephane chair with a sense of its being a place of momentary refuge . [She]187-mrs. clephane did not mean to speak till after dinner -- then [she]187-mrs. clephane would tell [him]94-fred landers everything [she]187-mrs. clephane thought . “[1067-a wanderer] How delicious they are ! ” [she]187-mrs. clephane murmured , smelling the violets . In [the library]2535-the library , after dinner , [Landers]94-fred landers settled [her]187-mrs. clephane in [his]94-fred landers deepest armchair , moved the lamp away , pressed a glass of old Chartreuse on [her]187-mrs. clephane , and said : “[1067-a wanderer] And now , what ’s wrong ? ” The suddenness and the perspicacity of the question took [her]187-mrs. clephane by surprise . [She]187-mrs. clephane had imagined [he]94-fred landers would leave the preliminaries to [her]187-mrs. clephane , or at any rate beat about the subject in a clumsy effort to get at it . But [she]187-mrs. clephane perceived that , awkward and almost timorous as [he]94-fred landers remained in smaller ways , the mere habit of life had given [him]94-fred landers a certain self - assurance at important moments . It was [she]187-mrs. clephane who now felt a tremor of reluctance . How could [she]187-mrs. clephane tell [him]94-fred landers -- what could [she]187-mrs. clephane tell [him]94-fred landers ? “[1067-a wanderer] Well , [you]1068-you know , [I]0-i really _ am _ homeless , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane began . “[0-i] Or at least , in remaining where [I]0-i am [I]0-i ’m forfeiting [my]0-i last shred of self - respect . [Anne]95-anne has told [me]0-i that [her]95-anne experiment has been a mistake . ” “[95-anne] What experiment ? ” “[95-anne] Having [me]0-i back . ” “[95-anne] Is that what [she]95-anne calls it -- an experiment ? ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane nodded . [Fred Landers]94-fred landers stood leaning against the mantelpiece , an unlit cigar in [his]94-fred landers hand . [His]94-fred landers face expressed perplexity and perturbation . “[95-anne] [I]0-i do n’t understand . What has happened ? [She]95-anne seemed to adore [you]1068-you . ” “[95-anne] Yes ; as [a visitor]1069-a visitor ; [a chaperon]1070-a chaperon ; [a travelling companion]1071-a travelling companion . ” “[1071-a travelling companion] Well -- that ’s not so bad to begin with . ” “[1071-a travelling companion] No ; but it has nothing on earth to do with the real relation between [a mother]356-a mother and [daughter]1843-daughter . ” “[1068-you] Oh , _ that_-- ” It was [her]187-mrs. clephane turn to flush . “[1068-you] [You]1068-you agree with [Anne]95-anne , then , that [I]0-i ’ve forfeited all right to claim it ? ” [He]94-fred landers seemed embarrassed . “[1068-you] What do [you]1068-you mean by claiming it ? ” [She]187-mrs. clephane hesitated a moment ; then [she]187-mrs. clephane began . It was not the story [she]187-mrs. clephane had meant to tell ; [she]187-mrs. clephane had hardly opened [her]187-mrs. clephane lips before [she]187-mrs. clephane understood that it would be as impossible to tell that to [Fred Landers]94-fred landers as to [Anne]95-anne . For an instant , as [he]94-fred landers welcomed [her]187-mrs. clephane to [the familiar house]2546-the familiar house , so full of friendly memories , [she]187-mrs. clephane had had the illusion of nearness to [him]94-fred landers , the sense of a brotherly reassuring presence . But as [she]187-mrs. clephane began to speak of [Chris]88-chris every one else in [her]187-mrs. clephane new life except [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter became remote and indistinct to [her]187-mrs. clephane . [She]187-mrs. clephane supposed it could not be otherwise . [She]187-mrs. clephane had chosen to cast [her]187-mrs. clephane lot elsewhere , and now , coming back after so many years , [she]187-mrs. clephane found the sense of intimacy and confidence irreparably destroyed . What did [she]187-mrs. clephane really know of the present [Fred Landers]94-fred landers , or [he]94-fred landers of [her]187-mrs. clephane ? All [she]187-mrs. clephane found [herself]187-mrs. clephane able to say was that when [she]187-mrs. clephane had heard that [Anne]95-anne meant to marry [Chris Fenno]88-chris [she]187-mrs. clephane had thought it [her]187-mrs. clephane duty to try to prevent the marriage ; and that [the girl]562-the girl had guessed [her]187-mrs. clephane interference and could not forgive [her]187-mrs. clephane . [She]187-mrs. clephane elaborated on this , lingering over the relatively insignificant details of [her]187-mrs. clephane successive talks with [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter in the attempt to delay the moment when [Landers]94-fred landers should begin to question [her]187-mrs. clephane . [He]94-fred landers had never liked [Chris]88-chris , [she]187-mrs. clephane knew , and the news of the engagement was clearly a shock to [him]94-fred landers . [He]94-fred landers said [he]94-fred landers had seen and heard nothing of [Fenno]88-chris since [Anne]95-anne and [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother had left . But what argument against the marriage would be more efficacious on [Nollie]154-nollie ’s lips than on [her]154-nollie own ? One only -- the one that [no one]750-no one must ever use . Once [Nollie]154-nollie knew , [Anne]95-anne would surely get to know ; the horror of that possibility sealed [the mother]242-the mother ’s lips . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane consulted the telephone book , but of course in vain . Whatever ’s ready-- ” [She]0-i sat down to it without changing [her]0-i dress .
