[Her]90-aline harsh face illuminated with curiosity , [she]90-aline handed [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress a card . “[1100-the gentleman] [The gentleman]1100-the gentleman is [downstairs]715-downstairs . [He]1100-the gentleman hopes [Madame]1453-madame will excuse the hour . ” [Her]0-i tone seemed to imply : “[1453-madame] [Madame]1453-madame , in this case , will excuse _ everything _ ! ” and [Kate]87-kate cast a startled glance at the name . [He]1100-the gentleman had come to [her]87-kate , then -- had come of [his]1100-the gentleman own accord ! [She]87-kate felt dizzy with relief and fear . Fear uppermost -- yes ; was [she]87-kate not always afraid of [him]1100-the gentleman ? [XIX]215-xix . [Chris Fenno]88-chris stood in [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room . [The servant who received [him]88-chris]2600-the servant who received him had turned on a blast of lamps and wall - lights , and in the hard overhead glare [he]88-chris looked drawn and worn , like [a man recovering from severe illness]2601-a man recovering from severe illness . [His]88-chris clothes , too , [Kate]87-kate fancied , were shabbier ; everything in [his]88-chris appearance showed a decline , a defeat . [She]87-kate had not much believed in [his]88-chris illness when [Nollie]154-nollie spoke of it ; the old habit of incredulity was too strong in [her]87-kate . But now [his]88-chris appearance moved [her]87-kate . [She]87-kate felt [herself]87-kate responsible , almost guilty . But for [her]87-kate folly , [she]87-kate thought , [he]88-chris might have been standing before [her]87-kate with a high head , on easy terms with [the world]1483-the world . “[1453-madame] [You]1104-you ’ve been ill ! ” [she]87-kate exclaimed . [His]88-chris gesture brushed that aside . “[1453-madame] [I]0-i ’m well now , thanks . ” [He]88-chris looked [her]87-kate in the face and added : “[1453-madame] May [we]1105-we have a few minutes ’ talk ? ” [She]87-kate faltered : “[1453-madame] If [you]1104-you think it necessary . ” Inwardly [she]87-kate had already begun to tremble . When [his]88-chris blue eyes turned to that harsh slate - gray , and the two perpendicular lines deepened between [his]88-chris brows , [she]87-kate had always trembled . “[1104-you] [You]0-i ’ve made it necessary , ” [he]88-chris retorted , [his]88-chris voice as harsh as [his]88-chris eyes . “[0-i] [I]0-i ? ” “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ve broken [our]1105-we compact . It ’s not [my]0-i doing . [I]0-i stuck to [my]0-i side of it . ” [He]88-chris flung out the short sentences like blows . [Her]87-kate heart was beating so wildly that [she]87-kate could not follow what [he]88-chris said . “[0-i] What do [you]1104-you mean ? ” [she]87-kate stammered . “[1104-you] That [you]1104-you agreed to help [me]0-i if [I]0-i gave up [Anne]95-anne . God knows what [your]1104-you idea of helping [me]0-i was . To [me]0-i it meant only one thing : [your]1104-you keeping quiet , keeping out of the whole business , and trusting [me]0-i to carry out [my]0-i side of the bargain -- as [I]0-i did . [I]0-i broke [our]1106-our engagement , chucked [my]0-i job , went away . And [you]1104-you ? Instead of keeping out of it , of saying nothing , [you]1104-you ’ve talked against [me]0-i , insinuated God knows what , and then refused to explain [your]1104-you insinuations . [You]1104-you ’ve put [me]0-i in such a position that [I]0-i ’ve got to take back [my]0-i word to [you]1104-you , or appear to [[your]1104-you daughter]1452-your daughter and [[your]1104-you family]1108-your family as [a man who has run away because [he]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him knew [he]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him could n’t face the charge hanging over [him]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him . ” It was only in the white - heat of anger that [he]1104-you spoke with such violence , and at such length ; [he]1104-you seemed spent , and desperately at bay , and the thought gave [Kate Clephane]87-kate courage . “[1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him] Well--_can _ [you]1104-you face it ? ” [she]0-i asked . [His]1104-you expression changed , as [she]0-i had so often seen it change . From menace it passed to petulance and then became almost pleading in its perplexity . [She]0-i said to [herself]0-i : “[1104-you] It ’s the first time [I]0-i ’ve ever been brave with [him]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him , and [he]1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him does n’t know how to take it . ” But even then [she]0-i felt the precariousness of the advantage . [His]1104-you ready wit had so often served [him]1104-you instead of resolution . It served [him]1104-you now . “[1109-a man who has run away because he knew he could n’t face the charge hanging over him] [You]0-i do mean to make the charge , then ? ” [he]1104-you retorted . [She]0-i stood silent , feeling [herself]0-i defeated , and at the same time humiliated that [their]2603-their angry thoughts should have dragged them down to such a level . “[0-i] Do n’t sneer-- ” [she]0-i faltered . “[216-sneer] [Sneer]216-sneer ? At what ? [I]0-i ’m in dead earnest -- can’t [you]0-i see it ? [You]0-i ’ve ruined [me]0-i -- or very nearly . [I]0-i ’m not speaking now of [my]0-i feelings ; that would make _ [you]0-i _ sneer , probably . At any rate , this is no time for discussing them . [I]0-i ’m merely putting [my]0-i case as [a poor devil who has to earn [his]1110-a poor devil who has to earn his living living]1110-a poor devil who has to earn his living , [a man who has [his]1110-a poor devil who has to earn his living good name to defend]1111-a man who has his good name to defend . On both counts [you]0-i ’ve done [me]0-i all the harm [you]0-i could . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i had to stop this marriage . ” “[0-i] Very well . [I]0-i agreed to that . [I]0-i did what [I]0-i ’d promised . Could n’t [you]0-i let it alone ? ” “[95-anne] No . Because [Anne]95-anne would n’t . [She]95-anne wanted to ask [you]0-i to come back . [She]95-anne saw [I]0-i could n’t bear it -- [she]95-anne suspected [me]0-i of knowing something . [She]95-anne insisted . ” “[95-anne] And [you]0-i sacrificed [my]0-i good name rather-- ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i ’d sacrifice anything . [You]0-i ’d better understand that . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do understand it . That ’s why [I]0-i ’m [here]735-here . To tell [you]0-i [I]0-i consider that what [you]0-i ’ve done has freed [me]0-i from [my]0-i promise . ” [She]0-i stretched out [her]0-i hands as if to catch [him]88-chris back . “[88-chris] [Chris]88-chris -- no , stay ! [You]88-chris ca n’t ! [You]88-chris ca n’t ! [You]88-chris know [you]88-chris ca n’t ! ” [He]88-chris stood leaning against the chimney - piece , [his]88-chris arms crossed , [his]88-chris head a little bent and thrust forward , in the attitude of sullen obstinacy that [she]0-i knew so well . And all at once in [her]0-i own cry [she]0-i heard the echo of other cries , other entreaties . [She]0-i saw [herself]0-i in another scene , stretching [her]0-i arms to [him]88-chris in the same desperate entreaty , with the same sense of [her]0-i inability to move [him]88-chris , even to reach [him]88-chris . [Her]0-i tears overflowed and ran down . “[88-chris] [You]88-chris do n’t mean [you]88-chris ’ll tell [her]1113-her ? ” [she]0-i whispered . [He]88-chris kept [his]88-chris dogged attitude . “[88-chris] [I]0-i ’ve got to clear [myself]0-i -- somehow . ” “[0-i] Oh , do n’t tell [her]1113-her , do n’t tell [her]1113-her ! [Chris]88-chris , do n’t tell [her]1113-her ! ” As the cry died on [her]0-i lips [she]0-i understood that , in uttering it , [she]0-i had at last cast [herself]0-i completely on [his]88-chris mercy . For it was not impossible that , if other means failed , [he]88-chris would risk justifying [himself]88-chris to [Anne]95-anne by revealing the truth . There were times when [he]88-chris was reckless enough to risk anything . And if [Kate]87-kate were right in [her]87-kate conjecture -- if [he]88-chris had the audacity [he]88-chris affected -- then [his]88-chris hold over [her]0-i was complete , and [he]88-chris knew it . If [any one else]1836-any one else told [Anne]95-anne , [the girl]562-the girl ’s horror would turn [her]0-i from [him]88-chris at once . But what if [he]88-chris [himself]88-chris told [her]0-i ? All this flashed on [Kate Clephane]87-kate in the same glare of enlightenment . There was a long silence . [She]0-i had sunk into a chair and hidden [her]0-i face in [her]0-i hands . Presently , through the enveloping cloud of [her]0-i misery , [she]0-i felt [his]88-chris nearness , and a touch on [her]0-i shoulder . “[87-kate] [Kate]87-kate -- won’t [you]87-kate try to understand ; to listen quietly ? ” [She]0-i lifted [her]0-i eyes and met [his]88-chris fugitively . [They]1116-they had lost [their]1116-they harshness , and were almost frightened . “[87-kate] [I]0-i was angry when [I]0-i came [here]735-here -- [a man]2087-a man would be , ” [he]88-chris continued . “[2087-a man] But what ’s to be gained by [our]1116-they talking to each other in this way ? [You]87-kate were awfully kind to [me]0-i in old times ; [I]0-i have n’t forgotten . But is that a reason for being so hard on [me]0-i now ? [I]0-i did n’t bring this situation on [myself]0-i -- you’re [[my]0-i witness]1117-my witness that [I]0-i did n’t . But here it is ; it ’s a fact ; [we]1116-they ’ve got to face it . ” [She]87-kate lowered [her]87-kate eyes and voice to whisper painfully : “[95-anne] To face [Anne]95-anne ’s love for [you]0-i ? ” “[95-anne] Yes . ” “[95-anne] [Her]95-anne determination-- ? ” “[95-anne] [Her]95-anne absolute determination . ” [His]88-chris words made [her]87-kate tremble again ; there had always been moments when [his]88-chris reasonableness alarmed [her]87-kate more than [his]88-chris anger , because [she]87-kate knew that , to be so gentle , [he]88-chris must be certain of eventually gaining [his]88-chris point . But [she]87-kate gathered resolution to say : “[95-anne] And if [I]0-i take back [my]0-i threats , as [you]0-i call them ? If [I]0-i take back all [I]0-i ’ve said--‘clear ’ [you]0-i entirely ? That ’s what [you]0-i want , [I]0-i understand ? If [I]0-i promise that , ” [she]87-kate panted , “[0-i] will [you]0-i promise too -- promise [me]0-i to find a way out ? ” [His]88-chris hand fell from [her]87-kate shoulder , and [he]88-chris drew back a step . “[0-i] A way out -- now ? But there is n’t any . ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane stood up . [She]87-kate remembered wondering long ago -- one day when [he]88-chris had been very tender -- how cruel [Chris]88-chris could be . The conjecture , then , had seemed whimsical , almost morbid ; now [she]87-kate understood that [she]87-kate had guessed in [him]88-chris from the outset this genius for reaching , at the first thrust , to the central point of [[his]88-chris antagonist]2606-his antagonist ’s misery . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ve seen [[my]0-i daughter]1455-my daughter , then ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve seen [her]1455-my daughter -- yes . This morning . It was [she]1455-my daughter who sent [me]0-i here . ” “[1455-my daughter] If [she]1455-my daughter ’s made up [her]1455-my daughter mind , why did [she]1455-my daughter send [you]0-i ? ” “[1455-my daughter] To tell [you]0-i how [she]1455-my daughter ’s suffering . [She]1455-my daughter thinks , [you]0-i know-- ” [He]2607-he wavered again for a second or two , and then brought out : “[1455-my daughter] [She]1455-my daughter ’s very unhappy about the stand [you]0-i take . [She]1455-my daughter thinks [you]0-i ought to say something to ... to clear up .... ” “[1455-my daughter] What difference will it make , if [she]1455-my daughter means to marry [you]0-i ? ” “[1455-my daughter] Why -- the immense difference of [her]1455-my daughter feeling for _ [you]0-i _ . [She]1455-my daughter ’s dreadfully hurt ... [she]1455-my daughter ’s very miserable .... ” “[1455-my daughter] But absolutely determined ? ” Again [he]2607-he made an embarrassed gesture of acquiescence . [Kate Clephane]87-kate stood looking about [the rich glaring room]2608-the rich glaring room . [She]87-kate felt like a dizzy moth battering itself to death against that implacable blaze . [She]87-kate closed [her]87-kate lids for an instant . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall tell [her]1455-my daughter , then ; [I]0-i shall tell [her]1455-my daughter the truth , ” [she]87-kate said suddenly . [He]2607-he stood in the doorway , [his]2607-he hard gaze upon [her]87-kate . “[0-i] Well , tell [her]1455-my daughter -- do tell [her]1455-my daughter ; if [you]0-i want never to see [her]1455-my daughter again , ” [he]2607-he said . [XX]217-xx . [He]2607-he must have been very sure of [her]2607-he not acting on [his]2607-he final challenge , or [he]2607-he would not have dared to make it . That was the continuous refrain of [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s thoughts as [the train]2239-the train carried [her]87-kate down to [Long Island]54-long island the next morning . “[1119-he] [He]1119-he ’s convinced [I]0-i shall never tell [her]1455-my daughter ; but what if [I]0-i do ? ” The thought sustained [her]87-kate through the long sleepless night , and gave [her]87-kate the strength and clearness of mind to decide that [she]87-kate must at once see [Anne]95-anne , however little [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter might desire the meeting . After all , [she]87-kate still had that weapon in [her]87-kate depleted armoury : [she]87-kate could reveal the truth . At [the station]2240-the station [she]87-kate found [one of [the Drover motors]2613-the drover motors]2612-one of the drover motors , and remembered with a start that it was a Saturday , and that [she]87-kate would probably come upon a large house - party at [[her]87-kate sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law ’s . But to [her]87-kate relief [she]87-kate learned that [the motor]2615-the motor had only brought [a departing visitor]2616-a departing visitor to [the up - train]2617-the up - train . [She]87-kate asked to be driven back in [it]2615-the motor , and in a few moments was rolling between the wrought - iron gates and down the long drive to [the house]255-the house . The front door stood open , and [she]87-kate went into [the hall]2619-the hall . The long oak tables were so laden with golf - sticks , tennis racquets and homespun garments that [she]87-kate saw [she]87-kate had been right in guessing [she]87-kate would encounter a houseful . But it was too late to turn back ; and besides , what did [the other people]2620-the other people matter ? [They]2620-the other people might , if [they]2620-the other people were numerous enough , make it easier for [her]87-kate to isolate [herself]87-kate with [Anne]95-anne . [The hall]2619-the hall seemed empty ; but as [she]87-kate advanced [she]87-kate saw [a woman]282-a woman ’s figure lazily outstretched in a deep armchair before the fire . [Lilla Maclew]218-lilla maclew rose from the chair to greet [her]282-a woman . “[0-i] Hallo -- [Aunt Kate]161-aunt kate ? ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane caught the embarrassment in [[her]187-mrs. clephane niece]2623-her niece ’s rich careless voice , and guessed that [the family]390-the family had already been made aware of the situation existing between [Anne]95-anne and [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother , and probably , therefore , of [the girl]562-the girl ’s engagement . But [Lilla Maclew]218-lilla maclew was even more easy , self - confident and indifferent than [Lilla Gates]153-lilla had been . The bolder dash of peroxyde on [her]218-lilla maclew hair , and the glint of jewels on [her]218-lilla maclew dusky skin , made [her]218-lilla maclew look like a tall bronze statue with traces of gilding on it . “[219-hallo] [Hallo]219-hallo , ” [she]218-lilla maclew repeated , rather blankly ; “[219-hallo] have [you]219-hallo come to lunch ? ” “[219-hallo] [I]0-i ’ve come to see [Anne]95-anne , ” [[Anne]95-anne ’s mother]1655-anne ’s mother answered . [Lilla]153-lilla ’s constraint visibly increased , and with it [her]153-lilla sullen reluctance to make any unnecessary effort . [One]247-one had n’t married money , [her]153-lilla tone proclaimed , to be loaded up like this with family bothers . “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne ’s out . Having at last settled [[her]166-mrs. drover own daughter]1685-her own daughter ’s difficulties , [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover ’s eyes seemed to ask , why should [she]166-mrs. drover so soon be called upon to deal with another family disturbance ? Even [juries]2632-juries , after a protracted trial , are excused from service for seven years ; yet here [she]166-mrs. drover was being drawn into the thick of a new quarrel when [the old one]2633-the old one was barely composed . “[87-kate] [Anne]95-anne ’s out , ” [she]166-mrs. drover added , offering a cool pink cheek to [[her]166-mrs. drover sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law . “[95-anne] May [I]0-i wait , then ? [The men]2161-the men are off at [a polo practice at [Hempstead]69-hempstead]1129-a polo practice at hempstead . [The hall]2619-the hall was already filling up with a jocund bustle of [Drovers]1818-drovers and [Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons . [Young , middle - aged and elderly]2638-young , middle - aged and elderly , [they]2638-young , middle - aged and elderly poured out of successive motors , all ruddy , prosperous , clamouring for food . Hardly distinguishable from [the family]390-the family were [the week - end friends]2640-the week - end friends returning with [them]2640-the week - end friends from one sportive spectacle or another . As [Kate Clephane]87-kate stood among [them]2640-the week - end friends , going through the mechanical gestures of greeting and small - talk , [she]87-kate felt so tenuous and spectral that [she]87-kate almost wondered how [she]87-kate could be visible to [their]2640-the week - end friends hearty senses . [They]2640-the week - end friends were all glad to see [her]87-kate , all a little surprised at [her]87-kate being [there]498-there , and all soon forgetful of [their]2640-the week - end friends own surprise in discussing the more important questions of polo , tennis and lunch . Once more [she]87-kate had the impression of being hurried with [them]2640-the week - end friends down [a huge sliding stairway]2642-a huge sliding stairway that perpetually revolved upon [itself]2642-a huge sliding stairway , and once more [she]87-kate recalled [her]87-kate difficulty in telling one of [them]2640-the week - end friends from another , and in deciding whether it was [the Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons or [the Drovers who had the smallest noses]2643-the drovers who had the smallest noses . “[95-anne] But [Anne]95-anne -- where ’s [Anne]95-anne ? ” [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover enquired , steering the tide of arrivals toward the shining stretch of a long luncheon - table . [He]159-hendrik drover put [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane at [his]159-hendrik drover left , and added , as [he]159-hendrik drover settled [her]187-mrs. clephane in [her]187-mrs. clephane seat : “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne and [Nollie]154-nollie went off early to [the Glenver finals]1130-the glenver finals . But [Joe]143-the tresseltons was [there]498-there too -- weren’t [you]1132-you , [Joe]143-the tresseltons ? ” [He]159-hendrik drover did not wait for [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton ’s answer , but addressed [himself]159-hendrik drover hurriedly to [the lady on [his]159-hendrik drover right]2644-the lady on his right . [Kate]87-kate had the feeling that [they]2645-they all thought [she]87-kate had committed an error of taste in appearing among [them]2645-they at that particular moment , but that it was no business of [theirs]2645-they , after all , and [they]2645-they must act in concert in affecting that nothing could be more natural . [The Drovers]146-the drovers and [Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons were great at acting in concert , and at pretending that whatever happened was natural , usual , and not of a character to interfere with one ’s lunch . When [a member of [the tribe]2647-the tribe]2646-a member of the tribe was ill , [the best doctors]2648-the best doctors and [most expensive nurses]2649-most expensive nurses were summoned , but the illness was spoken of as a trifling indisposition ; when misfortune befell [any one of [them]2645-they]2114-any one of them , it was not spoken of at all . Taking [Lilla]153-lilla for granted had brought this art to the highest point of perfection , and [her]87-kate capture of [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew had fully confirmed its usefulness . All this flashed through [Kate Clephane]87-kate while [she]87-kate refused the champagne ordered on [her]87-kate behalf , and pretended to eat Maryland chicken and corn _ soufflé _ ; but under the surface - rattle of [her]87-kate thoughts a watchful spirit brooded haggardly on the strangeness and unreality of the scene . [She]87-kate had come , in agony of soul , to seek [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter , to have speech with [her]306-her daughter at all costs ; and [the daughter]2467-the daughter was away watching a tennis match , and [no one]750-no one seemed surprised or concerned . Life , even [Anne]95-anne ’s life , was going on in its usual easy way . [The girl]562-the girl had found [[her]562-the girl betrothed]2205-her betrothed again , and been reunited to [him]2205-her betrothed ; what would it matter to [her]562-the girl , or to [[her]562-the girl approving family]2656-her approving family , if [the intruder who for a few months had gone through the pretence of]2657-the intruder who for a few months had gone through the pretence of being one of [them]2656-her approving family , and whose delusion [they]2656-her approving family had good - naturedly abetted , should vanish again from [the group]1678-the group ? As [she]562-the girl looked at [them]2656-her approving family all , so obtuse and so powerful , so sure of [themselves]2656-her approving family and [each other]496-each other , [her]562-the girl own claim to belong to [them]2656-her approving family became incredible even to [herself]562-the girl . [She]562-the girl had made [her]562-the girl choice long ago , and [she]562-the girl had not chosen [them]2656-her approving family ; and now [their]2656-her approving family friendly indifference made the fact clear . Well -- perhaps it also made [her]562-the girl own course clearer . [She]562-the girl was as much divided from [them]2656-her approving family already as death could divide [her]562-the girl . Why not die , then -- die altogether ? [She]562-the girl would tell [Anne]95-anne the truth , and then go away and never see [her]95-anne again ; and that would be death .... “[143-the tresseltons] Ah , here [they]1133-they are ! ” [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover called out genially . Lunch was over ; [the guests]2195-the guests , scattered about in [the hall]2619-the hall and [billiard - room]2662-billiard - room , were lighting [their]2195-the guests cigarettes over coffee and liqueurs . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , who had drifted out with [the rest]2663-the rest , and mechanically taken [her]187-mrs. clephane cup of coffee as the tray passed [her]187-mrs. clephane , lifted [her]187-mrs. clephane head and saw [Anne]95-anne and [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie . [Anne]95-anne entered first . [She]95-anne paused to take off [her]95-anne motor coat , glanced indifferently about [her]95-anne , and said to [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover : “[143-the tresseltons] [You]1134-you did n’t wait for [us]1135-we , [Aunt Enid]145-enid drover ? [We]1135-we were so late that [we]1135-we stopped to lunch at [Madge’s--]70-madge’s-- . ” Then [she]95-anne saw [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother and [her]379-her mother pale cheek whitened . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s eyes filled , and [she]187-mrs. clephane stood motionless . Everything about [her]187-mrs. clephane was so blurred and wavering that [she]187-mrs. clephane dared not stir , or even attempt to set down [her]187-mrs. clephane cup . “[1508-mother] [Mother]1508-mother ! ” [the girl]562-the girl exclaimed . With a quick movement [she]187-mrs. clephane made [her]187-mrs. clephane way through the cluster of [welcoming people]2666-welcoming people , and went up with outstretched arms to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane . For a moment [the two]573-the two held [each other]496-each other ; then [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover , beaming up to [them]573-the two , said benevolently : “[1508-mother] [[Your]1137-your mother]973-your mother must be awfully tired , [Anne]95-anne . Do carry [her]973-your mother off to [[your]1137-your own quarters]1139-your own quarters for a quiet talk-- ” and dazed , trembling , half - fearing [she]187-mrs. clephane was in a dream from which the waking would be worse than death , [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane found [herself]187-mrs. clephane mounting the stairs with [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter . On [the first landing]2670-the first landing [she]187-mrs. clephane regained [her]187-mrs. clephane senses , said to [herself]187-mrs. clephane : “[973-your mother] [She]973-your mother thinks [I]0-i ’ve come to take back what [I]0-i said , ” and tried to stiffen [her]187-mrs. clephane soul against this new form of anguish . [Anne]95-anne moved silently at [her]187-mrs. clephane side . After the first cry and the first kiss [she]187-mrs. clephane had drawn back into [herself]187-mrs. clephane , perhaps obscurely conscious of some inward resistance in [[her]187-mrs. clephane mother]379-her mother . But when the bedroom door had closed on [them]2672-them [she]187-mrs. clephane drew [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane down into an armchair , dropped on [her]187-mrs. clephane knees beside it , and whispered : “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother -- how could [you]185-mother and [I]0-i ever give [each other]496-each other up ? ” The words sounded like an echo of the dear unuttered things [the mother]242-the mother had heard said to [herself]242-the mother long ago , in [her]242-the mother endless dialogues with an invisible [Anne]95-anne . No tears rose to [her]242-the mother eyes , but their flood seemed to fill [her]242-the mother thirsty breast . [She]187-mrs. clephane drew [Anne]95-anne ’s head against it . “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne ... [little Anne]95-anne .... ” [Her]187-mrs. clephane fingers crept through the warm crinklings of hair , wound about the turn of the temples , and slipped down the cheeks . [She]187-mrs. clephane shut [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes , softly saying over [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s name . [Anne]95-anne was the first to speak . “[95-anne] [I]0-i ’ve been so unhappy . [I]0-i wanted [you]95-anne so to come . ” “[0-i] [Darling]206-darling , [you]95-anne were sure [I]0-i would ? ” “[95-anne] How could [I]0-i tell ? [You]95-anne seemed so angry . ” “[95-anne] With [you]95-anne ? Never , [child]1141-child ! ” There was a slight pause ; then , raising [herself]1141-child , [the girl]562-the girl slipped [her]1141-child arms about [[her]1141-child mother]379-her mother ’s neck . “[1142-him] Nor with [him]1142-him , any longer ? ” The chill of reality smote through [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s happy trance . [She]562-the girl felt [herself]562-the girl turning again into [the desolate stranger who had stood below watching for [Anne]95-anne ’s return]2677-the desolate stranger who had stood below watching for anne ’s return . “[1508-mother] [Mother]1508-mother -- [you]1508-mother see , [I]0-i want [you]1508-mother both , ” [she]562-the girl heard [the girl]562-the girl entreating ; and “[0-i] _ Now ! _ ” the inward voice admonished [her]562-the girl . Now indeed was the time to speak ; to make an end . It was clear that no compromise would be of any use . [Anne]95-anne had obviously imagined that [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother had come to forgive and be forgiven , and that [Chris]88-chris was to be included in the general amnesty . On no other terms would any amnesty be accepted . Through [the girl]562-the girl ’s endearments [Kate]87-kate felt , as never before , the steely muscles of [her]87-kate resolution . [Anne]95-anne pressed [her]87-kate closer . “[0-i] Ca n’t [we]1144-we agree , [mother]1508-mother , that [I]0-i must take [my]0-i chance -- and that , if the risks are as great as [you]1508-mother think , [you]1508-mother ’ll be there to help [me]0-i ? [You]1508-mother ’d say yes if [you]1508-mother knew the difference it has made , this last year , to have [you]1508-mother back ! ” [She]562-the girl lifted [her]562-the girl face close to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s to add , with a half - whimsical smile : “[2477-mothers] [Mothers]2477-mothers ought n’t ever to leave [[their]2477-mothers daughters]1148-their daughters . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat motionless in that persuasive hold . It did not seem to [her]87-kate , at the moment , as if [she]87-kate and [[her]87-kate child]327-her child were two , but as if [her]87-kate whole self had passed into the young body pressed pleadingly against [her]87-kate . “[2477-mothers] How can [I]0-i leave [her]1149-her -- how can [I]0-i ever leave [her]1149-her ? ” was [her]87-kate only thought . “[1508-mother] [You]1508-mother see , ” the cajoling voice went on , “[1508-mother] when [I]0-i asked [you]1508-mother to come back and live with [me]0-i , though [I]0-i _ did _ want [you]1508-mother to , most awfully , [I]0-i was n’t as sure ... well , as sure as [Uncle Fred]94-fred landers was ... that the experiment would be a success -- a perfect success . [She]87-kate held [her]306-her daughter fast , saying over and over , as [a mother]356-a mother would to [a child that has fallen and hurt itself]2685-a child that has fallen and hurt itself : “[0-i] There , there ... do n’t cry . ” [She]87-kate no longer knew what [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate was feeling . All [her]87-kate consciousness had passed into [Anne]95-anne . This young anguish , which is the hardest of all to bear , must be allayed : [she]87-kate was ready to utter any words that should lift that broken head from [her]87-kate breast . “[95-anne] [[My]0-i [Anne]95-anne]1507-my anne -- how could [I]0-i ever leave [you]95-anne ? ” [she]87-kate whispered . And as [she]87-kate spoke [she]87-kate felt [herself]87-kate instantly caught in the tight net of [her]87-kate renunciation . If [she]87-kate did not tell [Anne]95-anne now [she]87-kate would never tell [her]95-anne -- and it was exactly on this that [Chris]88-chris had counted . [He]88-chris had known that [she]87-kate would never speak . XXI . It had been decided that [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane must , of course , stay over the Sunday ; on Monday morning [she]187-mrs. clephane would return to [town]813-town with [Anne]95-anne . Meanwhile [Aline]90-aline was summoned with week - end raiment ; and [Kate Clephane]87-kate , after watching the house - party drive off to a distant polo match , remained alone in [the great house]2687-the great house with [[her]87-kate sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law . [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover ’s countenance , though worn from the strain of incessant hospitality , had lost its look of perturbation . It was clear that the affectionate meeting between [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter had been a relief to [the whole family]2691-the whole family , and [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover ’s ingenuous eye declared that since now , thank heaven , that matter was settled , there need be no farther pretence of mystery . [He]181-horace maclew sat nearly opposite [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , and in the strange whirl and dazzle that surrounded [her]187-mrs. clephane [she]187-mrs. clephane instinctively anchored [her]187-mrs. clephane gaze on [his]181-horace maclew broad frame and ponderous countenance . What had [his]181-horace maclew marriage done to [him]181-horace maclew , [she]187-mrs. clephane wondered , and what weight had it given [him]181-horace maclew in the counsels of [[his]181-horace maclew new family]2699-his new family ? [His]181-horace maclew marriage with [Lilla]153-lilla must have been the outcome , the climax , of these private concessions , and have prepared [him]181-horace maclew to view most of the problems of life from an easier angle . Undoubtedly , among [the men present]2704-the men present , though no quicker - witted than [the others]523-the others , [he]181-horace maclew would have been the one most likely to understand [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s case , could [she]187-mrs. clephane have put it to [him]181-horace maclew . But to do so -- [one]247-one had only to intercept [their]2704-the men present glances across the table to be sure of it -- would have been to take [Lilla]153-lilla also into [her]187-mrs. clephane confidence ; and it suddenly became clear to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane that no recoil of horror , and no Pharisaical disapproval , would be as intolerable to [her]187-mrs. clephane as [Lilla]153-lilla ’s careless stare and [Lilla]153-lilla ’s lazy : “[1175-he] Why , what on earth ’s all the fuss about ? Do n’t that sort of thing happen all the time ? ” It did , no doubt ; [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had already tried to adjust [her]187-mrs. clephane own mind to that . [She]187-mrs. clephane had known such cases ; [everybody]1566-everybody had ; [she]187-mrs. clephane had seen them smoothed over and lived down ; but that [she]187-mrs. clephane and [Anne]95-anne should ever figure as [one of [them]2704-the men present]1059-one of them was beyond human imagining . [She]187-mrs. clephane would have felt [herself]187-mrs. clephane befouled to the depths by [Lilla]153-lilla ’s tolerance . [Her]187-mrs. clephane unquiet eyes wandered from [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew to [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter . [Anne]95-anne shone with recovered joy .
