There was something so rich , dense and impregnable in the fact of possessing [Anne]95-anne ’s heart that [the mother]242-the mother could not remember to be alarmed when [their]2713-their eyes met . Suddenly [she]87-kate noticed that [Anne]95-anne was absorbed in conversation with [one of [[her]87-kate neighbours]2715-her neighbours]2714-one of her neighbours . This was [the Reverend Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow , [Rector of [St. Stephen ’s]71-st. stephen ’s]2716-rector of st. stephen ’s , [the New [York]72-york church of [the Clephane]87-kate and [Drover clan]2718-drover clan]2717-the new york church of the clephane and drover clan . [Old Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had been [a pillar of [St. Stephen]71-st. stephen ’s ’s]2719-a pillar of st. stephen ’s , and had bequeathed a handsome sum to [the parish]2720-the parish . [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow , formerly [the curate]2721-the curate , had come back a few years previously as [Rector of the church]2722-rector of the church , and was now regarded as one of the foremost lights of [the diocese]2723-the diocese , with a strong possibility of being named [its Coadjutor]2724-its coadjutor , or possibly [Bishop of [the American Episcopal Churches in [Europe]42-europe]73-the american episcopal churches in europe]2725-bishop of the american episcopal churches in europe . [The Drovers]146-the drovers and all [[their]146-the drovers tribe]2726-their tribe took [their]146-the drovers religion with moderation : [they]146-the drovers subscribed handsomely to parochial charities , [the older members of [the family]390-the family]2727-the older members of the family still went to [church]940-church on Sunday mornings , and once in the winter [each of [the family]390-the family]2730-each of the family invited [the Rector]430-the rector to a big dinner . But [their]146-the drovers relations with [him]430-the rector , though amicable , were purely formal , and [Kate]87-kate concluded that [his]430-the rector presence at one of the Drover week - ends was to be attributed to the prestige [he]430-the rector had acquired as [a certain Coadjutor]2733-a certain coadjutor or [possible Bishop]2734-possible bishop . The Drover social scheme was like a game of chess in which [Bishops]2735-bishops counted considerably more than [Rectors]2736-rectors . [The Rector of [St. Stephen]71-st. stephen ’s ’s]2737-the rector of st. stephen ’s struck [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , who had met [him]430-the rector only once before , as [a man accustomed to good company]2738-a man accustomed to good company , and eager to prove it . [He]430-the rector had a face as extensive as [Mr. Maclew]182-mr. maclew ’s but running to length instead of width . [His]430-the rector thin gray hair was carefully brushed back from a narrow benevolent forehead , and though [he]430-the rector loved a good cigar , and wore a pepper - and - salt suit on [his]430-the rector travels , [he]430-the rector knew [his]430-the rector value as a decorative element , and was fastidiously clerical on social occasions . [His]430-the rector manly chest seemed outspread to receive the pectoral cross , and all [his]430-the rector gestures were round and full , like the sleeves for which [they]2739-they were preparing . As [he]430-the rector leaned back , listening to [Anne]95-anne with lowered lids , and finger - tips thoughtfully laid against each other , [his]430-the rector occasional faint smile and murmur of assent suggested to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane that [the girl]562-the girl was discussing with [him]430-the rector the arrangements for the wedding ; and [the mother]242-the mother , laying down [her]242-the mother fork , closed [her]242-the mother eyes for an instant while the big resonant room reeled about [her]242-the mother . Then [she]242-the mother said to [herself]242-the mother that , after all , this was only what was to be expected , and that if [she]242-the mother had n’t the courage to face such a possibility , and many others like it , [she]242-the mother would assuredly never have the courage to carry out the plan which , all through the afternoon and evening , had been slowly forming in [her]242-the mother mind . That plan was simply , for the present , to hold fast to [Anne]95-anne , and let things follow [their]2739-they course . [She]242-the mother would return to [New York]5-new york the next day with [Anne]95-anne , [she]242-the mother would passively assist at [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter ’s preparations -- for an active share in them seemed beyond [her]242-the mother powers -- and [she]242-the mother would be [there]498-there when [Chris]88-chris came , and when [they]2739-they announced the engagement . Whatever happened , [she]242-the mother would be [there]498-there . [She]242-the mother would let [Chris]88-chris see at once that [he]88-chris would have to reckon with that . And how would [he]88-chris be able to reckon with it ? How could [he]88-chris stand it , day after day ? [They]2739-they would perhaps never exchange another word in private -- [she]242-the mother prayed [they]2739-they might not -- but [he]88-chris would understand by [her]242-the mother mere presence what [she]242-the mother meant , what [she]242-the mother was determined on . [He]88-chris would understand that in the end [he]88-chris would have to give up [Anne]95-anne because [she]242-the mother [herself]242-the mother would never do so . The struggle between [them]2739-they would become a definite , practical , circumscribed thing ; and , knowing [Chris]88-chris as [she]242-the mother did , [she]242-the mother felt almost sure [she]242-the mother could hold out longer than [he]88-chris . This new resolve gave [her]242-the mother a sort of light - headed self - confidence : when [she]242-the mother left the dinner - table [she]242-the mother felt so easy and careless that [she]242-the mother was surprised to see that the glass of champagne beside [her]242-the mother plate was untouched . [She]242-the mother felt as if all its sparkles were whirling through [her]242-the mother . On the return of [the gentlemen]2745-the gentlemen to [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow moved to [her]242-the mother side , and [she]242-the mother welcomed [him]224-dr. arklow with a smile . [He]224-dr. arklow opened with some mild generalities , and [she]242-the mother said to [herself]242-the mother that [he]224-dr. arklow was too anxiously observant of the social rules to speak of [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter ’s marriage before [she]242-the mother [herself]242-the mother alluded to it . For a few minutes [she]242-the mother strove to find a word which should provide [him]224-dr. arklow with an opening ; but to say to [any one]428-any one : “[0-i] [[My]0-i daughter]1455-my daughter is going to be married ” was beyond [her]242-the mother , and [they]2749-they lingered on among slumbrous platitudes . Suddenly [Anne]95-anne drifted up , sat down an on arm of [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s chair , and took [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s hand . [Kate]87-kate ’s eyes filled , and through [their]2749-they mist [she]87-kate fancied [she]87-kate saw [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow looking at [her]87-kate attentively . For the first time it occurred to [her]87-kate that , behind [the scrupulous social puppet]2752-the scrupulous social puppet , there might be [a simple - hearted man , familiar with the humble realities of pain and perplexity]2753-a simple - hearted man , familiar with the humble realities of pain and perplexity , and experienced in dealing with [them]2749-they . The thought gave [her]87-kate a sense of relief , and [she]87-kate said to [herself]87-kate : “[0-i] [I]0-i will try to speak to [him]1181-him alone . [I]0-i will go to see [him]1181-him when [we]1182-we get to [New York]5-new york . ” But meanwhile [she]87-kate merely continued to smile up at [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter , and [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow to say : “[1182-we] [[Our]1182-we young lady]1183-our young lady has been telling [me]0-i about the big tennis finals . There ’s no doubt all these sports are going to be a great factor in building up [a healthier , happier world]1184-a healthier , happier world . ” None of [the three]2755-the three made any allusion to [Anne]95-anne ’s engagement . XXII . “[95-anne] [Miss Anne Clephane]95-anne weds [War Hero]1185-war hero . Announces engagement to [Major Christopher Fenno]186-major fenno , [D.S.M.]57-the d.s.m. , [Chevalier of Legion of Honour]1186-chevalier of legion of honour . ” The headline glared at [Kate Clephane]87-kate from the first page of the paper [she]87-kate had absently picked up from the table of [[her]87-kate sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room . [She]87-kate and [Anne]95-anne , that morning , had journeyed back from [Long Island]54-long island in [[Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover ’s motor]2757-hendrik drover ’s motor , separated by [his]159-hendrik drover genial bulk , and shielded by it from the peril of private talk . On the day before -- that aching endless Sunday -- [Anne]95-anne , when with [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother , had steadily avoided the point at issue . [She]379-her mother seemed too happy in [their]2759-their reunion to risk disturbing its first hours ; perhaps , [Kate]87-kate thought , [she]87-kate was counting on the spell of that reunion to break down [[her]87-kate mother]379-her mother ’s opposition . But as [they]2759-their neared [New York]5-new york every mile brought [them]2759-their closer to the reality [they]2759-their were trying not to see ; and here it was at last , deriding [the mother]242-the mother from those hideous headlines . [She]87-kate heard [Anne]95-anne ’s step behind [her]87-kate , and [their]2759-their glance crossed above the paragraph . A flush rose to [the girl]562-the girl ’s cheek , while [her]562-the girl eyes hesitatingly questioned [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother . The decisive moment in [their]2759-their struggle was at hand . [Kate]87-kate felt that everything depended on [her]87-kate holding fast to the line [she]87-kate had resolved to follow , and [her]87-kate voice sounded thin and small in the effort to steady it . “[186-major fenno] Is [Major Fenno]186-major fenno in [New York]5-new york ? ” “[186-major fenno] No . [He]186-major fenno went back to [Baltimore]2-baltimore on Saturday . ” [Anne]95-anne wavered . “[186-major fenno] [He]186-major fenno ’s waiting to hear from [me]0-i ... before [he]186-major fenno comes . ” A hope leapt up in [the mother]242-the mother ’s breast , then sank its ineffectual wings . [She]87-kate glanced back slowly at the newspaper . “[186-major fenno] This announcement was made with [your]0-i permission ? ” The unwonted colour still burned in [the girl]562-the girl ’s cheek . [She]87-kate made a motion of assent , and added , after another pause : “[0-i] [Uncle Hendrik]151-hendrik and [Aunt Enid]145-enid drover thought it only fair . ” “[145-enid drover] Fair to [Major Fenno]186-major fenno ? ” “[186-major fenno] Yes . ” The silence prolonged itself . At length [the mother]242-the mother brought out : “[186-major fenno] But if [you]0-i ’ve announced [your]0-i engagement [he]186-major fenno has a right to be with [you]0-i . ” [Anne]95-anne looked at [her]0-i almost timidly . “[0-i] [I]0-i wanted first ... [we]1187-we both wanted ... to feel that when [he]186-major fenno came [you]0-i would ... would be ready to receive [him]186-major fenno . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate turned away from [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s eyes . The look in them was too intolerably sweet to [her]87-kate . [Anne]95-anne was imploring [her]95-anne approval -- [Anne]95-anne could not bear to be happy without it . Yes ; but [she]95-anne wanted [her]95-anne other happiness also ; [she]95-anne wanted that more than anything else ; [she]95-anne would not hesitate to sacrifice [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother to it if there were no other way . All this rushed over [Kate]87-kate in a final flash of illumination . “[0-i] [I]0-i want [you]0-i both ! ” [Anne]95-anne had said ; but [she]95-anne wanted [Chris Fenno]88-chris infinitely the more . “[0-i] [Dear--]1188-dear-- . ” At [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s first syllable [Anne]95-anne was at [her]87-kate side again , beseechingly . [Kate Clephane]87-kate lifted [her]87-kate hands to [the girl]562-the girl ’s shoulders . “[1188-dear--] [You]0-i ’ve made [your]0-i choice , [dearest]716-dearest . When [Major Fenno]186-major fenno comes of course [I]0-i will receive [him]186-major fenno . ” [Her]0-i lips felt dry and stiff as [she]0-i uttered [her]0-i prevarication . But all [her]0-i old arts of casuistry had come back ; what was the use of having practised them so long if they were not to serve [her]0-i now ? [She]0-i let [herself]0-i yield to [Anne]95-anne ’s embrace . * * * * * That afternoon , as [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane sat alone [upstairs]2312-upstairs , [Fred Landers]94-fred landers telephoned to ask if [she]187-mrs. clephane would receive [him]186-major fenno . [Anne]95-anne was out , and [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother sent word that when [Mr. Landers]133-mr. landers came [he]186-major fenno was to be shown up to [[her]379-her mother sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room . [He]186-major fenno entered [it]1715-her sitting - room , presently , with outstretched hands and a smile of satisfaction . “[0-i] Well , it ’s all settled , then ? Thank [God]195-god ! [You]1190-you ’ve done just the right thing ; [I]0-i knew [you]1190-you would . ” [Her]95-anne hand fell lifelessly into [his]186-major fenno ; [she]95-anne could not answer . [He]186-major fenno drew up an armchair to the little autumnal fire , and continued to contemplate [her]95-anne approvingly . “[0-i] [I]0-i know how hard it must have been . But there was only one thing to be considered : [Anne]95-anne needs [you]1190-you ! ” “[95-anne] [She]95-anne needs [Major Fenno]186-major fenno more . ” “[186-major fenno] Oh , well -- that ’s the law of life , is n’t it ? ” [His]186-major fenno tone seemed to say : “[186-major fenno] At any rate , it ’s the one [you]1190-you obeyed in [your]1190-you own youth . ” And again [she]95-anne found no answer . [She]95-anne was conscious that the gaze [he]186-major fenno still fixed on [her]95-anne had passed from benevolence to wistfulness . “[186-major fenno] Do [you]1190-you still mind it so awfully ? ” [His]186-major fenno question made [her]95-anne tears rise ; but [she]95-anne was determined not to return upon the past . [She]95-anne had proved the uselessness of the attempt . “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne has announced [her]95-anne engagement . What more is there to say ? [You]1190-you tell [me]0-i [she]95-anne needs [me]0-i ; well , here [I]0-i am with [her]95-anne . ” “[1190-you] And [you]1190-you do n’t know how [she]95-anne appreciates it . [She]95-anne rang [me]0-i up as soon as [you]1190-you got back this morning . [She]95-anne ’s overcome by [your]1190-you generosity in going down to [the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ after what had taken place between [you]1190-you -- after [her]95-anne putting [herself]95-anne so completely in the wrong . ” [He]1190-you paused again , as if weighing [his]1190-you next words . “[1190-you] [You]1190-you know [I]0-i ’m not any keener than [you]1190-you are about this marriage ; but , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear , [I]0-i believe it had to be . ” “[0-i] Had to be ? ” [His]1190-you capacious forehead crimsoned with the effort to explain . “[0-i] Well , [Anne]95-anne ’s [a young woman of considerable violence of feeling]1193-a young woman of considerable violence of feeling ... of ... of .... In short , there ’s no knowing what [she]95-anne might have ended by doing if [we]1194-we ’d all backed [you]1190-you up in opposing [her]95-anne . And [I]0-i confess [I]0-i did n’t feel sure enough of [the young man]2551-the young man to count on [his]2551-the young man not taking advantage of [her]95-anne ... [her]95-anne impetuosity , as it were , if [he]2551-the young man thought there was no other chance .... [You]1190-you understand ? ” [She]1477-my dear understood . What [he]1190-you was trying to say was that , on the whole , given [the girl]562-the girl ’s self - will , and taking into account [her]562-the girl ... well , [her]562-the girl peculiar heredity ... taking into account , in fact , [Kate Clephane]87-kate [herself]87-kate ... [the family]390-the family had probably adopted the safest course in accepting the situation . “[1190-you] Not that [I]0-i mean to imply -- of course not ! Only [the young people]1676-the young people nowadays settle most questions for [themselves]1676-the young people , do n’t [they]1676-the young people ? And in this case ... Well , all ’s well that ends well . [We]1197-we all know that some of the most successful marriages have had ... er ... rather risky preliminaries . ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat listening in a state of acquiescent lassitude . [She]87-kate felt as if [she]87-kate had been given a drug which had left [her]87-kate intelligence clear but paralyzed [her]87-kate will . What was the use of arguing , discussing , opposing ? Later , of course , if everything else failed , [Fred Landers]94-fred landers was after all the person [she]87-kate would have to turn to , to whom [her]87-kate avowal would have to be made ; but for the moment [he]94-fred landers was of no more use to [her]87-kate than any of [the others]523-the others . The game [she]87-kate had resolved to play must be played between [herself]87-kate and [Chris Fenno]88-chris ; everything else was the vainest expenditure of breath . “[0-i] [You]0-i _ do _ agree , do n’t [you]0-i ? ” [she]87-kate heard [Landers]94-fred landers rather nervously insisting ; and : “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i daresay [you]0-i ’re right , ” [she]87-kate assented . “[0-i] And the great thing , [you]0-i know , is that [Anne]95-anne should n’t lose [you]0-i , or [you]0-i lose [Anne]95-anne , because of this . All the rest will arrange itself somehow . Life generally does arrange things . And if it shouldn’t-- ” [He]94-fred landers stood up rather awkwardly , and [she]87-kate was aware of [his]94-fred landers advancing toward [her]87-kate . [His]94-fred landers face had grown long and solemn , and [his]94-fred landers broad bulk seemed to have narrowed to the proportions of [the lank youth]2777-the lank youth suffused with blushes who had taken shelter behind [[his]94-fred landers mother]707-his mother when [old Mrs. Landers]211-old mrs. landers had offered a bridal banquet to [the John Clephanes]158-the clephanes . “[1198-we] If it does n’t work out for [you]0-i as [we]1198-we hope ... there ’s [[my]0-i house]1199-my house ... that ’s been waiting for [you]0-i for ever so long ... though [I]0-i should n’t ever have ventured to suggest it .... ” “[1198-we] Oh-- ” [she]87-kate faltered out , the clutch of pain relaxing a little about [her]87-kate heart . “[1198-we] Well , well , ” [[her]87-kate visitor]676-her visitor stammered , rubbing [his]94-fred landers hands together deprecatingly , “[1198-we] [I]0-i only suggest it as a sort of last expedient ... a forlorn hope .... ” [His]94-fred landers nervous laugh tried to give the words a humorous turn , but [his]94-fred landers eyes were still grave . [Kate]87-kate rose and put [her]87-kate hand in [his]94-fred landers . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re awfully good to [me]0-i , ” was all [she]0-i found to say . Inwardly [she]0-i was thinking , with a fresh thrill of anguish : “[0-i] And now [I]0-i shall never be able to tell [him]1200-him -- never ! ” [He]94-fred landers had caught the note of dismissal in [her]0-i voice , and was trying to gather up the scattered fragments of [his]94-fred landers self - possession . “[0-i] Of course , at [our]1201-our age ... _ [my]0-i _ age , [I]0-i mean ... all that kind of thing is rather .... But there : [I]0-i did n’t want [you]0-i to feel there was no one [you]0-i could turn to . That ’s all . [You]0-i wo n’t bear [me]0-i a grudge , though ? Now then ; that ’s all right . And [you]0-i ’ll see : this other business will shake down in time . Bound to , [you]0-i know . [I]0-i daresay [the young man]2551-the young man has merits that [you]0-i and [I]0-i do n’t see . And [you]0-i ’ll let [me]0-i go on dropping in as usual ? After all , [I]0-i ’m [[Anne]95-anne ’s guardian]1203-anne ’s guardian ! ” [he]2551-the young man ended with [his]2551-the young man clumsy laugh . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall want [you]0-i more than ever , [Fred]94-fred landers , ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane said simply . * * * * * The next evening , as [she]187-mrs. clephane looked down the long dinner - table from [her]187-mrs. clephane seat at [its]2780-its head , [she]187-mrs. clephane was fantastically reminded of the first family dinner over which [she]187-mrs. clephane had presided after [her]187-mrs. clephane marriage . The background was the same ; the faces were the same , or so like that they seemed merely rejuvenated issues of the same coinage . [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover sat in [[[his]159-hendrik drover brother - in - law]2781-his brother - in - law ’s place]2782-his brother - in - law ’s place ; but even that change was not marked enough to disturb the illusion . [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover ’s heavy good - natured face belonged to the same type as [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s ; [one]247-one saw that [the two]573-the two had gone to [the same schools]2785-the same schools and [the same University]2786-the same university , frequented [the same clubs]2787-the same clubs , fished [the same salmon rivers]2788-the same salmon rivers ; [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover might have been the ghost of [John Clephane]96-john clephane revisiting the scene of [his]96-john clephane earthly trials in a mood softened by celestial influences . And as for [herself]187-mrs. clephane -- [Kate Clephane]87-kate -- if [she]187-mrs. clephane had conformed to the plan of life prepared for [her]187-mrs. clephane , instead of turning from it and denying it , might [she]187-mrs. clephane not reasonably have hoped to reappear on the scene in the form of [Enid Drover]145-enid drover ? These grotesque fancies had begun to weave their spirals through [her]187-mrs. clephane brain only after a first impact had emptied it of everything else , swept it suddenly clear of all meaning and all reason . That moment had come when [Chris Fenno]88-chris had entered in the wake of [the other guests]1890-the other guests ; when [she]187-mrs. clephane had heard [his]88-chris name announced like that of [any other member of [the family]390-the family]2790-any other member of the family ; had seen [him]88-chris advance across the interminable length of [the room]325-the room , all the lights in [it]325-the room converging upon [him]88-chris as [she]187-mrs. clephane felt that all the eyes in it converged on [her]187-mrs. clephane ; when [she]187-mrs. clephane had seen [Anne]95-anne at [his]88-chris side , felt [her]95-anne presence between [them]2793-they , heard [the girl]562-the girl ’s voice , imperious , beseeching : “[185-mother] [Mother]185-mother -- here ’s [Chris]88-chris , ” and felt [her]187-mrs. clephane hand drop into that other hand with the awful plunge that the heart makes when a sudden shock flings it from its seat . [She]187-mrs. clephane had lived through all that ; [she]187-mrs. clephane and [he]88-chris had faced [each other]496-each other ; had exchanged greetings , [she]187-mrs. clephane supposed ; had even , perhaps , said something to [each other]496-each other about [Anne]95-anne , and about [their]2793-they future relation . [She]187-mrs. clephane did not know what ; [she]187-mrs. clephane judged only , from the undisturbed faces about [them]2793-they , that there had been nothing alarming , nothing to scandalize or grieve ; that it had all , to the tribal eye , passed off decently and what [they]2793-they called “[88-chris] suitably ” . [Her]187-mrs. clephane past training had served [her]187-mrs. clephane -- [his]88-chris boundless assurance had served [him]88-chris . It was what [the French]226-the french called “[185-mother] a moment to pass ” ; [they]2793-they had passed it . And in [that mad world beyond the abyss]2797-that mad world beyond the abyss , where [she]187-mrs. clephane now found [herself]187-mrs. clephane , here [they]2793-they all were with the old faces , saying the same old things with the same old complacency , eating [their]2793-they way through the same Clephane courses , expressing the same approval of [the Clephane cellar]2798-the clephane cellar ( “[88-chris] It was [Hendrik]159-hendrik drover , [you]1204-you know , who advised [John]96-john clephane to lay down that ninety - five Clicquot , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane caught [Enid Drover]145-enid drover breathing across the bubbles to [[her]145-enid drover son - in - law]2799-her son - in - law ) . It was all , in short , as natural and unnatural , as horrible , intolerable and unescapable , as if [she]187-mrs. clephane had become young again , with all [her]187-mrs. clephane desolate and unavoidable life stretching away ahead of [her]187-mrs. clephane to -- this . And , in the mad phantasmagoria , there was [Chris]88-chris [himself]88-chris , symbolizing what [she]187-mrs. clephane had flown to in [her]187-mrs. clephane wild escape ; representing , in some horrible duality , at once [her]187-mrs. clephane sin and its harvest , [her]187-mrs. clephane flight and [her]187-mrs. clephane return . At the thought , [her]187-mrs. clephane brain began to spin again , and [she]187-mrs. clephane saw [her]187-mrs. clephane own youth embodied before [her]187-mrs. clephane in [Anne]95-anne , with [Anne]95-anne ’s uncompromising scorns and scruples , [Anne]95-anne ’s confident forward - looking gaze . “[159-hendrik drover] Ah , well , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane heard [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover say as [they]1206-they rose from the table , “[159-hendrik drover] these occasions will come round from time to time in [the best - regulated families]1205-the best - regulated families , and [I]0-i suppose [we]1206-they all feel-- ” while , at the other side of the table , [Enid Drover]145-enid drover , pink and melting from a last libation , sighed to [Horace Maclew]181-horace maclew : “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish [dear mother]1207-dear mother and [John]96-john clephane could have been here with [us]1206-they ! ” and [Lilla]153-lilla , overhearing [her]187-mrs. clephane , bracketed the observation in an ironic laugh . It had all gone off wonderfully ; thanks to [Anne]95-anne ’s tact the meeting between [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother and [[her]95-anne betrothed]2205-her betrothed had been thickly swaddled in layer on layer of [non - conducting , non - explosive “[96-john clephane] family ”]2802-non - conducting , non - explosive “ family ” . A sense of mutual congratulation was in the air as [the groups]1865-the groups formed [themselves]1865-the groups again in [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room . [The girl]562-the girl [herself]562-the girl moved from one to another , pale , vigilant , radiant ; [Chris Fenno]88-chris , in a distant corner , was settled with coffee - cup and cigarette at [Lilla Maclew]218-lilla maclew ’s side ; [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane found [herself]187-mrs. clephane barricaded behind [Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover and [one of [the older Tresseltons]2807-the older tresseltons]2806-one of the older tresseltons . [They]2808-they were [the very two men]2809-the very two men , [she]187-mrs. clephane remembered , between whom [she]187-mrs. clephane had spent [her]187-mrs. clephane evening after that first family dinner in which [this one]2810-this one was so hallucinatingly merged . Not until the party was breaking up , and farewells filled [the hall]2619-the hall , did [she]187-mrs. clephane suddenly find [herself]187-mrs. clephane -- [she]187-mrs. clephane knew not how -- isolated in [the inner drawing - room]2812-the inner drawing - room with [Chris Fenno]88-chris . [He]88-chris stood there before [her]187-mrs. clephane , and [she]187-mrs. clephane seemed to hear [his]88-chris voice for the first time . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to thank [you]1208-you .... ” [He]88-chris appeared to feel it was a bad beginning , and tried again . “[0-i] Sha n’t [I]0-i have the chance , some day soon , of finding [you]1208-you -- for a word or two , quietly ? ” [he]88-chris asked . [She]187-mrs. clephane faced [him]88-chris , erect and unflinching ; [she]187-mrs. clephane dragged [her]187-mrs. clephane eyes up to [his]88-chris . “[0-i] A chance ? But as soon as [you]0-i like -- as many chances as [you]0-i like ! [You]0-i ’ll always find [me]0-i -- [I]0-i shall always be [here]735-here . [I]0-i ’m never going to leave [Anne]95-anne , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane announced . It had been almost worth the agony [she]187-mrs. clephane had bought it with to see the look in [his]88-chris eyes when [he]88-chris heard that . XXIII . Extreme exhaustion -- the sense of having reached the last limit of endurable emotion -- plunged [Kate Clephane]87-kate , that night , into a dreamless sleep . It was months and months since [she]87-kate had reached those nethermost levels below sound or image or any mental movement ; and [she]87-kate rose from [them]2813-them revived , renewed -- and then suddenly understood that [they]2813-them had been only a grief - drugged mockery . The return to reality was as painful as that of [a traveller who has fallen asleep in the snow]2814-a traveller who has fallen asleep in the snow . One by one [she]87-kate had to readjust all [her]87-kate frozen faculties to the unchanged and intolerable situation ; and [she]87-kate felt weaker , less able to contend with it . The thought that that very day [she]87-kate might have to face [Chris Fenno]88-chris paralyzed [her]87-kate . [He]88-chris had asked to see [her]187-mrs. clephane alone -- and [she]187-mrs. clephane lay there , in the desolate dawn , rehearsing to [herself]187-mrs. clephane all the cruel things [he]88-chris would find to say ; for [his]88-chris ways of being cruel were innumerable . The day before [she]187-mrs. clephane had felt almost light - heartedly confident of being able to outface , to outlast [him]88-chris ; of [her]187-mrs. clephane power of making the situation even more intolerable to [him]88-chris than [he]88-chris could make it to [her]187-mrs. clephane . Now , in the merciless morning light , [she]187-mrs. clephane had a new view of [their]2815-their respective situations . Who had suffered most the previous evening , [he]88-chris or [she]2816-she ? Whose wakening that morning was most oppressed by fears ? [He]88-chris had proposed to have a talk with [her]187-mrs. clephane ; [he]88-chris had had the courage to do that ; and [she]187-mrs. clephane felt that by having that courage [he]88-chris had already gained another point in [their]2815-their silent struggle . Slowly the days dragged by ; [their]2815-their hours were filled , for [mother]1508-mother and [daughter]1843-daughter , by the crowding obligations and preoccupations natural to such times . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane was helping [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter with the wedding preparations ; a spectacle to charm and edify [the rest of [the family]390-the family]2820-the rest of the family . [Chris Fenno]88-chris , two or three days after the announcement of the engagement , had returned to [Baltimore]2-baltimore , where [he]88-chris had accepted a temporary job on a newspaper , and where [he]88-chris had that , and other matters , to wind up before [his]88-chris marriage . During [his]88-chris stay in [New York]5-new york , [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had had but two or three brief glimpses of [him]88-chris , and always in the presence of [others]1827-others . It was natural that [he]88-chris should wish to devote the greater part of [his]88-chris time to [[his]88-chris betrothed]2823-his betrothed . [He]88-chris and [Anne]95-anne went off in the early afternoon , and when [they]2824-they returned were , on each evening , engaged to dine with [some member of [the family]390-the family]2825-some member of the family . It was easy for [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane to excuse [herself]187-mrs. clephane from these entertainments . The fact of [her]187-mrs. clephane having presided at the dinner at which the engagement was announced had sealed it with [her]187-mrs. clephane approval ; and at the little dinners organized by [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie and [the other cousins]2827-the other cousins [her]187-mrs. clephane presence was hardly expected , and readily dispensed with . All this fitted in with the new times . The old days of introspections and explanations were over ; the era of taking things for granted was the only one that [[Anne]95-anne ’s generation]2828-anne ’s generation knew , and in that respect [Anne]95-anne was of [her]95-anne day . After the betrothal dinner [she]95-anne had said a tender goodnight to [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother , and the next evening , as [she]95-anne rushed up to dress after [her]95-anne long outing with [Chris]88-chris , had stopped at [Kate]87-kate ’s door to wave a loving hand and call out : “[0-i] [He]1210-he says [you]1211-you ’ve been so perfect to [him--]1212-him-- ” That was all . [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s own memories told [her]87-kate that to some natures happiness comes like a huge landslide burying all the past and spreading a fresh surface to life ’s sowings : and it was from [herself]87-kate , [she]87-kate reflected , that [Anne]95-anne had inherited [her]95-anne capacity for such all - obliterating bliss . The days passed , and [Chris Fenno]88-chris at length came back . [He]88-chris was staying with [the Joe Tresseltons]143-the tresseltons , and there was a constant coming and going of [the young people]1676-the young people between [the two houses]1165-the two houses . Opportunities were not lacking to see [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane in private , and for the first days after [his]88-chris return [she]87-kate waited in numb terror for the inevitable , the incalculable moment . But it did not come ; and gradually [she]87-kate understood that it never would . [His]88-chris little speech had been a mere formula ; [he]88-chris had nothing to say to [her]87-kate ; no desire was farther from [him]88-chris than the wish to speak with [her]87-kate alone . What [she]87-kate had dreaded past expression , but supposed to be inevitable , [he]88-chris had probably never even seriously considered . Explanations ? What was the use of explanations ? [He]88-chris had gained [his]88-chris point ; the thing now was to live at peace with [everybody]1566-everybody . [She]87-kate saw that all [her]87-kate calculations had been mistaken . [She]87-kate had fancied that [her]87-kate tactics would render [his]88-chris situation intolerable ; that if only [she]87-kate could bear to spend a few weeks in [his]88-chris presence [she]87-kate would demonstrate to [him]88-chris the impossibility of [his]88-chris spending the rest of [his]88-chris life in [hers]87-kate . But [his]88-chris reasoning reached a good deal farther , and embraced certain essential elements in human nature that [hers]87-kate had left out . [He]88-chris had said to [himself]88-chris -- [she]87-kate was sure of it now-- : “[1210-he] The next few weeks will be pretty bad , but after that [I]0-i ’ll have the upper hand . ” [He]88-chris had only to hold out till the wedding ; after that [she]87-kate would be [a mere mother - in - law]2833-a mere mother - in - law , and [mothers - in - law]2834-mothers - in - law are not a serious problem in modern life . How could [she]87-kate ever have imagined that [he]88-chris would not see through [her]87-kate game and out - manœuvre [her]87-kate , when [he]88-chris had done it so often before , and when [his]88-chris whole future depended on [his]88-chris doing it just once more ? [She]87-kate felt [herself]87-kate beaten at every point . Unless -- unless [she]87-kate told the truth to [Anne]95-anne . Every day was making that impossible thing more impossible ; yet every day was bringing [them]2835-them nearer to the day when not to do so -- if all other measures failed -- would be most impossible of all . [She]87-kate seemed to have reached that moment when , one morning , [Anne]95-anne came into [[her]87-kate room]1999-her room and caught [her]87-kate by the hand . “[716-dearest] [Dearest]716-dearest -- [you’ve]716-dearest got to come with [me]0-i this very minute . ” [Kate]87-kate , yielding to [the girl]562-the girl ’s hand , was drawn along [the corridor]2018-the corridor to [[her]87-kate bedroom]1762-her bedroom . There , on the bed , in a dazzle of whiteness , lay the wedding - dress . “[716-dearest] Will [you]716-dearest help [me]0-i to try it on ? ” [Anne]95-anne asked . * * * * * [Kate Clephane]87-kate rang the Rectory bell and found [herself]87-kate in [the Rectory sitting - room]2840-the rectory sitting - room . As [she]87-kate sat there , among photogravures of [Botticelli]227-botticelli Virgins and etchings of [English cathedrals]2841-english cathedrals , [she]87-kate could not immediately remember why [she]87-kate had come , and looked with a kind of detached curiosity at the volumes of memoirs and sermons on the table at [her]87-kate elbow , at the perpendicular Gothic chairs against the wall , and the Morris armchairs which had superseded [them]2842-them . [She]87-kate had not been in [a rectory sitting - room]2843-a rectory sitting - room since the committee meeting at [the Merrimans ’]2844-the merrimans ’ , on the day when [she]87-kate had received [Anne]95-anne ’s cable . [Her]87-kate lapse of memory lasted only for a few seconds , but during that time [she]87-kate relived with intensity the sensations of that other day , [she]87-kate felt [her]87-kate happy heart dancing against the message folded under [her]87-kate dress , [she]87-kate saw the southern sun gilding the dull faces about the table , and smelt the violets and mimosa in [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman ’s vases . [She]87-kate woke again to the present just as [an austere parlour - maid]2845-an austere parlour - maid was requesting [her]87-kate to step this way . [[Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow ’s study]2846-dr. arklow ’s study was full of books , of signed photographs of [Church dignitaries]2847-church dignitaries , of [more English cathedrals]2848-more english cathedrals , of worn leather armchairs and scattered pipes and tobacco - pouches . [The Rector]430-the rector [himself]430-the rector , on the hearth , loomed before [her]87-kate at once bland and formidable . [He]430-the rector had guessed , of course , that [she]87-kate had come to talk about the date and hour of the wedding , and all the formulas incidental to such visits fell from [his]430-the rector large benevolent lips . The visit really passed off more easily than [she]87-kate had expected , and [she]87-kate was on [her]87-kate feet again and feeling [him]430-the rector behind [her]87-kate like a gentle trade - wind accustomed to waft a succession of [visitors]2850-visitors to the door , when [she]87-kate stopped abruptly and faced [him]430-the rector . “[716-dearest] [Dr. Arklow--]228-dr. arklow-- ” [He]430-the rector waited benevolently . “[716-dearest] There ’s something else -- a case [I]0-i ’ve always wanted to put to [you]228-dr. arklow-- .... ” “[187-mrs. clephane] [Dear Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane -- do put it now . ” [He]430-the rector was waving [her]87-kate back into [her]87-kate armchair ; but [she]87-kate stood before [him]430-the rector , unconscious of the gesture . “[187-mrs. clephane] It ’s about [a friend of mine--]1214-a friend of mine-- ” “[1214-a friend of mine--] Yes : [a friend]843-a friend ? [Do]229-do sit down . ” [She]87-kate sat down , still unaware of [her]87-kate movements or [his]430-the rector . “[229-do] [A most unhappy woman]1216-a most unhappy woman .... [I]0-i told [her]1216-a most unhappy woman [I]0-i would ask ... ask what could be done .... [She]1216-a most unhappy woman had an idea that [you]228-dr. arklow-- could tell [her]1216-a most unhappy woman .... ” [He]430-the rector bowed expectantly . [Her]87-kate parched lips brought out : “[1216-a most unhappy woman] Of course it ’s confidential , ” and [his]430-the rector gesture replied that communications , in [that room]2851-that room , were always held to be so . “[1216-a most unhappy woman] Whatever [I]0-i can do-- ” [he]430-the rector added . “[1217-my friend] Yes . [[My]0-i friend]1217-my friend thought -- [her]1216-a most unhappy woman position is really desperate . ” [She]87-kate stopped , [her]87-kate voice failing [her]87-kate ; then the words came forth in panting jerks . “[1216-a most unhappy woman] [She]1216-a most unhappy woman was most unhappily married ... things went against [her]1216-a most unhappy woman -- everything did . [She]1216-a most unhappy woman tried ... tried [her]1216-a most unhappy woman best .... Then [she]1216-a most unhappy woman met [him]1218-he ... it was too difficult .... [He]1218-he was [[her]1216-a most unhappy woman lover]1219-her lover ; only for a short time . After that [her]1216-a most unhappy woman life was perfectly ... was all it should be . [She]1216-a most unhappy woman never saw [him]1218-he -- oh , for years . Now [[her]1216-a most unhappy woman daughter]306-her daughter wants to marry [him]1218-he .... ” “[1221-the same man] Marry [him]1218-he ? _ [The same man]1221-the same man ? _ ” [The Rector]430-the rector ’s voice swelled above [her]1216-a most unhappy woman like a wave ; [his]1218-he presence towered , blurred and gigantic . [She]1216-a most unhappy woman felt the tears in [her]1216-a most unhappy woman throat ; but again [she]1216-a most unhappy woman was seized by the besetting desire that [her]1216-a most unhappy woman secret should not be guessed , and a desperate effort at self - control drove the tears back and cleared [her]1216-a most unhappy woman voice . [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow still loomed and brooded . “[1221-the same man] And [the man--]1222-the man-- ” A slow flush of agony rose to [her]1216-a most unhappy woman forehead ; but [she]1216-a most unhappy woman remembered that [she]1216-a most unhappy woman was seated with [her]1216-a most unhappy woman back to the light , and took courage . “[1218-he] [He]1218-he -- [he]1218-he is determined . ” [She]1216-a most unhappy woman paused , and then went on : “[1218-he] It ’s too horrible . But at first [he]1218-he did n’t know ... when [he]1218-he first met [the girl]562-the girl . [Neither of [them]1225-them]1224-neither of them knew . And when [he]1218-he found out-- ” “[1218-he] Yes ? ” “[1218-he] Then -- it was too late , [he]1218-he said . [The girl]562-the girl does n’t know even now ; [she]562-the girl does n’t dream ; and [she]562-the girl ’s grown to care -- care desperately . ” “[562-the girl] That ’s [his]1218-he defence ? ” [Her]1216-a most unhappy woman voice failed [her]1216-a most unhappy woman again , and [she]1216-a most unhappy woman signed [her]1216-a most unhappy woman assent . There was another long pause . [She]1216-a most unhappy woman sat motionless , looking down at [her]1216-a most unhappy woman own interlocked hands . [She]1216-a most unhappy woman felt that [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow was uneasily pacing the hearth - rug ; at last [she]1216-a most unhappy woman was aware that [he]224-dr. arklow was once more standing before [her]1216-a most unhappy woman . “[562-the girl] [The lady [you]1218-he speak of]1227-the lady you speak of -- [[your]1218-he friend]1228-your friend -- is [she]1227-the lady you speak of [here]735-here ? ” [She]1216-a most unhappy woman started . “[1227-the lady you speak of] _ Here ? _ ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] In [New York]5-new york , [I]0-i mean ? ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] No ; no ; [she]1227-the lady you speak of ’s not [here]735-here , ” [Kate]87-kate cried precipitately . “[1227-the lady you speak of] That ’s the reason why [I]0-i offered to come-- ” “[0-i] [I]0-i see . ” [She]87-kate thought [she]87-kate caught a faint note of relief in [his]1218-he voice . “[0-i] [She]1227-the lady you speak of wished [you]1218-he to consult [me]0-i ? ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] Yes . ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] And [she]1227-the lady you speak of ’s done everything -- everything , of course , to stop this abomination ? ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] Oh , everything ... everything . ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] Except to tell [[her]1227-the lady you speak of daughter]306-her daughter ? ” [She]87-kate made another sign of assent . [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow cleared [his]1218-he throat , and declared with emphasis : “[1227-the lady you speak of] It is [her]1227-the lady you speak of duty to tell [[her]1227-the lady you speak of daughter]306-her daughter . ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] Yes , ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate faltered . [She]87-kate got to [her]87-kate feet and looked about [her]87-kate blindly for the door . “[1227-the lady you speak of] [She]1227-the lady you speak of must tell [[her]1227-the lady you speak of daughter]306-her daughter , ” [the Rector]430-the rector repeated with rising vehemence . “[1227-the lady you speak of] Such a shocking situation must be avoided ; avoided at all costs . ” “[1227-the lady you speak of] Yes , ” [she]87-kate repeated . [She]87-kate was on the threshold now ; automatically [she]87-kate held out [her]87-kate hand . “[1227-the lady you speak of] Unless , ” [the Rector]430-the rector continued uncertainly , [his]430-the rector eyes upon [her]87-kate , “[1227-the lady you speak of] [she]1227-the lady you speak of is absolutely convinced that less harm will come to all concerned if [she]1227-the lady you speak of has the courage to keep silence -- always . ” There was a pause . “[1227-the lady you speak of] As far as [I]0-i can see into the blackness of it , ” [he]430-the rector went on , gaining firmness , “[1227-the lady you speak of] the whole problem turns on that . [I]0-i may be mistaken ; perhaps [I]0-i am . But when [a man]2087-a man has looked for thirty or forty years into pretty nearly every phase of human suffering and error , as [men of [my]0-i cloth]1235-men of my cloth have to do , [he]2087-a man comes to see that there must be adjustments ... adjustments in the balance of evil . Compromises , [politicians]1236-politicians would call [them]1237-them . Well , [I]0-i ’m not afraid of the word . ” [He]430-the rector stood leaning against the jamb of the door ; [her]87-kate hand was on the doorknob , and [she]87-kate listened with lowered head . “[0-i] The thing in [the world]1483-the world [I]0-i ’m most afraid of is sterile pain , ” [he]430-the rector said after a moment . “[0-i] [I]0-i should never want [any one]428-any one to be the cause of that . ” [She]87-kate lifted [her]87-kate eyes with an effort , and saw in [his]430-the rector face the same look of understanding [she]87-kate had caught there for a moment while [she]87-kate talked with [him]430-the rector at [the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ after dinner . “[0-i] Sterile pain-- ” [she]87-kate murmured . [She]87-kate had crossed the threshold now ; [she]87-kate felt that [he]430-the rector was holding out [his]430-the rector hand . [His]430-the rector face once more wore the expression of worldly benevolence that was as much the badge of [his]430-the rector profession as [his]430-the rector dress . After all , [she]87-kate perceived , [he]430-the rector was glad that [she]87-kate had said nothing more definite , glad that [their]2856-their talk was safely over . Yet [she]87-kate had caught that other look . “[0-i] If [[your]1240-you friend]1228-your friend were [here]735-here ; if there were anything [I]0-i could do for [her]1228-your friend , or say to [her]1228-your friend -- anything to help-- ” “[1228-your friend] Oh , [she]1228-your friend ’s not [here]735-here ; [she]1228-your friend wo n’t be here , ” [Kate]87-kate repeated . “[1228-your friend] In that case-- ” Again [she]87-kate caught the relief in [his]430-the rector voice . “[0-i] But [I]0-i will tell [her]1228-your friend -- tell [her]1228-your friend what [you]1240-you ’ve said . ” [She]87-kate was aware that [they]1244-they were shaking hands , and that [he]430-the rector was averting [his]430-the rector apprehensive eyes from [hers]87-kate . “[0-i] For God ’s sake , ” the eyes seemed to entreat [her]87-kate , “[0-i] let [’s]1244-they get through with this before [you]1240-you betray [yourself]1240-you -- if there ’s anything further to betray . ” At the front door [he]430-the rector bowed [her]87-kate out , repeating cordially : “[1244-they] And about a date for [Anne]95-anne ’s wedding as soon as [you]1240-you and [she]95-anne are absolutely decided , remember [I]0-i ’m completely at [your]1240-you service . ” The door closed , and [she]87-kate found [herself]87-kate in [the street]637-the street . XXIV . [She]87-kate turned away from [the Rectory]501-the rectory and walked aimlessly up [Madison Avenue]76-madison avenue . It was a warm summer - coloured October day . At [Fifty - ninth Street]2859-fifty - ninth street [she]87-kate turned into [the Park]1931-the park and wandered on over the yellowing leaf - drifts of the ramble . In just such a state of blind bewilderment [she]87-kate had followed those paths on the day when [she]87-kate had first caught sight of [Chris Fenno]88-chris and [Lilla Gates]153-lilla in the twilight ahead of [her]87-kate . That was less than a year ago , and [she]87-kate looked back with amazement at the effect which that chance encounter had had on [her]87-kate . [She]87-kate seemed hardly to be suffering more now than [she]87-kate had suffered then . It had seemed unbearable , impossible , at the moment , that [Chris Fenno]88-chris should enter , even so episodically , so remotely , into [her]87-kate new life ; and here [he]88-chris was , ensconced in its very centre , in complete possession of it . [She]87-kate tried to think the situation out ; but , as always , [her]87-kate trembling thoughts recoiled , just as [she]87-kate had seen [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow ’s recoil . Every one to whom [she]87-kate had tried to communicate [her]87-kate secret without betraying it had had the same instantaneous revulsion . “[0-i] Not that -- don’t tell [me]0-i that ! ” [their]2861-their averted eyes , [their]2861-their shrinking voices seemed to say . It was too horrible for any ears . How then was [she]87-kate to obey [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow ’s bidding and impart the secret to [Anne]95-anne ? [He]224-dr. arklow had said it as positively as if [he]224-dr. arklow were handing down a commandment from [Sinai]230-sinai : “[2467-the daughter] [The daughter]2467-the daughter must be told . ” How easy to lay down abstract rules for [other people]691-other people ’s guidance : “[2467-the daughter] [The daughter]2467-the daughter ” was just [an imaginary person]2863-an imaginary person -- a convenient conversational pawn . But [[Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s daughter]2864-kate clephane ’s daughter -- [her]87-kate own [Anne]95-anne ! [She]87-kate closed [her]87-kate eyes and tried to face the look in [Anne]95-anne ’s as the truth dawned on [her]87-kate . “[1247-you] [You--_you]1247-you _ , [mother]1508-mother ? [The mother]242-the mother [I]0-i ’ve come to adore -- [the mother]242-the mother [I]0-i ca n’t live without , even with all [my]0-i other happiness ? _ [You]1247-you ? _ ” Yes -- perhaps that would be the worst of it , the way [Anne]95-anne would look at [her]87-kate and say “[1247-you] _ [You]1247-you ? _ ” For , once [the girl]562-the girl knew the truth , [[her]562-the girl healthy youth]2866-her healthy youth might so revolt from [Chris]88-chris ’s baseness , [Chris]88-chris ’s duplicity , that the shock of the discovery would be its own cure . But when the blow had fallen , when [Anne]95-anne ’s life had crashed about [her]95-anne , and the ruins been cleared away -- what then of [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother ? Why , [[her]562-the girl mother]379-her mother would be buried under those ruins ; [her]562-the girl life would be over ; but a hideous indestructible image of [her]379-her mother would remain , overshadowing , darkening [the daughter]2467-the daughter ’s future . “[1247-you] [This man [you]1247-you are going to marry]1251-this man you are going to marry has-- ” No ; [Kate Clephane]87-kate could go no farther than that . Such confessions were not to be made ; were not for [a daughter]950-a daughter ’s ears . [She]562-the girl began the phrase to [herself]562-the girl again and again , but could not end it .... And , after all , [she]562-the girl suddenly thought , [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow [himself]224-dr. arklow , having given the injunction , had at once qualified , had virtually withdrawn it . In declaring that such an abomination must at all costs be prevented [he]224-dr. arklow had spoken with the firmness of [a priest]2871-a priest ; but almost at once [the man]2069-the man had intervened , and had suggested to [the hypothetical mother]2873-the hypothetical mother the alternative of not speaking at all , if only [she]2873-the hypothetical mother could be sure of never betraying [herself]2873-the hypothetical mother in the future , of sacrificing everything to the supreme object of avoiding what [he]224-dr. arklow called sterile pain . Those tentative , half - apologetic words now effaced the others in [Kate]87-kate ’s mind . Though spoken with the accent of authority -- and almost under [his]224-dr. arklow breath -- [she]87-kate knew they represented what [he]224-dr. arklow really felt . But where should [she]87-kate find the courage to conform to [them]2874-them ? [She]87-kate had left [the Park]1931-the park , aimlessly , unseeingly , and was walking eastward through [a half - built street in the upper Nineties]2876-a half - built street in the upper nineties . The thought of returning [home]246-home -- re - entering [that house]2595-that house where the white dress still lay on the bed -- was unbearable . [She]87-kate walked on and on .... Suddenly [she]87-kate came upon [an ugly sandstone church - front with a cross above the doorway]2879-an ugly sandstone church - front with a cross above the doorway . The leathern swing - doors were flapping back and forth , [women passing in and out]2880-women passing in and out . [Kate Clephane]87-kate pushed open one of the doors and looked in . The day was fading , and in the dusky interior lights fluttered like butterflies about the paper flowers of the altar . There was no service , but praying figures were scattered here and there . Against the brown - washed walls of [the aisles]2881-the aisles [she]87-kate observed a row of [confessionals of varnished wood]2882-confessionals of varnished wood , like cigar - boxes set on end ; before one or two , [women]463-women were expectantly kneeling . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane wondered what [they]2874-them had to tell . Leaning against [one of the piers of [the nave]2885-the nave]2884-one of the piers of the nave [she]87-kate evoked all those imaginary confessions , and thought how trivial , how childish they would seem , compared to what [she]87-kate carried in [her]87-kate breast .... What a help it must be to turn to [somebody who could tell one firmly , positively what to do]2886-somebody who could tell one firmly , positively what to do -- to be able to lay down one ’s moral torture like a heavy load at the end of the day ! [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow had none of the authority which the habit of the confessional must give . [He]224-dr. arklow could only vaguely sympathize and deplore , and try to shuffle the horror out of sight as soon as [he]224-dr. arklow caught an unwilling glimpse of it . But [these men whose office it was to bind and to unbind]2887-these men whose office it was to bind and to unbind -- who spoke as the mere impersonal mouth - pieces of [a mighty Arbitrator]2888-a mighty arbitrator , letting neither moral repugnance nor false delicacy interfere with the sacred task of alleviation and purification -- how different must [they]2887-these men whose office it was to bind and to unbind be ! [Her]87-kate eyes filled at the thought of laying [her]87-kate burden in such hands . And why not ? Why not entrust [her]87-kate anonymous secret to one of [those anonymous ears]2889-those anonymous ears ? In talking to [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow [she]87-kate had felt that both [he]224-dr. arklow and [she]87-kate were paralyzed by the personal relation , and all the embarrassments and complications arising from it . When [she]87-kate spoke of [[her]87-kate friend]2890-her friend in distress , and [he]224-dr. arklow replied with the same evasive formula , both were conscious of the evasion , and hampered by it . And so it had been from the first -- there was not an ear into which [she]87-kate dared pour [her]87-kate agony . What if , now , at once , [she]87-kate were to join [those unknown penitents]2891-those unknown penitents ? It was possible , [she]87-kate knew -- [she]87-kate had but a step to take .... [She]87-kate did not take it . [Her]87-kate unrest drove [her]87-kate forth again into [the darkening street]2892-the darkening street , drove [her]87-kate homeward with uncertain steps , in the mood of forlorn expectancy of those who , having failed to exert [their]2891-those unknown penitents will , wait helplessly on the unforeseen . After all , how could [one]247-one tell ? [Chris]88-chris must , in [his]88-chris own degree , be suffering as [she]87-kate was suffering . Why not stick to [her]87-kate old plan of waiting , holding on , enduring everything , in the hope of wearing [him]88-chris out ? [She]87-kate reached the door of [[her]87-kate house]588-her house , set [her]87-kate teeth , and went in . Overhead , [she]87-kate remembered with a shudder , the white dress waited , with all that it implied .... [The drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room was empty , and [she]87-kate went up to [[her]87-kate own room]2025-her own room . There , as usual , the fire shone invitingly , fresh flowers opened in the lamplight . All was warmth , peace , intimacy . As [she]87-kate sat down by the fireside [she]87-kate seemed to see [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ’s heavy figure in the opposite armchair , [his]88-chris sturdy square - toed boots turned to the hearth . [She]87-kate remembered how , one day , as [he]88-chris sat there , [she]87-kate had said to [herself]87-kate that it might be pleasant to see [him]88-chris [there]498-there always . Now , in the extremity of [her]87-kate loneliness , the thought returned . Since then [he]88-chris had confessed [his]88-chris own hope to [her]87-kate -- shyly , obliquely , apologetically ; but under [his]88-chris stammering words [she]87-kate had recognized the echo of a long desire . [She]87-kate knew [he]88-chris had always loved [her]87-kate ; had not [Anne]95-anne betrayed that it was [[her]87-kate guardian]572-her guardian who had persuaded [her]87-kate to recall [[her]87-kate unknown mother]2899-her unknown mother ? [Kate Clephane]87-kate owed [him]88-chris everything , then -- all [her]87-kate happiness and all [her]87-kate sorrow ! [He]88-chris knew everything of [her]87-kate life -- or nearly everything . To whom else could [she]87-kate turn with the peculiar sense of security which that certitude gave ? [She]87-kate felt sorry that [she]87-kate had received [his]88-chris tentative advance so coldly , so inarticulately . After all , [he]88-chris might yet be [her]87-kate refuge -- [her]87-kate escape . [She]87-kate closed [her]87-kate eyes , and tried to imagine what life would be -- years and years of it -- at [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ’s side . To feel the nearness of that rugged patient kindness ; would it not lighten [her]87-kate misery , make the thoughts and images that were torturing [her]87-kate less palpable , less acute , less real ? [She]87-kate sat there for a long time , brooding . Now and then a step passing [her]87-kate door , or a burst of voices on [the landing]2900-the landing , told [her]87-kate that [Anne]95-anne was probably receiving [some of [[her]95-anne friends]289-her friends in [[her]95-anne own rooms]2903-her own rooms at [the other end of [the passage]2328-the passage]2904-the other end of the passage]2901-some of her friends in her own rooms at the other end of the passage . The wedding presents were already arriving ; [Anne]95-anne , with a childish pleasure that was unlike [her]95-anne usual aloofness from material things , had set them out on a long table in [[her]95-anne sitting - room]1715-her sitting - room . [The mother]242-the mother pictured [the eager group]2908-the eager group inspecting and admiring , the talk of future plans , the discussion of all the details of the wedding . The date for it would soon be fixed ; ostensibly , [her]87-kate own visit to [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow had been made for the purpose . But at the last moment [her]87-kate courage had failed [her]87-kate , and [she]87-kate had said vaguely , in leaving , that [she]87-kate would let [him]224-dr. arklow know . As [she]242-the mother sat there , [she]242-the mother saw [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter ’s pale illuminated face as though it were before [her]242-the mother . [Anne]95-anne ’s happiness shone through [her]87-kate , making [her]87-kate opaque and guarded features luminous and transparent ; and [the mother]242-the mother could measure , from [her]242-the mother own experience , the amount of heat and force that fed that incandescence . [She]87-kate [herself]87-kate had always had a terrible way of being happy -- and that way was [Anne]95-anne ’s . [She]87-kate simply could not bear to picture to [herself]87-kate the change , in [Anne]95-anne ’s face , from ecstasy to anguish . [She]87-kate had seen that change once , and the sight had burned itself into [her]87-kate eye - balls . To destroy [Anne]95-anne ’s happiness seemed an act of murderous cruelty . What did it matter -- as the chances of life went -- of what elements such happiness was made ? Had [she]87-kate , [Kate Clephane]87-kate , ever shrunk from [her]87-kate own bliss because of the hidden risks it contained ? [She]87-kate had played high , staked everything -- and lost . Could [she]87-kate blame [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter for choosing to take the same risks ? No ; there was , in all great happiness , or the illusion momentarily passing for it , a quality so beatific , so supernatural , that no pain with which it might have to be paid could , at the time , seem too dear ; could hardly , perhaps , ever seem so , to headlong hearts like [hers]87-kate and [Anne]95-anne ’s . [Her]87-kate own heart had begun to tremble and dilate with [her]87-kate new resolve ; the resolve to accept the idea of [Anne]95-anne ’s marriage , to cease [her]87-kate inward struggle against it , and try to be in reality what [she]87-kate was already pretending to be : [the acquiescent , approving mother]2912-the acquiescent , approving mother .... After all , why not ? Legally , technically , there was nothing wrong , nothing socially punishable , in the case . And what was there on the higher , the more private grounds where [she]87-kate pretended to take [her]87-kate stand and deliver [her]87-kate judgment ? [Chris Fenno]88-chris was [a young man]2913-a young man -- [she]87-kate was old enough to be , if not [[his]88-chris mother]707-his mother , at least [[his]88-chris mother - in - law]2915-his mother - in - law . What had [she]87-kate ever hoped or expected to be to [him]88-chris but a passing incident , a pleasant memory ? From the first , [she]87-kate had pitched [their]2916-their relation in that key ; had insisted on the difference in [their]2916-their ages , on [her]87-kate own sense of the necessary transiency of the tie , on the fact that [she]87-kate would not have it otherwise . Anything rather than to be [the old woman clutching at an impossible prolongation of bliss]2917-the old woman clutching at an impossible prolongation of bliss -- anything rather than be remembered as a burden instead of being regretted as a delight ! How often had [she]87-kate told [him]88-chris that [she]87-kate wanted to remain with [him]88-chris like the memory of a flowering branch brushed by at night ? “[1252-you] [You]1252-you wo n’t quite know if it was lilac or laburnum , or both -- [you’ll]1252-you only know it was something vanishing and sweet . ” Vanishing and sweet -- that was what [she]87-kate had meant to be ! And [she]87-kate had kept to [her]87-kate resolution till the blow fell-- Well , and was [he]88-chris so much to blame for its falling ? [She]87-kate [herself]87-kate had been the witness of [his]88-chris resistance , of [his]88-chris loyal efforts to escape . The vehemence of [Anne]95-anne ’s passion had thwarted [him]88-chris , had baffled [them]2918-them both ; if [he]88-chris loved [her]95-anne as passionately as [she]87-kate loved [him]88-chris , was [he]88-chris not justified in accepting the happiness forced upon [him]88-chris ? And how refuse it without destroying [the girl]562-the girl ’s life ? “[1252-you] If any one is to be destroyed , oh God , do n’t let it be [Anne]95-anne ! ” [the mother]242-the mother cried . [She]242-the mother seemed at last to have reached a clearer height , a more breathable air . Renunciation -- renunciation . If [she]242-the mother could attain to that , what real obstacle was there to [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter ’s happiness ? “[95-anne] [I]0-i would sell [my]0-i soul for [her]95-anne -- why not [my]0-i memories ? ” [she]242-the mother reflected . The sound of steps and voices outside had ceased . From [the landing]2900-the landing had come a “[0-i] Goodbye , [dearest]716-dearest ! ” in [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie ’s voice ; no doubt [she]154-nollie had been [the last visitor to leave]2923-the last visitor to leave , and [Anne]95-anne was now alone ; perhaps alone with [[her]95-anne betrothed]2205-her betrothed . Well ; to that thought also [Kate Clephane]87-kate must accustom [herself]87-kate ; by and bye [they]2925-they would be always alone , [those two]2926-those two , in the sense of being nearer to [each other]496-each other than either of [them]2925-they was to [any one else]1836-any one else . [The mother]242-the mother could bear that too . Not to lose [Anne]95-anne -- at all costs to keep [her]242-the mother hold on [the girl]562-the girl ’s confidence and tenderness : that was all that really mattered . [She]242-the mother would go to [Anne]95-anne now . [She]242-the mother [herself]242-the mother would ask [the girl]562-the girl to fix the date for the wedding . [She]242-the mother got up and walked along the deep - piled carpet of [the corridor]2018-the corridor . The door of [[Anne]95-anne ’s sitting - room]2933-anne ’s sitting - room was ajar , but no sound came from within . [Every one]536-every one was gone , then ; even [Chris Fenno]88-chris . With a breath of relief [the mother]242-the mother pushed the door open . [The room]325-the room was empty . One of the tall vases was full of branching chrysanthemums and autumn berries . In a corner stood a tea - table with scattered cups and plates . [The Airedale]149-the airedale drowsed by the hearth . As [she]242-the mother stood there , [Kate Clephane]87-kate saw [the little Anne who used to sit by that same fire trying to coax the red birds through the fender . The vision melted the last spot of resistance in [her]242-the mother heart]2937-the little anne who used to sit by that same fire trying to coax the red birds through the fender . the vision melted the last spot of resistance in her heart . The door of [[Anne]95-anne ’s bedroom]2938-anne ’s bedroom was also ajar , but no sound came from there either . Perhaps [the girl]562-the girl had gone out with [[her]562-the girl last visitors]2940-her last visitors , escaping for a starlit rush up [the Riverside Drive]2941-the riverside drive before dinner . These sudden sallies at queer hours were a way [the young people]1676-the young people had . [The mother]242-the mother listened a moment longer , then laid [her]242-the mother hand on the bedroom door . Before [her]242-the mother , directly in the line of [her]242-the mother vision , was [Anne]95-anne ’s narrow bed . On it the wedding - dress still lay , in a dazzle of whiteness ; and between [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane and the bed , looking also at the dress , stood [Anne]95-anne and [Chris Fenno]88-chris . [They]1676-the young people had not heard [her]562-the girl cross [the sitting - room]2944-the sitting - room or push open [the bedroom]1764-the bedroom door ; [they]1676-the young people did not hear [her]562-the girl now . All [their]1676-the young people faculties were absorbed in [each other]496-each other . [The young man]2551-the young man ’s arms were around [the girl]562-the girl , [her]562-the girl cheek was against [his]2551-the young man . One of [his]2551-the young man hands reached about [her]562-the girl shoulder and , making a cup for [her]562-the girl chin , pressed [her]562-the girl face closer . [They]1676-the young people were looking at the dress ; but the curves of [their]1676-the young people lips , hardly detached , were like those of a fruit that has burst apart of its own ripeness . [Kate Clephane]87-kate stood behind [them]1676-the young people like a ghost . It made [her]87-kate feel like [a ghost to be so invisible and inaudible]2949-a ghost to be so invisible and inaudible . Then a furious flame of life rushed through [her]87-kate ; in every cell of [her]87-kate body [she]87-kate felt that same embrace , felt the very texture of [[her]87-kate lover]1219-her lover ’s cheek against [her]87-kate own , burned with the heat of [his]2551-the young man palm as it clasped [Anne]95-anne ’s chin to press [her]562-the girl closer . “[0-i] Oh , not that -- not that -- not that ! ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane imagined [she]87-kate had shrieked it out at [them]1676-the young people , and pressed [her]87-kate hands to [her]87-kate mouth to stifle the cry ; then [she]87-kate became aware that it was only a dumb whisper within [her]87-kate . For a time which seemed without end [she]87-kate continued to stand there , invisible , inaudible , and [they]1676-the young people remained in [each other]496-each other ’s embrace , motionless , speechless . Then [she]87-kate turned and went . [They]1676-the young people did not hear [her]87-kate . A dark fermentation boiled up into [her]87-kate brain ; every thought and feeling was clogged with thick entangling memories .... Jealous ? Was [she]87-kate jealous of [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ? Was [she]87-kate physically jealous ? Was that the real secret of [her]87-kate repugnance , [her]87-kate instinctive revulsion ? Was that why [she]87-kate had felt from the first as if some incestuous horror hung between [them]1676-the young people ? [She]87-kate did not know -- it was impossible to analyze [her]87-kate anguish . [She]87-kate knew only that [she]87-kate must fly from it , fly as far as [she]87-kate could from the setting of these last indelible impressions . How had [she]87-kate ever imagined that [she]87-kate could keep [her]87-kate place at [Anne]95-anne ’s side -- that [she]87-kate could either outstay [Chris]88-chris , or continue to live under the same roof with [them]1676-the young people ? [Both projects]2953-both projects seemed to [her]87-kate , now , equally nebulous and impossible . [She]87-kate must put [the world]1483-the world between [them]1676-the young people -- the whole width of [the world]1483-the world was not enough . The very grave , [she]87-kate thought , would be hardly black enough to blot out that scene . [She]87-kate found [herself]87-kate , [she]87-kate hardly knew how , at the foot of the stairs , in [the front hall]2956-the front hall . [Her]87-kate precipitate descent recalled the early winter morning when , as hastily , almost as unconsciously , [she]87-kate had descended [those same stairs]2957-those same stairs , flying from [[[her]87-kate husband]283-her husband ’s house]2959-her husband ’s house . Nothing was changed in [the hall]2619-the hall : [her]87-kate eyes , once again morbidly receptive of details , noted on the door the same patent locks with which [her]87-kate fingers had then struggled . Now , as then , [a man]2087-a man ’s hat and stick lay on the hall table ; on that other day [they]1676-the young people had been [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s , now [they]1676-the young people were [Chris Fenno]88-chris ’s . That was the only difference . [She]87-kate stood there , looking about [her]87-kate , wondering why [she]87-kate did not push back the bolts and rush out into the night , hatless and cloakless as [she]87-kate was . What else was there to do but to go straight to [the river]2962-the river , or to some tram line with its mortal headlights bearing straight down on one ? One did n’t have to have a hat and cloak to go out in search of annihilation .... As [she]87-kate stood there the door - bell rang , and [she]87-kate heard the step of [a servant]2963-a servant coming to open the door . [She]87-kate shrank back into [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room , and in another moment [Enid Drover]145-enid drover had rustled in , [her]145-enid drover pink cheeks varnished with the cold , [her]145-enid drover furs full of the autumn freshness . [Her]145-enid drover little eyes were sharp with excitement . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]1477-my dear [Kate]87-kate ! [I]0-i ’ve rushed in with such good news : [I]0-i shall be late for dinner , [Hendrik]159-hendrik drover will be furious . But never mind ; [I]0-i had to tell [you]87-kate . But [Hendrik]159-hendrik drover says it may be snapped up at any minute , and [Anne]95-anne ought to decide at once . XXV . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane excused [herself]187-mrs. clephane from coming down to dinner ; [Aline]90-aline was to say that [she]90-aline was very tired , and begged that [no one]750-no one should disturb [her]90-aline . Perhaps in [his]88-chris absence [she]166-mrs. drover would be able to breathe more freely , see more clearly . [Anne]95-anne , as usual , respected [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s wishes ; [she]95-anne neither came up nor sent to enquire . [I]0-i can’t -- [I]0-i ca n’t ! ” The words escaped before [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane could repress them . [Her]0-i heart began to rush about in [her]0-i like a caged animal . [She]0-i leaned against the pillows , speechless for a moment ; then [she]0-i held out [her]0-i hand , seeking [Anne]95-anne ’s . “[0-i] There ’s nothing to ask , [dear]1521-dear ; nothing to tell . ” “[1258-you] [You]1258-you do n’t hate [him]88-chris , [mother]1508-mother ?
