[I]0-i must know . ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , under [[her]187-mrs. clephane daughter]306-her daughter ’s relentless eyes , felt the blood rising from [her]306-her daughter throat to [her]306-her daughter pale lips and drawn cheeks , and to the forehead in which [her]306-her daughter pulses must be visibly beating . [She]306-her daughter lay there , bathed in a self - accusing crimson , and it seemed to [her]306-her daughter that those clear young eyes were like steel blades plunging into the deepest folds of [her]306-her daughter conscience . “[0-i] [You]1258-you do n’t hate [him]88-chris ? But then [you]1258-you ’re in love with [him]88-chris -- [you’re]1258-you in love with [him]88-chris , and [I]0-i ’ve known it all along ! ” [The girl]562-the girl shrilled it out suddenly , and hid [her]562-the girl face in [her]562-the girl hands . [Kate Clephane]87-kate lay without speaking . In the first shock of the outcry all [her]306-her daughter defences had crashed together about [her]306-her daughter head , and it had been almost a relief to feel them going , to feel that pretences and disguises were at an end . Then [Anne]95-anne ’s hands dropped to [her]95-anne side , and [the mother]242-the mother , meeting [her]306-her daughter gaze , lost the sense of [her]242-the mother own plight in the sight of that other woe . All at once [she]242-the mother felt [herself]242-the mother strong and resolute ; all the old forces of dissimulation were pouring back through [her]242-the mother veins . The accusing red faded from [her]242-the mother face , and [she]242-the mother lay there and quietly met the question in [Anne]95-anne ’s eyes . “[95-anne] _ [Anne]95-anne ! _ ” [she]242-the mother simply said , with a little shrug . “[95-anne] Oh , [mother]1508-mother -- [mother]1508-mother ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i must be going mad ! ” [Anne]95-anne was on [her]95-anne knees at the bedside , [her]95-anne face buried in the coverlet . It was easier to speak to [her]95-anne while [her]95-anne eyes were hidden , and [Kate]87-kate laid a hand on [her]95-anne hair . “[1521-dear] Not mad , [dear]1521-dear ; but decidedly over - strung . ” [She]87-kate heard the note of magnanimity in [her]87-kate own voice . “[1521-dear] But can [you]1508-mother forgive [me]0-i -- ever ? ” “[1508-mother] Nonsense , [dear]1521-dear ; can [I]0-i do anything else ? ” “[0-i] But then -- if [you]1508-mother _ do _ forgive [me]0-i , really -- why must [you]1508-mother go away ? Why wo n’t [you]1508-mother promise to stay with [us]1281-us ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate lay against [her]87-kate pillows and meditated . [Her]87-kate hand was still in [Anne]95-anne ’s hair ; [she]87-kate held [the girl]562-the girl ’s head gently against the coverlet , still not wishing [her]87-kate own face to be too closely scrutinized . At length [she]87-kate spoke . “[1508-mother] [I]0-i did n’t mean to tell [you]1508-mother just yet ; and [you]1508-mother must tell [no one]750-no one . ” [She]87-kate paused , and rallied [her]87-kate failing courage . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t promise to stay with [you]1508-mother , [dear]1521-dear , because [I]0-i may be going to get married too . ” The first words were the most difficult to say ; after that [she]87-kate heard [her]87-kate voice going on steadily . “[94-fred landers] [Fred Landers]94-fred landers has asked [me]0-i to marry [him]94-fred landers ; and [I]0-i think [I]0-i shall accept .... No ; do n’t hug [me]0-i too hard , [child]1141-child ; [my]0-i head still aches -- There ; now [you]1508-mother understand , do n’t [you]1508-mother ? And [you]1508-mother wo n’t scold [me]0-i any more ? But remember , it ’s a secret from [every one]536-every one . It ’s not to be spoken of till after [you]1508-mother ’re married .... Now go . ” After [Anne]95-anne had left [her]87-kate , subdued but jubilant , [she]87-kate lay there and remembered , with a twinge of humiliation , that the night before [she]87-kate had hurried [downstairs]715-downstairs in a mad rush to death . Anything -- anything to escape from the coil of horror closing in on [her]87-kate ! ... And it had sufficed to [her]87-kate to meet [Enid Drover]145-enid drover in [the hall]2619-the hall , with that silly chatter about [the house]255-the house next door , to check the impulse , drive [her]87-kate back into the life [she]87-kate was flying from .... [She]87-kate reflected with self - derision that all [her]87-kate suicidal impulses seemed to end in the same way ; by landing [her]87-kate in the arms of [some man [she]87-kate did n’t care for]2981-some man she did n’t care for . Then [she]87-kate remembered [Anne]95-anne ’s illuminated face , and lay listening to the renewed life of [the house]255-the house , the bustle of happy preparations going on all about [her]87-kate . “[231-poor fred] [Poor Fred]231-poor fred ! Well -- if it ’s what [he]231-poor fred wants-- ” [she]87-kate thought . What [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate wanted , all [she]87-kate now wanted , was never again to see that dreadful question in [Anne]95-anne ’s eyes . And [she]87-kate had found no other way of evading it . XXVI . Now that a day for the wedding was fixed , the preparations went on more rapidly . Soon there was only a fortnight left ; then only ten days ; then a week . [[Chris Fenno]88-chris ’s parents]2983-chris fenno ’s parents were to have come to [New York]5-new york to make the acquaintance of [[[their]2983-chris fenno ’s parents son]2305-their son ’s betrothed]2985-their son ’s betrothed ; but though a date had several times been appointed for [their]2983-chris fenno ’s parents visit , [Mrs. Fenno]200-mrs. fenno , whose health was not good , had never been well enough to come , and finally it was arranged that [Anne]95-anne should go to [Baltimore]2-baltimore to see [them]2983-chris fenno ’s parents . [She]87-kate was to stay with [the Maclews]213-the maclews , who immediately seized the opportunity to organize a series of festivities in celebration of the event . [Lilla]153-lilla invited [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane to come with [[her]153-lilla daughter]306-her daughter ; but [Kate]87-kate declined , on the plea that [she]87-kate [herself]87-kate was not well . [People]256-people were beginning to notice how tired and thin [she]87-kate looked . [Her]87-kate glass showed streaks of gray in [her]87-kate redundant hair , and about [her]87-kate lips and eyes the little lines [she]87-kate had so long kept at bay . [Everybody in [the family]390-the family]723-everybody in the family agreed that it would be a good thing for [her]87-kate to have a few days ’ rest before the wedding . With regard to [her]87-kate own future [she]87-kate had sworn [Anne]95-anne to unconditional secrecy . [She]87-kate explained that [she]87-kate did not intend to give [Fred Landers]94-fred landers a definite answer till after the wedding , and [Anne]95-anne , who had all the [Clephane]87-kate reticence , understood [her]95-anne wish to keep the matter quiet , and even in [[her]95-anne guardian]572-her guardian ’s presence was careful not to betray that [she]95-anne knew of [his]572-her guardian hopes . [She]95-anne only made [him]572-her guardian feel that [he]572-her guardian was more than ever welcome , and touched [him]572-her guardian by showing an added cordiality at a moment when [most girls]2991-most girls are deaf and blind to all human concerns but [their]2991-most girls own . “[231-poor fred] It ’s so like [Anne]95-anne to find time to remember [an old derelict]1286-an old derelict just when [she]95-anne might be excused for forgetting that any of [us]1287-us exist . ” [He]572-her guardian said it with a gentle complacency as [he]572-her guardian sat in [[Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s sitting - room]2992-mrs. clephane ’s sitting - room one evening during [Anne]95-anne ’s absence . “[95-anne] [She]95-anne ’s like [you]1288-she -- very like [you]1288-she , ” [he]572-her guardian added , looking at [Kate Clephane]87-kate with shy beseeching eyes . [She]1288-she smiled back at [him]572-her guardian , wondering if [she]1288-she would ever have the courage to tell [him]572-her guardian that [she]1288-she meant to marry [him]572-her guardian . [He]572-her guardian was thinking of that too , [she]1288-she knew . Why not tell [him]572-her guardian now , at once ? [She]1288-she had only to lean forward and lay [her]1288-she hand on [his]572-her guardian . No words would be necessary . And surely [she]1288-she would feel less alone .... But [she]1288-she remained silent ; it was easier to think of speaking than to speak . It was [he]572-her guardian who questioned : “[1288-she] And afterward -- have [you]1288-she decided what [you]1288-she ’re going to do ? ” [She]1288-she continued to smile . “[95-anne] There ’ll be time to decide afterward . ” “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne tells [me]0-i [you]1288-she ’ve definitely refused to remain in [this house]927-this house . ” “[95-anne] [This house]927-this house has n’t many pleasant associations for [me]0-i . ” [He]572-her guardian coloured as if [she]1288-she had caught [him]572-her guardian in a failure of tact . “[95-anne] [I]0-i understand that . But with [the young people]1676-the young people [here]735-here ... or next door ... [she]95-anne hoped [you]1288-she ’d feel less lonely . ” Again [she]1288-she perceived that [he]572-her guardian was trying to remind [her]1288-she of a possible alternative , and again [she]1288-she let the allusion drop , answering merely : “[95-anne] [I]0-i ’m used to being lonely . It ’s not as bad as [people]256-people think . ” “[256-people] [You]1288-she ’ve known worse , [you]1288-she mean ? ” [He]572-her guardian seldom risked anything as direct as that . “[1288-she] And it would be worse for [you]1288-she , being with [Anne]95-anne after [she]95-anne ’s married ? [You]1288-she still hate the idea as much as ever ? ” [She]1288-she rose impatiently and went to lean against the mantelpiece . “[1288-she] [Fred]94-fred landers , what ’s the use ? [I]0-i shall never hate it less . But that ’s all over -- [I’ve]0-i accepted it . ” “[0-i] Yes , and made [Anne]95-anne so happy . ” “[0-i] Oh , love is what is making [Anne]95-anne happy ! ” [She]1288-she hardly knew how [she]1288-she brought the word from [her]1288-she lips . “[0-i] Well -- loving [Fenno]88-chris has n’t made [her]95-anne cease to love [you]1288-she . ” “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne is perfect . But suppose [we]1294-we talk of something else . At [my]0-i age [I]0-i find this bridal atmosphere a little suffocating . [I]0-i shall go abroad again , probably -- [I]0-i do n’t know . ” [She]1288-she turned and looked at [herself]1288-she in the glass above the mantel , seeing the gray streaks and the accusing crows’-feet . And as [she]1288-she stood there , [she]1288-she remembered how once , when [she]1288-she was standing in the same way before a mirror , [Chris]88-chris had come up behind [her]1288-she , and [they]1294-we had laughed at seeing [their]1294-we reflections kiss . How young [she]1288-she had been then -- how young ! Now , as [she]1288-she looked at [herself]1288-she , [she]1288-she saw behind [her]1288-she the reflection of [Fred Landers]94-fred landers ’s comfortable bulk , sunk in an armchair in after - dinner repose , [his]94-fred landers shirt - front bulging a little , the lamplight varnishing the top of [his]94-fred landers head through the thinning hair . [A middle - aged couple]2993-a middle - aged couple -- perfectly suited to [each other in age and appearance]2994-each other in age and appearance . [She]1288-she turned back and sat down beside [him]94-fred landers . “[0-i] Shall [we]1295-they try a Patience ? ” [she]1288-she said . [He]94-fred landers accepted with a wistful alacrity which seemed to say it was the most [he]94-fred landers hoped for , and [they]1295-they drew up a table and sat down opposite [each other]496-each other , calmly disposing the little cards in elaborate patterns . [They]1295-they had been playing for about half an hour when [she]1288-she rumpled up the cards abruptly , and sweeping them together into a passionate heap cried out : “[0-i] [I]0-i want it to be a gay wedding -- the gayest wedding that ever was ! [I]0-i ’m determined it shall be a gay wedding . ” [She]1288-she dropped [her]1288-she face into [her]1288-she hands , and sat there propping [her]1288-she elbows on the card - table , and laughing out between [her]1288-she intercrossed fingers : “[0-i] A really gay wedding , [you]1296-you know .... ” XXVII . Only three days more now ; for just three days more [she]1288-she and [Anne]95-anne would live under [one roof]2996-one roof . And then ? The interrogation was not [Anne]95-anne ’s . The news of [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s intended marriage had completely restored [the girl]562-the girl ’s serenity . [Chris Fenno]88-chris , detained in [Baltimore]2-baltimore by [[his]88-chris mother]707-his mother ’s sudden and somewhat alarming illness , had not yet reappeared ; it seemed likely now that [he]88-chris would arrive in [New York]5-new york only the day before the wedding . [Anne]95-anne was to have [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother to [herself]95-anne to the last ; and with every art of tenderness and dependence [she]95-anne tried to show [her]95-anne appreciation of these final days , sweet with the sweetness of dear things ending , yet without pain because they were not to precede a real separation . [Her]95-anne only anxiety -- the alarm about [Mrs. Fenno]200-mrs. fenno -- had been allayed by a reassuring telegram , and [she]95-anne moved within that rainbow bubble that once or twice in life contrives to pass itself off as the real horizon . The sight of [her]95-anne , [Kate Clephane]87-kate reasoned , ought to have been justification enough . Anything was worth doing or sacrificing to keep the bubble unbroken . And the last three days would pass -- the Day itself would pass . [The world]1483-the world , after it was over , would go on in the same old way . What was all the flurry about ? [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover did not find it easy to maintain so detached an attitude . [She]166-mrs. drover , for one , could not conceive how [[her]166-mrs. drover sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law could remain so calm at such a moment . “[1296-you] Of course [Nellie]232-nellie ’s wonderfully capable ; [she]232-nellie and [Lilla]153-lilla have taken almost all the worry on [their]1297-their shoulders , have n’t [they]1297-their ? [I]0-i never could have struggled alone with that immense list of invitations . But still [I]0-i do n’t think [you]1298-you ought to assume that _ everything ’s _ settled . After all , there are only three days left ! And [no one]750-no one seems to have even begun to think who ’s going to take [you]1298-you up the aisle .... ” “[750-no one] Up the aisle ? ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane echoed blankly . “[750-no one] Well , yes , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear . There _ is _ [an aisle at [St. Stephen ’s]71-st. stephen ’s]1301-an aisle at st. stephen ’s , ” [Enid Drover]145-enid drover chirped with one of [her]145-enid drover rare attempts at irony . “[151-hendrik] And of course [Hendrik]151-hendrik must take up [the bride]2149-the bride , and [you]1298-you must be [there]498-there , ready to receive [her]2149-the bride and give [her]2149-the bride away .... ” “[151-hendrik] Give [her]2149-the bride away ? ” “[151-hendrik] Had n’t [you]1298-you thought of that either ? ” [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover ’s little laugh had a tinge of condescension . Though all [the family]390-the family had conspired to make [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane forget that [she]187-mrs. clephane had lived for nearly twenty years outside the social pale , the fact remained ; [she]187-mrs. clephane _ had _ . And it was on just such occasions as this that [she]187-mrs. clephane betrayed it , somewhat embarrassingly to [[her]187-mrs. clephane sister - in - law]1891-her sister - in - law . Not even to know that , when [[a bride]587-a bride ’s father]3005-a bride ’s father was dead , it was [[her]587-a bride mother]379-her mother who gave [her]587-a bride away ! “[1298-you] [You]1298-you did n’t expect [Hendrik]151-hendrik to do it ? ” [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover rippled on , half compassionate , half contemptuous . It was hard to understand how [some people]3007-some people contrived to remain in ignorance of the most elementary rules of behaviour ! “[151-hendrik] [Hendrik]151-hendrik -- well , why should n’t [he]151-hendrik ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate said . [Anne]95-anne was passing through [the room]325-the room , a pile of belated presents in [her]95-anne arms . “[151-hendrik] Do [you]1298-you hear , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear ? [[Your]1298-you uncle]1305-your uncle [Hendrik]151-hendrik will be very much flattered . ” [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover ’s little eyes grew sharp with the vision of [Hendrik]151-hendrik ’s broad back and glossy collar playing the leading part in the ceremony . “[151-hendrik] [The bride]2149-the bride was given away by [[her]2149-the bride uncle]1307-her uncle , [Mr. Hendrik Drover]159-hendrik drover , of-- ” It really would read very well . “[159-hendrik drover] Flattered about what ? ” [Anne]95-anne paused to question . “[159-hendrik drover] [[Your]1298-you mother]973-your mother seems to think it ’s [[your]1298-you uncle]1305-your uncle who ought to give [you]1298-you away . ” “[1508-mother] Not [you]1298-you , [mother]1508-mother ? ” [Kate Clephane]87-kate caught the instant drop in [the girl]562-the girl ’s voice . Underneath [her]562-the girl radiant security , what suspicion , what dread , still lingered ? “[1508-mother] [I]0-i ’m so stupid , [dear]1521-dear ; [I]0-i had n’t realized it was the custom . ” “[0-i] Do n’t [you]1298-you want it to be ? ” “[1298-you] [I]0-i want what [you]1298-you want . ” [Their]3010-their thin - edged smiles seemed to cross like blades . “[1508-mother] [I]0-i want it to be [you]1298-you , [mother]1508-mother . ” “[1508-mother] Then of course , dear-- ” [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover heaved a faintly disappointed sigh . [Hendrik]151-hendrik would certainly have looked the part better . “[1508-mother] Well , _ that ’s _ settled , ” [she]166-mrs. drover said , in the tone of one who strikes one more item off an invisible list . “[1508-mother] And now the question is , who ’s to take [[your]1298-you mother]973-your mother up the aisle ? ” [Anne]95-anne and [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother were still exchanging smiles . “[94-fred landers] Why , [Uncle Fred]94-fred landers of course , is n’t [he]94-fred landers ? ” [Anne]95-anne cried . “[94-fred landers] That ’s the point . If [[your]1298-you mother ’s cousin]1314-your mother ’s cousin comes from [Meridia--]77-meridia-- ” [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane brushed aside [the possible cousin]3012-the possible cousin from [Meridia]41-meridia . “[94-fred landers] [Fred]94-fred landers shall take [me]0-i up , ” [she]187-mrs. clephane declared ; and [Anne]95-anne ’s smile lost its nervous edge . “[94-fred landers] Now , is there anything else left to settle ? ” [the girl]562-the girl gaily challenged [[her]562-the girl aunt]3014-her aunt ; and [Mrs. Drover]166-mrs. drover groaned back : “[94-fred landers] Anything else ? But it seems as if [we]1315-we ’d only just begun . If it were n’t for [Nollie]154-nollie and [Lilla]153-lilla [I]0-i should n’t feel sure of _ [anybody]1494-anybody ’s _ being at [the church]1317-the church when the time comes .... ” * * * * * The time had almost come : the sun had risen on the day before the wedding . [It]3015-it rose , mounted up in [a serene heaven]3016-a serene heaven , bent its golden arch over [an untroubled indifferent world]3017-an untroubled indifferent world , and stooped westward in splendid unawareness . The day , so full of outward bustle , of bell - ringing , telephone calls , rushings back and forth of [friends]251-friends , [satellites]3019-satellites and [servants]1717-servants , had drooped to its close in the unnatural emptiness of such conclusions . Everything was done ; every question was settled ; every last order given ; and [Anne]95-anne , with a kiss for [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother , had gone off with [Nollie]154-nollie and [Joe Tresselton]155-joe tresselton for one of the crepuscular motor - dashes that clear the cobwebs from modern brains . [Anne]95-anne had resolutely refused to have either [bridesmaids]3022-bridesmaids or the conventional family dinner of the bridal eve . [She]95-anne wanted to strip the occasion of all its meaningless formalities , and [Chris Fenno]88-chris was of the same mind . [He]88-chris was to spend the evening alone with [[his]88-chris parents]274-his parents at [[their]274-his parents hotel]3024-their hotel , and [Anne]95-anne had invited [no one]750-no one but [Fred Landers]94-fred landers to dine . [She]95-anne had warned [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother that [she]95-anne might be a little late in getting [home]246-home , and had asked [her]379-her mother , in view of [Mr. Landers]133-mr. landers ’s excessive punctuality , to be [downstairs]715-downstairs in time to receive and pacify [him]133-mr. landers . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had seen through the simple manœuvre , and had not resented it . After all , it would be the best opportunity to tell [Fred Landers]94-fred landers what [she]187-mrs. clephane had decided to tell [him]94-fred landers . As [she]187-mrs. clephane sat by [the drawing - room fire]3029-the drawing - room fire listening for the door - bell [she]187-mrs. clephane felt a curious sense of aloofness , almost of pacification . It might be only the quiet of exhaustion ; [she]187-mrs. clephane half - suspected it was , but [she]187-mrs. clephane was too exhausted to feel sure . Yet one thing was clear to [her]187-mrs. clephane ; [she]187-mrs. clephane had suffered less savagely since [she]187-mrs. clephane had known that [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow had guessed what [she]187-mrs. clephane was suffering . The problem had been almost too difficult for [him]224-dr. arklow ; but it was enough that [he]224-dr. arklow had perceived its difficulty , had seen that it was too deeply rooted in living fibres to be torn out without mortal hurt . “[0-i] Sterile pain ... [I]0-i should never want [any one]428-any one to be the cause of sterile pain .... ” That phrase of [his]224-dr. arklow helped [her]187-mrs. clephane even now ; [her]187-mrs. clephane mind clung fast to it as [she]187-mrs. clephane sat waiting for [Landers]133-mr. landers ’s ring . It came punctually , even sooner than the hour , as [Anne]95-anne had foreseen ; and in another moment [he]224-dr. arklow was advancing across [the room]325-the room in [his]224-dr. arklow slow bulky way , with excuses for [his]224-dr. arklow early arrival . “[0-i] But [I]0-i did it on purpose . [I]0-i was sure [Anne]95-anne would be late-- ” “[95-anne] [Anne]95-anne ! [She]95-anne is n’t even in-- ” “[0-i] [I]0-i knew it ! [They]1319-they ’re all a pack of [vagabonds]1320-vagabonds . And [I]0-i hoped [you]95-anne ’d be punctual , ” [he]224-dr. arklow continued , letting [himself]224-dr. arklow down into an armchair as if [he]224-dr. arklow were lowering a bale of goods over the side of [a ship]3031-a ship . “[95-anne] After all , [you]95-anne and [I]0-i belong to [the punctual generation]1321-the punctual generation . ” [She]95-anne winced a little at being so definitely relegated to the rank where [she]95-anne belonged . Yes : [he]224-dr. arklow and [she]95-anne were nearly of an age . [She]95-anne remembered , in [her]95-anne newly - married precocity , thinking of [him]224-dr. arklow as [a shy shambling boy]3032-a shy shambling boy , years younger than [herself]95-anne . Now [he]224-dr. arklow had the deliberate movements of [the elderly]3033-the elderly , and though [he]224-dr. arklow shot , fished , played golf , and kept up the activities common to [his]224-dr. arklow age , [his]224-dr. arklow mind , in maturing , had grown heavier , and seemed to have communicated its prudent motions to [his]224-dr. arklow body . [She]95-anne shut [her]95-anne eyes for a second from the vision . [Her]95-anne own body still seemed so supple , free and imponderable . If it had not been for [her]95-anne looking - glass [she]95-anne would never have known [she]95-anne was more than twenty . [She]95-anne glanced up at the clock ; a quarter to eight . Very likely [Anne]95-anne would not be back for another half hour . How would the evening ever drag itself to an end ? [They]1322-they exchanged a few words about the wedding , but the topic was intolerable to [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane . [She]95-anne had managed to face the situation as a whole : to consider its details was still beyond [her]95-anne . Yet if [she]95-anne left that subject , just beyond it lay the question [[her]95-anne companion]3034-her companion was waiting to ask ; and that alternative was intolerable too . [She]95-anne got up from [her]95-anne seat , moved aimlessly across [the room]325-the room , straightened a flower in a vase , put out a superfluous wall - light . “[1321-the punctual generation] That ’s enough illumination -- at [our]1322-they age , ” [she]95-anne said , coming back to [her]95-anne seat . “[1321-the punctual generation] Oh--_you _ ! ” [He]3034-her companion threw all [his]3034-her companion unspoken worship into the word . “[1323-yours] With that hair of [yours]1323-yours .... ” “[0-i] [My]0-i hair -- [my]0-i hair ! ” [Her]95-anne hands went up to the rich mass as if [she]95-anne would have liked to tear it from [her]95-anne head . At that moment [she]95-anne hated it , as [she]95-anne did everything else that mocked [her]95-anne with the barren illusion of youth . [Fred Landers]94-fred landers had coloured to the edge of [his]94-fred landers own thin hair ; no doubt [he]94-fred landers was afraid of [her]95-anne resenting even this expression of admiration . [His]94-fred landers embarrassment irritated yet touched [her]95-anne , and raising [her]95-anne eyes [she]95-anne looked into [his]1324-you . “[0-i] [I]0-i never knew till the other day that it ’s to [you]1324-you [I]0-i owe the fact of being [here]735-here , ” [she]95-anne said . [He]1324-you was evidently unprepared for this , and did not know whether to be distressed or gratified . [His]1324-you faint blush turned to crimson . “[0-i] To [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Oh , well -- [I’m]0-i not sorry it should be , ” [she]95-anne rejoined , [her]95-anne voice softening . “[0-i] But it ’s all nonsense . [Anne]95-anne was determined to get [you]1324-you back . ” “[95-anne] Yes ; because [you]1324-you told [her]95-anne [she]95-anne must . [She]95-anne owned up frankly . [She]95-anne said [she]95-anne was n’t sure , at first , how the plan would work ; but [you]1324-you were . [You]1324-you backed [me]0-i for all [you]1324-you were worth . ” “[1324-you] Oh , if [you]1324-you mean that ; of course [I]0-i backed [you]1324-you . [You]1324-you see , [she]95-anne did n’t know [you]1324-you ; and [I]0-i did . ” [She]0-i continued to look at [him]1324-you thoughtfully , almost tenderly . “[95-anne] [Very few people]1326-very few people have taken the trouble to care what became of [me]0-i . And [you]1324-you had n’t seen [me]0-i for nearly twenty years . ” “[1324-you] No ; but [I]0-i remembered ; and [I]0-i knew [you]1324-you ’d had a rotten bad start . ” “[0-i] [Lots of [women]463-women]1327-lots of women have that , and [nobody]923-nobody bothers . But [you]1324-you did ; [you]1324-you remembered and [you]1324-you brought [me]0-i [here]735-here . ” [She]0-i turned again , restlessly , and went and stood by the chimney - piece , resting [her]0-i chin on [her]0-i hand . [Landers]94-fred landers smiled up at [her]0-i , half deprecatingly . “[1324-you] If [I]0-i did , do n’t be too hard on [me]0-i . ” “[1324-you] Why should [I]0-i be ? [I]0-i ’ve had over a year . As happiness goes , that ’s a lifetime . ” “[1324-you] Do n’t speak as if [yours]1324-you were over . ” “[1324-you] Oh , it ’s been good enough to be worth while ! ” [He]94-fred landers sat silent for a while , meditatively considering [his]94-fred landers honest boot - tips . At length [he]94-fred landers spoke again , in a tone of sudden authority , such as came into [his]94-fred landers voice when business matters were being discussed . “[1324-you] [You]1324-you must n’t come back alone to [this empty house]1331-this empty house . ” [She]0-i looked slowly about [her]0-i . “[1324-you] No ; [I]0-i never want to see [this house]927-this house again . ” “[0-i] Where shall [you]0-i go , then ? ” “[0-i] After tomorrow ? There ’s [a steamer]1333-a steamer sailing for [the Mediterranean]4-the mediterranean the next day . [I]0-i think [I]0-i shall just go down and get on board . ” “[0-i] Alone ? ” [She]0-i shed a sudden smile on [him]94-fred landers . “[0-i] Will [you]0-i come with [me]0-i ? ” At the question [he]94-fred landers sprang up out of [his]94-fred landers armchair with the headlong haste of [a young man]2913-a young man . The movement upset a little table at [his]94-fred landers elbow ; but [he]94-fred landers let the table lie . “[0-i] By [God]195-god , yes ! ” [he]94-fred landers shouted , reaching out to [her]0-i with both hands . [She]0-i shrank back a little , not from reluctance but from a sense of paralyzing inadequacy . “[195-god] It ’s [I]0-i who am old now , ” [she]0-i thought with a shiver . “[0-i] What -- [you]0-i really would come with [me]0-i ? The day after tomorrow ? ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’d come with [you]0-i today , if there was enough of it left to get [us]1334-us anywhere . ” [He]94-fred landers stood looking at [her]0-i , waiting for [her]0-i to speak ; then , as [she]0-i remained silent , [he]94-fred landers slowly drew back a step or two . “[87-kate] [Kate]87-kate -- this is n’t one of [your]87-kate jokes ? ” As [she]0-i returned [his]94-fred landers look [she]0-i was aware that [her]0-i sight of [him]94-fred landers was becoming faintly blurred . “[87-kate] Perhaps it was , when [I]0-i began . [It]1335-it is n’t now . ” [She]0-i put [her]0-i hands in [his]94-fred landers . XXVIII . In the stillness of [the sleeping house]2000-the sleeping house [she]0-i sat up with a start , plucked out of a tormented sleep . “[1335-it] But it ca n’t be -- it ca n’t be -- it ca n’t be ! ” [She]0-i jumped out of bed , turned on the light , and stared about [her]0-i . What secret warning had waked [her]0-i with that cry on [her]0-i lips ? [She]0-i could not recall having dreamed : [she]0-i had only tossed and fought with some impalpable oppression . And now , as [she]0-i stood there , in [that hideously familiar room]3038-that hideously familiar room , the silence went on echoing with [her]0-i cry . All the excuses , accommodations , mitigations , mufflings , disguisings , had dropped away from the bare fact that [[her]0-i lover]1219-her lover was going to marry [[her]0-i daughter]306-her daughter , and that nothing [she]0-i could do would prevent it . A few hours ago [she]0-i had still counted on the blessed interval of time , the lulling possibilities of delay . [She]0-i had kissed [Anne]95-anne goodnight very quietly , [she]0-i remembered . Then it was eleven o’clock of the night before ; now it was the morning of the day . A pitch - black winter morning : there would be no daylight for another three hours . No daylight -- but the Day was here ! [She]0-i glanced at the clock . Half - past four . The longing seized [her]0-i to go and look at [Anne]95-anne for the last time ; but the next moment [she]0-i felt that hardly a sight in [the world]1483-the world would be less bearable . [She]0-i turned back into [[her]0-i room]1999-her room , wrapped [herself]0-i in [her]0-i dressing - gown , and went and sat in the window . What did [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue look like nowadays at half - past four o’clock of a winter morning ? Much as it had when [she]0-i had kept the same vigil nearly twenty years earlier , on the morning of [her]0-i flight with [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies . That night too [she]0-i had not slept , and for the same reason : the thought of [Anne]95-anne . On that other day [she]0-i had deserted [[her]0-i daughter]306-her daughter for the first time -- and now it seemed as though [she]0-i were deserting [her]0-i again . One betrayal of trust had led inexorably to the other . [Fifth Avenue]26-fifth avenue was much more brilliantly lit than on that other far - off morning . Long streamers of radiance floated on the glittering asphalt like tropical sea - weeds on [a leaden sea]3044-a leaden sea . But overhead the canopy of darkness was as dense , except for the tall lights hanging it here and there with a planetary glory . [The street]637-the street itself was empty . In old times one would have heard the desolate nocturnal sound of a lame hoof - beat as [a market - gardener]3046-a market - gardener ’s cart went by : [they]3047-they always brought out in the small hours the horses that were too bad to be seen by day . But all that was changed . The last lame horse had probably long since gone to [the knacker ’s yard]3048-the knacker ’s yard , and no link of sound was left between the Niagara - roar of the day and the hush before dawn . On that other morning [a hansom - cab]3049-a hansom - cab had been waiting around the corner for [young Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane . It had all been very well arranged -- [Hylton Davies]105-hylton davies had a gift for arranging . [[His]105-hylton davies yacht]359-his yacht was a marvel of luxury : food , service , appointments . [He]105-hylton davies was the kind of man who would lean across the table to say confidentially : “[0-i] [I]0-i particularly recommend that sauce . ” [He]105-hylton davies had the soul of [a club steward]3051-a club steward . It was curious to be thinking of [him]105-hylton davies now .... [She]0-i remembered that , as [she]0-i jumped into the hansom on that fateful morning , [she]0-i had thought to [herself]0-i : “[0-i] Now [I]0-i shall never again hear [[my]0-i mother - in - law]1336-my mother - in - law say : ‘ [I]0-i do think , [[my]0-i dear]1477-my dear , [you]1477-my dear make a mistake not to humour [John]96-john clephane ’s prejudices a little more ’ . ” [She]0-i had fixed [her]0-i mind with intensity on the things [she]0-i most detested in the life [she]0-i was leaving ; it struck [her]0-i now that [she]0-i had thought hardly at all of the life [she]0-i was going to . Above all , that day , [she]0-i had crammed into [her]0-i head every possible thought that might crowd out the image of [little Anne]95-anne : [John Clephane]96-john clephane ’s bad temper , [his]96-john clephane pettiness about money , [his]96-john clephane obstinacy , [his]96-john clephane obtuseness , the detested sound of [his]96-john clephane latch - key when [he]96-john clephane came [home]246-home , flown with self - importance , from [[his]96-john clephane club]3053-his club . “[195-god] Thank [God]195-god , ” [she]0-i remembered thinking , “[195-god] there ca n’t possibly be a latch - key on [a yacht]1338-a yacht ! ” Now [she]0-i suddenly reminded [herself]0-i that before long [she]0-i would have to get used to the click of another key . [Dear Fred Landers]94-fred landers ! That click would symbolize all the securities and placidities : all the thick layers of affection enfolding [her]0-i from loneliness , from regret , from remorse . It comforted [her]0-i already to know that , after tomorrow , there would always be some one between [herself]0-i and [her]0-i thoughts . In that mild warmth [she]0-i would bask like one of those late bunches of grapes that have just time , before they drop , to turn from sourness to insipidity . Now again [she]0-i was at the old game of packing into [her]0-i mind every thought that might crowd out the thought of [Anne]95-anne ; but [her]0-i mind was like a vast echoing vault , and the thoughts [she]0-i had to put into it would not have filled the palm of [her]0-i hand . Where would [she]0-i and [Landers]94-fred landers live ? A few months of travel , no doubt ; and then -- [New York]5-new york . Could [she]0-i picture [him]94-fred landers anywhere else ? Would it be materially possible for [him]94-fred landers to give up [his]94-fred landers profession -- renounce “[195-god] [the office ”]1542-the office ” ? [Her]0-i mind refused to see [him]94-fred landers in any other setting . And yet -- and yet .... But no ; it was useless to linger on that . Nothing , nothing that [she]0-i could invent would crowd out the thought of [Anne]95-anne . [She]0-i sat in the window , and watched the sky turn from black to gray , and then to the blank absence of colour before daylight .... * * * * * In [the motor]2615-the motor , on the way to [St. Stephen ’s]71-st. stephen ’s , the silence had become oppressive , and [Kate]87-kate suddenly laid [her]87-kate hand on [[her]87-kate daughter]306-her daughter ’s . “[1505-my darling] [[My]0-i darling]1505-my darling , [I]0-i wish [you]1505-my darling all the happiness there ever was in [the world]1483-the world -- happiness beyond all imagining . ” “[0-i] Oh , [mother]1508-mother , take care ! Not too much ! [You]1505-my darling frighten [me]0-i .... ” Through the white mist of tulle [Kate]87-kate caught [the girl]562-the girl ’s constrained smile . [She]562-the girl had been too vehement , then ? [She]562-the girl had over - emphasized ? Doubtless [she]562-the girl would never get exactly the right note . [She]87-kate heard [herself]87-kate murmuring vaguely : “[1505-my darling] But there ca n’t be too much , can there ? ” and [Anne]95-anne ’s answer : “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i do n’t know .... ” and mercifully that brought [them]3058-them to the verge of the crimson carpet and the awning . Not here ! _ shouted down at [her]95-anne from every shaft and curve of the vaulting , rained down on [her]95-anne from the accomplice heavens ! And [she]95-anne had called the sky indifferent ! But of course [he]1342-he was not here -- [he]1342-he would not be [here]735-here . [She]95-anne had always known that [she]95-anne would wear [him]1342-he out in the end . [Her]95-anne case was so much stronger than [his]1342-he . In a flash all [her]95-anne torturing doubts fell away from [her]95-anne . Not here ! Not here ! _ the sky shouted down at [her]87-kate . And [none of [them]1865-the groups]3079-none of them -- except perhaps [Anne]95-anne -- knew why .... [Anne]95-anne -- yes ; [Anne]95-anne ’s suffering would be terrible . But [she]95-anne was young -- [she]95-anne was young ; and some day [she]95-anne would know what [she]95-anne had been saved from .... [The mother]242-the mother stood alone and waited for [[her]242-the mother daughter]306-her daughter . XXIX . [The Drovers]702-the drovers had wanted [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane to return to [Long Island]54-long island with [them]702-the drovers that afternoon ; [Nollie Tresselton]154-nollie had added [her]154-nollie prayer ; [Anne]95-anne [herself]95-anne had urged [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother to accept . “[95-anne] How can [I]0-i drive away thinking of [you]1345-you here all alone ? ” [the girl]562-the girl had said ; and [Kate]87-kate had managed to smile back : “[0-i] [You]1345-you wo n’t be thinking of [me]0-i at all ! ” and had added that [she]0-i wanted to rest , and have time to gather up [her]0-i things before sailing . It had been settled , in the last days before the wedding , that [she]0-i was to go abroad for the winter : to [Italy]35-italy , perhaps , or [the south of [France]14-france]3097-the south of france . [The young couple]3098-the young couple , after a brief dash to [Florida]78-florida , were off for [India]79-india , by [Marseilles]65-marseilles and [Suez]80-suez ; it seemed only reasonable that [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane should not care to remain in [New York]5-new york . And [Anne]95-anne knew -- though [no one else]718-no one else did -- that when [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother went abroad [she]95-anne would not go alone . Nothing was to be said ... not a word to [any one]428-any one ; though by this time -- an hour after [bride]3102-bride and [groom]3103-groom had driven away to [the Palm Beach express]3104-the palm beach express -- [Chris Fenno]88-chris was no doubt in the secret . [Anne]95-anne had left without anxiety ; [she]95-anne understood [[her]95-anne mother]379-her mother ’s wish to keep [her]379-her mother plans to [herself]95-anne , and respected it . And in a few days now [the family]390-the family would be reassembling at [St. Stephen ’s]71-st. stephen ’s for another , even quieter wedding . * * * * * [Aline]90-aline came [downstairs]715-downstairs to [the long drawing - room]3108-the long drawing - room , where [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane was sitting alone in a litter of fallen rose - petals , grains of rice and ends of wedding - cake ribbon . [The house - keeper]2567-the house - keeper had come in to give [the butler]1698-the butler the address of [the hospital]946-the hospital to which [Mrs. Fenno]200-mrs. fenno wished the flowers to be sent , and [a footman]3114-a footman was already removing the baskets and bouquets from [the drawing - room]1691-the drawing - room . “[1345-you] [Madame]130-madame will be much more comfortable [upstairs]2312-upstairs than in all this untidiness ; and [Mr. Landers]133-mr. landers has telephoned to ask if [he]133-mr. landers may see [Madame]130-madame in about half an hour . ” [Aline]90-aline , of course , knew everything ; news reached [her]90-aline by every pore , as it circulates through [an Eastern bazaar]3116-an eastern bazaar . [Kate Clephane]87-kate sat motionless , without looking up . [She]87-kate heard what [the maid]295-the maid was saying , and could have repeated [her]90-aline exact words ; but they conveyed no meaning . “[133-mr. landers] [Madame]1453-madame must come up , ” [Aline]90-aline again insisted . The humiliation of being treated like [a sick person]3121-a sick person at length roused [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , and [she]87-kate got to [her]87-kate feet and followed [the maid]295-the maid . On the way [upstairs]2312-upstairs [she]0-i said to [her]1349-her : “[1453-madame] Presently [I]0-i will tell [you]1349-her what [I]0-i shall need on [the steamer]1888-the steamer . ” Then [she]0-i turned into [the sitting - room]2944-the sitting - room , and [Aline]90-aline softly closed the door on [her]0-i . The fire was burning briskly ; [Anne]95-anne ’s last bunch of violets stood on the low table near [the lounge]3125-the lounge . Outside the windows the winter light was waning . [Kate Clephane]87-kate , sitting down on [the lounge]3125-the lounge , remembered that [the room]325-the room had worn that same look of soothing intimacy on the day when [Anne]95-anne had first led [her]87-kate into [it]325-the room , little more than a year ago ; and [she]87-kate remembered that , then , also , [Fred Landers]94-fred landers had joined [her]87-kate [there]498-there , hurriedly summoned to reassure [her]87-kate loneliness . It was curious , in what neatly recurring patterns events often worked themselves out . The door opened and [he]94-fred landers came in . [He]94-fred landers still wore [his]94-fred landers wedding clothes , and the dark morning coat and the pearl in [his]94-fred landers tie suited [him]94-fred landers , gave [him]94-fred landers a certain air of self - confidence and importance . [He]94-fred landers looked like [a man who would smooth one]3129-a man who would smooth one ’s way , manage all the tiresome details of life admirably , without fuss or bluster . The small point of consciousness left alive in [Kate Clephane]87-kate registered the fact , and was dimly comforted by it . Steamer chairs , for instance , and the right table in a ventilated corner of [the dining - saloon]3130-the dining - saloon -- one would n’t have to bother about anything .... “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [we]1351-we could have got off tomorrow , ” [he]94-fred landers said , sitting down beside [her]1352-she , and looking at [her]1352-she with a smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i would have , [you]1352-she know , if [you]1352-she ’d thought it feasible . Why should n’t [we]1351-we have been married in [Liverpool]81-liverpool ? ” “[1353-they] Or on board ! Do n’t [they]1353-they provide [a registry office on [these modern boats]1355-these modern boats]1354-a registry office on these modern boats ? ” [she]1352-she jested with pale lips . “[1353-they] But next week -- next week [I]0-i shall carry [you]1352-she off , ” [he]94-fred landers continued with authority . “[0-i] Yes ; next week . ” [She]1352-she tried to add a word of sympathy , of affection ; the word [he]94-fred landers was waiting for . But [she]1352-she could only turn [her]1352-she wan smile on [him]94-fred landers . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]1477-my dear , [you]1352-she ’re dead - beat ; do n’t [you]1352-she want [me]0-i to go ? ” [She]1352-she shook [her]1352-she head . “[1352-she] No ? [You]1352-she ’d rather [I]0-i stayed -- [you]1352-she really would ? ” [His]94-fred landers face lit up . “[1352-she] [You]1352-she need n’t pretend with [me]0-i , [Kate]87-kate , [you]1352-she know . ” “[0-i] Need n’t [I]0-i ? [We]1357-we need n’t talk about plans till tomorrow . ” [She]1352-she tried to smile back . “[1357-we] But what else is there to talk about ? ” [Her]1352-she eyes rested on [his]94-fred landers face , and [she]1352-she read in it [his]94-fred landers effort to remain [the unobtrusive and undemanding friend]3131-the unobtrusive and undemanding friend . [She]1352-she knew [he]94-fred landers was waiting for an answer ; [she]1352-she felt the cruelty of letting [his]94-fred landers exclamation drop as if unheard ; but what more had [she]1352-she to say to [him]94-fred landers -- unless [she]1352-she should say everything ? The thought shot through [her]1352-she for the first time . Had [she]1352-she really meant to marry [him]94-fred landers without [his]94-fred landers knowing ? Perhaps [she]1352-she had ; [she]1352-she was not sure ; [she]1352-she felt [she]1352-she would never again be very sure of [her]1352-she own intentions . [His]3144-he attention , [his]3144-he receptive capacity , were still engrossed by the stark fact of [her]95-anne confession : [her]95-anne image and [Chris Fenno]88-chris ’s were slowly burning themselves into [his]3144-he shrinking vision . To assist at the process was like peeping into [a torture - chamber]3145-a torture - chamber , and for the moment [she]95-anne lost the sense of [her]95-anne own misery in the helpless contemplation of [his]3144-he . Sterile pain , if ever there was-- At last [she]95-anne crossed over to where [he]3144-he sat , and laid a touch on [his]3144-he shoulder . “[94-fred landers] [Fred]94-fred landers -- [you]94-fred landers must n’t let this hurt [you]94-fred landers . And now it ’s all over ... it ’s ended .... ” [He]3144-he did not change [his]3144-he attitude or even look up again . [She]95-anne still doubted if [he]3144-he heard [her]95-anne . After a minute or two [she]95-anne withdrew [her]95-anne hand and moved away . The strain had been too great ; [she]95-anne had imposed on [him]3144-he more than [he]3144-he could bear . [She]95-anne saw that clearly now : [she]95-anne said to [herself]95-anne that [their]3146-their talk was over , that [they]3146-their were already leagues apart . [Her]95-anne sentimental experience had shown [her]95-anne how often [two people]3147-two people still in the act of exchanging tender or violent words are in reality at [the opposite ends of the earth]3148-the opposite ends of the earth , and [she]95-anne reflected , ironically , how much success in human affairs depends on the power to detect such displacements . [She]95-anne [herself]95-anne had no such successes to [her]95-anne credit ; [hers]95-anne was at best the doubtful gift of discerning , perhaps more quickly than [most people]3149-most people , why [she]95-anne failed . But to all such shades of suffering [[her]95-anne friend]2890-her friend was impervious : [he]3144-he was taking [his]3144-he ordeal in bulk . [She]95-anne sat down and waited . Curiously enough , [she]95-anne was less unhappy than for a long time past . [His]3144-he pain and [his]3144-he pity were perhaps what [she]95-anne had most needed from [him]3144-he : the centre of [her]95-anne wretchedness seemed the point at which [they]3147-two people were meant to meet . If only [she]95-anne could have put it in words simple enough to reach [him]3144-he -- but to thank [him]3144-he for what [he]3144-he was suffering would have seemed like mockery ; and [she]95-anne could only wait and say to [herself]95-anne that perhaps before long [he]3144-he would go . After a while [he]3144-he lifted [his]3144-he head and slowly got to [his]3144-he feet . For a moment [he]3144-he seemed to waver ; then [he]3144-he crossed the space between [them]3147-two people , and stood before [her]95-anne . [She]95-anne rose too , and held out [her]95-anne hand ; but [he]3144-he did not appear to notice the gesture , though [his]3144-he eyes were now intensely fixed on [her]95-anne . “[94-fred landers] The time will come , ” [he]3144-he said , “[94-fred landers] when all this will seem very far off from [both of [us]1384-both of us]1384-both of us . That ’s all [I]0-i want to think of now . ” [She]95-anne looked up , not understanding . Then [she]95-anne began to tremble in all [her]95-anne body ; [her]95-anne very lips trembled , and the lids of [her]95-anne dazzled eyes . [He]3144-he was still looking at [her]95-anne , and [she]95-anne saw the dawn of the old kindness in [his]3144-he . [He]3144-he seemed to have come out on the other side of a great darkness . But all [she]95-anne found to say was the denial of what [she]95-anne was feeling . “[0-i] Oh , no -- no -- no-- ” ; and [she]95-anne put [him]3144-he from [her]95-anne . “[0-i] No ? ” “[0-i] It ’s enough ; enough ; what [you]0-i ’ve just said is enough . ” [She]95-anne stammered it out incoherently . “[0-i] Do n’t [you]0-i see that [I]0-i ca n’t bear any more ? ” [He]3144-he stood rooted there in [his]3144-he mild obstinate kindness . “[0-i] There ’s got to be a great deal more , though . ” “[0-i] Not now -- not now ! ” [She]95-anne caught [his]3144-he hand , and just laid it to [her]95-anne cheek . Then [she]95-anne drew back , with a sense of resolution , of finality , that must have shown itself in [her]95-anne face and air . “[0-i] Now [you]0-i ’re to go ; [you]0-i ’re to leave [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’m dreadfully tired . ” [She]95-anne said it almost like [a child who asks to be taken up and carried]3151-a child who asks to be taken up and carried . It seemed to [her]95-anne that for the first time in [her]95-anne life [she]95-anne had been picked up out of the dust and weariness , and set down in a quiet place where no harm could come . [He]3144-he was still looking at [her]95-anne , uncertainly , pleadingly . “[0-i] Tomorrow , then ? Tomorrow morning ? ” [She]95-anne hesitated . “[0-i] Tomorrow afternoon . ” “[0-i] And now [you]0-i ’ll rest ? ” “[0-i] Now [I]0-i ’ll rest . ” With that -- [their]3152-their hands just clasping -- [she]95-anne guided [him]3144-he gently to the door , and stood waiting till [she]95-anne heard [his]3144-he step go down the stair . Then [she]95-anne turned back into [the room]325-the room and opened the door of [[her]95-anne bedroom]1762-her bedroom . [The maid]295-the maid was there , preparing a becoming tea - gown . [She]95-anne had no doubt conjectured that [Mr. Landers]133-mr. landers would be coming back for dinner . “[90-aline] [Aline]90-aline ! [Aline]90-aline ’s look seemed to say that this was beyond all reasonable explanation . “[90-aline] But [those passages]1390-those passages -- [Madame]130-madame ordered [me]0-i to give them up . Ah , here ’s the number-- ” [She]187-mrs. clephane unhooked the receiver . XXX . [Kate Clephane]87-kate was wakened by the slant of Riviera sun across [her]87-kate bed . [The hotel]423-the hotel was different ; [it]423-the hotel was several rungs higher on the ladder than [the Minorque et l’Univers]3158-the minorque et l’univers , as [its]423-the hotel name -- [the Petit Palais]3159-the petit palais -- plainly indicated . [The bedroom]1764-the bedroom , too , was bigger , more modern , more freshly painted ; and the corner window of [the tiny adjoining _ salon]3161-the tiny adjoining _ salon _ actually clipped a wedge of sea in its narrow frame . So much was changed for the better in [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s condition ; in other respects , [she]87-kate had the feeling of having simply turned back a chapter , and begun again at the top of the same dull page . [[Her]187-mrs. clephane maid]287-her maid , [Aline]90-aline , was obviously of the same opinion ; in spite of the more commodious room , and [the sitting - room with [its]3163-the sitting - room with its costly inset of sea costly inset of [sea]2437-sea]3163-the sitting - room with its costly inset of sea , [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane had not recovered [her]187-mrs. clephane lost prestige in [Aline]90-aline ’s estimation . “[0-i] What was the good of all the fuss if it was to end in _ this _ ? ” [Aline]90-aline ’s look seemed to say , every morning when [she]90-aline brought in the breakfast - tray . Even the fact that letters now lay on it more frequently , and that telegrams were no longer considered epoch - making , did not compensate for the general collapse of [Aline]90-aline ’s plans and ambitions . When [one]247-one had had a good roof over [one]247-one ’s head , and a good motor at one ’s door , what was the sense of bolting away from [them]3167-them at a moment ’s notice and coming back to [second - rate hotels]3168-second - rate hotels and [rattling taxis]3169-rattling taxis , with all the loss of consequence implied ? [Aline]90-aline remained icily silent when [[her]90-aline mistress]294-her mistress , after a few weeks at [the Petit Palais]3159-the petit palais , mentioned that [she]294-her mistress had written to enquire about prices at [Dinard]9-dinard for the summer . [Kate Clephane]87-kate , on the whole , took the change more philosophically . To begin with , it had been [her]87-kate own choice to fly as [she]87-kate had ; and that in itself was a help -- at times ; and then -- well , yes,--already , after the first weeks , [she]87-kate had begun to be aware that [she]87-kate was slipping back without too much discomfort into the old groove . The first month after [her]87-kate arrival would n’t yet bear thinking about ; but it was well behind [her]87-kate now , and habit was working its usual miracle . [She]87-kate had been touched by the welcome [[her]87-kate old friends]3172-her old friends and [acquaintances]3173-acquaintances had given [her]87-kate , and exquisitely relieved -- after the first plunge -- to find [herself]87-kate again among [people who asked no questions about [her]87-kate absence]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence , betrayed no curiosity about it , and probably felt none . [They]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence were all very much occupied with [each other]496-each other ’s doings when [they]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence were together , but [the group]1678-the group was so continually breaking up and reshaping itself , with the addition of new elements , and the departing scattered in so many different directions , and toward destinations so unguessable , that once out of sight [they]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence seemed to have no more substance or permanence than [figures twitching by on a film]3177-figures twitching by on a film . This sense of unsubstantiality had eased [Kate Clephane]87-kate ’s taut nerves , and helped [her]87-kate to sink back almost unaware into [her]87-kate old way of life . Enough was known of [her]87-kate own existence in the interval -- a shadowy glimpse of [New [York]72-york opulence]3178-new york opulence , [an Opera box]3179-an opera box , [a massive and important family]3180-a massive and important family , [a beautiful daughter married to [a War Hero]3182-a war hero]3181-a beautiful daughter married to a war hero -- to add considerably to [her]87-kate standing in [the group]1678-the group ; but [[her]87-kate Riviera friends]3184-her riviera friends were all pleasantly incurious as to details . In most of [their]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence lives there were episodes to be bridged over by verbal acrobatics , and [they]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence were all accustomed to taking each other ’s fibs at [their]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence face - value . Of [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane [they]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence did not even ask any : [she]87-kate came back handsomer , better dressed -- yes , [[my]90-aline dear]1477-my dear , actually _ sables_!--and [she]87-kate offered [them]3174-people who asked no questions about her absence cock - tails and [Mah - Jongg]236-mah - jongg in [[her]87-kate own sitting - room]2693-her own sitting - room ( with a view of [the sea]333-the sea thrown in ) . But [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane did not turn [her]187-mrs. clephane head ; [her]187-mrs. clephane colour did not change . [Today]238-today ’s violets embodied neither hope nor mystery . [She]187-mrs. clephane had not yet opened the letters , or done more than briefly muster their superscriptions . None of the letters was interesting enough to be worth a glance . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane went over them once or twice , as if looking for one that was missing ; then [she]187-mrs. clephane pushed them aside and took up the local newspaper . [She]187-mrs. clephane had got back into [her]187-mrs. clephane old habit of lingering on every little daily act , making the most of it , spreading it out over as many minutes as possible , in the effort to cram [her]187-mrs. clephane hours so full that there should be no time for introspection or remembrance ; and [she]187-mrs. clephane read the paper carefully , from the grandiloquent leading article on the wonders of [the approaching Carnival]3199-the approaching carnival to the column in which the doings of the local and foreign society were glowingly recorded . “[1394-she] [The flower of [the American colony]1396-the american colony and [the most distinguished French and foreign notabilities of [the Riviera]16-the riviera]1397-the most distinguished french and foreign notabilities of the riviera]1395-the flower of the american colony and the most distinguished french and foreign notabilities of the riviera will meet this afternoon at the brilliant reception which [Mrs. Parley Plush]111-mrs. plush has organized at [[her]111-mrs. plush magnificent Villa [Mimosa]83-mimosa]1398-her magnificent villa mimosa in honour of [the Bishop of [the American Episcopal churches in [Europe]42-europe]73-the american episcopal churches in europe]1399-the bishop of the american episcopal churches in europe . ” Ah -- to be sure ; it was today ! But the possibility of [his]240-lord charles wanting more ( at which the violets seemed to hint ) produced an uncertainty not wholly disagreeable , especially when [he]240-lord charles and [she]187-mrs. clephane met in company , and [she]187-mrs. clephane guessed [the other women]3242-the other women ’s envy . “[247-one] [One]247-one has to have something to help [one]247-one out-- ” It was the old argument of [the drug - takers]3243-the drug - takers : well , call [Lord Charles]240-lord charles [her]187-mrs. clephane drug ! Why not , when [she]187-mrs. clephane was so visibly [his]240-lord charles ? [She]187-mrs. clephane settled [herself]187-mrs. clephane in a garden - chair and watched [his]240-lord charles approach . It was a skilful bit of manœuvring : [she]187-mrs. clephane knew [he]240-lord charles intended to “[1424-a typical case] eliminate [the bores]1427-the bores ” and join [her]187-mrs. clephane only when there was no danger of [their]3244-their being disturbed . [She]187-mrs. clephane could imagine how , in old days , [he]240-lord charles would have stalked contemptuously through such a company , without a glance to right or left . But not now . [He]240-lord charles had reached a phase in [his]240-lord charles decline when it became prudent to pause and admire the view at [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush ’s side , exchange affabilities with [[the Consul]473-the consul ’s wife]492-the consul ’s wife , nod familiarly to [Mr. Paly]121-mr. paly , and even suffer [himself]240-lord charles to be boisterously hailed by [Mrs. Horace Betterly]129-horace , who came clinking down [the loggia steps]3247-the loggia steps to shout out a reminder that [they]3248-they counted on [him]240-lord charles for dinner that evening . It was the fate of those who had to stuff [their]3248-they days full , and could no longer be particular about the quality of the stuffing . [Kate]87-kate could almost see the time when [Lord Charles]240-lord charles , very lean and wizened , would be collecting china frogs for [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush . [He]240-lord charles was half - way across [the terrace]1423-the terrace when a sudden expanding and agitating of [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush ’s plumes seemed to forerun the approach of [the Bishop]1415-the bishop . [An impressive black figure]3251-an impressive black figure appeared under the central arch of [the loggia]3252-the loggia . [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush surged forward , every fold of [her]111-mrs. plush draperies swelling : but [the new arrival]3253-the new arrival was not [the Bishop]1415-the bishop -- it was only [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity who , clothed in black cashmere and majesty , paused and looked about [her]111-mrs. plush . [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush , checked in [her]111-mrs. plush forward plunge , stood an instant rigid , almost tilted backward ; [her]111-mrs. plush right hand sketched the gesture of two barely extended fingers ; then [her]111-mrs. plush just resentment of [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity ’s strictures was swept away in the triumph of having [her]111-mrs. plush there at last , and [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush swept on full sail , welcoming [[her]111-mrs. plush unexpected guest]3255-her unexpected guest as obsequiously as if [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity had been [the Bishop]1415-the bishop . [Kate Clephane]87-kate looked on with lazy amusement . [She]87-kate could enjoy the humours of [her]87-kate little world now that [her]87-kate mind was more at leisure . [She]87-kate hoped the scene between [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush and [Mrs. Minity]100-mrs. minity would prolong itself , and was getting up to move within ear - shot when [the Bishop]1415-the bishop , supported by [Mr.]3258-mr. and [Mrs. Merriman]110-mrs. merriman , at length appeared . [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane stopped short half - way across [the terrace]1423-the terrace . [She]187-mrs. clephane had never dreamed of this -- never once thought it possible . Yet now [she]187-mrs. clephane remembered that [Dr. Arklow]224-dr. arklow had been spoken of at [the Drovers]702-the drovers ’ as [one of [the candidates for [this new diocese]3263-this new diocese]3262-the candidates for this new diocese]3261-one of the candidates for this new diocese ; and there [he]224-dr. arklow stood , on the steps just above [her]187-mrs. clephane , benignant and impressive as when [she]187-mrs. clephane had last seen [him]224-dr. arklow , at [St. Stephen ’s]71-st. stephen ’s , placing [Anne]95-anne ’s hand in [Chris Fenno]88-chris ’s .... [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ’s first impulse was to turn and lose [herself]187-mrs. clephane in [the crowd]413-the crowd . The sight of that figure brought with it too many banished scenes and obliterated memories . Back [they]413-the crowd all rushed on [her]187-mrs. clephane , fiercely importunate ; [she]187-mrs. clephane felt [their]413-the crowd cruel fingers at [her]187-mrs. clephane throat . For a moment [she]187-mrs. clephane stood irresolute , detached in the middle of [the terrace]1423-the terrace ; then , just as [she]187-mrs. clephane was turning , [she]187-mrs. clephane heard [Mrs. Plush]111-mrs. plush ’s trumpet - call : “[187-mrs. clephane] [Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane ? Yes , of course ; there [she]1428-she is ! [Dear Mrs. Clephane]187-mrs. clephane , [the Bishop]1415-the bishop has spied [you]187-mrs. clephane out already ! ” [He]1415-the bishop seemed to reach [her]187-mrs. clephane in a stride , so completely did [his]1415-the bishop approach span distances and wipe out time . [She]187-mrs. clephane saw [herself]187-mrs. clephane sitting again in a deep leather armchair , under the photogravure of [Salisbury Cathedral]86-salisbury cathedral , while [he]1415-the bishop paced the worn rug before the hearth , and [[his]1415-the bishop preacher]3266-his preacher ’s voice broke on the words : “[1415-the bishop] Sterile pain .... ” “[187-mrs. clephane] Shall [we]1430-we walk a little way ? [The garden]252-the garden seems very beautiful , ” [the Bishop]1415-the bishop suggested . [They]1430-we stood by a white balustrade under mimosa boughs , and exchanged futilities about the blueness of [the sea]333-the sea and the heat of the sun . “[187-mrs. clephane] A [New York]5-new york February ... brr .... ” “[1415-the bishop] Yes , do n’t [you]1415-the bishop envy [us]1430-we ? Day after day of this .... Oh , of course a puff of _ mistral _ now and then ... but then that ’s healthy ... and the flowers ! ” [He]1415-the bishop laid [his]1415-the bishop large hand deliberately on [hers]1477-my dear . “[1477-my dear] [[My]0-i dear]1477-my dear -- when are [you]1477-my dear coming [home]246-home to [New York]5-new york ? ” [She]1477-my dear felt [her]1477-my dear face just brushed by the understanding look [she]1477-my dear had caught twice before in [his]1415-the bishop eyes . “[1477-my dear] To [New York]5-new york ? Never . ” [He]1415-the bishop waited as if to weigh the answer , and then turned [his]1415-the bishop eyes on [the Mediterranean]4-the mediterranean . “[1477-my dear] Never is a long word . There is some one there who would be very happy if [you]1415-the bishop did . ” [She]1477-my dear answered precipitately : “[1434-he] It would never have been what [he]1434-he imagines .... ” “[1434-he] Is n’t [he]1434-he the best judge of that ? [He]1434-he thinks [you]1415-the bishop ought to have given [him]1434-he the chance . ” [She]1477-my dear dropped [her]1477-my dear voice to say : “[1434-he] [I]0-i wonder [he]1434-he can ask [me]0-i to think of ever living in [New York]5-new york again . ” “[1434-he] [He]1434-he does n’t ask it of [you]1415-the bishop ; [I]0-i ’m charged to say so . [He]1434-he understands fully .... [He]1434-he would be prepared to begin [his]1434-he life again anywhere .... It lies with [you]1415-the bishop .... ” There was a silence . At length [she]1477-my dear mastered [her]1477-my dear voice enough to say : “[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i know . [I]0-i ’m very grateful . It ’s a comfort to [me]0-i .... ” “[0-i] No more ? ” [She]1477-my dear waited again , and then , lifting [her]1477-my dear eyes , caught once more the understanding look in [his]1434-he . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know how to tell [you]1415-the bishop -- how to explain . It seems to [me]0-i ... [my]0-i refusing ... ” [she]1477-my dear lowered [her]1477-my dear voice still more ... “[0-i] the one thing that keeps [me]0-i from being too hopeless , too unhappy . ” [She]1477-my dear saw the first tinge of perplexity in [his]1434-he gaze . “[0-i] The fact of refusing ? ” “[0-i] The fact of refusing . ” Ah , it was useless ; [he]1434-he would never understand ! How could [she]1477-my dear have imagined that [he]1434-he would ? “[0-i] But is this really [your]0-i last word ; the very last ? ” [he]1434-he questioned mildly . “[0-i] Oh , it has to be -- it has to be . [It]1435-it ’s what [I]0-i live by , ” [she]1477-my dear almost sobbed . No ; [he]1434-he would never understand . [His]1434-he face had once more become blank and benedictory . [He]1434-he pressed [her]1477-my dear hand , said : “[1435-it] [[My]0-i dear child]1436-my dear child , [I]0-i must see [you]0-i again -- [we]1437-we must talk of this ! ” and passed on , urbane and unperceiving . [Her]1477-my dear eyes filled ; for a moment [her]1477-my dear loneliness came down on [her]1477-my dear like a pall . It was always so whenever [she]1477-my dear tried to explain , not only to [others]1827-others but even to [herself]1477-my dear . Yet deep down in [her]1477-my dear , deeper far than [her]1477-my dear poor understanding could reach , there was something that said “[1437-we] No ” whenever that particular temptation stirred in [her]0-i . Something that told [her]0-i that , as [Fred Lander]241-fred lander ’s pity had been the most precious thing [he]241-fred lander had to give [her]0-i , so [her]0-i refusal to accept it , [her]0-i precipitate flight from it , was the most precious thing [she]0-i could give [him]241-fred lander in return . [He]241-fred lander had overcome [his]241-fred lander strongest feelings , [his]241-fred lander most deep - rooted repugnance ; [he]241-fred lander had held out [his]241-fred lander hand to [her]0-i , in the extremity of [her]0-i need , across the whole width of [his]241-fred lander traditions and [his]241-fred lander convictions ; and [she]0-i had blessed [him]241-fred lander for it , and stood fast on [her]0-i own side . And this afternoon , when [she]0-i returned [home]246-home and found [his]241-fred lander weekly letter -- as [she]0-i was sure [she]0-i would , since it had not come with that morning ’s post -- [she]0-i would bless [him]241-fred lander again , bless [him]241-fred lander both for writing the letter , and for giving [her]0-i the strength to hold out against its pleadings . Perhaps [no one else]718-no one else would ever understand ; assuredly [he]241-fred lander would never understand [himself]241-fred lander . But there it was . Nothing on [earth]2002-earth would ever again help [her]0-i -- help to blot out the old horrors and the new loneliness -- as much as the fact of being able to take [her]0-i stand on that resolve , of being able to say to [herself]0-i , whenever [she]0-i began to drift toward new uncertainties and fresh concessions , that once at least [she]0-i had stood fast , shutting away in a little space of peace and light the best thing that had ever happened to [her]0-i .
